name location text document detected_location split_cfp_text detected_conference_name date_to_sentence
0 IEEE Workshop on Pervasive Group Communication @ IEEE GLOBECOM 2010 Miami, FL, USA CALL FOR PAPERS\n IEEE Workshop on Pervasive Group Communication @ IEEE GLOBECOM 2010\n\n URL: http://pergroup.realmv6.org\n\n Miami, FL, USA, December 6, 2010,\n\n held in conjunction with IEEE GLOBECOM 2010,\n\n and co-sponsored by IEEE HCCTC sub-committee,\n G-Lab, and The unbelievable Machine Company\n\nGroup communications have passed from research to deployment and back to a\nresearch issue. Newly deployed services, in particular IPTV, P2P content\ndistribution, and collaborative applications, are stimulating current research\non multicast, broadcast, concast, and anycast. Emerging design issues for a\nfuture multi-service Internet combined with the dynamic development of wireless\naccess techonologies challenge the community to rethink the position of group\ncommunications along the stack.\n\nThe PerGroup workshop invites the community to share efforts in search of\nseamless, pervasive group services, and to discuss directions on a\nhuman-centric multi-service Inter-networking architecture. We welcome\ncontributions that design new solutions or analyze existing deployments, but\nalso those that present striking problem statements or early conceptual work.\n\nTopics of interest include, but are not limited to:\n\nSystem Design & Methodology:\n - Architectures and protocols for fixed, wireless and ad hoc networks\n - Protocols and interfaces for intuitive group communications\n - Intra- and Inter-domain group communication\n - Native, overlay (including P2P) and hybrid multicast\n - Topology analysis & measuring, mining and modeling of \n - media-rich social networks\n - Measurement, simulation and analytical studies as well as deployment\n experiences\n\nSupporting Technologies:\n - Multipath routing / extension of emerging routing schemes\n - Cooperative relaying and network coding\n - Service placement and service location\n - Security and privacy issues for multicast, anycast, and broadcast\n - Real-time and QoS aspects\n\nApplications:\n - Adaptive content distribution, e.g., video broadcasting\n - Application-layer traffic optimization and provider interaction\n - Multicast & anycast in a future multi-service Internet\n - New data distribution models to facilitate group communication\n - Frameworks for human centric based group communications\n\n---------------\nIMPORTANT DATES\n---------------\nFull paper: June 25, 2010\nSubmission deadline: July 11, 2010\nNotification: August 12, 2010\nFinal version: August 31, 2010\n\n----------------------\nORGANIZATION COMMITTEE\n----------------------\nWorkshop Co-Chairs:\n\n- Thomas C. Schmidt, HAW Hamburg, Germany\n- Matthias WÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¤hlisch, Freie UniversitÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¤t Berlin, Germany\n- Georg Wittenburg, Freie UniversitÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¤t Berlin, Germany\n\nProgram Committee:\n\n- Kevin C. Berlin, Germany\n- Heather Yu, Huawei, USA\n- Thomas Zahn, Nokia, Germany\n- Martina Zitterbart, University of Karlsruhe, Germany\n\n---------------------\nSUBMISSION GUIDELINES\n---------------------\nAuthors are invited to submit full papers of up to five double-column, IEEE\nconference-style pages. One additional page will be allowed with additional\npublication fee. All submitted papers will be carefully evaluated by at least\nthree reviewers based on originality, significance, technical soundness, and\nclarity of expression. Accepted papers will appear in the IEEE GLOBECOM\nproceedings and will be included in IEEE digital library.\n\nAt least one of the authors of accepted papers must attend the workshop to\npresent the paper. An accepted paper must be registered before the registration\ndeadline. IEEE reserves the right to exclude a paper from distribution after\nthe conference (e.g., removal from IEEE Xplore) if the paper is not presented\nat the workshop. In case of double submissions or (self-)plagiarism, the paper\nwill be excluded from the technical program.\n\nFurther information: http://pergroup.realmv6.org/submission.html\n\n-------\nCONTACT\n-------\nFor further information regarding PerGroup 2010 and paper submission, please\ncontact pergroup_2010-chairs@edas.info. (CALL, FOR, PAPERS, \n , IEEE, Workshop, on, Pervasive, Group, Communication, @, IEEE, GLOBECOM, 2010, \n\n , URL, :, http://pergroup.realmv6.org, \n\n , Miami, ,, FL, ,, USA, ,, December, 6, ,, 2010, ,, \n\n , held, in, conjunction, with, IEEE, GLOBECOM, 2010, ,, \n\n , and, co, -, sponsored, by, IEEE, HCCTC, sub, -, committee, ,, \n , G, -, Lab, ,, and, The, unbelievable, Machine, Company, \n\n, Group, communications, have, passed, from, research, to, deployment, and, back, to, a, \n, research, issue, ., Newly, deployed, services, ,, in, particular, IPTV, ,, P2P, content, \n, distribution, ,, and, collaborative, applications, ,, are, stimulating, current, research, \n, ...) Miami [CALL FOR PAPERS, IEEE Workshop on Pervasive Group Communication @ IEEE GLOBECOM 2010, URL: http://pergroup.realmv6.org, Miami, FL, USA, December 6, 2010,, held in conjunction with IEEE GLOBECOM 2010,, and co-sponsored by IEEE HCCTC sub-committee,, G-Lab, and The unbelievable Machine Company, Group communications have passed from research to deployment and back to a, research issue, Newly deployed services, in particular IPTV, P2P content, distribution, and collaborative applications, are stimulating current research, on multicast, broadcast, concast, and anycast, Emerging design issues for a, future multi-service Internet combined with the dynamic development of wireless, access techonologies challenge the community to rethink the position of group, communications along the stack., The PerGroup workshop invites the community to share efforts in search of, seamless, pervasive group services, and to discuss directions on a, human-centric multi-service Inter-networking architecture, We welcome, contributions that design new solutions or analyze existing deployments, but, also those that present striking problem statements or early conceptual work., Topics of interest include, but are not limited to:, System Design & Methodology:, - Architectures and protocols for fixed, wireless and ad hoc networks, - Protocols and interfaces for intuitive group communications, - Intra- and Inter-domain group communication, - Native, overlay (including P2P) and hybrid multicast, - Topology analysis & measuring, mining and modeling of , - media-rich social networks, - Measurement, simulation and analytical studies as well as deployment, experiences, Supporting Technologies:, - Multipath routing / extension of emerging routing schemes, - Cooperative relaying and network coding, - Service placement and service location, - Security and privacy issues for multicast, anycast, and broadcast, - Real-time and QoS aspects, Applications:, - Adaptive content distribution, e.g., video broadcasting, - Application-layer traffic optimization and provider interaction, - Multicast & anycast in a future multi-service Internet, - New data distribution models to facilitate group communication, - Frameworks for human centric based group communications, ---------------, IMPORTANT DATES, ---------------, Full paper: June 25, 2010, Submission deadline: July 11, 2010, Notification: August 12, 2010, Final version: August 31, 2010, ----------------------, ORGANIZATION COMMITTEE, ----------------------, Workshop Co-Chairs:, - Thomas C, Schmidt, HAW Hamburg, Germany, - Matthias WÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¤hlisch, Freie UniversitÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¤t Berlin, Germany, - Stig Venaas, Cisco Systems, USA, - Matthias WÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¤hlisch, Freie UniversitÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¤t Berlin, Germany, - Heather Yu, Huawei, USA, - Thomas Zahn, Nokia, Germany, - Martina Zitterbart, University of Karlsruhe, Germany, ---------------------, SUBMISSION GUIDELINES, ---------------------, Authors are invited to submit full papers of up to five double-column, IEEE, conference-style pages, One additional page will be allowed with additional, publication fee, All submitted papers will be carefully evaluated by at least, three reviewers based on originality, significance, technical soundness, and, clarity of expression, Accepted papers will appear in the IEEE GLOBECOM, proceedings and will be included in IEEE digital library., At least one of the authors of accepted papers must attend the workshop to, present the paper, An accepted paper must be registered before the registration, ...] IEEE Workshop on Pervasive Group Communication @ IEEE GLOBECOM 2010 {'December 6, 2010': ' miami, fl, usa, december 6, 2010,', 'June 25, 2010': 'full paper: june 25, 2010', 'July 11, 2010': 'submission deadline: july 11, 2010', 'August 12, 2010': 'notification: august 12, 2010', 'August 31, 2010': 'final version: august 31, 2010'}
1 3rd International Symposium on Computational Intelligence and Design Hangzhou, China CALL FOR PAPERS\n3rd International Symposium on Computational Intelligence and Design\n\nDear Colleagues and Friends,\n\nOn behalf of the successful symposium- ISCID 2009, the organizing committee and our local organizers wish to extend to you our personal welcome to attend the 2010 International Symposium on Computational Intelligence and Design (ISCID 2010) which will be held at Hangzhou, China in 29-31, October 2010. This symposium provides an idea-exchange and discussion platform for the worldÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢s engineers and academia, where internationally recognized researches and practitioners share cutting-edge information, address the hottest issue in computational intelligence and design, explore new technologies, exchange and build upon ideas. And provide researchers and practitioners interested in new information technologies an opportunity to highlight innovative research directions, novel applications, and a growing number of relationships between rough sets and such areas as computational intelligence, knowledge discovery and data mining, intelligent information systems, web mining, synthesis and analysis of complex objects, non-conventional models of computation and design. \nConference: October 29-31, 2010 (CALL, FOR, PAPERS, \n, 3rd, International, Symposium, on, Computational, Intelligence, and, Design, \n\n, Dear, Colleagues, and, Friends, ,, \n\n, On, behalf, of, exchange, and, discussion, platform, for, the, worldÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢s, Hangzhou [CALL FOR PAPERS, 3rd International Symposium on Computational Intelligence and Design, Dear Colleagues and Friends,, On behalf of the successful symposium- ISCID 2009, the organizing committee and our local organizers wish to extend to you our personal welcome to attend the 2010 International Symposium on Computational Intelligence and Design (ISCID 2010) which will be held at Hangzhou, China in 29-31, October 2010, This symposium provides an idea-exchange and discussion platform for the worldÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢s engineers and academia, where internationally recognized researches and practitioners share cutting-edge information, address the hottest issue in computational intelligence and design, explore new technologies, exchange and build upon ideas, And provide researchers and practitioners interested in new information technologies an opportunity to highlight innovative research directions, novel applications, and a growing number of relationships between rough sets and such areas as computational intelligence, knowledge discovery and data mining, intelligent information systems, web mining, synthesis and analysis of complex objects, non-conventional models of computation and design, 'weãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâ¢ãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâ¢ãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâ¬ãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâ¢ãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâ¢re certain you will find the city of hangzhou and the surrounding area to be most pleasant and it will be my distinct pleasure to welcome each of you to the iscid in october 2010.', 'January 22': 2 17th ACM Conference on Computer and Communications Security Chicago, IL CALL FOR PAPERS\nThe 17th ACM Conference on Computer and Communications Security\nOctober 4 - 8 2010\n \nScope\n\nThe annual ACM Computer and Communications Security Conference is a leading international forum for information security researchers, practitioners, developers, and users to explore cutting-edge ideas and results, and to exchange techniques, tools, and experiences. The conference seeks submissions from academia, government, and industry presenting novel research on all practical and theoretical aspects of computer and communications security, as well as case studies and implementation experiences. Papers should have relevance to the construction, evaluation, application, or operation of secure systems. Theoretical papers must make a convincing argument for the practical significance of the results. All topic areas related to computer and communications security are of interest and in scope. Accepted papers will be published by ACM Press in the conference proceedings. Outstanding papers will be invited for possible publication in a special issue of the ACM Transactions on Information and System Security.\n\nPaper Submission Process\n\nSubmissions must be made by the deadline of April 17, 2010, through the website: http://www.easychair.org/conferences/?conf=ccs2010 Submitted papers must not substantially overlap papers that have been published or that are simultaneously submitted to a journal, conference or workshop. Simultaneous submission of the same work is not allowed. Authors of accepted papers must guarantee that their papers will be presented at the conference.\n\nPaper Format\n\nSubmissions must be at most ten pages in double-column ACM format (note: pages must be numbered) excluding the bibliography and well-marked appendices, and at most 12 pages overall. Submissions must NOT be anonymized. Only PDF or Postscript files will be accepted. Submissions may also be accompanied by a link to a short (at most 3 minutes) video or slide presentation. For more details on the supplemental material, see the CCS 2010 website. Submissions not meeting these guidelines risk rejection without consideration of their merits.\n\nTutorial submissions\n\nProposals for long (3-hour) and short (1.5-hour) tutorials on research topics of current and emerging interest should be submitted electronically to the tutorials chair by May 24, 2010. The guidelines for tutorial proposals can be found on the website.\n\nImportant Dates\n\nPaper Submission Due: Saturday, April 17, 2010 (11:59 PM CDT)\nAcceptance Notification: Monday, June 21, 2010\nCamera Ready Papers Due: Friday, July 16, 2010\nCommitees\n\nSteering Commitee\nOrganizing Commitee\nProgram Commitee\nLast modified: 2010-01-19 11:02:02 EST (CALL, FOR, PAPERS, \n, The, 17th, ACM, Conference, on, Computer, and, Communications, Security, \n, October, 4, -, 8, 2010, \n \n, Scope, \n\n, The, annual, ACM, Computer, and, Communications, Security, Conference, is, a, leading, international, forum, for, information, security, researchers, ,, practitioners, ,, developers, ,, and, users, to, explore, cutting, -, edge, ideas, and, results, ,, and, to, exchange, techniques, ,, tools, ,, and, experiences, ., The, conference, seeks, submissions, from, academia, ,, government, ,, and, industry, presenting, novel, research, on, all, practical, and, theoretical, aspects, of, computer, and, communications, security, ,, as, well, as, case, studies, and, implementation, experiences, ., ...) None [CALL FOR PAPERS, The 17th ACM Conference on Computer and Communications Security, October 4 - 8 2010, , Scope, The annual ACM Computer and Communications Security Conference is a leading international forum for information security researchers, practitioners, developers, and users to explore cutting-edge ideas and results, and to exchange techniques, tools, and experiences, The conference seeks submissions from academia, government, and industry presenting novel research on all practical and theoretical aspects of computer and communications security, as well as case studies and implementation experiences, Papers should have relevance to the construction, evaluation, application, or operation of secure systems, Theoretical papers must make a convincing argument for the practical significance of the results, All topic areas related to computer and communications security are of interest and in scope, Accepted papers will be published by ACM Press in the conference proceedings, Outstanding papers will be invited for possible publication in a special issue of the ACM Transactions on Information and System Security., Paper Submission Process, Submissions must be made by the deadline of April 17, 2010, through the website: http://www.easychair.org/conferences/?conf=ccs2010 Submitted papers must not substantially overlap papers that have been published or that are simultaneously submitted to a journal, conference or workshop, Simultaneous submission of the same work is not allowed, Authors of accepted papers must guarantee that their papers will be presented at the conference., Paper Format, Submissions must be at most ten pages in double-column ACM format (note: pages must be numbered) excluding the bibliography and well-marked appendices, and at most 12 pages overall, Submissions must NOT be anonymized, Only PDF or Postscript files will be accepted, Submissions may also be accompanied by a link to a short (at most 3 minutes) video or slide presentation, For more details on the supplemental material, see the CCS 2010 website, Submissions not meeting these guidelines risk rejection without consideration of their merits., Tutorial submissions, Proposals for long (3-hour) and short (1.5-hour) tutorials on research topics of current and emerging interest should be submitted electronically to the tutorials chair by May 24, 2010, The guidelines for tutorial proposals can be found on the website., Important Dates, Paper Submission Due: Saturday, April 17, 2010 (11:59 PM CDT), Acceptance Notification: Monday, June 21, 2010, 3 First Workshop on Automated Knowledge Base Construction Grenoble, France First Workshop on Automated Knowledge Base Construction 2010\n May 17-19, 2010\n Grenoble, France\n\n http://akbc.xrce.xerox.com\n\n CALL FOR PAPERS\n 4-8 page submissions due March 5, 2010\n\nGood decision-making is dependent on comprehensive, accurate\nknowledge. But the information relevant to many important decisions\nin areas such as business, government, medicine and scientific\nresearch is massive, and growing at an accelerating pace. Relevant\nraw data is widely available on the web and other data sources, but\nusually in order to be useful it must be gathered, extracted,\norganized, and normalized into a knowledge base.\n\nHand-built knowledge bases such as Wikipedia have made us all better\ndecision-makers. However more than human editing will be necessary to\ncreate a wide variety of domain-specific, deeply comprehensive,\nmore highly structured knowledge bases.\n\nA variety of automated methods have begun to reach levels of accuracy\nand scalability that make them applicable to automatically\nconstructing useful knowledge bases from text and other sources.\nThese capabilities have been enabled by research in areas including\nnatural language processing, information extraction, information\nintegration, databases, search and machine learning. There are\nsubstantial scientific and engineering challenges in advancing and\nintegrating such relevant methodologies.\n\nThis workshop will gather researchers in a variety of fields that\ncontribute to the automated construction of knowledge bases.\n\nThere has recently been a tremendous amount of new work in this area,\nsome of it in traditionally disconnected communities. In this\nworkshop the organizers aim to bring these communities together.\n\n\nTopics of interest include:\n\n* information extraction; open information extraction,\n named entity extraction; entity resolution, relation extraction.\n* information integration; schema alignment; ontology alignment;\n ontology constrution.\n* monolingual alignment, alignment between knowlege bases and text.\n* joint inference between text interpretation and knowledge base\n pattern analysis, semantic analysis of natural language,\n reading the web, learning by reading.\n* databases; distributed information systems; probabilistic\n databases.\n* scalable computation; distributed computation.\n* information retrieval; search on mixtures of structured and\n unstructured data; querying under uncertainty.\n* machine learning; unsupervised, lightly-supervised and\n distantly-supervised learning; learning from naturally-available\n data.\n* human-computer collaboration in knowledge base construction;\n automated population of wikis.\n* dynamic data, online/on-the-fly adaptation of knowledge.\n* inference; scalable approximate inference.\n* languages, toolkits and systems for automated knowledge base\n construction.\n* demonstrations of existing automatically-built knowledge bases.\n\n\nSpeakers / Participants include:\n\n* Oren Etzioni, University of Washington\n* Michael Cafarella, University of Michigan\n* AnHai Doan, University of Wisconsin\n* Patrick Gallinari, LIP6\n* Alon Halevy, Google\n* Zachary Ives, University of Pennsylvania\n* Ron Kaplan, Powerset / Microsoft\n* Andrew McCallum, University of Massachusetts\n* Zaiqing Nie, Microsoft Research\n* Fernando Pereira, Google & University of Pennsylvania\n* Sunita Sarawagi, Indian Institute of Technology\n* Gerhard Weikum, Max Planck Institute\n* Dan Weld, University of Washington\n\nImportant dates:\n\n* Paper submission deadline: Friday 5 March 2010\n* Notification of acceptance: Friday 2 April 2010\n* Camera-ready due from authors: Monday 3 May 2010\n* Workshop: Mon-Wed 17-19 May 2010\n (just after AIStats in Sardinia)\n\n\nSubmission Instructions:\n\nFour to eight pages, two-column, in ICML conference style. LaTeX and\nMSWord style file are available from the workshop web site. Papers\nshould be submitted through the electronic submission URL, also\navailable through the AKBC workshop web site.\n\n\nReview and multiple submission policy:\n\nEvery paper will receive 3 single-blind reviews. Work submitted or\nappearing elsewhere is welcome to this workshop, within the\nrequirements of the other venue.\n\n\nOrganizing committee:\n\nProgram Chair: Andrew McCallum\nPublication Chair: Guillaume Bouchard\nFunding Chair: Cedric Archambeau\nLocal Arrangements: Onno Zoeter\nHost Arrangements: Jean-Marc Andreoli\n\n\nWorkshop venue:\n\nThe workshop will take place in the chateau at Xerox Research Centre\nEurope, near Grenoble, France.\n\nImportant Dates:\nSubmission deadline: 5 March 2010\nNotification due date: 2 April 2010\nFinal manuscript deadline: 3 May 2010\n\nOther info:\n\nIn addition to technical talks, talks about submitted papers and a\nposter session, we will have plenty of time for informal discussions\nand community building: a reception dinner the evening before we\nbegin, lunches provided on-site with time to talk, a banquet dinner on\nthe first evening, and on the second day a half-day hike in the local\nAlps, including a raclette dinner at a refuge.\n\nRegistration will be free for European Pascal Network members. (First, Workshop, on, Automated, Knowledge, Base, Construction, 2010, \n , May, 17, -, 19, ,, 2010, \n , Grenoble, ,, France, \n\n , http://akbc.xrce.xerox.com, \n\n , CALL, FOR, PAPERS, \n , 4, -, 8, page, submissions, due, March, 5, ,, 2010, \n\n, Good, decision, -, making, is, dependent, on, comprehensive, ,, accurate, \n, knowledge, ., , But, the, information, relevant, to, many, important, decisions, \n, in, areas, such, as, business, ,, government, ,, medicine, and, scientific, \n, research, is, massive, ,, and, growing, at, an, accelerating, pace, ., , Relevant, \n, raw, data, is, widely, available, on, the, web, and, other, data, sources, ,, but, ...) Grenoble [First Workshop on Automated Knowledge Base Construction 2010, May 17-19, 2010, Grenoble, France, http://akbc.xrce.xerox.com, CALL FOR PAPERS, 4-8 page submissions due March 5, 2010, Good decision-making is dependent on comprehensive, accurate, knowledge, But the information relevant to many important decisions, in areas such as business, government, medicine and scientific, research is massive, and growing at an accelerating pace, Relevant, raw data is widely available on the web and other data sources, but, usually in order to be useful it must be gathered, extracted,, organized, and normalized into a knowledge base., Hand-built knowledge bases such as Wikipedia have made us all better, decision-makers, However more than human editing will be necessary to, create a wide variety of domain-specific, deeply comprehensive,, more highly structured knowledge bases., A variety of automated methods have begun to reach levels of accuracy, and scalability that make them applicable to automatically, constructing useful knowledge bases from text and other sources., These capabilities have been enabled by research in areas including, natural language processing, information extraction, information, integration, databases, search and machine learning, There are, substantial scientific and engineering challenges in advancing and, integrating such relevant methodologies., This workshop will gather researchers in a variety of fields that, contribute to the automated construction of knowledge bases., There has recently been a tremendous amount of new work in this area,, some of it in traditionally disconnected communities, In this, workshop the organizers aim to bring these communities together., Topics of interest include:, * information extraction; open information extraction,, named entity extraction; entity resolution, relation extraction., * information integration; schema alignment; ontology alignment;, ontology constrution., * monolingual alignment, alignment between knowlege bases and text., * joint inference between text interpretation and knowledge base, pattern analysis, semantic analysis of natural language,, reading the web, learning by reading., * databases; distributed information systems; probabilistic, databases., * scalable computation; distributed computation., * information retrieval; search on mixtures of structured and, unstructured data; querying under uncertainty., * machine learning; unsupervised, lightly-supervised and, distantly-supervised learning; learning from naturally-available, data., * human-computer collaboration in knowledge base construction;, automated population of wikis., * dynamic data, online/on-the-fly adaptation of knowledge., * inference; scalable approximate inference., * languages, toolkits and systems for automated knowledge base, construction., * demonstrations of existing automatically-built knowledge bases., Speakers / Participants include:, * Oren Etzioni, 4 North-Eastern Student Colloquium on Artificial Intelligence University of Massachusetts, Amherst, MA -----------------------------------------------------------\r\n NESCAI 2010\r\nNorth-Eastern Student Colloquium on Artificial Intelligence\r\n nescai.cs.umass.edu\r\n-----------------------------------------------------------\r\n\r\nCALL FOR PAPERS\r\n\r\nThe fourth annual North-Eastern Student Colloquium on Artificial Intelligence (NESCAI) will be hosted at University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) on April 16-18. Students are encouraged to submit papers describing new or previously submitted research and ideas in all areas of AI (see partial list below). The primary author on each submitted paper must be a student attending a school in the northeastern United States or eastern Canada. Due to generous sponsorship, a small $50 registration fee covers conference costs and two nights of accommodation. The conference website can be found at http://nescai.cs.umass.edu.\r\n\r\nNESCAI is the premier student colloquium on AI, bringing together students from all areas of Artificial Intelligence research. The colloquium hosts students from the Northeastern U.S. and Eastern Canada and aims to foster an exchange of ideas, discussions and networking. NESCAI is sponsored by the Department of Computer Science at the University of Massachusetts Amherst, and Yahoo Inc.\r\n\r\nImportant Dates:\r\n\r\n * Paper Submission for Review: 1 March 2010\r\n * Reviewer Responses and Acceptance Decision: 22 March 2010\r\n * Final Revision of Accepted Papers: 5 April 2010 \r\n\r\nSubmission Details: We welcome both full and short papers. All accepted papers will be presented at a poster session and selected full papers will be accepted for talks.\r\n\r\nFULL PAPERS (8 pages): Appendices may exceed the eight-page limit, but the reviewers are under no obligation to read any material beyond the page limit. Full papers may be:\r\n\r\n * Research papers presenting previously submitted or novel research in AI\r\n * Conceptual papers presenting and motivating new ideas and research directions in AI\r\n * Survey papers summarizing the state of the art in a particular sub-field of AI \r\n\r\nSHORT PAPERS (2 pages): Short papers may be:\r\n\r\n * Research abstracts\r\n * Progress reports on ongoing research \r\n\r\nAll submissions will be peer-reviewed using a double-blind system by at least two graduate students in the respective areas. We encourage the resubmission of both previously and currently submitted papers, as long as this is indicated by the author. We will work with authors to ensure that copyrights held by other conferences will not be violated but we do not anticipate any problems, as there will be no formal publication of NESCAI proceedings.\r\n\r\nAll papers accepted by NESCAI (including those accepted as oral presentations) will also be presented as posters during one of the poster sessions. It is expected that all papers will be accepted for poster presentation, with only a select few being chosen for talks (based on peer reviews). \r\n\r\nFormatting instructions: Author Guidelines (http://nescai.cs.umass.edu/guidelines.php)\r\n\r\nQuestions:\r\n\r\nPlease contact the program committee:\r\nnescai-pc@cs.umass.edu\r\n\r\nProgram Committee:\r\nDavid Mimno (UMass, co-chair)\r\nSameer Singh (UMass, co-chair)\r\nCristian Danescu-Niculescu-Mizil (Cornell)\r\nKuzman Ganchev (UPenn)\r\nAlexandra Goultiaeva (UToronto)\r\nRob Hall (CMU)\r\nGeorge Konidaris (UMass)\r\nYuri Malitsky (Brown)\r\nChristian Muise (UToronto)\r\nMegan Olsen (UMass)\r\nOmar F. Zaidan (JHU)\r\nHaoqi Zhang (Harvard)\r\n\r\nContent Areas:\r\n * Agents (game theory, distributed AI, markets, etc.)\r\n * Applications (e.g., computational biology, sensor networks, etc.)\r\n * Approaches drawing from critical orientations and science studies\r\n * Cognitive architectures and modeling\r\n * Constraint satisfaction\r\n * Control Learning\r\n * Game playing and interactive entertainment\r\n * Human-computer interaction\r\n * Information integration\r\n * Knowledge bases and expert systems\r\n * Knowledge representation and reasoning\r\n * Machine learning and data mining\r\n * Natural language processing\r\n * Neural networks\r\n * Planning, scheduling and problem solving\r\n * Robotics\r\n * Search\r\n * Semantic web\r\n * Uncertainty\r\n * Vision and perception\r\n * Other (e.g., art and music, artificial life, philosophical foundations, mathematical foundations, etc.) (-----------------------------------------------------------, \r\n , NESCAI, 2010, \r\n, North, -, Eastern, Student, Colloquium, on, Artificial, Intelligence, \r\n , nescai.cs.umass.edu, \r\n, -----------------------------------------------------------, \r\n\r\n, CALL, FOR, PAPERS, \r\n\r\n, The, fourth, annual, North, -, Eastern, Student, Colloquium, on, Artificial, Intelligence, (, NESCAI, ), will, be, hosted, at, University, of, Massachusetts, Amherst, (, Amherst, ,, MA, ), on, April, 16, -, 18, ., Students, are, encouraged, to, submit, papers, describing, new, or, previously, submitted, research, and, ideas, in, all, areas, of, AI, (, see, partial, list, below, ), ., The, primary, author, on, each, submitted, paper, must, be, a, student, attending, a, school, in, the, northeastern, United, States, ...) MA [-----------------------------------------------------------, NESCAI 2010, North-Eastern Student Colloquium on Artificial Intelligence, nescai.cs.umass.edu, -----------------------------------------------------------, CALL FOR PAPERS, The fourth annual North-Eastern Student Colloquium on Artificial Intelligence (NESCAI) will be hosted at University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) on April 16-18, Students are encouraged to submit papers describing new or previously submitted research and ideas in all areas of AI (see partial list below), The primary author on each submitted paper must be a student attending a school in the northeastern United States or eastern Canada, Due to generous sponsorship, a small $50 registration fee covers conference costs and two nights of accommodation, The conference website can be found at http://nescai.cs.umass.edu., NESCAI is the premier student colloquium on AI, bringing together students from all areas of Artificial Intelligence research, The colloquium hosts students from the Northeastern U.S, and Eastern Canada and aims to foster an exchange of ideas, discussions and networking, NESCAI is sponsored by the Department of Computer Science at the University of Massachusetts Amherst, and Yahoo Inc., Important Dates:, * Paper Submission for Review: 1 March 2010, * Reviewer Responses and Acceptance Decision: 22 March 2010, * Final Revision of Accepted Papers: 5 April 2010 , Submission Details: We welcome both full and short papers, All accepted papers will be presented at a poster session and selected full papers will be accepted for talks., FULL PAPERS (8 pages): Appendices may exceed the eight-page limit, but the reviewers are under no obligation to read any material beyond the page limit, Full papers may be:, * Research papers presenting previously submitted or novel research in AI, * Conceptual papers presenting and motivating new ideas and research directions in AI, * Survey papers summarizing the state of the art in a particular sub-field of AI , SHORT PAPERS (2 pages): Short papers may be:, * Research abstracts, * Progress reports on ongoing research , All submissions will be peer-reviewed using a double-blind system by at least two graduate students in the respective areas, We encourage the resubmission of both previously and currently submitted papers, as long as this is indicated by the author, We will work with authors to ensure that copyrights held by other conferences will not be violated but we do not anticipate any problems, as there will be no formal publication of NESCAI proceedings., All papers accepted by NESCAI (including those accepted as oral presentations) will also be presented as posters during one of the poster sessions, It is expected that all papers will be accepted for poster presentation, with only a select few being chosen for talks (based on peer reviews), Formatting instructions: Author Guidelines (http://nescai.cs.umass.edu/guidelines.php), Questions:, Please contact the program committee:, nescai-pc@cs.umass.edu, Program Committee:, David Mimno (UMass, co-chair), Sameer Singh (UMass, co-chair), Cristian Danescu-Niculescu-Mizil (Cornell), Kuzman Ganchev (UPenn), Alexandra Goultiaeva (UToronto), Rob Hall (CMU), George Konidaris (UMass), Yuri Malitsky (Brown), Christian Muise (UToronto), Megan Olsen (UMass), Omar F, Zaidan (JHU), Haoqi Zhang (Harvard), Content Areas:, * Agents (game theory, distributed AI, markets, etc.), * Applications (e.g., computational biology, sensor networks, etc.), * Approaches drawing from critical orientations and science studies, * Cognitive architectures and modeling, * Constraint satisfaction, * Control Learning, * Game playing and interactive entertainment, * Human-computer interaction, * Information integration, * Knowledge bases and expert systems, * Knowledge representation and reasoning, * Machine learning and data mining, * Natural language processing, * Neural networks, * Planning, scheduling and problem solving, * Robotics, * Search, * Semantic web, * Uncertainty, * Vision and perception, * Other (e.g., art and music, artificial life, philosophical foundations, mathematical foundations, etc.)] Due to generous sponsorship, a small $50 registration fee covers conference costs and two nights of accommodation {'April 16-18': 'the fourth annual north-eastern student colloquium on artificial intelligence (nescai) will be hosted at university of massachusetts amherst (amherst, ma) on april 16-18', '1 March 2010': ' * paper submission for review: 1 march 2010', '22 March 2010': ' * reviewer responses and acceptance decision: 22 march 2010', '5 April 2010': ' * final revision of accepted papers: 5 april 2010 '}
5 IADIS International Conference e-Learning 2010 Freiburg, Germany CALL FOR PAPERS - Deadline for submissions (new date): 15 March 2010 --\n\nIADIS INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE E-LEARNING 2010\nFreiburg, Germany, 26 - 29 July 2010\n(http://www.elearning-conf.org/)\npart of the IADIS Multi Conference on Computer Science and Information Systems(MCCSIS 2010)\nFreiburg, Germany 26 ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ 31 July 2010 \n(http://www.mccsis.org/)\n\n* Conference background and goals\nThe IADIS e-Learning 2010 conference aims to address the main issues of concern within e-Learning. This conference covers both technical as well as the non-technical aspects of e-Learning.\nThe conference accepts submissions in the following seven main areas: Organisational Strategy and Management Issues; Technological Issues; e-Learning Curriculum Development Issues; Instructional Design Issues; e-Learning Delivery Issues; e-Learning Research Methods and Approaches; e-Skills and Information Literacy for Learning.\n\n* Format of the Conference \nThe conference will comprise of invited talks and oral presentations. The proceedings of the conference will be published in the form of a book and CD-ROM with ISBN, and will be available also in the IADIS Digital Library (accessible on-line).\n\n* Best Papers\nSelected authors of best papers will be invited to submit extended versions of their papers to selected journals (i.e. IADIS International Journal on Computer Science and Information Systems - ISSN: 1646-3692) including journals from INDERSCIENCE Publishers.\n\n* Types of submissions \nFull and Short Papers, Reflection Papers, Posters/Demonstrations, Tutorials, Panels and Doctoral Consortium. All submissions are subject to a blind refereeing process.\n\n* Topics related to e-Learning are of interest. These include, but are not limited to the following areas and topics: \n\nOrganisational Strategy and Management Issues (main area)\n- Higher and Further Education\n- Primary and Secondary Education\n- Workplace Learning\n- Vocational Training\n- Home Schooling\n- Distance Learning\n- Blended Learning\n- Change Management\n- Educational Management\n- Continuous Professional Development (CPD) for Educational and Training Staff \n- Return on e-Learning Investments (ROI)\n\nTechnological Issues (main area)\n- Learning Management Systems (LMS)\n- Managed Learning Environments (MLEs)\n- Virtual Learning Environments (VLEs)\n- Computer-Mediated Communication (CMC) Tools\n- Social Support Software\n- Architecture of Educational Information Systems Infrastructure\n- Security and Data Protection\n- Learning Objects\n- XML Schemas and the Semantic Web\n- Web 2.0 Applications\n\ne-Learning Curriculum Development Issues (main area)\n- Philosophies and Epistemologies for e-learning\n- Learning Theories and Approaches for e-learning\n- e-Learning Models\n- Conceptual Representations\n- Pedagogical Models\n- e-Learning Pedagogical Strategies\n- e-Learning Tactics\n- Developing e-Learning for Specific Subject Domains\n\nInstructional Design Issues (main area)\n- Designing e-Learning Settings\n- Developing e-Learning Pilots and Prototypes\n- Creating e-Learning Courses\n - Collaborative learning\n - Problem-based learning\n - Inquiry-based learning\n - Blended learning\n - Distance learning\n- Designing e-Learning Tasks\n - E-learning activities\n - Online Groupwork\n - Experiential learning\n - Simulations and Modelling\n - Gaming and edutainment\n - Creativity and design activities\n - Exploratory programming\n\ne-Learning Delivery Issues (main area)\n- e-Delivery in different contexts\n - Higher and Further Education\n - Primary and Secondary Schools\n - Workplace Learning\n - Vocational Training\n - Distance Learning\n- Online Assessment\n- Innovations in e-Assessment\n- e-Moderating\n- e-Tutoring\n- e-Facilitating\n- Leadership in e-Learning Delivery\n- Networked Information and Communication Literacy Skills\n- Participation and Motivation in e-Learning\n\ne-Learning Research Methods and Approaches (main area)\n- Action Research\n- Design Research\n- Course and Programme Evaluations\n- Systematic Literature Reviews\n- Historical Analysis\n- Case Studies\n- Meta-analysis of Case Studies \n- Effectiveness and Impact Studies\n- Evaluation of e-Learning Technologies\n- Evaluation of Student and Tutor Satisfaction \n- Learning and cognitive styles\n- Ethical Issues in e-learning\n\ne-Skills and Information Literacy for Learning (main area)\n- Teaching information literacy\n- Electronic library and information search skills\n- ICT skills education\n\t- in schools and colleges\n\t- for business, industry and the public sector\n\t- in adult, community, home and prison education\n\t- informal methods (peer groups, family)\n- Education for computer-mediated communication skills\n\t- Netiquette\n\t- Online safety for children and vulnerable users\n\t- Cybercrime awareness and personal prevention\n- Student production of online media\n\t- Web design\n\t- Digital storytelling\n\t- Web 2.0 tools\n\t- etc.\n- Digital media studies\n\n\n* Important Dates:\n- Submission Deadline (new date): 15 March 2010\n- Notification to Authors (new date): 12 April 2010\n- Final Camera-Ready Submission and Early Registration (new date): Until 7 May 2010\n- Late Registration (new date): After 7 May 2010\n- Conference: Freiburg, Germany, 26 - 29 July 2010\n\n* Conference Location \nThe conference will be held in Freiburg, Germany. \n\n* Secretariat \nIADIS Secretariat - IADIS INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE E-LEARNING 2010\nRua Sao Sebastiao da Pedreira, 100, 3 \n1050-209 Lisbon, Portugal \nE-mail: secretariat@elearning-conf.org/\nWeb site: http://www.elearning-conf.org/\n\n* Program Committee \n\ne-Learning 2010 Conference Program Chairs:\nMiguel Baptista Nunes, University of Sheffield, United Kingdom\nMaggie McPherson, University of Leeds, United Kingdom\n\nGeneral MCCSIS 2010 Conference Co-Chairs:\nPiet Kommers, University of Twente, The Netherlands \nPedro (http://www.elearning-conf.org/), part of the IADIS Multi Conference on Computer Science and Information Systems(MCCSIS 2010), Freiburg, Germany 26 ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ 31 July 2010 , (http://www.mccsis.org/), * Conference background and goals, The IADIS e-Learning 2010 conference aims to address the main issues of concern within e-Learning, This conference covers both technical as well as the non-technical aspects of e-Learning., The conference accepts submissions in the following seven main areas: Organisational Strategy and Management Issues; Technological Issues; e-Learning Curriculum Development Issues; Instructional Design Issues; e-Learning Delivery Issues; e-Learning Research Methods and Approaches; e-Skills and Information Literacy for Learning., * Format of the Conference , The conference will comprise of invited talks and oral presentations, The proceedings of the conference will be published in the form of a book and CD-ROM with ISBN, and will be available also in the IADIS Digital Library (accessible on-line)., * Best Papers, Selected authors of best papers will be invited to submit extended versions of their papers to selected journals (i.e, IADIS International Journal on Computer Science and Information Systems - ISSN: 1646-3692) including journals from INDERSCIENCE Publishers., * Types of submissions , Full and Short Papers, Reflection Papers, Posters/Demonstrations, Tutorials, Panels and Doctoral Consortium, All submissions are subject to a blind refereeing process., * Topics related to e-Learning are of interest, These include, but are not limited to the following areas and topics: , Organisational Strategy and Management Issues (main area), - Higher and Further Education, - Primary and Secondary Education, - Workplace Learning, - Vocational Training, - Home Schooling, - Distance Learning, - Blended Learning, - Change Management, - Educational Management, - Continuous Professional Development (CPD) for Educational and Training Staff , - Return on e-Learning Investments (ROI), Technological Issues (main area), - Learning Management Systems (LMS), - Managed Learning Environments (MLEs), - Virtual Learning Environments (VLEs), - Computer-Mediated Communication (CMC) Tools, - Social Support Software, - Architecture of Educational Information Systems Infrastructure, - Security and Data Protection, - Learning Objects, - XML Schemas and the Semantic Web, - Web 2.0 Applications, e-Learning Curriculum Development Issues (main area), - Philosophies and Epistemologies for e-learning, - Learning Theories and Approaches for e-learning, - e-Learning Models, - Conceptual Representations, - Pedagogical Models, - e-Learning Pedagogical Strategies, - e-Learning Tactics, - Developing e-Learning for Specific Subject Domains, Instructional Design Issues (main area), - Designing e-Learning Settings, - Developing e-Learning Pilots and Prototypes, - Creating e-Learning Courses, - Collaborative learning, - Problem-based learning, - Inquiry-based learning, - Blended learning, - Distance learning, - Designing e-Learning Tasks, - E-learning activities, - Online Groupwork, - Experiential learning, - Simulations and Modelling, - Gaming and edutainment, - Creativity and design activities, - Exploratory programming, e-Learning Delivery Issues (main area), - e-Delivery in different contexts, - Higher and Further Education, - Primary and Secondary Schools, - Workplace Learning, - Vocational Training, - Distance Learning, - Online Assessment, - Innovations in e-Assessment, - e-Moderating, - e-Tutoring, - e-Facilitating, - Leadership in e-Learning Delivery, - Networked Information and Communication Literacy Skills, - Participation and Motivation in e-Learning, e-Learning Research Methods and Approaches (main area), - Action Research, - Design Research, - Course and Programme Evaluations, - Systematic Literature Reviews, - Historical Analysis, - Case Studies, - Meta-analysis of Case Studies , - Effectiveness and Impact Studies, - Evaluation of e-Learning Technologies, - Evaluation of Student and Tutor Satisfaction , - Learning and cognitive styles, - Ethical Issues in e-learning, e-Skills and Information Literacy for Learning (main area), ...] IADIS INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE E-LEARNING 2010 {'15 March 2010': '- submission deadline (new date): 15 march 2010', '26 - 29 July 2010': '- conference: freiburg, germany, 26 - 29 july 2010', 'July 2010': 'freiburg, germany 26 ãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâ¢ãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâ¢ãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâ¬ãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâ¢ãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâ 6 IADIS International Conference Intelligent Systems and Agents 2010 Freiburg, Germany -- CALL FOR PAPERS - Deadline for submissions (new date): 15 March 2010 --\r\n\r\nIADIS INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE INTELLIGENT SYSTEMS AND AGENTS 2010\r\nFreiburg, Germany, 29 - 31 July 2010\r\n(http://www.isa-conf.org/)\r\npart of the IADIS Multi Conference on Computer Science and Information Systems (MCCSIS 2010)\r\nFreiburg, Germany 26 ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ 31 July 2010 \r\n(http://www.mccsis.org)\r\n\r\n* Conference background and goals\r\nThe IADIS Intelligent Systems and Agents conference addresses in detail two main aspects: intelligent systems and agents. The conference has the intention to provide a contribution to academics and practitioners. So, both fundamental and applied research are considered relevant.\r\n\r\n* Format of the Conference \r\nThe conference will comprise of invited talks and oral presentations. The proceedings of the conference will be published in the form of a book and CD-ROM with ISBN, and will be available also in the IADIS Digital Library (accessible on-line).\r\n\r\n* Best Papers\r\nSelected authors of best papers will be invited to submit extended versions of their papers to selected journals (i.e. IADIS International Journal on Computer Science and Information Systems - ISSN: 1646-3692) including journals from INDERSCIENCE Publishers.\r\n\r\n* Types of submissions \r\nFull and Short Papers, Reflection Papers, Posters/Demonstrations, Tutorials, Panels and Doctoral Consortium. \r\nAll submissions are subject to a blind refereeing process.\r\n\r\n* Topics related to Intelligent Systems and Agents are of interest. These include, but are not limited to the following areas: \r\n\r\nArea 1 ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ Intelligent Systems\r\n- Algorithms\r\n- Artificial Intelligence\r\n- Automation Systems and Control\r\n- BioInformatics \r\n- Computational Intelligence\r\n- Expert Systems\r\n- Fuzzy Technologies and Systems\r\n- Game and Decision Theories\r\n- Intelligent Control Systems\r\n- Intelligent Internet Systems \r\n- Intelligent Software Systems\r\n- Intelligent Systems\r\n- Machine Learning\r\n- Neural Networks\r\n- Neurocomputers\r\n- Optimization\r\n- Parallel Computation\r\n- Pattern Recognition\r\n- Robotics and Autonomous Robots\r\n- Signal Processing\r\n- Systems Modelling\r\n- Web Mining\r\n\r\nArea 2 ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ Agents\r\n- Adaptive Agent Systems\r\n- Agent Applications\r\n- Agent Communication\r\n- Agent Development\r\n- Agent middleware\r\n- Agent Models and Architectures\r\n- Agent Ontologies \r\n- Agent Oriented Systems and Engineering\r\n- Agent Programming, Languages and Environments\r\n- Agent Systems \r\n- Agent Technologies\r\n- Agent Theories\r\n- Agent Trends\r\n- Agents Analysis and Design\r\n- Agents and Learning\r\n- Agents and Ubiquitous Computing\r\n- Agents in Networks\r\n- Agents Protocols and Standards\r\n- Artificial Systems \r\n- Computational Complexity \r\n- eCommerce and Agents\r\n- Embodied Agents\r\n- Mobile Agents\r\n- Multi-Agent Systems\r\n- Negotiation Strategies\r\n- Performance Issues\r\n- Security, Privacy and Trust\r\n- Semantic Grids\r\n- Simulation\r\n- Web Agents\r\n\r\n* Important Dates:\r\n- Submission Deadline (new date): 15 March 2010\r\n- Notification to Authors (new date): 12 April 2010\r\n- Final Camera-Ready Submission and Early Registration (new date): Until 7 May 2010\r\n- Late Registration (new date): After 7 May 2010\r\n- Conference: Freiburg, Germany 29 - 31 July 2010\r\n\r\n* Conference Location \r\nThe conference will be held in Freiburg, Germany. \r\n\r\n* Secretariat \r\nIADIS Secretariat - IADIS INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE INTELLIGENT SYSTEMS AND AGENTS 2010\r\nRua Sao Sebastiao da Pedreira, 100, 3 Freiburg [-- CALL FOR PAPERS - Deadline for submissions (new date): 15 March 2010 --, IADIS INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE INTELLIGENT SYSTEMS AND AGENTS 2010, Freiburg, Germany, 29 - 31 July 2010, (http://www.isa-conf.org/), part of the IADIS Multi Conference on Computer Science and Information Systems (MCCSIS 2010), Freiburg, Germany 26 ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ 31 July 2010 , (http://www.mccsis.org), * Conference background and goals, The IADIS Intelligent Systems and Agents conference addresses in detail two main aspects: intelligent systems and agents, The conference has the intention to provide a contribution to academics and practitioners, So, both fundamental and applied research are considered relevant., * Format of the Conference , The conference will comprise of invited talks and oral presentations, The proceedings of the conference will be published in the form of a book and CD-ROM with ISBN, and will be available also in the IADIS Digital Library (accessible on-line)., * Best Papers, Selected authors of best papers will be invited to submit extended versions of their papers to selected journals (i.e, IADIS International Journal on Computer Science and Information Systems - ISSN: 1646-3692) including journals from INDERSCIENCE Publishers., * Types of submissions , Full and Short Papers, Reflection Papers, Posters/Demonstrations, Tutorials, Panels and Doctoral Consortium, All submissions are subject to a blind refereeing process., * Topics related to Intelligent Systems and Agents are of interest, These include, but are not limited to the following areas: , Area 1 ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ and Engineering, - Agent Programming, Languages and Environments, - Agent Systems , - Agent Technologies, - Agent Theories, - Agent Trends, - Agents Analysis and Design, - Agents and Learning, - - Multi-Agent Systems, - Negotiation Strategies, - Performance Issues, - Security, Privacy and Trust, - Semantic Grids, - Simulation, - Web Agents, * Important Dates:, - Submission Deadline (new date): 15 March 2010, - Notification to Authors (new date): 12 April 2010, - Final Camera-Ready Submission and Early Registration (new date): Until 7 May 2010, - Late Registration (new date): After 7 May 2010, - Conference: Freiburg, Germany 29 - 31 July 2010, * Conference Location , The conference will be held in Freiburg, Germany, * Secretariat , IADIS Secretariat - IADIS INTERNATIONAL 7 IADIS International Conference Wireless Applications and Computing 2010 Freiburg, Germany -- CALL FOR PAPERS - Deadline for submissions (new date): 15 March 2010 --\r\n\r\nIADIS INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE WIRELESS APPLICATIONS AND COMPUTING 2010\r\nFreiburg, Germany, 26 ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ 28 July 2010\r\n(http://www.wac-conf.org/)\r\npart of the IADIS Multi Conference on Computer Science and Information Systems (MCCSIS 2010)\r\nFreiburg, Germany 26 ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ 31 July 2010\r\n(http://www.mccsis.org)\r\n\r\n\r\n* Keynote Speaker (confirmed):\r\nProfessor Dirk Westhoff, Hamburg University of Applied Sciences, Germany\r\n\r\n* Conference background and goals\r\nThe IADIS Wireless Applications and Computing 2010 conference addresses several themes related to theory and practice within wireless networks, computing and application related areas. \r\n\r\nEnormous developments in wireless technologies made in recent years enabled both researchers and industry to create new, innovative wireless and mobile application and services, protocols, middleware platforms and application frameworks. Corresponding research is related to all communication layers, but also includes application-related topics, theoretical results and non-technical issues. Main topics have been identified. However, innovative contributions that donÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢t fit into these areas will also be considered since they might be of benefit to conference attendees.\r\n\r\n* Format of the Conference \r\nThe conference will comprise of invited talks and oral presentations. The proceedings of the conference will be published in the form of a book and CD-ROM with ISBN, and will be available also in the IADIS Digital Library (accessible on-line).\r\n\r\n* Best Papers\r\nSelected authors of best papers will be invited to submit extended versions of their papers to selected journals (i.e. IADIS International Journal on Computer Science and Information Systems - ISSN: 1646-3692) including journals from INDERSCIENCE Publishers.\r\n\r\n* Types of submissions \r\nFull and Short Papers, Reflection Papers, Posters/Demonstrations, Tutorials, Panels and Doctoral Consortium. \r\nAll submissions are subject to a blind refereeing process.\r\n\r\n* Topics related to Wireless Applications and Computing are of interest. These include, but are not limited to the following areas: \r\n\r\n- Ad-hoc Networking\r\n- Cellular Phone Networks and Satellite Based Systems\r\n- Context Aware Applications\r\n- Distributed Systems Aspects of Wireless Applications\r\n- Integration of Wired and Wireless Networks\r\n- Location-based Applications and Services\r\n- Mobile Commerce\r\n- Mobile Computing Software Architectures\r\n- Mobile Entertainment, Gaming and Learning\r\n- Performance and Simulation Aspects of Wireless Networks\r\n- Pervasive Computing\r\n- Security in Wireless Networks\r\n\r\n- Wireless Access Networks\r\n- Wireless Application Frameworks\r\n- Wireless Applications Programming\r\n- Wireless Communication Middleware\r\n- Wireless Database Access\r\n- Wireless End-user Devices\r\n- Wireless Home Networks\r\n- Wireless Multimedia\r\n- Wireless Peer-to-Peer Networks\r\n- Wireless Positioning Technologies\r\n- WLANs and WPANs\r\n\r\n* Important Dates:\r\n- Submission Deadline (new date): 15 March 2010\r\n- Notification to Authors (new date): 12 April 2010\r\n- Final Camera-Ready Submission and Early Registration (new date): Until 7 May 2010\r\n- Late Registration (new date): After 7 May 2010\r\n- Conference: Freiburg, Germany, 26 28 July 2010\r\n\r\n* Conference Location \r\nThe conference will be held in Freiburg, Germany. \r\n\r\n* Secretariat \r\nIADIS Secretariat - IADIS INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE WIRELESS APPLICATIONS AND 31 July 2010, (http://www.mccsis.org), * Keynote Speaker (confirmed):, Professor Dirk Westhoff, Hamburg University of Applied Sciences, Germany, * Conference background and goals, The IADIS Wireless Applications and Computing 2010 conference addresses several themes related to theory and practice within wireless networks, computing and application related areas, Enormous developments in wireless technologies made in recent years enabled both researchers and industry to create new, innovative wireless and mobile application and services, protocols, middleware platforms and application frameworks, Corresponding research is related to all communication layers, but also includes application-related topics, theoretical results and non-technical issues, Main topics have been identified, However, innovative contributions that donÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢t fit into these areas will also be considered since they might be of benefit to conference attendees., * Format of the Conference , The conference will comprise of invited talks and oral presentations, The proceedings of the conference will be published in the form of a book and CD-ROM with ISBN, and will be available also in the IADIS Digital Library (accessible on-line)., * Best Papers, Selected authors of best papers will be invited to submit extended versions of their papers to selected journals (i.e, IADIS International Journal on Computer Science and Information Systems - ISSN: 1646-3692) including journals from INDERSCIENCE Publishers., * Types of submissions , Full and Short Papers, Reflection Papers, Posters/Demonstrations, Tutorials, Panels and Doctoral Consortium, All submissions are subject to a blind refereeing process., * Topics related to Wireless Applications and Computing are of interest, These include, but are not limited to the following areas: , - Ad-hoc Networking, - Cellular Phone Networks and Satellite Based Systems, - Context Aware Applications, - Distributed Systems Aspects of Wireless Applications, - Integration of Wired and Wireless Networks, - Location-based Applications and Services, - Mobile Commerce, - Mobile Computing Software Architectures, - Mobile Entertainment, Gaming and Learning, - Performance and Simulation Aspects of Wireless Networks, - Pervasive Computing, - Security in Wireless Networks, - Wireless Access Networks, - Wireless Application Frameworks, - Wireless Applications Programming, - Wireless Communication Middleware, - Wireless Database Access, - Wireless End-user Devices, - Wireless Home Networks, - Wireless Multimedia, - Wireless Peer-to-Peer Networks, - Wireless Positioning Technologies, - WLANs and WPANs, * Important Dates:, - Submission Deadline (new date): 15 March 2010, - Notification to Authors (new date): 12 April 2010, - Final Camera-Ready Submission and Early Registration (new date): Until 7 May 2010, - Late Registration (new date): After 7 May 2010, - Conference: Freiburg, Germany, 26 8 IADIS International Conference Web Based Communities 2010 Freiburg, Germany Apologies for cross-postings.
