Toronto [Apologies for multiple postings., ============================================================, Second INTERNATIONAL WORKSHOP on , Collaborative Agents -- REsearch and Development (CARE) 2010, 31st August 2010, York University, Toronto, Canada, Abstract submission: April 14, 2010, Full paper submission: April 16, 2010, http://www.csse.monash.edu.au/~xtg/CARE2010/, ============================================================, The workshop is held in conjunction with the International Conference on Intelligent Agent Technology (IAT)., http://www.yorku.ca/wiiat10/, Summary, =======, Collaboration is required when multiple agents achieve complex goals that are difficult or impossible to attain for an individual agent, This collaboration takes place under conditions of incomplete information, uncertainty, and bounded rationality, much of which has been previously studied in economics and artificial intelligence, However, many real world domains are characterised by even greater complexity, including the possibility of unreliable and non-complying collaborators, complex market and incentive frameworks, and complex transaction costs and organisational structures, This workshop's thematic focus is on collaborative and autonomous agents that plan, negotiate, coordinate, and act under this complexity., , This workshop aims to foster discussions on computational models of collaboration in distributed systems, addressing a range of theoretical and practical issues, We seek contributions of members in research and industry that use the agent paradigm to approach their problems., , Some issues of interest of this workshop are:, o How to enable agents to form and follow joint agreements and contracts in complex organisational and market driven domains., o How to develop a comprehensive contractual formation/maintenance framework applicable to many application domains., o How to build comprehensive customer lifecycle management systems for customers, including telecommunication consumers, students and patients., o How to deploy lifecycle management systems in real world applications, such as healthcare, telecommunication, and smart campuses., o How to design markets that are adequate for agents to act with incomplete and uncertain information of the behaviour of collaborating agents, o How to build MAS that work efficiently in partially regulated markets (where governance policy or partnership agreements govern part of the market)., o What are the implications of partial regulation on the management of contractual relationships and service delivery., o How organisational structures influence the negotiation of agents and the distribution/execution of tasks., o How to cope with collaborators that exhibit unreliable and non-conformant behaviour, eg where agreements are made but are not always conformed with., o How can interventions and incentive structures assist in managing contractual relationships and service delivery., o How to assign transaction costs to actions in planning, assignment, and execution in organisational structures, o How can transaction costs influence the social outcome of the system which is further influenced by the organisational context under which the collaboration takes place, o Can lessons learnt in game theoretic computation inform collaborative agent settings., o What role does learning and adaptivity play in building organisational MAS., The one day workshop will feature a mixture of invited talks, discussions and submitted contributions describing current work or work in progress in collaborative agent research and technology, The workshop environment fosters open discussions among all participants, particularly encouraging students to discuss their research topics and seek feedback from senior agent researchers., Contact, =======, CARE organisers, christian.guttmann@gmail.com, dignum@cs.uu.nl , Important Dates, ===============, Abstract submission: April 14, 2010, Full paper submission: April 16, 2010, Notification: May 28, 2010, Camera ready: June 7, 2010, Topics of Interest include (but are not limited to):, ====================================================, RESEARCH, * Collaboration frameworks, * Models of teamwork and joint action, * Organisation/Institutes/Norms, * Auctioning/Negotiation, * Task/Resource allocation, * Behaviour modelling/monitoring, * Adherence/Intervention mechanisms, * Incentive frameworks, * Intervention mechanisms, * Agreement technology, * Contract networks/formation, * Cloud computing, APPLICATION AREAS, * Collaborative care planning/management , * Disaster planning/management, * Traffic planning/management, * Transport/Logistics, * Applications in primary and preventative healthcare , * Chronic disease planning/management, * Epidemiological agent models, * Unmanned air/land vehicles, * Robotic soccer/Robotic rescues, * Weather forecast, * Artificial and natural immune systems, * Social networks (e.g., LinkedIn, Facebook,...), * Smart grid network (e.g., electricity/gas metering), Submission and Publication, ==========================, Submission is to be done electronically at Cyberchair at: http://wi-consortium.org/cyberchair/wiiat10/scripts/ws_submit.php, CARE 2010 seeks 4-page submissions formatted according to IEEE specification, Style Files for Paper Submission, IEEE Computer Society Proceedings Manuscript Formatting Guidelines:, DOC: 15 IEEE GLOBECOM 2010 Next-Generation Networking (NGN) Symposium Miami, FL Call For Paper\n\nIEEE GLOBECOM 2010 Next-Generation Networking (NGN) Symposium\nDecember 6-10, 2010, Miami, Florida, USA\n\nScope and Motivation\n\nNetworking technologies have experienced profound levels of advancement\nover the last three decades. These evolutions have come about as a\nresult of relentless research and development efforts across all layers\nof the network hierarchy. As these advances continue to transform our\neveryday lives, many new challenges and opportunities are emerging in\nthe broader area of "next-generation networking". In particular, some of\nthe key focus areas include network heterogeneity, scalability,\nvirtualization, services and applications, security, manageability,\ndependability, and performance predictability. Moreover, the\nnext-generation wireless networks are introducing even more niche\nproblems in mobility management, content distribution, and\nself-organization. \n\nAlong these lines, the planned Next-Generation\nNetworking (NGN) Symposium at IEEE GLOBECOM 2010 will hope to address\nmany of these exciting new focus areas. This symposium will solicit\nparticipation from both academic and industry researchers working in the\narea of next-generation networking technologies, services,\narchitectures, and protocols. The overall goal here will be to present a\nlatest snapshot of the ongoing work as well as to shed further light on\nfuture directions in this space. The symposium will encourage the\nsubmission of novel technical studies as well as broader position and\nvision papers comprising hypothetical/speculative scenarios. \n\nTopics of Interest\n\nThe planned symposium topics of interest include, but are not limited\n\no Future Internet and next-generation networking architectures\no Heterogeneous multi-layer and multi-domain networks, wireless-wireline \n internetworking\no Overlay networks and peer-to-peer networking\no Network virtualization, virtual private networks (VPN), and services\no Provisioning, monitoring, and management of IP services: traffic\n engineering, mobility support, etc.\no Flow management: resource sharing, congestion control, etc.\no Routing: unicast, multicast, anycast, etc (wireless, wireline)\no Multihoming, network planning and optimization\no Addressing and naming, especially in the presence of mobility and portability\no Operational and research issues with IPv6\no VoIP protocols and services\no Self-protecting networking\no Switch and router architectures, performance, control, buffer\n management, packet scheduling \no Network management methodologies and control plane design\no Internet survivability and network resilience strategies\no Mechanisms for self-organisation and autonomous networking\no Traffic measurement, analysis, modeling, visualization, and engineering\no Anomaly, intrusion, and attack detection/prevention\no Policy based mechanisms and high-speed firewall technology\no Packet classification and forwarding mechanisms at ultra-high link rates (ter\nabits)\no High speed and parallel processing architectures for next generation routers\no Connecting mobile/wireless devices to the Internet\no Converged networks and applications, including NGN telecom networks\no Content-based networking: caching, distribution, load balancing, resiliency\no Mobile/wireless content distribution\no Internet applications including interactive media, voice and video,\n games, immersive applications \no Internet signalling and service enabling protocols, including SIP,\n NSIS, HTTP, RTSP/RTP, etc \no Privacy and/or security issues and intrusion detection/prevention in\n the Internet \no Design methodologies for Internet services\no Internet economics, pricing models, accounting, Internet growth\n modeling \no IP multimedia subsystem: architecture and design\no Next-Generation access networking\n\nImportant Dates\n\n o Paper Submission: March 15, 2010\n o Paper Acceptance: July 1, 2010\n o Camera-ready Paper: August 1, 2010\n o Conference: December 6-12, 2010\n\nSymposium Chairs\n\nYan Chen, Northwestern University\nZhenhai Duan, Florida State University\nNasir Ghani, University of New Mexico\nWojciech Kabacinski, Poznan University of Technology (Call, For, Paper, \n\n, IEEE, GLOBECOM, 2010, Next, -, Generation, Networking, (, NGN, ), Symposium, \n, December, 6, -, 10, ,, 2010, ,, Miami, ,, Florida, ,, USA, \n\n, Scope, and, Motivation, \n\n, Networking, technologies, have, experienced, profound, levels, of, advancement, \n, over, the, last, three, decades, ., These, evolutions, have, come, about, as, a, \n, result, of, relentless, research, and, development, efforts, across, all, layers, \n, of, the, network, hierarchy, ., As, these, advances, continue, to, transform, our, \n, everyday, lives, ,, many, new, challenges, and, opportunities, are, emerging, in, \n, the, broader, area, of, ", next, -, generation, ...) Miami [Call For Paper, IEEE GLOBECOM 2010 Next-Generation Networking (NGN) Symposium, December 6-10, 2010, Miami, Florida, USA, Scope and Motivation, Networking technologies have experienced profound levels of advancement, over the last three decades, These evolutions have come about as a, result of relentless research and development efforts across all layers, of the network hierarchy, As these advances continue to transform our, everyday lives, many new challenges and opportunities are emerging in, the broader area of "next-generation networking", In particular, some of, the key focus areas include network heterogeneity, scalability,, virtualization, services and applications, security, manageability,, dependability, and performance predictability, Moreover, the, next-generation wireless networks are introducing even more niche, problems in mobility management, content distribution, and, self-organization, Along these lines, the planned Next-Generation, Networking (NGN) Symposium at IEEE GLOBECOM 2010 will hope to address, many of these exciting new focus areas, This symposium will solicit, participation from both academic and industry researchers working in the, area of next-generation networking technologies, services,, architectures, and protocols, The overall goal here will be to present a, latest snapshot of the ongoing work as well as to shed further light on, future directions in this space, The symposium will encourage the, submission of novel technical studies as well as broader position and, vision papers comprising hypothetical/speculative scenarios, Topics of Interest, The planned symposium topics of interest include, but are not limited, o Future Internet and next-generation networking architectures, o Heterogeneous multi-layer and multi-domain networks, wireless-wireline , internetworking, o Overlay networks and peer-to-peer networking, o Network virtualization, virtual private networks (VPN), and services, o Provisioning, monitoring, and management of IP services: traffic, engineering, mobility support, etc., o Flow management: resource sharing, congestion control, etc., o Routing: unicast, multicast, anycast, etc (wireless, wireline), o Multihoming, network planning and optimization, o Addressing and naming, especially in the presence of mobility and portability, o Operational and research issues with IPv6, o VoIP protocols and services, o Self-protecting networking, o Switch and router architectures, performance, control, buffer, management, packet scheduling , o Network management methodologies and control plane design, o Internet survivability and network resilience strategies, o Mechanisms for self-organisation and autonomous networking, o Traffic measurement, analysis, modeling, visualization, and engineering, o Anomaly, intrusion, and attack detection/prevention, o Policy based mechanisms and high-speed firewall technology, o Packet classification and forwarding mechanisms at ultra-high link rates (ter, abits), o High speed and parallel processing architectures for next generation routers, o Connecting mobile/wireless devices to the Internet, o Converged networks and applications, including NGN telecom networks, o Content-based networking: caching, distribution, load balancing, resiliency, o Mobile/wireless content distribution, o Internet applications including interactive media, voice and video,, games, immersive applications , o Internet signalling and service enabling protocols, including SIP,, NSIS, HTTP, RTSP/RTP, etc , o Privacy and/or security issues and intrusion detection/prevention in, the Internet , o Design methodologies for Internet services, o Internet economics, pricing models, accounting, Internet growth, modeling , o IP multimedia subsystem: architecture and design, o Next-Generation access networking, Important Dates, o Paper Submission: March 15, 2010, o Paper Acceptance: July 1, 2010, o Camera-ready Paper: August 1, 2010, o Conference: December 6-12, 2010, Symposium Chairs, Yan Chen, Northwestern University, Zhenhai Duan, Florida State University, Nasir Ghani, University of New Mexico, Wojciech Kabacinski, Poznan University of Technology] IEEE GLOBECOM 2010 Next-Generation Networking (NGN) Symposium {'December 6-10, 2010': 'december 6-10, 2010, miami, florida, usa', 'March 15, 2010': ' o paper submission: march 15, 2010', 'July 1, 2010': ' o paper acceptance: july 1, 2010', 'August 1, 2010': ' o camera-ready paper: august 1, 2010', 'December 6-12, 2010': ' o conference: december 6-12, 2010'}
16 Fourth International Workshop on Trustworthy Ubiquitous Computing Paris, France \n CALL FOR PAPERS - TwUC 2010\n\nFourth International Workshop on Trustworthy Ubiquitous Computing\n (TwUC 2010)\n\nNovember 8-10, 2010, Paris, France\n\nhttp://www.twuc.info\n------------------------------------------------------------------------\n\nThe Fourth International Workshop on the vision of a trustworthy\nubiquitous computing will be held on November 8-10, 2010, in Paris,\nFrance. The workshop will be held in conjunction with the 12th\ninternational conference on Advances in Mobile Multimedia (iiWAS2010)\nand the 8thInternational Conference on Advances in Mobile Computing &\nMultimedia (MoMM2010). TwUC covers aspects of trust in ubiquitous\ncomputing environments. The aspects of context, privacy, reliability,\nusability and user experience related to ubiquitous computing\nenvironments represent the main topics of the workshop.\n\nMarc Weiser presented his vision of disappearing and ubiquitous\ncomputing more than 15 years ago. The big picture of the computer\nintroduced into our environment was a big innovation and the starting\npoint for various areas of research. In order to totally adopt the idea\nof ubiquitous computing several houses were build, equipped with\ntechnology and used as laboratory in order to find and test appliances\nthat are useful and could be made available in our everyday life.\nWithin the last years industry picked up the idea of integrating\nubiquitous computing and already available products like remote\ncontrols for your house were developed and brought to the marked.\n\nIn spite of many applications and projects in the area of ubiquitous\nand pervasive computing the success is still far away. One of the main\nreasons is the lack of acceptance of and confidence in this technology.\nAlthough researchers and industry are working in all of these areas a\nforum to elaborate security, reliability and privacy issues, that\nresolve in trustworthy interfaces and computing environments for people\ninteracting within these ubiquitous environments is important. The user\nexperience factor of trust thus becomes a crucial issue for the success\nof a UbiComp application.\n\nThe goal of the TwUC 2010 workshop is to provide an international forum\nfor scientists, engineers and industry to address recent research\nresults and to present and discuss their ideas, theories, technologies,\nsystems, tools, applications, work in progress and experiences on all\ntheoretical and practical issues.\n\nTopics of Interest The conference program will include peer reviewed\nfull papers around but not limited to the following topics:\n\n- Usability and HCI in Ubiquitous Computing Environments\n\t- Methods and concepts to enhance and ensure usability in \n\t UbiComp environments User experience in ubiquitous environ-\n\t ments \n\t- User satisfaction and trust in ubiquitous environments\n\t- User perceived QoS, usability and quality of experience (QoE) \n\t- Trust and context in ubiquitous environments \n\t- Trust and the design of UbiComp appliances User centred \n\t design in ubiquitous environments \n\t- User centred evaluation methods in ubiquitous environments \n- Security in Ubiquitous Computing Environments \n\t- Security issues and technologies \n\t- Usage policies \n\t- Identity and access \n\t- Threat and vulnerability\n\t- Malicious software in ubiquitous environments and its effect\n\t on trust \n\t- Trusted computing and platforms \n- Reliability in Ubiquitous Computing Environments\n\t- Software design \n\t- Software quality and metrics \n\t- Methods and concepts to enhance and ensure reliability in \n\t UbiComp applications and environments \n- Privacy in Ubiquitous Computing Environments \n\t- Issues and appliances on privacy in ubiquitous computing \n\t environments \n\t- Data and information ownership \n\t- Souvereignity of social and technical methods for ensuring \n\t confidentiality \n\nIMPORTANT DATES\n\nExtended paper submission deadline: July 31, 2010\n\nPaper submission July 15, 2010 \nAcceptance Notification August 30, 2010 \nCamera-Ready Papers September 30, 2010 \nTwUC 2010 Workshop November 8-10, 2010\n\nPUBLICATION\n\nAll accepted conference papers will be published together with the iiWAS2010 /\nMoMM2010 proceedings by the ACM digital library and the Austrian computer\nsociety books@ocg books series. Distinguished papers, after further revisions,\nwill be published in selected journals. For a detailed list of journals please\nvisit our website http://www.twuc.info\n\nSUBMISSION\n\nThe TwUC2010 workshop solicits full and short research papers. For detailed\ninformation concerning the submission please visit our website\nhttp://www.twuc.info\n\nCONTACT\n\nThomas Grill, ICT&S Centre, University of Salzburg\nSigmund-Haffner Str. 18, 5020 Salzburg, Austria Email: thomas.grill[at[sbg.ac.at (\n , CALL, FOR, PAPERS, -, TwUC, 2010, \n\n, Fourth, International, Workshop, on, Trustworthy, Ubiquitous, Computing, \n , (, TwUC, 2010, ), \n\n, November, 8, -, 10, ,, 2010, ,, Paris, ,, France, \n\n, http://www.twuc.info, \n, ------------------------------------------------------------------------, \n\n, The, Fourth, International, Workshop, on, the, vision, of, a, trustworthy, \n, ubiquitous, computing, will, be, held, on, November, 8, -, 10, ,, 2010, ,, in, Paris, ,, \n, France, ., The, workshop, will, be, held, in, conjunction, with, the, 12th, \n, international, conference, on, Advances, in, Mobile, Multimedia, (, iiWAS2010, ), \n, and, the, 8thInternational, Conference, on, Advances, in, Mobile, Computing, &, \n, Multimedia, ...) Paris [ CALL FOR PAPERS - TwUC 2010, Fourth International Workshop on Trustworthy Ubiquitous Computing, (TwUC 2010), November 8-10, 2010, Paris, France, http://www.twuc.info, ------------------------------------------------------------------------, The Fourth International Workshop on the vision of a trustworthy, ubiquitous computing will be held on November 8-10, 2010, in Paris,, France, The workshop will be held in conjunction with the 12th, international conference on Advances in Mobile Multimedia (iiWAS2010), and the 8thInternational Conference on Advances in Mobile Computing &, Multimedia (MoMM2010), TwUC covers aspects of trust in ubiquitous, computing environments, The aspects of context, privacy, reliability,, usability and user experience related to ubiquitous computing, environments represent the main topics of the workshop., Marc Weiser presented his vision of disappearing and ubiquitous, computing more than 15 years ago, The big picture of the computer, introduced into our environment was a big innovation and the starting, point for various areas of research, In order to totally adopt the idea, of ubiquitous computing several houses were build, equipped with, technology and used as laboratory in order to find and test appliances, that are useful and could be made available in our everyday life., Within the last years industry picked up the idea of integrating, ubiquitous computing and already available products like remote, controls for your house were developed and brought to the marked., In spite of many applications and projects in the area of ubiquitous, and pervasive computing the success is still far away, One of the main, reasons is the lack of acceptance of and confidence in this technology., Although researchers and industry are working in all of these areas a, forum to elaborate security, reliability and privacy issues, that, resolve in trustworthy interfaces and computing environments for people, interacting within these ubiquitous environments is important, The user, experience factor of trust thus becomes a crucial issue for the success, of a UbiComp application., The goal of the TwUC 2010 workshop is to provide an international forum, for scientists, engineers and industry to address recent research, results and to present and discuss their ideas, theories, technologies,, systems, tools, applications, work in progress and experiences on all, theoretical and practical issues., Topics of Interest The conference program will include peer reviewed, full papers around but not limited to the following topics:, - Usability and HCI in Ubiquitous Computing Environments, \t- Methods and concepts to enhance and ensure usability in , \t UbiComp environments User experience in ubiquitous environ-, \t ments , \t- User satisfaction and trust in ubiquitous environments, \t- User perceived QoS, usability and quality of experience (QoE) , \t- Trust and context in ubiquitous environments , \t- Trust and the design of UbiComp appliances User centred , \t design in ubiquitous environments , \t- User centred evaluation methods in ubiquitous environments , - Security in Ubiquitous Computing Environments , \t- Security issues and technologies , \t- Usage policies , \t- Identity and access , \t- Threat and vulnerability, \t- Malicious software in ubiquitous environments and its effect, \t on trust , \t- Trusted computing and platforms , - Reliability in Ubiquitous Computing Environments, \t- Software design , \t- Software quality and metrics , \t- Methods and concepts to enhance and ensure reliability in , \t UbiComp applications and environments , - Privacy in Ubiquitous Computing Environments , \t- Issues and appliances on privacy in ubiquitous computing , \t environments , \t- Data and information ownership , \t- Souvereignity of social and technical methods for ensuring , \t confidentiality , IMPORTANT DATES, Extended paper submission deadline: July 31, 2010, Paper submission July 15, 2010 , Acceptance Notification August 30, 2010 , Camera-Ready Papers September 30, 2010 , TwUC 2010 Workshop November 8-10, 2010, PUBLICATION, All accepted conference papers will be published together with the iiWAS2010 /, MoMM2010 proceedings by the ACM digital library and the Austrian computer, society books@ocg books series, Distinguished papers, after further revisions,, will be published in selected journals, For a detailed list of journals please, visit our website http://www.twuc.info, SUBMISSION, The TwUC2010 workshop solicits full and short research papers, For detailed, information concerning the submission please visit our website, http://www.twuc.info, CONTACT, Thomas Grill, ICT&S Centre, University of Salzburg, Sigmund-Haffner Str, 18, 5020 Salzburg, Austria Email: thomas.grill[at[sbg.ac.at] Fourth International Workshop on Trustworthy Ubiquitous Computing {'November 8-10, 2010': 'twuc 2010 workshop november 8-10, 2010', 'July 31, 2010': 'extended paper submission deadline: july 31, 2010', 'July 15, 2010': 'paper submission july 15, 2010 ', 'August 30, 2010': 'acceptance notification august 30, 2010 ', 'September 30, 2010': 'camera-ready papers september 30, 2010 '}
17 2nd International Workshop on Reliable Networks Design and Modeling Moscow, Russia \n Call for Papers\n\n RNDM 2010\n\n 2nd International Workshop on Reliable Networks Design and Modeling\n\n 18th-20th October 2010, Moscow, Russia\n\n http://www.rndm.pl\n\n technically sponsored by IEEE \n---------------------------------------------------------------------\n\n\nRNDM 2010 is the second meeting in the series of RNDM workshops. Following the success of the first event that took place in St. Petersburg, Russia (http://www.rndm.pl/rndm09/rndm09final.pdf), RNDM 2010 is aimed at attracting world-class participants from both academia and industry working in the area of reliable networks design and modeling.\nSpecial attention will be paid to network survivability, i.e. the capability to deliver essential services in the presence of failures. Therefore, the workshop will focus on methods of survivable networks design and modeling, including the issues of dedicated/shared backup paths, p-cycles, fast service recovery, service resilience differentiation, survivability of multilayer networks and others. \n\n\nThe topics cover, but are not necessarily limited to the following: \n\n- coordination of multilayer survivability operations,\n- design of dedicated/shared backup paths,\n- fast service recovery,\n- fault management and control in survivable networks,\n- impact on detection accuracy and latency on survivability,\n- methods for measurement, evaluation, or validation \n of survivability,\n- modeling malicious behaviour or attacks on networks,\n- models and algorithms of survivable networks design and modeling,\n- multilayer network survivability,\n- optical networks survivability,\n- p-cycles and other protection structures,\n- restoration strategies under different types of failures,\n- role of redundancy in survivable networks,\n- self-regenerative networks,\n- service resilience differentiation,\n- survivability of anycast and multicast networks,\n- survivability of P2P and overlay systems,\n- survivability under traffic grooming in multilayer networks,\n- theory and methods of reliability and availability,\n- use of self-healing techniques in surviving attacks,\n- wired/wireless network survivability.\n\n \nThe authors are encouraged to submit full papers describing original, previously unpublished research results, not currently under review by another conference or journal, addressing state-of-the-art research and development in the area of reliable networks design and modeling.\nAll submitted papers will be reviewed. All accepted papers will be published in IEEE Xplore and additionally in printed proceedings with an ISBN number. Paper submission and review will be done via EDAS (http://www.edas.info/newPaper.php?c=8823&track=9505). The maximum length of submitted papers should not exceed 6 pages formatted according to the IEEE instructions available at http://www.ieee.org/web/publications/authors/transjnl/ \n\nExtended version of papers of special merit will be considered for publication in a Journal Special Issue. A Best Paper Award will be given. \n\nMore information can be found at http://www.rndm.pl.\n\n----------------------------------------------------------------------\n\nGENERAL CHAIR\n Jacek Rak, Gdansk University of Technology (PL)\n\nCO-CHAIRS\n David Tipper, University of Pittsburgh (US)\n Krzysztof Walkowiak, Wroclaw University of Technology (PL)\n\n\nSTEERING COMMITTEE \n Maurice Gagnaire, Telecom ParisTech (FR)\n Josep Sole Pareta, Universitat Politecnica de Catalunya (ES)\n Mario Pickavet, Ghent University (BE)\n Michal Pioro, Warsaw University of Technology (PL), Lund University (SE)\n Jacek Rak, Gdansk University of Technology (PL)\n\n\nTECHNICAL PROGRAM COMMITTEE \n Nail Akar, Bilkent University (TR)\n Achim Autenrieth, Nokia Siemens Networks (DE)\n Piotr Cholda, AGH University of Science and Technology (PL)\n Tibor Cinkler, Budapest University of Technology \n and Economics (HU)\n John Doucette, TRLabs, University of Alberta (CA)\n Luigi Fratta, Politecnico do Milano (IT)\n Maurice Gagnaire, Telecom ParisTech (FR)\n Nasir Ghani, University of New Mexico (US)\n Wayne D. Grover, TRLabs, University of Alberta (CA)\n Claus Gruber, Detecon International GmbH (DE)\n Anwar Haque, Bell (CA)\n Bjarne Helvik, Norwegian University of Science and Technology (NO)\n Andrzej Jajszczyk, AGH University of Science and Technology (PL)\n Brigitte Jaumard, Concordia University (CA)\n Sun-il Kim, University of Alaska (US)\n Ken-ichi Kitayama, Osaka University (JP)\n Olivier Klopfenstein, Orange Labs (FR)\n Arie Koster, RWTH Aachen (DE)\n Igor Kotenko, SPIIRAS (RU)\n Lemin Li, University of Electronic Science and Technology \n of China (CN) \n Lorne Mason, McGill University (CA)\n Deep Medhi, University of Missouri - Kansas City (US)\n Michael Menth, Universitaet Wuerzburg (DE)\n Wojciech Molisz, Gdansk University of Technology (PL)\n Hussein Mouftah, University of Ottawa (CA)\n Biswanath Mukherjee, University of California, Davis (US)\n Sebastian Orlowski, Konrad-Zuse-Zentrum fuer \n Informationstechnik Berlin (DE)\n Krzysztof Pawlikowski, University of Canterbury (NZ)\n Mario Pickavet, Ghent University (BE)\n Michal Pioro, Warsaw University of Technology (PL), \n Lund University (SE)\n George Rouskas, North Carolina State University Sterbenz, University of Kansas (US), \n Lancaster University (UK)\n Suresh Subramaniam, George Washington University (US)\n Janos Tapolcai, Budapest University of Technology \n and Economics (HU)\n Massimo Tornatore, University of California, Davis (US)\n Kishor Trivedi, Duke University (US)\n Dominique VerchÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ©re, fÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¼r 2010\n- workshop: October 18-20, 2010\n--------------------------------------------------------------------- (\n , Call, for, Papers, \n\n , RNDM, 2010, \n\n , 2nd, International, Workshop, on, Reliable, Networks, Design, and, Modeling, \n\n , 18th-20th, October, 2010, ,, Moscow, ,, Russia, \n\n , http://www.rndm.pl, \n\n , technically, sponsored, by, IEEE, \n, ---------------------------------------------------------------------, \n\n\n, RNDM, 2010, is, the, second, meeting, in, the, series, of, RNDM, workshops, ., Following, the, success, of, the, first, event, that, took, place, in, St., Petersburg, ,, Russia, (, http://www.rndm.pl/rndm09/rndm09final.pdf, ), ,, RNDM, 2010, is, aimed, at, attracting, world, -, class, participants, from, both, academia, and, industry, working, in, the, area, of, reliable, networks, design, and, modeling, ., \n, Special, attention, will, be, paid, to, ...) Moscow [ Call for Papers, RNDM 2010, 2nd International Workshop on Reliable Networks Design and Modeling, 18th-20th October 2010, Moscow, Russia, http://www.rndm.pl, technically sponsored by IEEE , ---------------------------------------------------------------------, RNDM 2010 is the second meeting in the series of RNDM workshops, Following the success of the first event that took place in St, Petersburg, Russia (http://www.rndm.pl/rndm09/rndm09final.pdf), RNDM 2010 is aimed at attracting world-class participants from both academia and industry working in the area of reliable networks design and modeling., Special attention will be paid to network survivability, i.e, the capability to deliver essential services in the presence of failures, Therefore, the workshop will focus on methods of survivable networks design and modeling, including the issues of dedicated/shared backup paths, p-cycles, fast service recovery, service resilience differentiation, survivability of multilayer networks and others, The topics cover, but are not necessarily limited to the following: , - coordination of multilayer survivability operations,, - design of dedicated/shared backup paths,, - fast service recovery,, - fault management and control in survivable networks,, - impact on detection accuracy and latency on survivability,, - methods for measurement, evaluation, or validation , of survivability,, - modeling malicious behaviour or attacks on networks,, - models and algorithms of survivable networks design and modeling,, - multilayer network survivability,, - optical networks survivability,, - p-cycles and other protection structures,, - restoration strategies under different types of failures,, - role of redundancy in survivable networks,, - self-regenerative networks,, - service resilience differentiation,, - survivability of anycast and multicast networks,, - survivability of P2P and overlay systems,, - survivability under traffic grooming in multilayer networks,, - theory and methods of reliability and availability,, - use of self-healing techniques in surviving attacks,, - wired/wireless network survivability., , The authors are encouraged to submit full papers describing original, previously unpublished research results, not currently under review by another conference or journal, addressing state-of-the-art research and development in the area of reliable networks design and modeling., All submitted papers will be reviewed, All accepted papers will be published in IEEE Xplore and additionally in printed proceedings with an ISBN number, Paper submission and review will be done via EDAS (http://www.edas.info/newPaper.php?c=8823&track=9505), The maximum length of submitted papers should not exceed 6 pages formatted according to the IEEE instructions available at http://www.ieee.org/web/publications/authors/transjnl/ , Extended version of papers of special merit will be considered for publication in a Journal Special Issue, A Best Paper Award will be given, More information can be found at http://www.rndm.pl., ----------------------------------------------------------------------, GENERAL CHAIR, Jacek Rak, Gdansk University of Technology (PL), CO-CHAIRS, David Tipper, University of Pittsburgh (US), Krzysztof Walkowiak, Wroclaw University of Technology (PL), STEERING COMMITTEE , Maurice Gagnaire, Telecom ParisTech (FR), Josep Sole Pareta, Universitat Politecnica de Catalunya (ES), Mario Pickavet, Ghent University (BE), Michal Pioro, Warsaw University of Technology (PL), Lund University (SE), Jacek 18 2nd Symposium on Progress in Information and Communication Technology Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia SPICT 2010 - CALL FOR PAPERS \n2nd Symposium on Progress in Information and Communication Technology\nKuala Lumpur\n============================\n\nSPICT'10 solicits contributions from the following non-exclusive list of topics in information and communication technology:\n\n- Agent & Multi-agent Systems\n- Antennas & Propagation\n- Artificial Intelligence\n- Bioinformatics & Scientific Computing\n- Business Intelligence\n- Communication Systems and Networks\n- Complex Systems: Modeling and Simulation\n- Computer Vision\n- Database and Application\n- Geographical Information Systems\n- Grid and Utility Computing\n- Image Processing\n- Information indexing & retrieval\n- Information Systems\n- Intelligent Systems\n- Internet Technology\n- Knowledge Management\n- Mobile Communication Services\n- Multimedia Technology and Systems\n- Natural Language Processing\n- Network Management and services\n- Ontology and Web Semantic\n- Optical Communications and Networks\n- Parallel and Distributed Computing\n- Pattern Recognition\n- Pervasive Computing\n- Real-Time and Embedded Systems\n- Remote Sensing\n- Robotic Technologies\n- Security and Cryptography\n- Sensor Networks\n- Service Computing\n- Signal Processing\n- Software Engineering\n- Strategic Information Systems\n\nIMPORTANT DATES \n=============== \nPaper Submission Deadline: August 1, 2010\nNotification of Acceptance: September 1, 2010\nCamera-Ready Deadline: October 15, 2010\nMain Conference to be held: December 12 - 13, 2010\n\nPAPER SUBMISSION \n================ \nAll submissions will be handled electronically via the conference website http://spict.utar.edu.my/SPICT-10/. \nReviewing will be double-blind. \nIn submitting a manuscript to SPICT, authors acknowledge that no paper substantially similar in content \nhas been or will be submitted to another conference or workshop during the review period \n(July 1, 2009 Communication, Technology, \n, Kuala, Lumpur, \n, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, \n\n, SPICT'10, solicits, contributions, from, the, following, Kuala Lumpur [SPICT 2010 - CALL FOR PAPERS , 2nd Symposium on Progress in Information and Communication Technology, Kuala Lumpur, ============================, SPICT'10 solicits contributions from the following non-exclusive list of topics in information and communication technology:, - Agent & Multi-agent Systems, - Antennas & Propagation, - Artificial Intelligence, - Bioinformatics & Scientific Computing, - Business Intelligence, - Communication Systems and Networks, - Complex Systems: Modeling and Simulation, - Computer Vision, - Database and Application, - Geographical Information Systems, - Grid and Utility Computing, - Image Processing, - Information indexing & retrieval, - Information Systems, - Intelligent Systems, - Internet Technology, - Knowledge Management, - Mobile Communication Services, - Multimedia Technology and Systems, - Natural Language Processing, - Network Management and services, - Ontology and Web Semantic, - Optical Communications and Networks, - Parallel and Distributed Computing, - Pattern Recognition, - Pervasive Computing, - Real-Time and Embedded Systems, - Remote Sensing, - Robotic Technologies, - Security and Cryptography, - Sensor Networks, - Service Computing, - Signal Processing, - Software Engineering, - Strategic Information Systems, IMPORTANT DATES , =============== , Paper Submission Deadline: August 1, 2010, Notification of Acceptance: September 1, 2010, Camera-Ready Deadline: October 15, 2010, Main Conference to be held: December 12 - 13, 2010, PAPER SUBMISSION , ================ , All submissions will be handled electronically via the conference website http://spict.utar.edu.my/SPICT-10/, Reviewing will be double-blind, In submitting a manuscript to SPICT, authors acknowledge that no paper substantially similar in content , has been or will be submitted to another conference or workshop during the review period , (July 1, 2009 ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ August 15, 2010) , For further information and updates: http://spict.utar.edu.my/SPICT-10/] 2nd Symposium on Progress in Information and Communication Technology {'August 1, 2010': 'paper submission deadline: august 1, 2010', 'September 1, 2010': 'notification of acceptance: september 1, 2010', 'October 15, 2010': 'camera-ready deadline: october 15, 2010', 'December 12 - 13, 2010': 'main conference to be held: december 12 - 13, 2010', 'July 1, 2009': '(july 1, 2009 ãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâ¢ãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâ¢ãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâ¬ãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâ¢ãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâ august 15, 2010) ', 'August 15, 2010': '(july 1, 2009 ãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâ¢ãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâ¢ãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâ¬ãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâ¢ãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâ august 15, 2010) '}
19 10th International Workshop on Worst-Case Execution Time Analysis Brussels, Belgium 10th International Workshop on Worst-Case Execution Time Analysis\n\n Brussels, Belgium\n July 6, 2010\n http://www.artist-embedded.org/artist/WCET-2010.html\n\nin conjunction with the 22nd Euromicro Intl Conference on Real-Time Systems\nhttp://ecrts.eit.uni-kl.de/ecrts10\n\nGOALS:\n\nThe goal of the workshop is to bring together people from academia, tool\nvendors and users in industry who are interested in all aspects of timing\nanalysis for real-time systems. The workshop fosters a highly interactive\nformat with ample time for in-depth discussions. It provides a relaxed forum\nto present and discuss new ideas, new research directions, and to review\ncurrent trends in this area. The presentations will be kept short to leave\nplenty of time for interaction of attendees.\n\nTOPICS:\n\nThe topics of the workshop include any issue related to timing analysis, in\nparticular:\n\n- Different approaches to WCET computation\n- Flow analysis for WCET, loop bounds, feasible paths\n- Low-level timing analysis, modeling and analysis of processor features\n- Strategies to reduce the complexity of WCET analysis\n- Integration of WCET and schedulability analysis\n- Methods and benchmarks for WCET analysis evaluation\n- Case studies, and industrial experience of WCET analysis\n- Measurement-based WCET analysis\n- Tools for WCET analysis\n- Program and processor design for timing predictability\n- Integration of WCET analysis in development processes\n- Compiler optimizations for worst-case paths\n- WCET analysis for multi-threaded and multi-core systems\n- WCET analysis in the academic curriculum\n\nStatements which are innovative, controversial, or that present new approaches\nare specially sought.\n\nSUBMISSION OF PAPERS:\n\nPapers for the workshop must be written in English, should not exceed 10 pages\nin the specified format, and should be submitted in PDF via the EasyChair\nsystem at\n\n https://www.easychair.org/login.cgi?conf=wcet2010\n\nFormatting instructions and templates are given at the workshop website,\n\n http://www.artist-embedded.org/artist/WCET-2010.html\n\nSubmissions not adhering to the page limit, or formatting instructions, may be\nrejected without further reviewing. Authors of accepted papers shall prepare\nand submit a final version of their paper. The deadline for these final\nversions is June 10, 2010. The workshop proceedings with the final papers will\nbe published by the Austrian Computer Society (OCG, http://www.ocg.at/) as OCG\nSchriftenreihe (with ISBN number).\n\nIMPORTANT DATES:\n\n Submission deadline: April 13 2010\n Notification of acceptance: May 14 2010\n Final version of papers due: June 10 2010\n WCET Workshop: July 6 2010\n\nPROGRAM COMMITTEE:\n\n Antoine Colin, Rapita Systems Ltd., UK\n Amine Marref, MÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¤lardalen University, Sweden\n Christine Rochange, IRIT, University of Toulouse, France\n Isabelle Puaut, University of Rennes I/IRISA, France\n Niklas Holsti, Tidorum Ltd, Finland\n Stefan Petters, Polytechnic Institute of Porto, Portugal\n Heiko Falk, Technische University, Sweden\n Peter Puschner, Vienna University of Technology, Austria\n\nThe workshop is supported by the ArtistDesign NoE,\nhttp://www.artist-embedded.org/artist/ (10th, International, Workshop, on, Worst, -, Case, Execution, Time, Analysis, \n\n , Brussels, ,, Belgium, \n , July, 6, ,, 2010, \n , http://www.artist-embedded.org/artist/WCET-2010.html, \n\n, in, conjunction, with, the, 22nd, Euromicro, Intl, Conference, on, Real, -, Time, Systems, \n, http://ecrts.eit.uni, -, kl.de, /, ecrts10, \n\n, GOALS, :, \n\n, The, goal, of, the, workshop, is, to, bring, together, people, from, academia, ,, tool, \n, vendors, and, users, in, industry, who, are, interested, in, all, aspects, of, timing, \n, analysis, for, real, -, time, systems, ., The, workshop, fosters, a, highly, interactive, \n, format, with, ample, time, for, in, -, depth, discussions, ., It, provides, ...) Brussels [10th International Workshop on Worst-Case Execution Time Analysis, Brussels, Belgium, July 6, 2010, http://www.artist-embedded.org/artist/WCET-2010.html, in conjunction with the 22nd Euromicro Intl Conference on Real-Time Systems, http://ecrts.eit.uni-kl.de/ecrts10, GOALS:, The goal of the workshop is to bring together people from academia, tool, vendors and users in industry who are interested in all aspects of timing, analysis for real-time systems, The workshop fosters a highly interactive, format with ample time for in-depth discussions, It provides a relaxed forum, to present and discuss new ideas, new research directions, and to review, current trends in this area, The presentations will be kept short to leave, plenty of time for interaction of attendees., TOPICS:, The topics of the workshop include any issue related to timing analysis, in, particular:, - Different approaches to WCET computation, - Flow analysis for WCET, loop bounds, feasible paths, - Low-level timing analysis, modeling and analysis of processor features, - Strategies to reduce the complexity of WCET analysis, - Integration of WCET and schedulability analysis, - Methods and benchmarks for WCET analysis evaluation, - Case studies, and industrial experience of WCET analysis, - Measurement-based WCET analysis, - Tools for WCET analysis, - Program and processor design for timing predictability, - Integration of WCET analysis in development processes, - Compiler optimizations for worst-case paths, - WCET analysis for multi-threaded and multi-core systems, - WCET analysis in the academic curriculum, Statements which are innovative, controversial, or that present new approaches, are specially sought., SUBMISSION OF PAPERS:, Papers for the workshop must be written in English, should not exceed 10 pages, in the specified format, and should be submitted in PDF via the EasyChair, system at, https://www.easychair.org/login.cgi?conf=wcet2010, Formatting instructions and templates are given at the workshop website,, http://www.artist-embedded.org/artist/WCET-2010.html, Submissions not adhering to the page limit, or formatting instructions, may be, rejected without further reviewing, Authors of accepted papers shall prepare, and submit a final version of their paper, The deadline for these final, versions is June 10, 2010, The workshop proceedings with the final papers will, be published by the Austrian Computer Society (OCG, http://www.ocg.at/) as OCG, Schriftenreihe (with ISBN number)., IMPORTANT DATES:, Submission deadline: April 13 2010, Notification of acceptance: May 14 2010, Final version of papers due: June 10 2010, WCET Workshop: July 6 2010, PROGRAM COMMITTEE:, Antoine Colin, Rapita Systems Ltd., UK, Amine Marref, KÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¤stner, AbsInt GmbH, Germany, STEERING COMMITTEE:, Guillem Bernat, Rapita Systems Ltd., UK, Jan Gustafsson, MÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¤lardalen 20 International Electron Devices and Materials Symposium Chungli, Taiwan CALL FOR PAPERS.\nThe International Electron Devices and Materials Symposium (IEDMS) 2010 \nTo be held at National Central University, Taiwan, and scheduled from Thursday, 18 November to Friday 19 November. The main theme of 2010 IEDMS is "Green Technology"; topics of interest are, but not limited to the followings:\n\n * Sustainable Energy Devices\n Solar cells, thermoelectric devices, energy conversion devices\n * Integrated Circuits and Packaging Technologies\n 3-D ICs and packaging, Low power consumption ICs, Power devices, Novel memory\n * Compound Semiconductor Materials, Electronic and Photonic Devices\n High-speed devices, Lasers, light-emitting diodes, photodetectors, Organic electronics\n * Novel Nano Devices and Materials, Sensors\n Novel Nano structures and devices, Spintronics, sensor materials and devices\n\nImportant Dates: \n * Abstract Submission: 7/31/2010\n * Notification of Acceptance: 8/31/2010\n * Final Paper Submission: 9/30/2010\n * Advanced Registration: 10/31/2010\n * Conference: 11/18/2010 - 11/19/2010 (CALL, FOR, PAPERS, ., \n, The, International, Electron, Devices, and, Materials, Symposium, (, IEDMS, ), 2010, \n, To, be, held, at, National, Central, University, ,, Taiwan, ,, and, scheduled, from, Thursday, ,, 18, November, to, Friday, 19, November, ., The, main, theme, of, 2010, IEDMS, is, ", Green, Technology, ", ;, topics, of, interest, are, ,, but, not, limited, to, the, followings, :, \n\n , *, Sustainable, Energy, Devices, \n , Solar, cells, ,, thermoelectric, devices, ,, energy, conversion, devices, \n , *, Integrated, Circuits, and, Packaging, Technologies, \n , 3-D, ICs, and, packaging, ,, Low, power, consumption, ICs, ,, Power, devices, ,, Novel, ...) Taiwan [CALL FOR PAPERS., The International Electron Devices and Materials Symposium (IEDMS) 2010 , To be held at National Central University, Taiwan, and scheduled from Thursday, 18 November to Friday 19 November, The main theme of 2010 IEDMS is "Green Technology"; topics of interest are, but not limited to the followings:, * Sustainable Energy Devices, Solar cells, thermoelectric devices, energy conversion devices, * Integrated Circuits and Packaging Technologies, 3-D ICs and packaging, Low power consumption ICs, Power devices, Novel memory, * Compound Semiconductor Materials, Electronic and Photonic Devices, High-speed devices, Lasers, light-emitting diodes, photodetectors, Organic electronics, * Novel Nano Devices and Materials, Sensors, Novel Nano structures and devices, Spintronics, sensor materials and devices, Important Dates: , * Abstract Submission: 7/31/2010, * Notification of Acceptance: 8/31/2010, * Final Paper Submission: 9/30/2010, * Advanced Registration: 10/31/2010, * Conference: 11/18/2010 - 11/19/2010] The International Electron Devices and Materials Symposium (IEDMS) 2010 {'Thursday': 'to be held at national central university, taiwan, and scheduled from thursday, 18 november to friday 19 november', '7/31/2010': ' * abstract submission: 7/31/2010', '8/31/2010': ' * notification of acceptance: 8/31/2010', '9/30/2010': ' * final paper submission: 9/30/2010'}
21 The 2nd Workshop on Privacy and Security in Pervasive and Ambient Intelligence Environments Samos, Greece **************************************\n\nCall for Papers - Workshop PSPAE 2010\nThe 2nd Workshop on Privacy and Security in Pervasive and Ambient Intelligence Environments\n*** Proceedings published by ACM (electronic) **\n\n (in conjunction with 3rd International Conference on\nPErvasiveTechnologies Related to Assistive Environments\n(PETRA) 2010)\n***** June 23-25, Samos, GREECE ****\n\n ** Workshop Web Site http://www.petrae.org/workshop.htm (please\nselect PSPAE) **\n** / Topics and areas of interest include, but are not limited to:** /\n\n*Privacy, security and trust in the design of pervasive and ambient\nintelligence environments\n\n * Ethical issues of Ambient Intelligence\n * Ethical guidelines for the design of pervasive and ambient intelligence environments\n\n*User and/or usability/user experience studies related to the\ndesign of pervasive and ambient intelligence environments\n*Policies and practices for access, authentication, authorization and auditing\nin pervasive and ambient environments\n*Policies for information sharing in pervasive environments\n*User and context awareness in pervasive computing and ambient intelligent environments\n\n * Access Control enforcement, authentication and secure data access in pervasive environments\n * Encryption, cryptographic techniques to ensure privacy and security in pervasive environments\n * Case studies in respect to privacy and security in pervasive environments\n * Developing secure pervasive/ambient infrastructures\n\n****/ Conference Proceedings: /******\nACM will be the publisher of the\nproceedings of the PETRA conference and workshops and\nthe conference proceedings will be a volume in the ACM International Conference\nProceedings Series (electronic) in the ACM Digital Library.. Authors should *use the\n ACM Word or LaTeX style templates to prepare their articles. See: http://www.acm.org/sigs/pubs/proceed/template.html\nAuthors should apply ACM Computing Classification categories and terms.\n The Classification Schemecan be found at: http://www..acm.org/class/1998/\n\n * Papers may be accepted either as full papers (8 pages) or short papers (4 pages).\n * At least one author, of each accepted paper, is required to register and present the paper.\n\n*******Important dates:************\n*Paper Submission Deadline: March 15, 2010 \n*Notifications of Acceptance: March 25, 2010\n*Final manuscript deadline: March 30, 2010\n*Conference begins: June 23, 2010\n\n * Submission information:*\n\nInterested authors should submit their contribution at the conference\nsite (please goto www.petrae.org then --) choose workshops and select\n--) PSPAE.\nAt the end of the page under Submission Information please follow the link to the submission\nsystem)\n ***Workshop Chairs***\n Grammati Pantziou, Technological Educational Institution (T.E.I.) of Athens ,Greece\nPetros Belsis, T.E.I. of Athens , Greece\nMatt Bishop, University of California , Davis , USA (*, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, \n\n, Call, for, Papers, -, Workshop, PSPAE, 2010, \n, The, 2nd, Workshop, on, Privacy, and, Security, in, Pervasive, and, Ambient, Intelligence, Environments, \n, *, *, *, Proceedings, published, by, ACM, (, electronic, ), *, *, \n\n , (, in, conjunction, with, 3rd, International, Conference, on, \n, PErvasiveTechnologies, Related, to, Assistive, Environments, \n, (, PETRA, ), 2010, ), \n, *, *, *, *, *, ...) 5, 2010\nHangzhou, China\n\n\nTopics include but are not limited to:\n\n * High-Performance Computing\n * Parallel and Distributed Computing/ Algorithms\n * Multimedia & Signal Processing\n * Data Mining & Data Engineering\n * Graph & Image & Video processing\n * Meteorological Information Processing\n * Numerical Weather Forecast\n * Internet, intranet and extranet security\n * Internet Information Transmission\n * Information Security Technology and Theory\n * Geographic Information System (GIS)\n * Management Information System (MIS)\n * E-Commerce and E-business\n * Communications & Mobile Computing\n * Informatization & Education\n * Enterprise Informatization\n * Bioinformatics and Biological computation\n * Biology & Medical Information Process\n * Mathematics Methods in Information processing\n * Soil & Hydrology Information Processing\n * Computer Forensic Technology\n\n Download Call for Paper\n ICISE2010 Call for Papers (PDF format)\n ICISE2010 Call for Papers (MS Word .doc format)\n\n Deadlines\n Paper Submission: June 1, 2010\n Acceptance Notification: August 15, 2010\n Author Registration: September 15, 2010\n Conference Date : December 3-5, 2010 (Dear, all, ,, \n\n, Please, see, the, forwaded, email, for, details, about, the, conference, ., \n\n, A, CALL, FOR, PAPERS, \n, 2nd, International, Conference, on, Information, Science, and, Engineering, \n, December, 3, -, 5, ,, 2010, \n, Hangzhou, ,, China, \n\n\n, Topics, include, but, are, not, limited, to, :, \n\n , *, High, -, Performance, Computing, \n , *, Parallel, and, Distributed, Computing/, Algorithms, \n , *, Multimedia, &, Signal, Processing, \n , *, Data, Mining, &, Data, Engineering, \n , *, Graph, &, Image, &, Video, processing, \n , *, Meteorological, Information, Processing, \n , *, Numerical, Weather, Forecast, \n , *, Internet, ,, intranet, and, extranet, ...) 23 Seventh International Conference on Data Integration in the Life Sciences Gothenburg, Sweden CALL FOR PAPERS\nSeventh International Conference on Data Integration in the Life Sciences\nin Gothenburg, Sweden\nAugust 25th - 27th 2010\n\nThe development and increasingly widespread deployment of high throughput experimental methods in the life sciences is giving rise to numerous large, complex and valuable data resources. This foundation of experimental data underpins the systematic study of organisms and diseases, which increasingly depend on the development of models of biological systems. The development of these models often requires integration of diverse experimental data resources; once constructed, the models themselves become data and present new integration challenges for tasks such as interpretation, validation and comparison.\nTopics of Interest\n\nDILS provides a forum for the discussion of emerging challenges for data integration in the life sciences, and the techniques that seek to address them. Topics of interest include, but are not limited to:\n\n * Architectures and data management techniques for the life sciences\n * Query processing and optimization for biological data\n * Biological Data sharing and update propagation\n * Query formulation assistance for scientists\n * Modeling of life sciences data\n * Biological Metadata management\n * Annotation in scientific data integration\n * Provenance modeling and management for the life sciences\n * Scientific Workflows and analysis pipelines\n * Laboratory information management systems in biology\n * Biological data quality and data cleaning\n * Life sciences ontologies\n * Semantic web for the life sciences\n * Mining integrated life sciences data\n * Text mining in the life science literature\n * Machine learning in data integration in the life sciences\n * Grid Computing and Grid technologies for the life sciences\n * System prototypes for biology\n * Commercial solutions in the life sciences\n * Integration challenges presented by new kinds of biological data\n * Scientific results arising from innovative data integration solutions\n\nSubmission Guidelines\n\nAuthors are invited to submit original contributions of practical relevance and technical rigor, experience reports and demonstrations of relevance to data integration in the life sciences. DILS 2010 invites two types of papers:\n\n 1. Research papers (up to 16 pages).\n 2. System/Demonstration papers (up to 8 pages).\n\nPapers describing commercial solutions are welcome as long as sufficient detail of the problem and its technical solution are provided.\n\nPlease find detailed instructions for preparing the camera-ready copy of your paper in Springer's LNCS Author and Volume Editor Instructions.\n\n \n\nThe proceedings of DILS will be published by Springer in Lecture Notes in Bioinformatics.\n\n \n\nPlease submit your paper using the DILS 2010 EasyChair site:\nhttp://www.easychair.org/conferences/?conf=dils2010\n\n \n\nAbstract submission deadline: 11 April 2010\n\nFull paper deadline: 18 April 2010\n\nAuthor Notification: 17 May 2010\n\nCamera Ready Copy Due: 7 June 2010 (CALL, FOR, PAPERS, \n, Seventh, International, Conference, on, Data, Integration, in, the, Life, Sciences, \n, in, Gothenburg, ,, Sweden, \n, August, 25th, -, 27th, 2010, \n\n, The, development, and, increasingly, widespread, deployment, of, high, throughput, experimental, methods, in, the, life, sciences, is, giving, rise, to, numerous, large, ,, complex, and, valuable, data, resources, ., This, foundation, of, experimental, data, underpins, the, systematic, study, of, organisms, and, diseases, ,, which, increasingly, depend, on, the, development, of, models, of, biological, systems, ., The, development, of, these, models, often, requires, integration, of, diverse, experimental, data, resources, ;, once, constructed, ,, the, models, themselves, ...) Gothenburg [CALL FOR PAPERS, Seventh International Conference on Data Integration in the Life Sciences, in Gothenburg, Sweden, August 25th - 27th 2010, The development and increasingly widespread deployment of high throughput experimental methods in the life sciences is giving rise to numerous large, complex and valuable data resources, This foundation of experimental data underpins the systematic study of organisms and diseases, which increasingly depend on the development of models of biological systems, The development of these models often requires integration of diverse experimental data resources; once constructed, the models themselves become data and present new integration challenges for tasks such as interpretation, validation and comparison., Topics of Interest, DILS provides a forum for the discussion of emerging challenges for data integration in the life sciences, and the techniques that seek to address them, Topics of interest include, but are not limited to:, * Architectures and data management techniques for the life sciences, * Query processing and optimization for biological data, * Biological Data sharing and update propagation, * Query formulation assistance for scientists, * Modeling of life sciences data, * Biological Metadata management, * Annotation in scientific data integration, * Provenance modeling and management for the life sciences, * Scientific Workflows and analysis pipelines, * Laboratory information management systems in biology, * Biological data quality and data cleaning, * Life sciences ontologies, * Semantic web for the life sciences, * Mining integrated life sciences data, * Text mining in the life science literature, * Machine learning in data integration in the life sciences, * Grid Computing and Grid technologies for the life sciences, * System prototypes for biology, * Commercial solutions in the life sciences, * Integration challenges presented by new kinds of biological data, * Scientific results arising from innovative data integration solutions, Submission Guidelines, Authors are invited to submit original contributions of practical relevance and technical rigor, experience reports and demonstrations of relevance to data integration in the life sciences, DILS 2010 invites two types of papers:, 1, Research papers (up to 16 pages)., 2, System/Demonstration papers (up to 8 pages)., Papers describing commercial solutions are welcome as long as sufficient detail of the problem and its technical solution are provided., Please find detailed instructions for preparing the camera-ready copy of your paper in Springer's LNCS Author and Volume Editor Instructions., , The proceedings of DILS will be published by Springer in Lecture Notes in Bioinformatics., , Please submit your paper using the DILS 2010 EasyChair site:, http://www.easychair.org/conferences/?conf=dils2010, , Abstract submission deadline: 11 April 2010, Full paper deadline: 18 April 2010, Author Notification: 17 May 2010, Camera Ready Copy Due: 7 June 2010] Seventh International Conference on Data Integration in the Life Sciences {'August 25th - 27th 2010': 'august 25th - 27th 2010', '11 April 2010': 'abstract submission deadline: 11 april 2010', '18 April 2010': 'full paper deadline: 18 april 2010', 'May 2010': 'author notification: 17 may 2010', '7 June 2010': 'camera ready copy due: 7 june 2010'}
24 Twelfth IEEE Workshop on Control and Modeling for Power Electronics (COMPEL 2010) Boulder, USA Twelfth IEEE Workshop on Control and Modeling for Power Electronics (COMPEL 2010)\n28th June 2010 - 30th June 2010\n\nImportant Dates\n\n Digest submissions deadline: April 2, 2010\n Author notification of acceptance by May 7, 2010\n Final papers due: June 26, 2010 (Twelfth, IEEE, Workshop, on, Control, and, Modeling, for, Power, Electronics, (, COMPEL, 2010, ), \n, 28th, June, 2010, -, 30th, June, 2010, \n\n, Important, Dates, \n\n , Digest, submissions, deadline, :, April, 2, ,, 2010, \n , Author, notification, of, acceptance, by, May, 7, ,, 2010, \n , Final, papers, due, :, June, 26, ,, 2010) None [Twelfth IEEE Workshop on Control and Modeling for Power Electronics (COMPEL 2010), 28th June 2010 - 30th June 2010, Important Dates, Digest submissions deadline: April 2, 2010, Author notification of acceptance by May 7, 2010, Final papers due: June 26, 2010] Twelfth IEEE Workshop on Control and Modeling for Power Electronics (COMPEL 2010) {'April 2, 2010': ' digest submissions deadline: april 2, 2010', 'May 7, 2010': ' author notification of acceptance by may 7, 2010', 'June 26, 2010': ' final papers due: june 26, 2010'}
25 5th Advanced Satellite Multimedia Systems Conference and the 11th Signal Processing for Space Communications Workshop Cagliari, Italy The 5th Advanced Satellite Multimedia Systems Conference and the 11th Signal Processing for Space Communications Workshop \n\nTheory\n\n * Coding, modulation and synchronization schemes\n * OFDM and spread spectrum techniques for satellite communications\n * MIMO, multi-user detection & diversity techniques\n * Fading and interference mitigation techniques\n * Distortion countermeasures\n * Applicability of advanced signal processing and communication techniques to GNSSs\n * Propagation measurements and channel models\n * Antennas and user terminals technologies\n * Signal processing for secure communications and signal intelligence applications\n * Multiple access strategies\n * Networking and radio resource management\n\nSystems Architectures and Applications\n\n * On board processing techniques and advanced payload architectures\n * Next generation mobile, broadband and broadcast satellite systems\n * Fixed and mobile technologies in hybrid access networks\n * Advance high-rate digital modems for space communications\n * Integration between satellite, MANET, VANET and wireless sensor networks\n * Integration between telecommunication, navigation and earth observation systems\n * Satellite and the Future Internet\n * Unmanned Aerial Vehicles supported by integrated space systems\n * Satellite-based solutions for aeronautical applications (Air Traffic Control, Aeronautical Operational Control, Air Passenger Communications)\n * Cross layer design of satellite networks and ad-hoc satellite networking\n * Standardization and regulatory issues\n * Business and market analysis of SatCom systems\n * Operational experience with existing satellite systems\n * Demonstrations and trials\n\nVenue\n\nThe joint event will be held at the Hotel Flamingo Resort in Pula, Cagliari, Sardinia, Italy. Sardina is a pearl in the Mediterranean Sea. The sea of Sardina with its transparent blue, turquoise, green waters, contours the island perimeter, consigning it to the myth of paradise-like lands\n\nImportant dates\n\nPaper Registration on EDAS: March 15, 2010 \nFull paper submission deadline: April 11, 2010\nAcceptance notice: May 15, 2010\nFinal manuscript due: June 15, 2010\n\nAuthors of the best papers presented at the conference will be invited to contribute to a Special Issue of an International Journal devoted to the ASMS highlights. (The, 5th, Advanced, Satellite, Multimedia, Systems, Conference, and, the, 11th, Signal, Processing, for, Space, Communications, Workshop, \n\n, Theory, \n\n , *, Coding, ,, modulation, and, synchronization, schemes, \n , *, OFDM, and, spread, spectrum, techniques, for, satellite, communications, \n , *, MIMO, ,, multi, -, user, detection, &, diversity, techniques, \n , *, Fading, and, interference, mitigation, techniques, \n , *, Distortion, countermeasures, \n , *, Applicability, of, advanced, signal, processing, and, communication, techniques, to, GNSSs, \n , *, Propagation, measurements, and, channel, models, \n , *, Antennas, and, user, terminals, technologies, \n , *, Signal, processing, for, secure, communications, and, signal, intelligence, applications, \n , *, Multiple, access, strategies, ...) 26 The International Symposium on Wireless Personal Multimedia Communications Recife, Pernambuco, Brazil The International Symposium on Wireless Personal Multimedia Communications 2010 will be held in Recife, Brazil. The venue is 10 minutes from International Airport of Guararapes and is in Boa Viagem beach area. The beach is protected by a line of natural reefs, after which the city was named.\n\nThe WPMC Symposia series was inaugurated in 1998 at Yokosuka Research Park, Japan, as a forum for enabling collaboration in the field of wireless multimedia communications. Over the years WPMC has been held in Asia, Europe and North America, and has established itself as a unique global symposium dedicated to wireless multimedia convergence.\n\nContinuing the series, the 13th edition of the symposium will held for the first time in South America and that too in Brazil ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ home to diversity.\nImportant Dates\n\nPaper Submission: March 10, 2010\n\nTutorial Proposal Submission: April 10, 2010\n\nNotification of Acceptance: June 10, 2010\n\nCamera-Ready Submission: July 10, 2010\n\nConference dates: October 11, 2010 -
