36 Workshop on Multilinguality in Information Access Evaluation: Bringing Content, Users, Languages and Tasks into the Loop Milton Keynes, United Kingdom Calling for papers\nWorkshop on Multilinguality in Information Access Evaluation: Bringing Content, Users, Languages and Tasks into the Loop\nMilton Keynes, England\n\n\nServices and users of multilingual IR systems continue to evolve, with many new factors and trends influencing the field. E.g., we are moving to a situation in which there is no longer a single dominant language in which most online information is captured and, with the advance of broadband access and the evolution of both wired and wireless connectivity, users are not just information consumers, but also producers. Text now comes in many shapes: user generated, with low publishing threshold, heavily contextualised, often code switching and multi-lingual, and under little or no editorial control, changes the scene for much of the processing frameworks we previously have been able to assume: blogs, discussion forums, comments left behind on news sites, IM, SMS, Twitter: many new formats for textual interaction carry valuable and timely information, which needs specific tools for processing.\n\nImportant Dates\n\n * Submission Deadline: Friday 12nd February 2010\n * Notification of Acceptance: Friday 26th February 2010\n * Camera Ready: Wednesday 10th March 2010\n * Workshop: Sunday 28th March 2010. (Calling, for, papers, \n, Workshop, on, Multilinguality, in, Information, Access, Evaluation, :, Bringing, Content, ,, Users, ,, Languages, and, Tasks, into, the, Loop, \n, Milton, Keynes, ,, England, \n\n\n, Services, and, users, of, multilingual, IR, systems, continue, to, evolve, ,, with, many, new, factors, and, trends, influencing, the, field, ., E.g., ,, we, are, moving, to, a, situation, in, which, there, is, no, longer, a, single, dominant, language, in, which, most, online, information, is, captured, and, ,, with, the, advance, of, broadband, access, and, the, evolution, of, both, wired, and, wireless, connectivity, ,, users, are, not, just, information, consumers, ,, ...) None [Calling for papers, Workshop on Multilinguality in Information Access Evaluation: Bringing Content, Users, Languages and Tasks into the Loop, Milton Keynes, England, Services and users of multilingual IR systems continue to evolve, with many new factors and trends influencing the field, E.g., we are moving to a situation in which there is no longer a single dominant language in which most online information is captured and, with the advance of broadband access and the evolution of both wired and wireless connectivity, users are not just information consumers, but also producers, Text now comes in many shapes: user generated, with low publishing threshold, heavily contextualised, often code switching and multi-lingual, and under little or no editorial control, changes the scene for much of the processing frameworks we previously have been able to assume: blogs, discussion forums, comments left behind on news sites, IM, SMS, Twitter: many new formats for textual interaction carry valuable and timely information, which needs specific tools for processing., Important Dates, * Submission Deadline: Friday 12nd February 2010, * Notification of Acceptance: Friday 26th February 2010, * Camera Ready: Wednesday 10th March 2010, * Workshop: Sunday 28th March 2010.] Workshop on Multilinguality in Information Access Evaluation: Bringing Content, Users, Languages and Tasks into the Loop {'Friday 12nd February 2010': ' * submission deadline: friday 12nd february 2010', 'Friday 26th February 2010': ' * notification of acceptance: friday 26th february 2010', 'Wednesday 10th March 2010': ' * camera ready: wednesday 10th march 2010', 'Sunday 28th March 2010': ' * workshop: sunday 28th march 2010.'}
37 The Sixth International Workshop on Agents and Data Mining Interaction (ADMI-10) Toronto, Canada Apologize if you receive more than one copy.\n\nPaper deadline: FEBRUARY 20, 2010, 23:59:59 PDT\n\n** The proceedings will be published by Springer LNAI **\n** Format can be Springer LNAI with up to 12 pages**\n** Papers should be submitted through the ADMI'10 submission system lined to the ADMI'10 website**\n\n\n=====================================\nCall For Papers to \nThe Sixth International Workshop on Agents and Data Mining Interaction (ADMI-10)\nMAY 10-14, 2010 Toronto, Canada\nhttp://admi10.agentmining.org/\n\nHeld in conjunction with \nThe Ninth International Conference on\nAutonomous Agents and Multiagent Systems (AAMAS2010)\nhttp://www.cse.yorku.ca/AAMAS2010/\n\nImportant dates: \n"\tElectronic submission of full papers: February 20, 2010\n"\tNotification of paper acceptance: March 5, 2010\n"\tCamera-ready copies of accepted papers: March 15, 2010\n"\tAAMAS-2010 workshop: May 10-11, 2010\n\n=====================================\nCall for papers to Special Sessions with AAMAS-ADMI10\n"\tAgent Behavior Analysis\n\tSubmissions on data mining and machine learning for analyzing, learning, planning \n and negoatiating agent behaviors in multi-agent ssytems, etc.\n"\tAgent-based Cloud, Distributed, and Peer-to-Peer Data Mining\n\tSubmissions on agent-based cloud, distributed and peer-to-peer computing for data mining, database management, \n enterprise applications integration, etc. \n"\tData Mining for Agent Intelligence Enhancement\n\tSubmissions on data mining and machine learning for enhancing agent intelligence, etc.\n"\tData Mining for Agent Learning \n\tSubmissions on data mining and machine learning for enhancing agent learning, reasoning and \n adaptation in complex environment, etc.\n\n=====================================\nCall for papers to general sessions\n\t\n\tThe workshop welcomes theoretical work and applied disseminations aiming to: \n"\texploit agent-enriched data mining and machine learning, and demonstrate how agent technology can \n\tcontribute to critical data mining and machine learning problems in theory and practice; \n"\timprove data mining-driven agents and systems, and show how data mining and machine learning \n\tcan strengthen agent intelligence and intelligent systems in research and practical applications; \n"\texplore the integration of agents and data mining towards a super-intelligent system \n\tand intelligent information processing; \n"\tidentify challenges and directions for future research and development in agent mining, through \n\tthe synergy and interaction amongst relevant fields; and \n"\treport workable applications and case studies of agent mining.\n\nTopics: Contributions on the following and other related topics are solicited:\n"\tChallenges and prospects in agent mining \n"\tTheoretical foundation for agent mining\n"\tAgent-driven data analysis, knowledge discovery and machine learning\n"\tData mining-driven agents and multi-agent systems and intelligent systems\n"\tPerformance evaluation and validation in agent mining \n"\tEmerging agent mining applications and lessons learned\n\n\n=====================================\nAbout ADMI Workshop Series\n\nHistory: The International Workshop on Agents and Data Mining Interaction (ADMI-10) consolidates several efforts in\n\tpromoting the interaction and integration between multi-agent systems and data mining \n\tdata warehousing. ADMI-10 is a consolidation and re-allocation of the ADMI workshop series \n\tinitated in 2006 and the AIS-ADM workshop series started in 2005. \n\nScope: The ADMI workshop series provides a premier forum for sharing research and engineering results, \n\tas well as potential challenges and prospects encountered in the coupling crossing autonomous \n\tagents and multi-agent systems, data mining and knowledge discovery, data wareshousing, \n\tmachine learning, and artificial intelligence and intelligent systems. \n\n\n=====================================\nPost-workshop publication:\n"\tThe ADMI-10 Proceedings will be published by Springer-Verlag as a volume of LNCS/LNAI series.\n"\tSpecial Issues on Agent Mining (to be confirmed).\n\n\n=====================================\nGeneral Co-Chair:\n"\tGerhard Weiss\n\tUniversity of Maastricht, Netherlands\n"\tPhilip S Yu\n \tUniversity of Illinois at Chicago USA\n\t\nCo-Chairs:\n"\tLongbing Cao\n \tUniversity of Technology Sydney, Australia\n"\tAna Bazzan\n\tUniversidade Federal do Rio Grande do Sul \n\tInstituto de Informatica, Brasil\n"\tPericles A. Mitkas, \n\tAristotle University of Thessaloniki, Greece\n"\tVladimir Gorodetsky\n\tRussian Academy of Sciences, St. Petersburg. \n\nSupported by \nAgent-Mining Interaction and Integration\nSpecial Interest Group (AMII-SIG)\nhttp://www.agentmining.org\n\nContact: \nLongbing Cao, Ana Bazzan, Pericles A. Mitkas, Vladimir Gorodetsky\nEmail: admi10@agentmining.org (Apologize, if, you, receive, more, than, one, copy, ., \n\n, Paper, deadline, :, FEBRUARY, 20, ,, 2010, ,, 23:59:59, PDT, \n\n, *, *, The, proceedings, will, be, published, by, Springer, LNAI, *, *, \n, *, *, Format, can, be, Springer, LNAI, with, up, to, 12, pages, *, *, \n, *, *, Papers, should, be, submitted, through, the, ADMI'10, submission, system, lined, to, the, ADMI'10, website, *, *, \n\n\n, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, ...) 38 The First IEEE International Workshop on Emerging Applications for Cloud Computing Seoul, South Korea The First IEEE International Workshop on Emerging Applications for Cloud Computing\nin\nSeoul, South Korea\n\n\n\nCloud computing is swiftly becoming a very significant computing paradigm, allowing organizations to implement more computationally smart and agile environments by improving efficiency and reliability at lower cost. Many potential uses have been proposed to leverage this powerful resource, covering many areas of applied computing. This workshop seeks to identify and explore new and emerging technologies utilizing cloud computing infrastructure.\n\nWe intend to bring together cloud computing researchers, experts, developers, and practitioners from academia, industry, and government, to discuss new and emerging trends in research and application of cloud computing technologies for these environments. We seek to identify the greatest risks and challenges facing these paradigms, and outline approaches for solving them. Finally, we aim to provide the foundation for new collaborative efforts across disciplines.\n\nWe solicit unpublished research papers that address theoretical issues and practical implementations/experiences related to new technologies and applications enabled by cloud computing.\n\nTopics of interest related to cloud computing include, but are not limited to the following:\n\n * Cost analysis and revenue models for clouds\n * Different cloud service models (SaaS, PaaS, IaaS)\n * Data assurance/management in clouds\n * Digital forensic challenges and applications\n * Digital identity management in private/public/hybrid clouds\n * Enterprise applications based on clouds\n * Network and storage architectures for clouds\n * Programming models and tools for clouds\n * Performance monitoring and optimization\n * Scalability and complexity in clouds\n * Scientific and high performance computing\n * Security policy and trust models for clouds\n * Service computing\n * Virtualization techniques and applications\n\nInvited participants Researchers, experts, developers, and practitioners from academia, industry, and government working on all aspects of cloud computing. We particularly encourage application developers to submit papers detailing implementation experiences and results. Our intention is to involve participants across disciplines, allowing them to work towards influencing the direction of cloud computing research.\n\nImportant Dates \nMarch 1, 2010: Deadline for paper submission\nMarch 30, 2010: Notification of acceptance\nApril 30, 2010: Camera-ready due\nJuly 19-23, 2010: Workshop Dates (The, First, IEEE, International, Workshop, on, Emerging, Applications, for, Cloud, Computing, \n, in, \n, Seoul, ,, South, Korea, \n\n\n\n, Cloud, computing, is, swiftly, becoming, a, very, significant, computing, paradigm, ,, allowing, organizations, to, implement, more, computationally, smart, and, agile, environments, by, improving, efficiency, and, reliability, at, lower, cost, ., Many, potential, uses, have, been, proposed, to, leverage, this, powerful, resource, ,, covering, many, areas, of, applied, computing, ., This, workshop, seeks, to, identify, and, explore, new, and, emerging, technologies, utilizing, cloud, computing, infrastructure, ., \n\n, We, intend, to, bring, together, cloud, computing, researchers, ,, experts, ,, developers, ,, and, practitioners, ...) Seoul [The First IEEE International Workshop on Emerging Applications for Cloud Computing, in, Seoul, South Korea, Cloud computing is swiftly becoming a very significant computing paradigm, allowing organizations to implement more computationally smart and agile environments by improving efficiency and reliability at lower cost, Many potential uses have been proposed to leverage this powerful resource, covering many areas of applied computing, This workshop seeks to identify and explore new and emerging technologies utilizing cloud computing infrastructure., We intend to bring together cloud computing researchers, experts, developers, and practitioners from academia, industry, and government, to discuss new and emerging trends in research and application of cloud computing technologies for these environments, We seek to identify the greatest risks and challenges facing these paradigms, and outline approaches for solving them, Finally, we aim to provide the foundation for new collaborative efforts across disciplines., We solicit unpublished research papers that address theoretical issues and practical implementations/experiences related to new technologies and applications enabled by cloud computing., Topics of interest related to cloud computing include, but are not limited to the following:, * Cost analysis and revenue models for clouds, * Different cloud service models (SaaS, PaaS, IaaS), * Data assurance/management in clouds, * Digital forensic challenges and applications, * Digital identity management in private/public/hybrid clouds, * Enterprise applications based on clouds, * Network and storage architectures for clouds, * Programming models and tools for clouds, * Performance monitoring and optimization, * Scalability and complexity in clouds, * Scientific and high performance computing, * Security policy and trust models for clouds, * Service computing, * Virtualization techniques and applications, Invited participants Researchers, experts, developers, and practitioners from academia, industry, and government working on all aspects of cloud computing, We particularly encourage application developers to submit papers detailing implementation experiences and results, Our intention is to involve participants across disciplines, allowing them to work towards influencing the direction of cloud computing research., Important Dates , March 1, 2010: Deadline for paper submission, March 30, 2010: Notification of acceptance, April 30, 2010: Camera-ready due, July 19-23, 2010: Workshop Dates] The First IEEE International Workshop on Emerging Applications for Cloud Computing {'March 1, 2010:': 'march 1, 2010: deadline for paper submission', 'March 30, 2010:': 'march 30, 2010: notification of acceptance', 'April 30, 2010': 'april 30, 2010: camera-ready due', 'July 19-23, 2010': 'july 19-23, 2010: workshop dates'}
39 6th EuroNF Conference on Next Generation Internet Paris, France ****************************************\nCall for papers\n6th EuroNF Conference on Next Generation Internet\nJune 2-4, 2010 - Paris, France\nhttp://euronf.enst.fr/NGI2010/\n****************************************\nFollowing the past successful conferences, NGI 2010 focuses on the design, engineering, and operation of Next Generation Internet networks. It is organized by the Network of Excellence (NoE) Euro-NF, which was initiated by the European Commission during the 7th Framework Programme. Euro-NF serves as its main platform for interaction, dissemination, and collaboration. To stimulate discussions, NGI 2010 invites scientists and practitioners from industry and academia, and especially welcomes contributions from outside Euro-NF.\n\nImportant Dates\n---------------\n Paper submission deadline: \t\tMarch 26, 2010 strict deadline\n Acceptance notifications: \t\tApril 30, 2010\n Camera-ready due: \t\t\tMay 14, 2010\n Conference: \t\t\t\tJune 2 - 4, 2010\n\nScope\n-----\nOriginal papers on recent advances in next generation networking are invited. Topics of interest are - but are not limited to - the following areas:\n\nApplications and Services\n Applications for wireless sensor networks\n Grid computing\n Location-based and context-aware services\n Network co-operation\n Overlay networks and peer-to-peer\n Cloud computing\nOptical Networks\n Multi-layer networks\n Routing & wavelength assignment\n Traffic grooming and traffic engineering\n Transport Ethernet, PON, WDM\nNetwork Architecture\n Access, metropolitan, and core networks\n Environment-aware / green networking\n Future Internet\n Inter-domain and intra-domain routing\n Network management and control\n Security architectures and mechanisms\n Self-organized systems\n Testbeds and experimental evaluations\nWireless Networks\n Ad hoc and sensor networks\n Cellular networks\n Cross-layer design\n Integration of fixed and mobile networks\n WiFi and WiMax\nTraffic Engineering\n Admission and congestion control\n Performance evaluation of NG networks\n Quality of service (QoS) and quality of experience (QoE)\n Service differentiation and multi-service support\n Traffic measurements, modeling and statistical characterization\n Optimization algorithms and heuristics for network dimensioning\nSocio-Economic Aspects\n Cost models\n Regulation, IPR, network neutrality and governance\n SLAs, pricing and quality of experience\n Trust, privacy and security \n\nTechnical Programme Committee\n-----------------------------\nConference Chairs\n Claude Chaudet, France\n Artur Hecker, France\n\nTechnical Programme Committee\n\nSamuli Aalto, Helsinki University of Technology, Finland\nFrancois Baccelli, INRIA, France\nJoÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ£o Each paper is going to be reviewed by at least three reviewers. The publication of an accepted paper requires the registration of at least one author. One author registration is valid for up to three papers.\n\n*** Paper Format\nSubmitted papers must not be longer than 8 pages. The paper must contain a short abstract (up to 250 words), the complete list of authors including affiliations, and keywords. The layout of the papers must comply with the IEEE standards. Document templates are available on the NGI 2010 Website.\n\n*** Paper Submission\nAll papers must be submitted electronically as PDF files through easychair using:\nhttp://www.easychair.org/conferences/?conf=ngi2010\n\nIf you are not yet registered for easychair, you can create a free account at the following address:\nhttp://www.easychair.org/conferences/account_apply.cgi (*, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, \n, Call, for, papers, \n, 6th, EuroNF, Conference, on, Next, Generation, Internet, \n, June, 2, -, 4, ,, 2010, -, Paris, ,, France, \n, http://euronf.enst.fr/NGI2010/, \n, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, ...) Paris [****************************************, Call for papers, 6th EuroNF Conference on Next Generation Internet, June 2-4, 2010 - Paris, France, http://euronf.enst.fr/NGI2010/, ****************************************, Following the past successful conferences, NGI 2010 focuses on the design, engineering, and operation of Next Generation Internet networks, It is organized by the Network of Excellence (NoE) Euro-NF, which was initiated by the European Commission during the 7th Framework Programme, Euro-NF serves as its main platform for interaction, dissemination, and collaboration, To stimulate discussions, NGI 2010 invites scientists and practitioners from industry and academia, and especially welcomes contributions from outside Euro-NF., Important Dates, ---------------, Paper submission deadline: \t\tMarch 26, 2010 strict deadline, Acceptance notifications: \t\tApril 30, 2010, Camera-ready due: \t\t\tMay 14, 2010, Conference: \t\t\t\tJune 2 - 4, 2010, Scope, -----, Original papers on recent advances in next generation networking are invited, Topics of interest are - but are not limited to - the following areas:, Applications and Services, Applications for wireless sensor networks, Grid computing, Location-based and context-aware services, Network co-operation, Overlay networks and peer-to-peer, Cloud computing, Optical Networks, Multi-layer networks, Routing & wavelength assignment, Traffic grooming and traffic engineering, Transport Ethernet, PON, WDM, Network Architecture, Access, metropolitan, and core networks, Environment-aware / green networking, Future Internet, Inter-domain and intra-domain routing, Network management and control, Security architectures and mechanisms, Self-organized systems, Testbeds and experimental evaluations, Wireless Networks, Ad hoc and sensor networks, Cellular networks, Cross-layer design, Integration of fixed and mobile networks, WiFi and WiMax, Traffic Engineering, Admission and congestion control, Performance evaluation of NG networks, Quality of service (QoS) and quality of experience (QoE), Service differentiation and multi-service support, Traffic measurements, modeling and statistical characterization, Optimization algorithms and heuristics for network dimensioning, Socio-Economic Aspects, Cost models, Regulation, IPR, network neutrality and governance, SLAs, pricing and quality of experience, Trust, privacy and security , Technical Programme Committee, -----------------------------, Conference Chairs, Claude Chaudet, France, Artur Hecker, France, Technical Programme Committee, Samuli Aalto, Helsinki University of Technology, Finland, Francois Baccelli, INRIA, France, 40 12th International Conference on Information Integration and Web-based Applications & Services Paris, France ********************* Apology for Multiple Posting ***********************\n\n C A L L F O R P A P E R S\n\n12th International Conference on\nInformation Integration and Web-based Applications & Services\n 8-10 November, 2010\n Paris, France\n\n http://www.iiwas.org/conferences/iiwas2010/\n email: iiwas2010@iiwas.org\n\n\n\n----------------\nIMPORTANT DATES\n----------------\nJune 4, 2010\t: Full papers submission\nAugust 9, 2010\t: Acceptance Notification\nAugust 30, 2010 : Camera-Ready Papers and Registration\nNovember 8-10, 2010 : Conference\n\n\n**********************************************************\n\nBarely more than ten years after the birth of the World Wide Web, the Global Information Infrastructure is daily reality. In spite of the many applications in all domains of our societies: e-business, e-commerce, e-learning, e-science, and e-government, for instance, and in spite of the tremendous advances by engineers and scientists, the seamless integration of information and services remains a major challenge. The current shared vision for the future is one of semantically rich information and service oriented architecture for global information systems. This vision is at the convergence of progress in technologies such as XML, Web services, RDF, OWL, of multimedia, multimodal, and multilingual information retrieval, and of distributed, mobile and ubiquitous computing.\n\nThe goal of iiWAS2010 is to provide an international forum for scientists, engineers, and managers in academia, industry, and government to address recent research results and to present and discuss their ideas, theories, technologies, systems, tools, applications, work in progress and experiences on all theoretical and practical issues arising in information and service integration.\n\nTOPICS OF INTEREST\n\nConference program will include invited talks, peer reviewed technical program, demos, short papers, posters, tutorials, panels, workshops and invited sessions on the same or related topics, industrial presentations, exhibitions around but not limited to the following topics:\n\nWeb Engineering and Web Services Track:\n\n - Web Data Integration, Monitoring and Management\n - Web Data Models, Metrics, Tools, Languages and Performance\n - Web Agents, Intelligence and Mining\n - Web Security and Trust Management\n - Web Visualization, Rich Web UI and Deep/Hidden Web\n - Web-based Enterprise Systems and Business Processes\n - Web-based Auction and Negotiation\n - Federated and cross-organizational Web engineering\n - Web Services Architectural styles\n - Web Services performance\n - Dependability, security and privacy of web services (blogs, RSS, wikis, etc.)\n - Orchestration, choreography and composition of web services\n - Tools and technologies for Web Services development, deployment and management\n - The impact of Web Services on enterprise systems\n - Impact of formal methods on Web Services\n\nE-applications Track (e-Business, e-Commerce, e-Payment, e-Government, e-Learning, e-science, e-communities):\n\n - E-application design models and methods\n - E-application development processes, standards and methodologies\n - E-application usability, accessibility, reuse and integration\n - E-application localization and internalization\n - E-applications case studies and best practices\n - E-applications social and legal issues\n - E-applications service architectures\n - E-applications competition and collaborations\n - E-applications data analytics and visualization\n - Digital libraries\n - Innovative E-Frameworks & E-Applications\n - Innovative E-applications in Web 2.0, AJAX, E4X and other new developments\n - Model-driven E-application development\n - Workflow and E-services\n\nWeb Data and Semantic Web Track:\n\n - XML data and schema integration\n - XML data models, query processing and data management\n - XML data privacy and security\n - Web databases and warehousing\n - Web data mining, exploration, and visualization\n - Document Engineering and Integration\n - Web Data Markup Languages, tools and methodologies for representing and managing Semantic Web data\n - Web Semantics content creation, annotation, and extraction\n - Web Semantics brokering, integration and interoperability\n - Web Semantics search, query, and visualization\n - Web Semantics middleware and services\n - Web Semantics provenance, trust & security\n - Ontology creation, searching, extraction, and evolution\n - Ontology mapping, merging, and alignment\n\nInformation Integration in Ubiquitous Computing Track:\n\n - Mobile and Ubiquitous Information and Service Integration\n - Tools and techniques for designing, implementing, & evaluating Ubiquitous Computing Systems\n - Grid and P2P architectures for service and information integration\n - Agent-based ubiquitous applications\n - Location and context-aware applications and services\n - Infrastructure support for mobility and pervasive Web\n - Web proxies and content adaptation\n - Service creation and management environments for pervasive web\n - Low-cost web access devices and networking for emerging regions\n - Privacy-enhancing technologies in pervasive web\n - Social search and the use of "human computing" in web search\n - Experience report on ubiquitous computing implementation\n - Visionary scenario on ubiquitous computing\n\nPUBLICATION\n---------------------\niiWAS2010 Proceedings will be published by ACM (pending approval) in cooperation with the Austrian Computer Society as a volume set in the books@ocg series and will be indexed and included in ACM Digital Library.\n\nDistinguished papers, after further revisions, will be published in special issues of :\n\n[1] International Journal of Web Information Systems\n (http://www.emeraldinsight.com/ijwis.htm)\n[2] International Journal of Web and Grid Services\n (https://www.inderscience.com/browse/index.php?journalID=47)\n[3] More are pending approval\n\nSUBMISSION GUIDELINES\n\nPapers must be submitted electronically in Postscript, PDF, or RTF/DOC format at ((http://www.iiwas.org/conferences/iiwas2010/)\nSubmitted papers must not substantially overlap with papers that have been published or that are simultaneously submitted to a journal or a conference with proceedings. Submitted papers will be blindly peer reviewed by at least three members of the international program committee and carefully evaluated based on originality, significance, technical soundness, and clarity of exposition. Accepted papers will appear in the conference proceedings to be published by ACM (pending approval) and the Austrian Computer Society in books@ocg book series. The submitted papers should not exceed 8 pages and must follow the ACM guidelines (http://www.acm.org/sigs/publications/proceedings-templates).\n\n\nCOMMITTEES\nhttp://www.iiwas.org/conferences/iiwas2010/committee.html\n\nORGANIZATION\nThe conference is endorsed by the international organization for information integration and web based applications and services (@WAS) in cooperation with ACM SIGWEB (approval pending), hosted and organized by The University of Paris 8, France and supported by Monash University, Australia, La Trobe University, Australia and will be held in conjunction with the 8th international conference on Advances in Mobile Computing and Multimedia (MoMM2010 -http://www.iiwas.org/conferences/momm2010/).\n\nCONTACT\nDavid Taniar\n@WAS Scientific Committee Chair\nClayton School of Information Technology\nMonash University\nClayton, VIC 3800\nAustralia\nEmail: david@iiwas.org (*, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, Apology, for, Multiple, Posting, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, \n\n , C, A, L, L, , F, O, R, , P, A, P, E, R, S, \n\n, 12th, International, Conference, on, \n, Information, Integration, and, Web, -, based, Applications, &, Services, \n , 8, -, 10, November, ,, 2010, \n , Paris, ,, France, \n\n , http://www.iiwas.org/conferences/iiwas2010/, \n , email, :, iiwas2010@iiwas.org, \n\n\n\n, ----------------, \n, IMPORTANT, ...) Paris [********************* Apology for Multiple Posting ***********************, C A L L F O R P A P E R S, 12th International Conference on, Information Integration and Web-based Applications & Services, 8-10 November, 2010, Paris, France, http://www.iiwas.org/conferences/iiwas2010/, email: iiwas2010@iiwas.org, ----------------, IMPORTANT DATES, ----------------, June 4, 2010\t: Full papers submission, August 9, 2010\t: Acceptance Notification, August 30, 2010 : Camera-Ready Papers and Registration, November 8-10, 2010 : Conference, **********************************************************, Barely more than ten years after the birth of the World Wide Web, the Global Information Infrastructure is daily reality, In spite of the many applications in all domains of our societies: e-business, e-commerce, e-learning, e-science, and e-government, for instance, and in spite of the tremendous advances by engineers and scientists, the seamless integration of information and services remains a major challenge, The current shared vision for the future is one of semantically rich information and service oriented architecture for global information systems, This vision is at the convergence of progress in technologies such as XML, Web services, RDF, OWL, of multimedia, multimodal, and multilingual information retrieval, and of distributed, mobile and ubiquitous computing., The goal of iiWAS2010 is to provide an international forum for scientists, engineers, and managers in academia, industry, and government to address recent research results and to present and discuss their ideas, theories, technologies, systems, tools, applications, work in progress and experiences on all theoretical and practical issues arising in information and service integration., TOPICS OF INTEREST, Conference program will include invited talks, peer reviewed technical program, demos, short papers, posters, tutorials, panels, workshops and invited sessions on the same or related topics, industrial presentations, exhibitions around but not limited to the following topics:, Web Engineering and Web Services Track:, - Web Data Integration, Monitoring and Management, - Web Data Models, Metrics, Tools, Languages and Performance, - Web Agents, Intelligence and Mining, - Web Security and Trust Management, - Web Visualization, Rich Web UI and Deep/Hidden Web, - Web-based Enterprise Systems and Business Processes, - Web-based Auction and Negotiation, - Federated and cross-organizational Web engineering, - Web Services Architectural styles, - Web Services performance, - Dependability, security and privacy of web services (blogs, RSS, wikis, etc.), - Orchestration, choreography and composition of web services, - Tools and technologies for Web Services development, deployment and management, - The impact of Web Services on enterprise systems, - Impact of formal methods on Web Services, E-applications Track (e-Business, e-Commerce, e-Payment, e-Government, e-Learning, e-science, e-communities):, - E-application design models and methods, - E-application development processes, standards and methodologies, - E-application usability, accessibility, reuse and integration, - E-application localization and internalization, - E-applications case studies and best practices, - E-applications social and legal issues, - E-applications service architectures, - E-applications competition and collaborations, - E-applications data analytics and visualization, - Digital libraries, - Innovative E-Frameworks & E-Applications, - Innovative E-applications in Web 2.0, AJAX, E4X and other new developments, - Model-driven E-application development, - Workflow and E-services, Web Data and Semantic Web Track:, - XML data and schema integration, - XML data models, query processing and data management, - XML data privacy and security, - Web databases and warehousing, - Web data mining, exploration, and visualization, - Document Engineering and Integration, - Web Data Markup Languages, tools and methodologies for representing and managing Semantic Web data, - Web Semantics content creation, annotation, and extraction, - Web Semantics brokering, integration and interoperability, - Web Semantics search, query, and visualization, - Web Semantics middleware and services, - Web Semantics provenance, trust & security, - Ontology creation, searching, extraction, and evolution, - Ontology mapping, merging, and alignment, Information Integration in Ubiquitous Computing Track:, - Mobile and Ubiquitous Information and Service Integration, - Tools and techniques for designing, implementing, & evaluating Ubiquitous Computing Systems, - Grid and P2P architectures for service and information integration, - Agent-based ubiquitous applications, - Location and context-aware applications and services, - Infrastructure support for mobility and pervasive Web, - Web proxies and content adaptation, - Service creation and management environments for pervasive web, - Low-cost web access devices and networking for emerging regions, - Privacy-enhancing technologies in pervasive web, - Social search and the use of "human computing" in web search, - Experience report on ubiquitous computing implementation, - Visionary scenario on ubiquitous computing, PUBLICATION, ---------------------, iiWAS2010 Proceedings will be published by ACM (pending approval) in cooperation with the Austrian Computer Society as a volume set in the books@ocg series and will be indexed and included in ACM Digital Library., Distinguished papers, after further revisions, will be published in special issues of :, [1] International Journal of Web Information Systems, (http://www.emeraldinsight.com/ijwis.htm), [2] International Journal of Web and Grid Services, (https://www.inderscience.com/browse/index.php?journalID=47), [3] More are pending approval, SUBMISSION GUIDELINES, Papers must be submitted electronically in Postscript, PDF, or RTF/DOC format at ((http://www.iiwas.org/conferences/iiwas2010/), Submitted papers must not substantially overlap with papers that have been published or that are simultaneously submitted to a journal or a conference with proceedings, Submitted papers will be blindly peer reviewed by at least three members of the international program committee and carefully evaluated based on originality, significance, technical soundness, and clarity of exposition, Accepted papers will appear in the conference proceedings to be published by ACM (pending approval) and the Austrian Computer Society in books@ocg book series, The submitted papers should not exceed 8 pages and must follow the ACM guidelines (http://www.acm.org/sigs/publications/proceedings-templates)., COMMITTEES, http://www.iiwas.org/conferences/iiwas2010/committee.html, ...] 12th International Conference on Information Integration and Web-based Applications & Services {'8-10 November, 2010': ' 8-10 november, 2010', 'June 4, 2010': 'june 4, 2010 : full papers submission', 'August 9, 2010': 'august 9, 2010 : acceptance notification', 'August 30, 2010': 'august 30, 2010 : camera-ready papers and registration', 'November 8-10, 2010': 'november 8-10, 2010 : conference'}
41 Artificial Intelligence and Logistics - Workshop at ECAI 2010 Lisbon, Portugal // NEW CALL FOR PAPERS //\n\nArtificial Intelligence and Logistics - Workshop at ECAI 2010 \n Lisbon, Portugal, August 17, 2010\n\nhttp://www.sfbtr8.spatial-cognition.de/ailog-2010/\n--------------------------------------------------\n\nIMPORTANT DATES\n\nMay 11, 2010 (extended)\t\tPaper submission deadline\nJune 7, 2010\t\t Notification of acceptance\nJune 21, 2010\t\t Camera-ready papers due\nAugust 17, 2010\t\t Workshop at ECAI 2010\n\n---------------------------------------------------------------------------\n\nMOTIVATION\n\nLogistics is concerned with the organization and control of processes in\nspace and time in order to transport or manufacture goods and the\ncoordination of the resulting flows of material and information, as well as\nmonetary flows. Complexity and dynamics of logistic networks have reached a\nlevel that more and more prevents the processes from being entirely\nobservable and fully controllable, caused by, e.g., a globalized economy, a\nshift from buyer's to seller's markets, and shorter product life cycles.\nThus, recent trends in logistics point towards solutions with distributed\nand self-organizing processes.\n\nSuch logistic networks are characterized by a wide variety of heterogeneous\nproperties, constraints, and requirements: temporal (very quickly, just in\ntime), economic (low cost, given budget), physical (smooth, secure travel),\ninformational (public, secure data), environmental (low energy,\necology-preserving). Different qualities or modalities need different\nrepresentations; transitions between different subsystems require interfaces\nbetween different representations, transformations of processes, and methods\nfor their selection; knowledge about situations and goals is crucial for the\nselection of the most suitable strategy; etc. This manifold set of demands\nand the emerging uncertainty requires the inclusion of methods from\nartificial intelligence and cognitive science. AIL-2010 addresses the use of\nthese AI methods in modern logistics.\n\n---------------------------------------------------------------------------\n\nTOPICS OF INTEREST\n\nThis workshop addresses researchers from logistics that utilize and develop\nAI approaches as well as researchers from AI that apply their work in\nlogistics or see possibilities to connect to logistic problems or methods.\n\nWe encourage contributions from the following research and application\nareas:\n\nPossible Research Areas:\t\n\nCoordination in Space and Time\nKnowledge Representation and Reasoning\nMulti Modal Interaction\nCognitive Robotics\nCognitive Modeling\nSpatial and Temporal Reasoning\nOntologies\nLogic and Constraint Programming\nAmbient Intelligence\nPlanning and Scheduling\nMulti Agent Systems\nData Mining\nCase-Based Reasoning\nMachine Learning\nHuman-machine Interfaces\n...\n\nPossible Application Areas:\n\nTransport logistics\nProduction planning and control\nAssembly and disassembly\nProcess modeling and monitoring\nProcess planning\nIntelligent manufacturing systems\nProduction Scheduling\nInventory organization and optimization\nAutomated inspection and quality control\nSupply chain management\nTraffic management\n...\n\nA special focus will be given to applying AI techniques in order to\nintegrate and interact with humans within the logistic process, may they be \nusers, system designers, analysts, or other stakeholders. Intelligent\nlogistic systems will instruct users; they communicate and explain their\nsituation and reasoning upon demand; they notify managers about anomalies or \nin case of an emergency; they engage in clarification dialogs upon\nmisunderstandings. The better the human interface becomes, the more we\nexpect logistic scenarios to become re-populated by users such that shared \nhuman-machine scenarios may benefit from human expertise and intelligence \nwhile operators are relieved from tedious automated routine. This way we\nmove from a de-centralized view of cooperating autonomous units to an\n"emancipated" society of logistic units interacting among themselves and\nwith human agents. We explicitly encourage submissions that tackle this\nchallenge.\n\n\n---------------------------------------------------------------------------\n\nSubmitted papers must be in PDF format and follow the ECAI style guidelines.\nTechnical papers must not exceed a length of 6 pages.\n\nWe also welcome the submission of position papers or papers describing work\nin progress as short papers. Short papers must not exceed a length of 3\npages. If in doubt, submit a technical paper.\n\nFor submitting your paper, please use the Easychair online submission\nsystem at http://www.easychair.org/conferences/?conf=ail2010 .\nThe paper submission deadline is May 7.\n\nSubmitted papers will be reviewed by at least two reviewers. Papers selected\nfor presentation at the workshop will appear in the ECAI workshop\nproceedings. Workshop participants are required to register for the ECAI\nmain conference.\n\nFor more details, visit the workshop homepage:\nhttp://www.sfbtr8.spatial-cognition.de/ailog-2010/\n\n\n---------------------------------------------------------------------------\n\nPROGRAM COMMITEE (tentative)\n\nAna Bazzan (Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil)\nSusanne Biundo (University of Ulm, Germany)\nJuergen Branke (University of Warwick, UK)\nStefan Kirn (University of Hohenheim, Germany)\nMartin Lauer (Karlsruhe Institute of Technology, Germany)\nRamon Lopez de Mantaras (IIIA-CSIC, Spain)\nCarles Sierra (IIIA-CSIC, Spain)\nWilfried Sihn (Technical University of Vienna, Austria)\nIngo Timm (University of Frankfurt, Germany)\nGerhard Weiss (Maastricht University, Netherlands)\n\n---------------------------------------------------------------------------\n\nORGANIZERS\n\nKerstin Schill\nCollaborative Research Center "Spatial Cognition", Bremen, Germany\n\nBernd Scholz-Reiter\nResearch Center "Intelligent Production and Logistics Systems", Bremen,\nGermany\n\nLutz Frommberger\nCollaborative Research Center "Spatial Cognition", Bremen, Germany\n\n---------------------------------------------------------------------------\n\nCONTACT\n\nFor any inquiries about the workshop refer to Lutz Frommberger \n(lutz@sfbtr8.uni-bremen.de). (//, NEW, CALL, FOR, PAPERS, //, \n\n, Artificial, Intelligence, and, Logistics, -, Workshop, at, ECAI, 2010, \n , Lisbon, ,, Portugal, ,, August, 17, ,, 2010, \n\n, http://www.sfbtr8.spatial, -, cognition.de, /, ailog-2010/, \n, --------------------------------------------------, \n\n, IMPORTANT, DATES, \n\n, May, 11, ,, 2010, (, extended, ), \t\t, Paper, submission, deadline, \n, June, 7, ,, 2010, \t\t , Notification, of, acceptance, \n, June, 21, ,, 2010, \t\t , Camera, -, ready, papers, due, \n, August, 17, ,, 2010, \t\t , Workshop, at, ECAI, 2010, \n\n, ---------------------------------------------------------------------------, \n\n, MOTIVATION, \n\n, Logistics, is, concerned, with, the, organization, and, control, of, processes, in, \n, space, and, time, in, order, ...) Lisbon [// NEW CALL FOR PAPERS //, Artificial Intelligence and Logistics - Workshop at ECAI 2010 , Lisbon, Portugal, August 17, 2010, http://www.sfbtr8.spatial-cognition.de/ailog-2010/, --------------------------------------------------, IMPORTANT DATES, May 11, 2010 (extended)\t\tPaper submission deadline, June 7, 2010\t\t Notification of acceptance, June 21, 2010\t\t Camera-ready papers due, August 17, 2010\t\t Workshop at ECAI 2010, ---------------------------------------------------------------------------, MOTIVATION, Logistics is concerned with the organization and control of processes in, space and time in order to transport or manufacture goods and the, coordination of the resulting flows of material and information, as well as, monetary flows, Complexity and dynamics of logistic networks have reached a, level that more and more prevents the processes from being entirely, observable and fully controllable, caused by, e.g., a globalized economy, a, shift from buyer's to seller's markets, and shorter product life cycles., Thus, recent trends in logistics point towards solutions with distributed, and self-organizing processes., Such logistic networks are characterized by a wide variety of heterogeneous, properties, constraints, and requirements: temporal (very quickly, just in, time), economic (low cost, given budget), physical (smooth, secure travel),, informational (public, secure data), environmental (low energy,, ecology-preserving), Different qualities or modalities need different, representations; transitions between different subsystems require interfaces, between different representations, transformations of processes, and methods, for their selection; knowledge about situations and goals is crucial for the, selection of the most suitable strategy; etc, This manifold set of demands, and the emerging uncertainty requires the inclusion of methods from, artificial intelligence and cognitive science, AIL-2010 addresses the use of, these AI methods in modern logistics., ---------------------------------------------------------------------------, TOPICS OF INTEREST, This workshop addresses researchers from logistics that utilize and develop, AI approaches as well as researchers from AI that apply their work in, logistics or see possibilities to connect to logistic problems or methods., We encourage contributions from the following research and application, areas:, Possible Research Areas:\t, Coordination in Space and Time, Knowledge Representation and Reasoning, Multi Modal Interaction, Cognitive Robotics, Cognitive Modeling, Spatial and Temporal Reasoning, Ontologies, Logic and Constraint Programming, Ambient Intelligence, Planning and Scheduling, Multi Agent Systems, Data Mining, Case-Based Reasoning, Machine Learning, Human-machine Interfaces, ..., Possible Application Areas:, Transport logistics, Production planning and control, Assembly and disassembly, Process modeling and monitoring, Process planning, Intelligent manufacturing systems, Production Scheduling, Inventory organization and optimization, Automated inspection and quality control, Supply chain management, Traffic management, ..., A special focus will be given to applying AI techniques in order to, integrate and interact with humans within the logistic process, may they be , users, system designers, analysts, or other stakeholders, Intelligent, logistic systems will instruct users; they communicate and explain their, situation and reasoning upon demand; they notify managers about anomalies or , in case of an emergency; they engage in clarification dialogs upon, misunderstandings, The better the human interface becomes, the more we, expect logistic scenarios to become re-populated by users such that shared , human-machine scenarios may benefit from human expertise and intelligence , while operators are relieved from tedious automated routine, This way we, move from a de-centralized view of cooperating autonomous units to an, "emancipated" society of logistic units interacting among themselves and, with human agents, We explicitly encourage submissions that tackle this, challenge., ---------------------------------------------------------------------------, Submitted papers must be in PDF format and follow the ECAI style guidelines., Technical papers must not exceed a length of 6 pages., We also welcome the submission of position papers or papers describing work, in progress as short papers, Short papers must not exceed a length of 3, pages, If in doubt, submit a technical paper., ...] Artificial Intelligence and Logistics - Workshop at ECAI 2010 {'August 17, 2010': 'august 17, 2010 workshop at ecai 2010', 'May 11, 2010': 'may 11, 2010 (extended) paper submission deadline', 'June 7, 2010': 'june 7, 2010 notification of acceptance', 'June 21, 2010': 'june 21, 2010 camera-ready papers due'}
42 IADIS International Conference ICT, Society, and Human Beings 2010 Freiburg, Germany CALL FOR PAPERS - Deadline for submissions (new date): 15 March 2010 --\n\nIADIS International Conference ICT, Society, and Human Beings 2010\nFreiburg, Germany, 29 31 July 2010\n(http://www.ict-conf.org/)\npart of the IADIS Multi Conference on Computer Science and Information Systems (MCCSIS 2010)\nFreiburg, Germany 26 ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ 31 July 2010\n(http://www.mccsis.org)\n\n\n* Keynote Speaker (confirmed):\nProfessor Alice Robbin, Director, Rob Kling Center for Social Informatics, Indiana University, Bloomington, USA\n\n* Conference background and goals\nChanges in behaviour, perspectives, values, competencies, human and psychological aspects, feelings are all of interest. Computer Science and ICT related disciplines work more and more together with various behavioural and social sciences. Organisational and institutional changes, Societal changes, Cognitive effects and changes, Motivational and emotionalchanges, Value changes and new lifestyles are all considered as well as experiences from Child psychology and Development psychology. \n\nIn general all types of research strategies are encouraged and especially cross disciplinary and multidisciplinary studies. Case studies, broader empirical field studies, theoretical analyses, cross cultural studies, scenarios, ethnographic studies, epistemological analyses.\n\n* Format of the Conference \nThe conference will comprise of invited talks and oral presentations. The proceedings of the conference will be published in the form of a book and CD-ROM with ISBN, and will be available also in theIADIS Digital Library (accessible on-line).\n\n* Best Papers\nSelected authors of best papers will be invited to submit extended versions of their papers to selected journals (i.e. IADIS International Journal on Computer Science and Information Systems - ISSN: 1646-3692) including journals from INDERSCIENCE Publishers.\n\n* Types of submissions \nFull and Short Papers, Reflection Papers, Posters/Demonstrations, Tutorials, Panels and Doctoral Consortium. All submissions are subject to a blind refereeing process.\n\n* Topics related to ICT, Society and Human Beings: are of interest. These include, but are not limited to the following areas and topics: \n\n- Globalization and ICT (Main area)\n - Globalization processes\n - Glocalization processes\n - Values, norms\n - Labour market (outsourcing,integration, mobility)\n - Universal access\n - Virtual worlds\n - Global villages\n - Rethinking economical and social theories\n - Human capital theory\n - Sustainability, Democracy\n - Global catastrophes\n - Vulnerability\n - Surveillance\n\n- Life role and ICT (Main area)\n - Professional role\n - Leadership role\n - Private role\n - Virtual roles\n - Home of the future\n - Mobile life\n - Role conflicts\n\n- Life environment and ICT (Main area)\n - Psychosocial environment\n - Work environment/Work place\n - Work content \n - Organizational structure\n - Decision support systems\n - Human-human communication\n - Power structure-formal and informal\n - Leadership \n - Career patterns\n - Influence/participation\n - Working hours and salary/compensation \n - Work pace/work load \n - Physical and ergonomic conditions\n - Learning and knowledge growth\n - Home Environment\n - Public Environment/Sphere\n - Private Environment/Sphere\n - Virtual Environment/Sphere\n - Virtual (on-line) communities\n - Organisational Design and Management\n - Psychosocial work environment\n\n- Effects on humans (Main area)\n - Analyses of impact as well as technology contributing to desirable human qualities\n - Psychosocial impact\n - Life styles\n - Human needs (meaningfulness, belonging, autonomy, confidence) \n - Happiness and fun\n - Wellbeing and health\n - Dependency \n - Identity\n - Integrity \n - Trust and privacy\n - Addictiveness (games) \n - Availability\n - Motivation\n - Human memory \n - Cybersickness\n - Stress (over- and understimulation)\n - Workload\n - Fatigue\n - Love and Relationship\n - Skills and competencies\n - Creativity\n - Problem solving\n - Social competence\n\n- Information and Communication Technologies (ICT) - ICT applications and systems contributing to desirable goals (Main area)\nPerspectives \n - Social and psychosocial\n - Cross-cultural\n- Ethical\n - Theoretical\n - Gender\n - Class\n - Rural ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ 31 July 2010, (http://www.mccsis.org), * Keynote Speaker (confirmed):, Professor Alice Robbin, Director, Rob Kling Center for Social Informatics, Indiana University, Bloomington, USA, * Conference background and goals, Changes in behaviour, perspectives, values, competencies, human and psychological aspects, feelings are all of interest, Computer Science and ICT related disciplines work more and more together with various behavioural and social sciences, Organisational and institutional changes, Societal changes, Cognitive effects and changes, Motivational and emotionalchanges, Value changes and new lifestyles are all considered as well as experiences from Child psychology and Development psychology, In general all types of research strategies are encouraged and especially cross disciplinary and multidisciplinary studies, Case studies, broader empirical field studies, theoretical analyses, cross cultural studies, scenarios, ethnographic studies, epistemological analyses., * Format of the Conference , The conference will comprise of invited talks and oral presentations, The proceedings of the conference will be published in the form of a book and CD-ROM with ISBN, and will be available also in theIADIS Digital Library (accessible on-line)., * Best Papers, Selected authors of best papers will be invited to submit extended versions of their papers to selected journals (i.e, IADIS International Journal on Computer Science and Information Systems - ISSN: 1646-3692) including journals from INDERSCIENCE Publishers., * Types of submissions , Full and Short Papers, Reflection Papers, Posters/Demonstrations, Tutorials, Panels and Doctoral Consortium, All submissions are subject to a blind refereeing process., * Topics related to ICT, Society and Human Beings: are of interest, These include, but are not limited to the following areas and topics: , - Globalization and ICT (Main area), - Globalization processes, - Glocalization processes, - Values, norms, - Labour market (outsourcing,integration, mobility), - Universal access, - Virtual worlds, - Global villages, - Rethinking economical and social theories, - Human capital theory, - Sustainability, Democracy, - Global catastrophes, - Vulnerability, - Surveillance, - Life role and ICT (Main area), - Professional role, - Leadership role, - Private role, - Virtual roles, - Home of the future, - Mobile life, - Role conflicts, - Life environment and ICT (Main area), - Psychosocial environment, - Work environment/Work place, - Work content , - Organizational structure, - Decision support systems, - Human-human communication, - Power structure-formal and informal, - Leadership , - Career patterns, - Influence/participation, - Working hours and salary/compensation , - Work pace/work load , - Physical and ergonomic conditions, - Learning and knowledge growth, - Home Environment, - Public Environment/Sphere, - Private Environment/Sphere, - Virtual Environment/Sphere, - Virtual (on-line) communities, - Organisational Design and Management, - Psychosocial work environment, - Effects on humans (Main area), - Analyses of impact as well as technology contributing to desirable human qualities, - Psychosocial impact, - Life styles, - Human needs (meaningfulness, belonging, autonomy, confidence) , - Happiness and fun, - Wellbeing and health, - Dependency , - Identity, - Integrity , - Trust and privacy, - Addictiveness (games) , - Availability, - Motivation, - Human memory , - Cybersickness, - Stress (over- and understimulation), - Workload, - Fatigue, - Love and Relationship, - Skills and competencies, - Creativity, - Problem solving, - Social competence, - Information and Communication Technologies (ICT) - ICT applications and systems contributing to desirable goals (Main area), Perspectives , - Social and psychosocial, - Cross-cultural, - Ethical, - Theoretical, ...] IADIS International Conference ICT, Society, and Human Beings 2010 {'15 March 2010': '- submission deadline (new date): 15 march 2010', 'July 2010': 'freiburg, germany 26 ãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâ¢ãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâ¢ãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâ¬ãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâ¢ãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâãâ germany, 29-31 july 2010'}
43 12th International Symposium on Symbolic and Numeric Algorithms for Scientific Computing Timisoara, Romania C A L L F O R PAPERS\nThe 12th International Symposium on \nSymbolic and Numeric Algorithms for Scientific Computing\n\nSYNASC aims to stimulate the interaction between the two scientific communities of symbolic and numeric computing, with the purpose of exhibiting interesting applications of these areas both in theory and in practice. The choice of this topic is motivated by the belief of the organizers that the dialogue between the two communities is very necessary in order to make significant progress in making the computer a truly intelligent aid for mathematicians and engineers.\n\nImportant dates:\n\n15 March 2010 : Special sessions / Workshops / Tutorials proposals\n30 May 2010 : Paper submission\n15 August 2010 : Notification of acceptance\n01 September 2010 : Registration\n08 September 2010 : Revised papers according to the reviews\n23-26 September 2010 : Symposium period\n30 November 2010 : Final papers for post-proceedings\n\nTopics of interests:\n\n * Symbolic Computation\n + computer algebra;\n + symbolic techniques applied to numerics;\n + hybrid symbolic and numeric algorithms;\n + numerics and symbolics for geometry;\n + programming with constraints, narrowing.\n\n * Logic and programming\n + automatic reasoning;\n + formal system verification;\n + formal verification and synthesis;\n + software quality assessment;\n + static analysis;\n + timing analysis.\n\n * Artificial Intelligence\n + hard computational problem solving;\n + intelligent systems (front-ends) for scientific computing;\n + agent-based complex systems modeling and development;\n + knowledge and data intensive systems;\n + soft computing;\n + recommender systems for scientific computing;\n + data mining and web mining;\n + information retrieval.\n\n * Numerical computing\n + iterative approximation of fixed points;\n + solving systems of nonlinear equations;\n + numerical and symbolic algorithms for differential equations;\n + numerical and symbolic algorithms for optimization;\n + parallel algorithms for numeric computing;\n + scientific visualization and image processing.\n\n * Distributed computing\n + parallel, distributed and web computing for symbolics and numerics;\n + cloud computing\n + grid middleware and applications;\n + agent-based grid computing;\n + grid services;\n + workflow management.\n\nThis list is not intended to be exhaustive.\n\nPublication:\n------------\n\nThe research papers accepted for the conference will be collected as post-proceedings published by IEEE Computer Society Press (ISI Proceedings). (For previous proceedings see http://ieeexplore.ieee.org/xpl/RecentIssue.jsp?punumber=4438060) (C, A, L, L, , F, O, R, , PAPERS, \n, The, 12th, International, Symposium, on, \n, Symbolic, and, Numeric, Algorithms, for, Scientific, Computing, \n\n, SYNASC, aims, to, stimulate, the, interaction, between, the, two, scientific, communities, of, symbolic, and, numeric, computing, ,, with, the, purpose, of, exhibiting, interesting, applications, of, these, areas, both, in, theory, and, in, practice, ., , The, choice, of, this, topic, is, motivated, by, the, belief, of, the, organizers, that, , the, dialogue, , between, the, two, communities, is, very, necessary, in, order, to, make, significant, progress, in, , making, the, computer, a, truly, intelligent, aid, ...) None [C A L L F O R PAPERS, The 12th International Symposium on , Symbolic and Numeric Algorithms for Scientific Computing, SYNASC aims to stimulate the interaction between the two scientific communities of symbolic and numeric computing, with the purpose of exhibiting interesting applications of these areas both in theory and in practice, The choice of this topic is motivated by the belief of the organizers that the dialogue between the two communities is very necessary in order to make significant progress in making the computer a truly intelligent aid for mathematicians and engineers., Important dates:, 15 March 2010 : Special sessions / Workshops / Tutorials proposals, 30 May 2010 : Paper submission, 15 August 2010 : Notification of acceptance, 01 September 2010 : Registration, 08 September 2010 : Revised papers according to the reviews, 23-26 September 2010 : Symposium period, 30 November 2010 : Final papers for post-proceedings, Topics of interests:, * Symbolic Computation, + computer algebra;, + symbolic techniques applied to numerics;, + hybrid symbolic and numeric algorithms;, + numerics and symbolics for geometry;, + programming with constraints, narrowing., * Logic and programming, + automatic reasoning;, + formal system verification;, + formal verification and synthesis;, + software quality assessment;, + static analysis;, + timing analysis., * Artificial Intelligence, + hard computational problem solving;, + intelligent systems (front-ends) for scientific computing;, + agent-based complex systems modeling and development;, + knowledge and data intensive systems;, + soft computing;, + recommender systems for scientific computing;, + data mining and web mining;, + information retrieval., * Numerical computing, + iterative approximation of fixed points;, + solving systems of nonlinear equations;, + numerical and symbolic algorithms for differential equations;, + numerical and symbolic algorithms for optimization;, + parallel algorithms for numeric computing;, + scientific visualization and image processing., * Distributed computing, + parallel, distributed and web computing for symbolics and numerics;, + cloud computing, + grid middleware and applications;, + agent-based grid computing;, + grid services;, + workflow management., This list is not intended to be exhaustive., Publication:, ------------, The research papers accepted for the conference will be collected as post-proceedings published by IEEE Computer Society Press (ISI Proceedings), (For previous proceedings see http://ieeexplore.ieee.org/xpl/RecentIssue.jsp?punumber=4438060)] The 12th International Symposium on Symbolic and Numeric Algorithms for Scientific Computing {'15 March 2010': '15 march 2010 : special sessions / workshops / tutorials proposals', 'May 2010': '30 may 2010 : paper submission', '15 August 2010': '15 august 2010 : notification of acceptance', 'September 2010': '01 september 2010 : registration', '08 September 2010': '08 september 2010 : revised papers according to the reviews', '23-26 September 2010': '23-26 september 2010 : symposium period', 'November 2010': '30 november 44 International workshop on Distributed Architecture modeling for Novel Component based Embedded systems Tozeur, Tunisia \nInternational workshop on Distributed Architecture modeling for Novel Component based Embedded systems\n In conjunction with NOTERE 2010\n Tozeur, Tunisia, 29-30 May 2010\n http://www.irit.fr/DANCE2010/\n========================================================================\n\nIMPORTANT DATES:\nSubmission of papers: March 1st, 2010 (extended)\nNotification of acceptance: March 20th, 2010\nCamera-ready paper due: April 10th, 2010\nWorkshop dates: March 29th - March 30th, 2010\n\nAll accepted papers will be published within the conference proceedings edited by IEEE.\n\nBest workshop papers will be considered -within best NOTERE conference papers- for two special issues:\n\n* Wiley Concurrency and Computation: Practice and Experiment Journal\n (http://www3.interscience.wiley.com/journal/117946197/grouphome/home.html)\n* Springer Journal of Supercomputing\n (http://www.springer.com/computer/programming/journal/11227)\n\n\nCo-organizers :\n\nBrahim Hamid (IRIT-University of Toulouse , France), brahim.hamid@irit.fr \nFranÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ§ois Terrier (CEA LIST , France), francois.terrier@cea.fr \n\nDistributed systems research covers a wide spectrum of applications ranging across embedded real/time systems, commercial transaction systems, transportation systems, and military/space systems. Such systems are subject to some paradigms including coordination due to the absence of centralization, and too much uncertainly result of hardware of software behaviors, heterogeneity and son forth. Indeed, such systems raise several issues not found in single processor systems. The main difficulty arises when considering dependability, security, adaptability and resources constrained computing. This area requires computing systems to run software in an efficient and trustworthy way. That is, in order to be able to design complex architectures in reasonable time, novel and effective design methodologies are needed to automatically build applications from high-level descriptions to take into account what needs to be deployed on hardware. To remedy this weakness, combining both model and component seems to be a very promising cocktail for building solutions to this problem.\n\nThe introduction of the component approach in the development of embedded systems allows facilitating their design by building through an assembly of existing components. Indeed, this approach provides a clear separation between the specification and implementation of components. Note however that in the context of component software, distributed architecture is significantly more demanding than that of traditional monolithic integrated solution. Model-driven engineering provides a very useful contribution for the design of distributed systems since it bridges the gap between design issues and implementation concerns. It helps the designer to concentrate on application structure and required behavior and it permits us to specify in a separate way non-functional requirements such as underlying execution infrastructure/middleware, dependability and security issues that are very important to guide the implementation process.\n\nThe supporting research in the distributed systems area includes system architecture, design techniques, testing, validation, proof of correctness, modeling, software reliability, operating systems, parallel processing and real/time processing. The goal of this workshop is to present significant works dealing with the design of distributed architecture and applications for embedded systems using both model-driven approach and component-based development. Architecture design involves defining how the architecture is specified. Here, we focus on design tools with some view of the possible implementations frameworks providing run-time support to take full benefits of existing infrastructure to build flexible efficient distributed systems.\n\nLooking forward to your submissions (\n, International, workshop, on, Distributed, Architecture, modeling, for, Novel, Component, based, Embedded, systems, \n , In, conjunction, with, NOTERE, 2010, \n , Tozeur, ,, Tunisia, ,, 29, -, 30, May, 2010, \n , http://www.irit.fr/DANCE2010/, \n, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, ...) Tozeur [International workshop on Distributed Architecture modeling for Novel Component based Embedded systems, In conjunction with NOTERE 2010, Tozeur, Tunisia, 29-30 May 2010, http://www.irit.fr/DANCE2010/, ========================================================================, IMPORTANT DATES:, Submission of papers: March 1st, 2010 (extended), Notification of acceptance: workshop papers will be considered -within best NOTERE conference papers- for two special issues:, * Wiley Concurrency and Computation: Practice and Experiment Journal, (http://www3.interscience.wiley.com/journal/117946197/grouphome/home.html), * Springer Journal of Supercomputing, (http://www.springer.com/computer/programming/journal/11227), Co-organizers :, Brahim Hamid (IRIT-University of Toulouse , France), brahim.hamid@irit.fr , FranÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ§ois Terrier (CEA LIST , France), francois.terrier@cea.fr , Distributed systems research covers a wide spectrum of applications ranging across embedded real/time systems, commercial transaction systems, transportation systems, and military/space systems, Such systems are subject to some paradigms including coordination due to the absence of centralization, and too much uncertainly result of hardware of software behaviors, heterogeneity and son forth, Indeed, such systems raise several issues not found in single processor systems, The main difficulty arises when considering dependability, security, adaptability and resources constrained computing, This area requires computing systems to run software in an efficient and trustworthy way, That is, in order to be able to design complex architectures in reasonable time, novel and effective design methodologies are needed to automatically build applications from high-level descriptions to take into account what needs to be deployed on hardware, To remedy this weakness, combining both model and component seems to be a very promising cocktail for building solutions to this problem., The introduction of the component approach in the development of embedded systems allows facilitating their design by building through an assembly of existing components, Indeed, this approach provides a clear separation between the specification and implementation of components, Note however that in the context of component software, distributed architecture is significantly more demanding than that of traditional monolithic integrated solution, Model-driven engineering provides a very useful contribution for the design of distributed systems since it bridges the gap between design issues and implementation concerns, It helps the designer to concentrate on application structure and required behavior and it permits us to specify in a separate way non-functional requirements such as underlying execution infrastructure/middleware, dependability and security issues that are very important to guide the implementation process., The supporting research in the distributed systems area includes system architecture, design techniques, testing, validation, proof of correctness, modeling, software reliability, operating systems, parallel processing and real/time processing, The goal of this workshop is to present significant works dealing with the design of distributed architecture and applications for embedded systems using both model-driven approach and component-based development, Architecture design involves defining how the architecture is specified, Here, we focus on design tools with some view of the possible implementations frameworks providing run-time support to take full benefits of existing infrastructure to build flexible efficient distributed systems., Looking forward to your submissions] International workshop on Distributed Architecture modeling for Novel Component based Embedded systems {'May 2010':
