'camera-ready paper due: april 10th, 2010'}
45 10th International Symposium on Communications and Information Technologies Tokyo, Japan The 10th International Symposium on Communications and Information Technologies will be held in Meiji University, Tokyo, Japan. Meiji University is one of major old-established universities in Japan, being located in the center of Tokyo, the most exciting city in Asia. The ISCIT presents every possibility on new information technologies. Prospective authors are invited to submit their papers reporting original work as well as tutorial overviews in all areas of information technologies and communications. The topics for regular sessions include, but are not limited to, the followings:\n1. Signal Processing\n\t\n1.1 \tAdaptive, Multimedia and Multirate Signal Processing\n1.2 \tMixed Signal Processing\n1.3 \tSpeech Processing and Coding\n1.4 \tVideo Processing and Coding\n1.5 \tDigital Filters and Filter Banks\n1.6 \tWavelets and Multirate Signal Processing\n1.7 \tFast Computations for Signal Processing and Communication Systems\n1.8 \tIntelligent Signal Processing for Communications & Systems\n1.9 \tSecurity Signal Processing\n1.10 \tOptical Signal Processing\n1.11 \tNoise Control\n1.12 \tVideo and Multimedia Technology & Communications\n1.13 \tAudio/Acoustic Signal Processing\n1.14 \tOthers\n\t\n2. Communication Systems\n\t\n2.1 \tCommunication Theory\n2.2 \tHigh Speed Networks\n2.3 \tMultimedia Services and Technologies\n2.4 \tNetwork Management and Design\n2.5 \tIntelligent Communication Systems and Network Protocols\n2.6 \tSignal Processing for Communications\n2.7 \tWireless/Mobile Communications\n2.8 \tWideband Communications\n2.9 \tUbiquitous Sensor Networks/ Cooperative Networks/ Ad-hoc Networks\n2.10 \tNext-Generation Wireless Internet\n2.11 \tOthers\n\t\t\n3. Computer and Information\n\t\n3.1 \tArtificial Intelligence and Applications\n3.2 \tComputer Networks\n3.3 \tComputer Systems and Applications\n3.4 \tInternet Technologies and Applications\n3.5 \tModeling and Simulation\n3.6 \tData/Network Security\n3.7 \tStorage Systems and Techniques\n3.8 \tSystem Software\n3.9 \tOthers\n\t\n4. Circuits and Systems\n\t\n4.1 \tAnalog Circuits, Filters and Data Conversion\n4.2 \tAnalog and Mixed Signal Processing\n4.3 \tNumerical Methods and Circuit Simulation\n4.4 \tCircuits and Systems for Communications\n4.5 \tNeural Networks and Fuzzy Logic Processing\n4.6 \tOthers\n\t\n5. VLSI\n\t\n5.1 \tAnalog and Digital ICs for Communications\n5.2 \tLow Power Design & VLSI Physical Synthesis\n5.3 \tModelingv, Simulation and CAD Tools\n5.4 \tInternet Technologies and Applications\n5.5 \tVLSI Architecture for Signal Processing\n5.6 \tOthers\n\t\n6. Information Technologies\n\t\n6.1 \tEmbedded Technology\n6.2 \tSoftware Development\n6.3 \tHuman Interface\n6.4 \tVirtual Reality and Mixed Reality\n6.5 \tEducation and E-learning\n6.6 \tOthers\n\t\n7. Emerging Technologies in Communications and Information Technologies\nAuthors are invited to submit a full paper according toz posted guidelines. Only electronic submissions will be accepted. Authors are expected to present their papers at the Symposium upon acceptance and presenting authors are required to register for the Symposium. Accepted papers will be included in the IEEE Xplore database and in the Elsevier EI Compendex.\nImportant Due Dates and Author's Schedule:\n\t\nProposal for Special Sessions: \tApril 15, 2010\nDeadline for Submission of Full Paper: \tApril 15, 2010\nNotification of Acceptance: \tJune 10, 2010\nDeadline for Submission of Camera Ready Paper: \tJuly 10, 2010 (The, 10th, International, Symposium, on, Communications, and, Information, Technologies, will, be, held, in, Meiji, University, ,, Tokyo, ,, Japan, ., Meiji, University, is, one, of, major, old, -, established, universities, in, Japan, ,, being, located, in, the, center, of, Tokyo, ,, the, most, exciting, city, in, Asia, ., The, ISCIT, presents, every, possibility, on, new, information, technologies, ., Prospective, authors, are, invited, to, submit, their, papers, reporting, original, work, as, well, as, tutorial, overviews, in, all, areas, of, information, technologies, and, communications, ., The, topics, for, regular, sessions, include, ,, but, are, not, limited, to, ,, the, followings, :, \n, ...) Tokyo [The 10th International Symposium on Communications and Information Technologies will be held in Meiji University, Tokyo, Japan, Meiji University is one of major old-established universities in Japan, being located in the center of Tokyo, the most exciting city in Asia, The ISCIT presents every possibility on new information technologies, Prospective authors are invited to submit their papers reporting original work as well as tutorial overviews in all areas of information technologies and communications, The topics for regular sessions include, but are not limited to, the followings:, 1, Signal Processing, \t, 1.1 \tAdaptive, Multimedia and Multirate Signal Processing, 1.2 \tMixed Signal Processing, 1.3 \tSpeech Processing and Coding, 1.4 \tVideo Processing and Coding, Techniques, 3.8 \tSystem Software, 3.9 \tOthers, \t, 4, Circuits and Systems, \t, 4.1 \tAnalog Circuits, Filters and Data Conversion, 4.2 \tAnalog and Mixed Signal Processing, 4.3 \tNumerical Methods and Circuit Simulation, 4.4 \tCircuits and Systems for Communications, 4.5 \tNeural Networks and Fuzzy Logic Processing, 4.6 \tOthers, \t, 5, VLSI, \t, 5.1 \tAnalog and Digital ICs for Communications, accepted, Authors are expected to present their papers at the Symposium upon acceptance and presenting authors are required to register for the Symposium, Accepted papers will be included in the IEEE Xplore database and in the Elsevier EI Compendex., Important Due Dates and Author's Schedule:, \t, Proposal for Special Sessions: \tApril 15, 2010, Deadline for Submission of Full Paper: \tApril 15, 46 2010 International Forum on Strategic Technologies (IFOST 2010) Ulsan, Korea (South) 2010 International Forum on Strategic Technologies (IFOST 2010)\r\n\r\nUlsan, 13-15 October, 2010\r\n\r\nThe 2010 International Forum on Strategic Technologies (IFOST 2010) will be held on 13-15 October 2009 in Ulsan, Korea. The conference will be hosted by University of Ulsan (Ulsan, the Republic of Korea) and the contribution from Novosibirsk State Technical University (Novosibirsk, Russia), Tomsk Polytechnic University (Tomsk, Russia), Mongolian University of Science and Technology (Ulan-Bator, Mongolia), Harbin University of Science and Technology (Harbin, Public Republic of China), University of Malaya (Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia), Ha Noi University of Technology (Ha Noi, Vietnam) and Vietnam National University HoChiMinh city (VNU-HCM)- HoChiMinh city University of Technology (HCMUT). \r\nSponsors of IFOST 2010: Ulsan Metropolitan City, Ulsan Technopark, University of Ulsan\r\n\r\nThis conference will commence in the morning of 13 October with registration and opening session, followed by plenary session, then will continue till afternoon of 15 October with technical program divided into five parallel sessions: e-Vehicle/Green Car, New Materials, Renewable Energy, Smart Grid(Intelligent Power System and Energy), Bio-/Chemio-/Nano-Technology and Others with Green Technology\r\nOBJECTIVES\r\nThe technical program brings together researchers, graduate students from academia, research labs, and engineers from industry to exchange, discuss and share their experiences, new ideas and researches about theoretical and practical aspects of advanced strategic technologies.\r\nPROPOSED THEMES\r\nThe papers solicited in IFOST 2010 will cover a variety of topics including but not limited to:\r\n\r\nSession 1. E-Vehicle / Green Car:\r\n\r\nSession 2. New Materials:\r\n\r\nSession 3. Renewable Energy: Bioenergy, Photovoltaics, Solar heating and cooling, Concentrating solar power, Wind Energy, Hydropower, Ocean energy systems, Geothermal, Energy conservation in buildings and in industry, Energy storage, Energy policy. \r\n\r\nSession 4. Smart Grid (Intelligent Power System and Energy):\r\n\r\nSession 5. Bio-/Chemio-/Nano- Technology:\r\n\r\nSession 6. Others\r\n\r\nAuthors are invited to submit electronically original contributions in the conference themes and related topics on the following site:\r\n\r\nPapers should not be longer than 6 (six) A4-pages in double column PDF format. \r\nA template of a paper can be downloaded at this address http://www.ieee.org/web/publications/pubservices/confpub/AuthorTools/conferenceTemplates.html \r\n\r\nAll submitted papers will be reviewed and evaluated on the basis of relevance, originality, technical quality and clarity. \r\nAccepted papers will be included in the conference proceedings. The official language is English. Details regarding the paper format and the submission process will be posted at the conference website. (2010, International, Forum, on, Strategic, Technologies, (, IFOST, 2010, ), \r\n\r\n, Ulsan, ,, 13, -, 15, October, ,, 2010, \r\n\r\n, The, 2010, International, Forum, on, Strategic, Technologies, (, IFOST, 2010, ), will, be, held, on, 13, -, 15, October, 2009, in, Ulsan, ,, Korea, ., The, conference, will, be, hosted, by, University, of, Ulsan, (, Ulsan, ,, the, Republic, of, Korea, ), and, the, contribution, from, Novosibirsk, State, Technical, University, (, Novosibirsk, ,, Russia, ), ,, Tomsk, Polytechnic, University, (, Tomsk, ,, Russia, ), ,, Mongolian, University, of, Science, and, Technology, (, Ulan, -, Bator, ,, Mongolia, ), ,, Harbin, ...) 2009 in Ulsan, Korea, The conference will be hosted by University of Ulsan (Ulsan, the Republic of Korea) and the contribution from Novosibirsk State Technical University (Novosibirsk, Russia), Tomsk Polytechnic University (Tomsk, Russia), Mongolian University of Science and Technology (Ulan-Bator, Mongolia), Harbin University of Science and Technology (Harbin, Public Republic of China), (HCMUT), Sponsors of IFOST 2010: Ulsan Metropolitan City, Ulsan Technopark, University of Ulsan, This conference will commence in the morning of 13 October with registration and opening session, followed by plenary session, then will continue till afternoon of 15 October with technical program divided into five parallel sessions: e-Vehicle/Green Car, New Materials, Renewable Energy, Smart Grid(Intelligent Power System and Energy), Bio-/Chemio-/Nano-Technology and Others with Green Technology, OBJECTIVES, The technical program brings together researchers, graduate students from academia, research labs, and engineers from industry to exchange, discuss and share their experiences, new ideas and researches about theoretical and practical aspects of advanced strategic technologies., PROPOSED THEMES, The papers solicited in IFOST 2010 will cover a variety of topics including but not limited to:, Session 1, E-Vehicle / Green Car:, Session 2, New Materials:, Session 3, Renewable Energy: Bioenergy, Photovoltaics, Solar heating and cooling, Concentrating solar power, Wind Energy, Hydropower, Ocean energy systems, Geothermal, Energy conservation in buildings and in industry, Energy storage, Energy policy, Session 4, Smart Grid (Intelligent Power System and Energy):, Session 5, Bio-/Chemio-/Nano- Technology:, Session 6, Others, Authors are invited to submit electronically original contributions in the conference themes and related topics on the following site:, Papers should not be longer than 6 (six) A4-pages in double column PDF format, A template of a paper can be downloaded at this address http://www.ieee.org/web/publications/pubservices/confpub/AuthorTools/conferenceTemplates.html , All submitted papers will be reviewed and evaluated on the basis submission process will be posted at the conference website.] 2010 International Forum on Strategic Technologies (IFOST 2010) {'13-15 October, 2010': 'ulsan, 13-15 october, 2010', '13-15 October 2009': 'the 2010 international forum on strategic technologies (ifost 2010) will be held on 13-15 october 2009 in ulsan, korea', '15 October': 'this conference will commence in the morning of 13 october with registration and opening session, followed by plenary session, then will continue till afternoon of 15 october with technical program divided into five parallel sessions: e-vehicle/green car, new materials, renewable energy, smart grid(intelligent power system and energy), bio-/chemio-/nano-technology and others with green technology'}
47 Workshop for Negation and Speculation in Natural Language Processing Uppsala, Sweden CALL FOR PAPERS\n========================================\n\nWorkshop for Negation and Speculation in Natural Language Processing\n\nOrganised by the University of Antwerp and Saarland University\n\nJuly 10, 2010, Uppsala, Sweden\n\nhttp://www.clips.ua.ac.be/NeSpNLP2010\n\n========================================\n\nPapers are invited for the one-day workshop to be held in Uppsala on the 10th of July, 2010.\n\nIn recent years, research has yielded substantial progress in NLP tasks like NE recognition, WSD, parsing, semantic role labeling, and anaphora resolution among others. This has been in part supported by the organisation of shared tasks, which provide annotated data, a definition of the task and an evaluation framework, motivating researchers to develop new techniques to tackle these tasks. Other tasks like paraphrasing, summarization or textual entailment have also progressed, but results are still relatively low because deep understanding of language - mapping meaning to meaning - is necessary. This raises methodological questions. Furthermore, large scale linguistic resources are still lacking.\n\nNegation and speculation are two phenomena involved in deep understanding of text. Both are related to expressing the factuality of statements, that is, expressing to which extent a statement is or is not a fact or a speculation. Negation turns an affirmative statement into negative (it rains/it does not rain). Speculation is used to express to which extent a statement is certain or speculated (it might rain/apparently, it will rain/ it is likely to rain/it is not clear whether it will rain/we suspect that it will rain).\n\nSCOPE AND TOPICS\n\nIn this workshop we aim at bringing together researchers working on negation and speculation from any area related to computational language learning and processing. The general goal of the workshop is to stimulate research about these topics. Specific goals are to describe the lexical aspects of negation and speculation, to define how the semantics of these phenomena can be modelled for computational purposes, to explore techniques aimed at learning the factuality of an statement, and to analyse how the treatment of these phenomena affects the efficiency of NLP applications. Finally, the workshop aims at encouraging discussion about the need of deep linguistic processing as a way to take computational linguistics a step further.\n\nThe wokshop will address the following aspects of negation and speculation, although it will be open to other related topics:\n\n- Lexical aspects of negation and speculation\n- Linguistic resources with information about negation and speculation: corpora, dictionaries, lexical databases \n- Descriptive analysis of negation and speculation cues\n- Negation and speculation across domains and genres\n- Negation and speculation in biomedical texts and biomedical text mining \n- Handling negation and speculation in NLP: dialogue systems, sentiment analysis, text mining, textual entailment, information extraction, machine translation, paraphrasing\n- Learning the scope of negation and speculation cues\n- Interaction of negation and speculation for evaluating the factuality of an statement\n- Corpora annotation: guidelines, bootstrapping techniques, quality assessment\n- Modelling factuality for computational purposes\n- Algorithms to learn negation and speculation\n- Structured prediction of negation and speculation \n- Joint learning of negation and speculation\n- Inference of factual knowledge\n\n\t\nSUBMISSIONS\n\nAuthors are invited to submit full papers on original, unpublished work in the topic area of this workshop. All submissions must conform to the official ACL 2010 style guidelines and should not exceed 8 pages. Formatting instructions can be found in the ACL web page: http://www.acl2010.org/authors.html\n\nThe reviewing of the papers will be blind and the papers should not include the authors' names and affiliations. Each submission will be reviewed by at least two members of the program committee. Accepted papers will be published in the workshop proceedings with an ISBN.\n\nPapers should be submitted as PDF no later than May 14, 2010, via the following website:\n\t \nhttp://www.easychair.org/conferences/?conf=nespnlp2010\n\n\nIMPORTANT DATES\n\nMay 14 - Deadline for workshop papers\nJune 15 - Notification of acceptance\nJune 25 - Camera-ready papers due \nJuly 10 - Workshop in Uppsala \n\nORGANISATION\n\t\nRoser Morante, CLiPS-LTG, University of Antwerp\nroser.morante [at] ua dot ac dot be\nCaroline Sporleder, MMCI / Computational Linguistics and Phonetics, Saarland University\ncsporled [at] coli dot uni-sb dot de\n\nPROGRAM COMMITTEE\n\nTimothy Baldwin - University Melbourne \nAljoscha Burchardt - TU Darmstadt \nClaire Cardie - Cornell University \nXavier Carreras - Technical University of Catalonia \nWendy W. Chapman - University of Pittsburgh \nKevin B. Cohen - University of Colorado \nWalter Daelemans - University of Antwerp \nBonnie Dorr - University of Maryland \nRoxana Girju - University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign \nSanda Harabagiu - University of Texas at Dallas \nIris Hendrickx - University of Lisbon \nVeronique Hoste - University College Ghent \nHalil Kilicoglu - Concordia University \nLori Levin - Carnegie Mellon University \nLluis MÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ rquez - Uppsala [ CALL FOR PAPERS, ========================================, Workshop for Negation and Speculation in Natural Language Processing, Organised by the University of Antwerp and Saarland University, July 10, 2010, Uppsala, Sweden, http://www.clips.ua.ac.be/NeSpNLP2010, ========================================, Papers are invited for the one-day workshop to be held in Uppsala on the 10th of July, 2010., In recent years, research has yielded substantial progress in NLP tasks like NE recognition, WSD, parsing, semantic role labeling, and anaphora resolution among others, This has been in part supported by the organisation of shared tasks, which provide annotated data, a definition of the task and an evaluation framework, motivating researchers to develop new techniques to tackle these tasks, Other tasks like paraphrasing, summarization or textual entailment have also progressed, but results are still relatively low because deep understanding of language - mapping meaning to meaning - is necessary, This raises methodological questions, Furthermore, large scale linguistic resources are still lacking., Negation and speculation are two phenomena involved in deep understanding of text, Both are related to expressing the factuality of statements, that is, expressing to which extent a statement is or is not a fact or a speculation, Negation turns an affirmative statement into negative (it rains/it does not rain), Speculation is used to express to which extent a statement is certain or speculated (it might rain/apparently, it will rain/ it is likely to rain/it is not clear whether it will rain/we suspect that it will rain)., SCOPE AND TOPICS, In this workshop we aim at bringing together researchers working on negation and speculation from any area related to computational language learning and processing, The general goal of the workshop is to stimulate research about these topics, Specific goals are to describe the lexical aspects of negation and speculation, to define how the semantics of these phenomena can be modelled for computational purposes, to explore techniques aimed at learning the factuality of an statement, and to analyse how the treatment of these phenomena affects the efficiency of NLP applications, Finally, the workshop aims at encouraging discussion about the need of deep linguistic processing as a way to take computational linguistics a step further., The wokshop will address the following aspects of negation and speculation, although it will be open to other related topics:, - Lexical aspects of negation and speculation, - Linguistic resources with information about negation and speculation: corpora, dictionaries, lexical databases , - Descriptive analysis of negation and speculation cues, - Negation and speculation across domains and genres, - Negation and speculation in biomedical texts and biomedical text mining , - Handling negation and speculation in NLP: dialogue systems, sentiment analysis, text mining, textual entailment, information extraction, machine translation, paraphrasing, - Learning the scope of negation and speculation cues, - Interaction of negation and speculation for evaluating the factuality of an statement, - Corpora annotation: guidelines, bootstrapping techniques, quality assessment, - Modelling factuality for computational purposes, - Algorithms to learn negation and speculation, - Structured prediction of negation and speculation , - Joint learning of negation and speculation, - Inference of factual knowledge, \t, SUBMISSIONS, Authors are invited to submit full papers on original, unpublished work in the topic area of this workshop, All submissions must conform to the official ACL 2010 style guidelines and should not exceed 8 pages, Formatting instructions can be found in the ACL web page: http://www.acl2010.org/authors.html, The reviewing of the papers will be blind and the papers should not include the authors' names and affiliations, Each submission will be reviewed by at least two members of the program committee, Accepted papers will be published in the workshop proceedings with an ISBN., Papers should be submitted as PDF no later than May 14, 2010, via the following website:, \t , http://www.easychair.org/conferences/?conf=nespnlp2010, IMPORTANT DATES, May 14 - Deadline for workshop papers, June 15 - Notification of acceptance, June 25 - Camera-ready papers due , July 10 - Workshop in Uppsala , ORGANISATION, \t, Roser Morante, CLiPS-LTG, University of Antwerp, roser.morante [at] ua dot ac dot be, Caroline Sporleder, MMCI / Computational Linguistics and Phonetics, Saarland University, csporled [at] coli dot uni-sb dot de, PROGRAM COMMITTEE, Timothy Baldwin - University of Lisbon , Veronique Hoste - University College Ghent , Halil Kilicoglu - Concordia University , Lori Levin - Carnegie Mellon University , Lluis MÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ rquez - Barcelona Media Innovation Center , Khalil Sima'an - University of Amsterdam , Caroline Sporleder - Saarland University, Mihai Surdeanu - Stanford University , Antal van den Bosch - Tilburg University , Michael Wiegand - Saarland University , Theresa Wilson - University of Edinburgh] Workshop for Negation and Speculation in Natural Language Processing {'July 10, 2010': 'july 10, 2010, uppsala, sweden', 'the 10th of July, 2010': 'papers are invited for the one-day workshop to be held in uppsala on the 10th of july, 2010.', 'May 14, 2010': 'papers should be submitted as pdf no later than may 14, 2010, via the following website:', 'May 14': 'may 14 - deadline for workshop papers', 'June 15': 'june 15 - notification of acceptance', 'June 25': 'june 25 - camera-ready papers due ', 'July 10': 'july 10 - workshop in uppsala '}
48 The 4th e-Science Workshop Belo Horizonte, MG, Brazil The 4th e-Science Workshop\nhttp://www.dcc.ufrj.br/~escience\n\n(in conjunction with CSBC 2010)\nBelo Horizonte, MG, Brazil\nJuly 2010\n\n----------------------------------------------------------------------\nIMPORTANT DATES\n----------------------------------------------------------------------\n\nDeadline for submissions (full papers and posters): March 8th, 2010\nNotification of acceptance: April 19th, 2010\nCamera ready due: May 17th, 2010\nWorkshop dates: July 20th - 23rd, 2010\n\n----------------------------------------------------------------------\nMOTIVATION\n----------------------------------------------------------------------\n\nOver the past decades, we have seen a revolution in the way science and engineering has been conducted. Specially, computation became an established third brand of science alongside theory and experiment. Scientists now need to access and exploit computational resources and databases that are geographically distributed through the use of high speed networks. Those resources must be modeled and managed in a similar way we model software development and data through software engineering processes and database techniques. In order to attack the next generation of scientific problems, multidisciplinary and distributed teams of scientists need to collaborate to make progress on these new challenges.\n\nCurrent advances in Software Engineering and Database research, including ontologies, scientific process/workflow modeling, semantic web services, software component management, grid computing, resource modeling, process and data provenance, data curation, among others can help to address these challenges. Several national and international projects around the world have been initiated to carry out research and innovation activities that will transform the goal of e-Science and Grid computing into a reality.\n\nThe IV e-Science workshop aims at bringing together recent developments in databases and software engineering towards a computerized infrastructure to accomplish science in the large, supporting the next generation of scientific research and experiments. The definition, execution and management of scientific experiments can no longer be developed in an ad-hoc manner. The topic of e-science or cyberinfrastructure is part of the ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂGrand Challenges in Computer Science Research in Brazil ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ 2006 ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ 2016ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ report from the Brazilian Computer Society.\n\nThis workshop serves as a forum to present, discuss and establish new partnership among scientists that participate in research and product/tool developments, and highlights related activities from the Brazilian and international community. The first three versions of the event were co-located with SBBD/SBES, and showed that there is an interesting audience on the theme. New projects are taking place, based on partnerships on the database and software engineering area. In this forth edition, we would like to extend the possible fields of collaborations to other areas of Computer Science that have much to contribute to e-Science.\n\n----------------------------------------------------------------------\nTOPICS OF INTEREST\n----------------------------------------------------------------------\n\nThe topics of interest of the workshop include (but are not limited to): \n\n- e-Science and Grid applications\n- e-Science workflow management\n- Ontologies and databases for e-Science\n- Data and process provenance\n- Collaborative Science Models and Techniques\n- Data Access Management\n- Virtual e-Science Organizations\n- Service-Oriented Grid Architectures\n- Grid economy and Business Models\n- Autonomic, Real-Time and Self-Organizing Grids\n- Web semantics for e-Science\n- Enabling Technologies for e-Science: Internet and Web Services\n- e-Science Experimentation Environments\n- Experimentation processes for science in large scale\n- Scientific Knowledge Management applied to science in large scale\n- Arts, Humanities and e-Social Science \n- Bioinformatics and Health \n- Physical Sciences and Engineering \n- Climate & Earth Sciences \n\n----------------------------------------------------------------------\nSUBMISSION GUIDELINES\n----------------------------------------------------------------------\n\nThe workshop will accept submissions of technical papers and posters written in either English or Portuguese. Technical papers must not exceed 8 pages, and posters must not exceed 4 pages. Papers and posters should be formatted according to the Brazilian Computer Society paper format. All papers and posters must be submitted using the JEMS conference system.\n\nThe technical papers and posters will be reviewed according to the following criteria: adequacy to the workshop scope, relevance, technical quality, clarity, and originality. Technical papers describing preliminary work and ongoing research are also eligible. Assessment of results is desirable but not a pre-condition for the submission of the paper. All technical papers must present related work. Technical papers and posters will be peer reviewed according to recommendations of the committee. \n\nSelected technical papers will be orally presented during the workshop and published on the conference CD. Authors must prepare a poster that will be presented during the poster section. \n\nSelected posters will be presented during a poster section in the event and published on the conference CD. Authors should be available to discuss them with the audience during the poster section. \n\nSubmission site: https://submissoes.sbc.org.br/home.cgi?c=1074\n\n\n\n----------------------------------------------------------------------\nWORKSHOP CHAIRS\n----------------------------------------------------------------------\n\nVanessa Braganholo \nDCC/UFRJ\nbraganholo@dcc.ufrj.br\n\nJonice Oliveira\nDCC/UFRJ\njonice@dcc.ufrj.br\n\n----------------------------------------------------------------------\nSTEERING COMMITTEE\n----------------------------------------------------------------------\n\nFernanda Campos ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ UFJF\nJonice Oliveira - MG [The 4th e-Science Workshop, http://www.dcc.ufrj.br/~escience, (in conjunction with CSBC 2010), Belo Horizonte, MG, Brazil, July 2010, ----------------------------------------------------------------------, IMPORTANT DATES, ----------------------------------------------------------------------, Deadline for submissions (full papers and posters): March 8th, 2010, Notification of acceptance: April 19th, 2010, Camera ready due: May 17th, 2010, Workshop dates: July 20th - 23rd, 2010, ----------------------------------------------------------------------, MOTIVATION, ----------------------------------------------------------------------, Over the past decades, we have seen a revolution in the way science and engineering has been conducted, Specially, computation became an established third brand of science alongside theory and experiment, Scientists now need to access and exploit computational resources and databases that are geographically distributed through the use of high speed networks, Those resources must be modeled and managed in a similar way we model software development and data through software engineering processes and database techniques, In order to attack the next generation of scientific problems, multidisciplinary and distributed teams of scientists need to collaborate to make progress on these new challenges., Current advances in Software Engineering and Database research, including ontologies, scientific process/workflow modeling, semantic web services, software component management, grid computing, resource modeling, process and data provenance, data curation, among others can help to address these challenges, Several national and international projects around the world have been initiated to carry out research and innovation activities that will transform the goal of e-Science and Grid computing into a reality., The IV e-Science workshop aims at bringing together recent developments in databases and software engineering towards a computerized infrastructure to accomplish science in the large, supporting the next generation of scientific research and experiments, The definition, execution and management of scientific experiments can no longer be developed in an ad-hoc manner, The topic of e-science or cyberinfrastructure is part of the ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ, 2016ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ report from the Brazilian Computer Society., This workshop serves as a forum to present, discuss and establish new partnership among scientists that participate in research and product/tool developments, and highlights related activities from the Brazilian and international community, The first three versions of the event were co-located with SBBD/SBES, and showed that there is an interesting audience on the theme, New projects are taking place, based on partnerships on the database and software engineering area, In this forth edition, we would like to extend the possible fields of collaborations to other areas of Computer Science that have much to contribute to e-Science., ----------------------------------------------------------------------, TOPICS OF INTEREST, ----------------------------------------------------------------------, The topics of interest of the workshop include (but are not limited to): , - e-Science and Grid applications, - e-Science workflow management, - Ontologies and databases for e-Science, - Data and process provenance, - Collaborative Science Models and Techniques, - Data Access Management, - Virtual e-Science Organizations, - Service-Oriented Grid Architectures, - Grid economy and Business Models, - Autonomic, Real-Time and Self-Organizing Grids, - Web semantics for e-Science, - Enabling Technologies for e-Science: Internet and Web Services, - e-Science Experimentation Environments, - Experimentation processes for science in large scale, - Scientific Knowledge Management applied to science in large scale, - Arts, Humanities and e-Social Science , - Bioinformatics and Health , - Physical Sciences and Engineering , - Climate & Earth Sciences , ----------------------------------------------------------------------, SUBMISSION GUIDELINES, ----------------------------------------------------------------------, The workshop will accept submissions of technical papers and posters written in either English or Portuguese, Technical papers must not exceed 8 pages, and posters must not exceed 4 pages, Papers and posters should be formatted according to the Brazilian Computer Society paper format, All papers and posters must be submitted using the JEMS conference system., The technical papers and posters will be reviewed according to the following criteria: adequacy to the workshop scope, relevance, technical quality, clarity, and originality, Technical papers describing preliminary work and ongoing research are also eligible, Assessment of results is desirable but not a pre-condition for the submission of the paper, All technical papers must present related work, Technical papers and posters will be peer reviewed according to recommendations of the committee, Selected technical papers will be orally presented during the workshop and published on the conference CD, Authors must prepare a poster that will be presented during the poster section, Selected posters will be presented during a poster section in the event and published on the conference CD, Authors should be available to discuss them with the audience during the poster section, Submission site: https://submissoes.sbc.org.br/home.cgi?c=1074, ----------------------------------------------------------------------, WORKSHOP CHAIRS, ----------------------------------------------------------------------, Vanessa Braganholo , DCC/UFRJ, braganholo@dcc.ufrj.br, Jonice Oliveira, DCC/UFRJ, jonice@dcc.ufrj.br, ----------------------------------------------------------------------, STEERING COMMITTEE, ----------------------------------------------------------------------, Fernanda Campos ClÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¡udia Werner - COPPE/UFRJ, Duncan Ruiz - PUC/RS, Fabio Porto - LNCC, Fernanda BaiÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ£o - UNIRIO, Fernanda Campos - UFJF, ...] The 4th e-Science Workshop {'July 2010': 'july 2010', 'March 8th, 2010': 'deadline for submissions (full papers and posters): march 8th, 2010', 'April 19th, 2010': 'notification of acceptance: april 19th, 2010', 'May 17th, 2010': 'camera ready due: may 17th, 2010', 'July 20th - 23rd, 2010': 'workshop dates: july 20th - 23rd, 2010'}
49 1st International Workshop on Reuse in Business Process Management Hoboken, NJ-USA (close to New York City) 1st International Workshop on Reuse in Business Process Management\n\nIn Conjunction with BPM 2010 (The 8th International Conference on Business Process Management)\n\n\n=== Aims and Scope ===\n\nThe current complexity inherent in the corporative world demands a great dynamism from the IT infrastructure in order to provide technical solutions for conducting business. Business Process Management (BPM), including its service-oriented foundation, has been providing important technological support to improve organization competitiveness. In order to increase dynamism and competitiveness, BPM can benefit from reuse approaches and techniques at several stages of business process life cycle.\n\nThe 1st International Workshop on Reuse in Business Process Management will be dedicated to explore any type of reuse in the Business Process Management domain. Therefore, it will be a forum to discuss systematic reuse applied to BPM at its various levels:\n\n 1. the basic service-oriented foundation level ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ including issues such as service development, description, publication, discovery and selection;\n 2. the service composition level ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ encompassing service negotiation and service aggregation;\n 3. the management and monitoring upper level ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ including business process modeling, execution, monitoring, and contract establishment and enactment;\n 4. the Quality of Service and Semantics orthogonal level.\n\nMoreover, the impact of reuse on business- and service-oriented engineering as well as how it can help in the design of more high-quality process models are very important topics to be discussed in this workshop.\n\nDifferent existing reuse approaches and techniques can be extended to be applied to this fairly new domain, including: software product line or software product families; variability descriptors; design patterns such as feature modeling; aspect-orientation; and component-based development. In addition, completely new approaches and techniques can be proposed. Their use must also be discussed, preferably under experimentation as well as results analysis.\n\n\n=== Suggested Topics ===\n\nPossible topics for the workshop papers are (but are not restricted to):\n\n * Product Lines (Product Families) for BPM\n * Patterns for business process and workflows\n * Variability descriptors applied in BPM elements\n * Feature modeling applied in BPM elements\n * Aspect-oriented extensions for BPM\n * Component-based Development and Service and Business-oriented Engineering\n * Reuse in Service-oriented Architecture (SOA)\n * Reuse in service development, negotiation, composition\n * Quality of Service (QoS) and Reuse\n * Reuse in SaaS (Software as a Service) approaches\n * Reusable asset libraries for BPM\n * Reuse in semantic Web services\n * Empirical findings related to reuse in the BPM domain\n * Surveys related to reuse in the BPM domain\n * Reuse in business process modeling, execution, monitoring\n * Reuse in electronic contract establishment\n * Case studies and experiments results related to reuse in BPM\n * Experiences with reuse in industry\n * Analysis of reuse related to Web services, WSDL, WS-BPEL\n * Reuse in e-Business, e-Commerce, B2B, B2C, virtual organizations\n * Web services, WSDL, WS-BPEL and extensions to improve reuse\n * Reuse related to ecosystems and business processes\n\n\n=== Important Dates ===\n\n * Paper submission deadline: 30 May 2010 (Extended Deadline)\n * Notification of acceptance: 30 June 2010\n * Camera ready: 25 July 2010\n * Workshop day: 13 September 2010\n\n\n=== Journal Special Issue ===\n\nSelected papers will be considered for extension and publication in a special issue of the "International Journal of Business Process Integration and Management" (IJBPIM) published by InderScience. (1st, International, Workshop, on, Reuse, in, Business, Process, Management, \n\n, In, Conjunction, with, BPM, 2010, (, The, 8th, International, Conference, on, Business, Process, Management, ), \n\n\n, =, =, =, Aims, and, Scope, =, =, =, \n\n, The, current, complexity, inherent, in, the, corporative, world, demands, a, great, dynamism, from, the, IT, infrastructure, in, order, to, provide, technical, solutions, for, conducting, business, ., Business, Process, Management, (, BPM, ), ,, including, its, service, -, oriented, foundation, ,, has, been, providing, important, technological, support, to, improve, organization, competitiveness, ., In, order, to, increase, dynamism, and, competitiveness, ,, BPM, can, benefit, from, reuse, ...) B2B [1st International Workshop on Reuse in Business Process Management, In Conjunction with BPM 2010 (The 8th International Conference on Business Process Management), === Aims and Scope ===, The current complexity inherent in the corporative world demands a great dynamism from the IT infrastructure in order to provide technical solutions for conducting business, Business Process Management (BPM), including its service-oriented foundation, has been providing important technological support to improve organization competitiveness, In order to increase dynamism and competitiveness, BPM can benefit from reuse approaches and techniques at several stages of business process life cycle., The 1st International Workshop on Reuse in Business Process Management will be dedicated to explore any type of reuse in the Business Process Management domain, Therefore, it will be a forum to discuss systematic reuse applied to BPM at its various levels:, 1, the basic service-oriented foundation level including business process modeling, execution, monitoring, and contract establishment and enactment;, 4, the Quality of Service and Semantics orthogonal level., Moreover, the impact of reuse on business- and service-oriented engineering as well as how it can help in the design of more high-quality process models are very important topics to be discussed in this workshop., Different existing reuse approaches and techniques can be extended to be applied to this fairly new domain, including: software product line or software product families; variability descriptors; design patterns such as feature modeling; aspect-orientation; and component-based development, In addition, completely new approaches and techniques can be proposed, Their use must also be discussed, preferably under experimentation as well as results analysis., === Suggested Topics ===, Possible topics for the workshop papers are (but are not restricted to):, * Product Lines (Product Families) for BPM, * Patterns for business process and workflows, * Variability descriptors applied in BPM elements, * Feature modeling applied in BPM elements, * Aspect-oriented extensions for BPM, * Component-based Development and Service and Business-oriented Engineering, * Reuse in Service-oriented Architecture (SOA), * Reuse in service development, negotiation, composition, * Quality of Service (QoS) and Reuse, * Reuse in SaaS (Software as a Service) approaches, * Reusable asset libraries for BPM, * Reuse in semantic Web services, * Empirical findings related to reuse in the BPM domain, * Surveys related to reuse in the BPM domain, * Reuse in business process modeling, execution, monitoring, * Reuse in electronic contract establishment, * Case studies and experiments results related to reuse in BPM, * Experiences with reuse in industry, * Analysis of reuse related to Web services, WSDL, WS-BPEL, * Reuse in e-Business, e-Commerce, B2B, B2C, virtual organizations, * Web services, WSDL, WS-BPEL and extensions to improve reuse, * Reuse related to ecosystems and business processes, === Important Dates ===, * Paper submission deadline: 30 May 2010 (Extended Deadline), * Notification of acceptance: 30 June 2010, * Camera ready: 25 July 2010, * Workshop day: 13 September 2010, === Journal Special Issue ===, Selected papers will be considered for extension and publication in a special issue of the "International Journal of Business Process Integration and Management" (IJBPIM) published by InderScience.] 1st International Workshop on Reuse in Business Process Management {'May 2010': ' * paper submission deadline: 30 may 2010 (extended deadline)', '30 June 2010': ' * notification of acceptance: 30 june 2010', '25 July 2010': ' * camera ready: 25 july 2010', '13 September 2010': ' * workshop day: 13 september 2010'}
50 PRICAI 2010 Special Session on Methods for the (Semi-)automatic Creation of Language Resources for Asian Languages Daegu, Korea Call for Papers\r\n\r\n PRICAI 2010 Special Session on Methods for the (Semi-)automatic\r\n Creation of Language Resources for Asian Languages\r\n\r\n Aug 30 - Sept 2, 2010, Daegu, Korea\r\n\r\n Conference website:\r\n http://www.pricai2010.org/\r\n\r\n Special session on the (Semi-)automatic Creation of Language\r\n Resources for Asian Languages:\r\n http://faculty.washington.edu/fxia/pricai2010/\r\n\r\n Other special sessions:\r\n http://www.pricai2010.org/program/sub_02_6.asp\r\n\r\n\r\n1. Conference Description\r\n\r\nThe Eleventh Pacific Rim International Conference on Artificial Intelligence (PRICAI-10) will provide an international forum for researchers and industry practitioners to share their new ideas, original research results and practical development experiences which concentrate on AI technologies and their applications in areas of social and economic importance for countries in the Pacific Rim.\r\n\r\nPRICAI2010 will be held at the Novetel Hotel in Daegu, Daegu is the fourth largest city in South Korea and has been the center of history, administration, education, and culture. The city has many cultural heritages and tourist attractions to well display Korean culture as well as complexes, department stores and large shopping malls.\r\n\r\n\r\n2. Special session on (Semi-)automatic Creation of Language\r\n Resources for Asian Languages\r\n\r\n As part of the conference, we are organizing a special session on\r\n (Semi-)automatic Creation of Language Resources for Asian Languages.\r\n Language resources (e.g., parallel/comparable corpora,\r\n treebanks/Propbank/discourse treebanks, WordNet, FrameNet,\r\n and dictionaries) are invaluable for natural language processing.\r\n In the past two decades, there have been much effort in creating\r\n such resources; however, many of the studies rely on manual annotation,\r\n which is labor extensive and expensive.\r\n\r\n This special session aims to provide an opportunity for researchers\r\n to share their ideas and efforts in automating the process of creating\r\n language resources for Asian languages. Topics of interest include but\r\n are not limited to:\r\n * Automatic extraction of bilingual/comparable corpora from the Web\r\n * Automatic compilation of bilingual/multi-lingual dictionaries\r\n * (Semi-)automatic annotation of treebanks\r\n * (Semi-)automatic creation of WordNet and FrameNet for a new language\r\n * Automatic merging of language resources with different annotation\r\n schemes and/or from different sources\r\n\r\n\r\n3. Important dates:\r\n * Submission deadline: March 31, 2010, 23:59 Pacific standard time (PST)\r\n * Notification: May 15, 2010\r\n * Camera-ready deadline: May 31, 2010\r\n * Conference date: Aug 30 - Sept 2, 2010\r\n\r\n\r\n4. Submission information\r\n\r\n The papers should report original and unpublished research on topics of\r\ninterest for the special session. Accepted papers are expected to be presented\r\nat the conference, and will be published in the conference proceedings. They\r\nshould emphasize obtained results rather than intended work, and should\r\nindicate clearly the state of completion of the reported results.\r\n\r\n Papers for special sessions should be prepared in accordance with the\r\nPRICAI 2010 requirements (http://sc.snu.ac.kr/PRICAI10/PRICAI10Prep.html),\r\nand submitted through the PRICAI 2010 submission website\r\n(http://sc.snu.ac.kr/PRICAI10/PRICAI10Sub.html).\r\n\r\n\r\n5. Organizers:\r\n\r\n Special session chair and contact:\r\n Fei Xia (University of Washington, USA), fxia@uw.edu\r\n\r\n Program committee:\r\n * Key-Sun Choi (KAIST, Korea)\r\n * Long Jiang (Microsoft China)\r\n * Sadao Kurohashi (Kyoto Univ, Japan)\r\n * Olivia Kwong (City Univ of Hong Kong, Hong Kong)\r\n * Yuji Matsumoto (Nara Institute of Science and Technology, Japan)\r\n * Maosong Sun (Tsinghua Univ, China)\r\n * Tiejun Zhao (Harbin Institute of Technology, China)\r\n * Guodong Zhou (Soochow University, China)\r\n * Chengqing Zong (Chinese Academy of Sciences, China) (Call, for, Papers, \r\n\r\n , PRICAI, 2010, Special, Session, on, Methods, for, the, (, Semi-)automatic, \r\n , Creation, of, Language, Resources, for, Asian, Languages, \r\n\r\n , Aug, 30, -, Sept, 2, ,, 2010, ,, , Daegu, ,, Korea, \r\n\r\n , Conference, website, :, \r\n , http://www.pricai2010.org/, \r\n\r\n , Special, session, on, the, (, Semi-)automatic, Creation, of, Language, \r\n , Resources, for, Asian, Languages, :, \r\n , http://faculty.washington.edu/fxia/pricai2010/, \r\n\r\n , Other, special, sessions, :, \r\n , http://www.pricai2010.org/program/sub_02_6.asp, \r\n\r\n\r\n, 1, ., Conference, Description, \r\n\r\n, The, Eleventh, Pacific, Rim, International, Conference, on, Artificial, Intelligence, (, PRICAI-10, ), will, provide, an, international, forum, for, researchers, and, industry, practitioners, to, share, their, new, ideas, ,, ...) Daegu [Call for Papers, PRICAI 2010 Special Session on Methods for the (Semi-)automatic, Creation of Language Resources for Asian Languages, Aug 30 - Sept 2, 2010, Daegu, Korea, Conference website:, http://www.pricai2010.org/, Special session on the (Semi-)automatic Creation of Language, Resources for Asian Languages:, http://faculty.washington.edu/fxia/pricai2010/, Other special sessions:, http://www.pricai2010.org/program/sub_02_6.asp, 1, Conference Description, The Eleventh Pacific Rim International Conference on Artificial Intelligence (PRICAI-10) will provide an international forum for researchers and industry practitioners to share their new ideas, original research results and practical development experiences which concentrate on AI technologies and their applications in areas of social and economic importance for countries in the Pacific Rim., PRICAI2010 will be held at the Novetel Hotel in Daegu, Daegu is the fourth largest city in South Korea and has been the center of history, administration, education, and culture, The city has many cultural heritages and tourist attractions to well display Korean culture as well as complexes, department stores and large shopping malls., 2, Special session on (Semi-)automatic Creation of Language, Resources for Asian Languages, As part of the conference, we are organizing a special session on, (Semi-)automatic Creation of Language Resources for Asian Languages., Language resources (e.g., parallel/comparable corpora,, treebanks/Propbank/discourse treebanks, WordNet, FrameNet,, and dictionaries) are invaluable for natural language processing., In the past two decades, there have been much effort in creating, such resources; however, many of the studies rely on manual annotation,, which is labor extensive and expensive., This special session aims to provide an opportunity for researchers, to share their ideas and efforts in automating the process of creating, language resources for Asian languages, Topics of interest include but, are not limited to:, * Automatic extraction of bilingual/comparable corpora from the Web, * Automatic compilation of bilingual/multi-lingual dictionaries, * (Semi-)automatic annotation of treebanks, * (Semi-)automatic creation of WordNet and FrameNet for a new language, * Automatic merging of language resources with different annotation, schemes and/or from different sources, 3, Important dates:, * Submission deadline: March 31, 2010, 23:59 Pacific standard time (PST), * Notification: May 15, 2010, * Camera-ready deadline: May 31, 2010, * Conference date: Aug 30 - Sept 2, 2010, 4, Submission information, The papers should report original and unpublished research on topics of, interest for the special session, Accepted papers are expected to be presented, at the conference, and will be published in the conference proceedings, They, should emphasize obtained results rather than intended work, and should, indicate clearly the state of completion of the reported results., Papers for special sessions should be prepared in accordance with the, PRICAI 2010 requirements (http://sc.snu.ac.kr/PRICAI10/PRICAI10Prep.html),, and submitted through the PRICAI 2010 submission website, (http://sc.snu.ac.kr/PRICAI10/PRICAI10Sub.html)., 5, Organizers:, Special session chair and contact:, Fei Xia (University of Washington, USA), fxia@uw.edu, Program committee:, * Key-Sun Choi (KAIST, Korea), * Long Jiang (Microsoft China), * Sadao Kurohashi (Kyoto Univ, Japan), * Olivia Kwong (City Univ of Hong Kong, Hong Kong), * Yuji Matsumoto (Nara Institute of Science and Technology, Japan), * Maosong Sun (Tsinghua Univ, China), * Tiejun Zhao (Harbin Institute of Technology, China), * Guodong Zhou (Soochow University, China), * Chengqing Zong (Chinese Academy of Sciences, China)] PRICAI 2010 Special Session on Methods for the (Semi-)automatic {'March 31, 2010': ' * submission deadline: march 31, 2010, 23:59 pacific standard time (pst)', 'May 15, 2010': ' * notification: may 15, 2010', 'May 31, 2010': ' * camera-ready deadline: may 31, 2010', '2, 2010': ' * conference date: aug 30 - sept 2, 2010'}
51 Reliable and Autonomous Computational Science Conference Atlanta, GA, USA A CALL FOR PAPERS\nReliable and Autonomous Computational Science Conference\nIn Atlanta, Georgia, USA, on the 28th October 2010\n\nTheme & Goal\n Increasing size and complexity of software and hardware systems makes it harder to ensure their reliability. At the same time, the issues of autonomous computing become more critical as we more and more rely on software systems in our daily life. Such complexity is getting even more critical with the ubiquitous computing of embedded devices and other pervasive systems. These trends make it necessary to support software engineers with a set of techniques and tools for developing reliable and autonomous software. To cope with the growing complexity, RACS focuses on is a place for highly original ideas about reliable and autonomous software. The purpose of the RACS 2010 is to bring together researchers from diverse communities who are interested in building reliable and autonomous computing technologies more robust, and to discuss and exchange experimental or theoretical results, novel design, work-in-progress, experience, case study, and trend-setting ideas.\n\n\nPapers\n Authors are invited to submit original papers in all areas of reliable software and autonomous computing. All papers will be fully refereed and undergo a blind review process by at least three referees. All accepted papers should be submitted in ACM 2-column camera-ready format for publication in the conference proceedings. The final version of the paper should not be more than 6 pages long; 4 extra pages will be allowed at additional cost. Selected papers will be recommended for publication in an International Journal as a special RACS 2010 section.\n\n\nWokshop Proposal\n In conjunction with the RACS 2010 conference, a number of workshops will be organized. Workshop proposals which should include "Title of the workshop", "Short bio of organizers", "A tentative list of TPC", and " A tentative website address" are to be sent to the workshop Chair(stjhang@suwon.ac.kr) by March 10, 2010.\n\n\nImportant Dates\n - May. 31, 2010 Paper Submission\n - Jun. 31, 2010 Author Notification\n - Aug. 31, 2010 Camera-Ready Copy (A, CALL, FOR, PAPERS, \n, Reliable, and, Autonomous, Computational, Science, Conference, \n, In, Atlanta, ,, Georgia, ,, USA, ,, on, the, 28th, October, 2010, \n\n, Theme, &, Goal, \n , Increasing, size, and, complexity, of, software, and, hardware, systems, makes, it, harder, to, ensure, their, reliability, ., At, the, same, time, ,, the, issues, of, autonomous, computing, become, more, critical, as, we, more, and, more, rely, on, software, systems, in, our, daily, life, ., Such, complexity, is, getting, even, more, critical, with, the, ubiquitous, computing, of, embedded, devices, and, other, pervasive, systems, ., These, trends, make, it, necessary, to, support, software, ...) Atlanta [A CALL FOR PAPERS, Reliable and Autonomous Computational Science Conference, In Atlanta, Georgia, USA, on the 28th October 2010, Theme & Goal, Increasing size and complexity of software and hardware systems makes it harder to ensure their reliability, At the same time, the issues of autonomous computing become more critical as we more and more rely on software systems in our daily life, Such complexity is getting even more critical with the ubiquitous computing of embedded devices and other pervasive systems, These trends make it necessary to support software engineers with a set of techniques and tools for developing reliable and autonomous software, To cope with the growing complexity, RACS focuses on is a place for highly original ideas about reliable and autonomous software, The purpose of the RACS 2010 is to bring together researchers from diverse communities who are interested in building reliable and autonomous computing technologies more robust, and to discuss and exchange experimental or theoretical results, novel design, work-in-progress, experience, case study, and trend-setting ideas., Papers, Authors are invited to submit original papers in all areas of reliable software and autonomous computing, All papers will be fully refereed and undergo a blind review process by at least three referees, All accepted papers should be submitted in ACM 2-column camera-ready format for publication in the conference proceedings, The final version of the paper should not be more than 6 pages long; 4 extra pages will be allowed at additional cost, Selected papers will be recommended for publication in an International Journal as a special RACS 2010 section., Wokshop Proposal, In conjunction with the RACS 2010 conference, a number of workshops will be organized, Workshop proposals which should include "Title of the workshop", "Short bio of organizers", "A tentative list of TPC", and " A tentative website address" are to be sent to the workshop Chair(stjhang@suwon.ac.kr) by March 10, 2010., Important Dates, - May, 31, 2010 Paper Submission, - Jun, 31, 2010 Author Notification, - Aug, 31, 2010 Camera-Ready Copy] Reliable and Autonomous Computational Science Conference {'the 28th October 2010': 'in atlanta, georgia, usa, on the 28th october 2010', 'March 10, 2010': 'workshop proposals which should include "title of the workshop", "short bio of organizers", "a tentative list of tpc", and " a tentative website address" are to be sent to the workshop chair(stjhang@suwon.ac.kr) by march 10, 2010.'}
52 Fourth Symposium on Semantic Mining in Biomedicine Hinxton, Cambridgeshire, UK CALL FOR PAPERS\nThe Fourth Symposium on Semantic Mining in Biomedicine\nwill be held at the European Bioinformatics Institute (EBI) in\nHinxton, Cambridgeshire, UK on October 25th and 26th, 2010.\n\nSMBM 2010 aims to bring together researchers from text and data mining\nin biomedicine, medical, bio- and chemoinformatics, and researchers\nfrom biomedical ontology design and engineering. SMBM 2010 is the\nfollow-up event of SMBM 2005 (EBI, U.K.), SMBM 2006 (University of\nJena, Germany) and SMBM 2008 (University of Turku, Finland).\n\nA parallel event (LBM: The International Symposium on Languages in\nBiology and Medicine) has been held in 2005 (KAIST, Daejeon, South\nKorea), 2007 (Matrix, Biopolis, Singapore) and 2009 (Jeju Island,\nSouth Korea).\n\nThe biomedical research community eagerly awaits the full integration\nof very large text collections, biological databases, ontologies and\nterminological resources. However, many challenges have yet to be met\nto achieve this ambitious goal. Significant advances have been made\nand many working systems for tasks ranging from entity recognition and\nsimple relation extraction to structured event extraction have been\ndeployed. Where do we stand and how do we advance toward fully\nintegrated systems combining the different tools and data sources?\n\nWe are inviting papers from a full range of topics (see below),\nemphasizing in particular work on methods deployed in a\nproduction-like research environment, the integration of text with\ndomain resources such as micro-array data and ontological resources\nsuch as GO, UMLS etc. We also welcome contributions from across the\nbiomedical domains, including genomics, translational medicine,\nclinical practice, and public health.\n\nFor detailed up-to-date information, please consult the web site of the\nconference: http://www.smbm.eu/\n\nTopics of interest include (but are not limited to):\n\n * Text mining, information extraction, and information retrieval\n * Terminology and ontology development for biomedical information\n systems\n * Evaluation techniques and standards for text mining solutions\n * Integration of text and data mining in the biomedical domain\n * Annotation schemes for biomedical corpora\n * Text mining for resource building, e.g. ontologies, and resource\n enrichment, e.g., biomedical databases\n * Representation and discovery of biomedical domain knowledge\n * Privacy/trust, e.g in processing of patient records\n * Image/caption processing in relation to content extraction\n * domain-specific reasoning processes, e.g., to infer\n non-explicit information, validation (trust-worthiness,\n believability, safety) of extracted information\n * (Semantic) Web mining of biomedical information\n\nAll accepted papers will be published in the conference proceedings\nthat will be available online. We invite both full and short papers,\nwhere full papers will be given an oral presentation and short papers\npresented as posters. Selected papers will be invited to submit an\nextended version for publication in the Journal of Biomedical\nSemantics (JBMS).\n\nSubmissions should follow the instructions for JBMS authors, with a\nlimit of eight (8) pages for full papers and four (4) pages for short\npapers (plus one optional page for references). Manuscripts will be\nsubmitted electronically as PDF files. Reviewing will be double-blind,\nand submissions should therefore NOT contain author names or other\nobviously identifying information.\n\nImportant dates\n\nJuly 30, 2010 Paper submission deadline\nAugust 30, 2010 Notification of acceptance\nSeptember 24, 2010 Camera-ready deadline\nOctober 25-26, 2010 Conference\n\nScientific chairs\nNigel Collier (National Institute of Informatics, Japan)\nUdo Hahn (Jena University, Language & Information Engineering\nLab, Germany)\n\nOrganizing chairs\nDietrich Rebholz-Schuhmann (European Bioinformatics Institute, UK)\nFabio Rinaldi (University of Zurich, Switzerland)\nSampo Pyysalo (University of Tokyo, Japan)\n\nPC Committee\n\nAdeline Nazarenko (Universite Paris-Nord, France)\nAdrian Shephard (Birkbeck University of London, UK)\nAi Kawazoe (Tsuda college, Japan)\nAlfonso Valencia (CNIO, Spain)\nAnita Burgun-Parenthoine (University of Rennes, France)\nChun-Nan Hsu (Academia Sinica, Taiwan)\nDina Demner-Fushman (National Library of Medicine, USA)\nFilip Ginter (University of Turku, Finland)\nFlorian Leitner (CNIO, Spain)\nGerold Schneider (University of Zurich, Switzerland)\nGoran Nenadic (University of Manchester, UK)\nGwan-Su Yi (KAIST, South Korea)\nHagit Shatkay (Queen's University, Canada)\nHongfang Liu (Georgetown University Medical Center, USA)\nHyunju Lee (GIST, South Korea)\nJaewoo Kang (Korea University, South Korea)\nJin-Dong Kim (University of Tokyo, Japan)\nJong C. Park (KAIST, South Korea)\nJung-Jae Kim (Nanyang Technological University, Singapore)\nJun'ichi Tsujii (University of Tokyo, Japan and NaCTeM, UK)\nKarin Verspoor (University of Colorado, USA)\nKevin Cohen (University of Colorado, USA)\nMartin Krallinger (CNIO, Spain)\nMartin Romacker (Novartis Pharma AG, Switzerland)\nMichael Krauthammer (Yale University School of Medicine, USA)\nOlivier Bodenreider (National Library of Medicine, USA)\nPatrick Lambrix (University of Tokyo, Japan) (CALL, FOR, PAPERS, \n, The, Fourth, Symposium, on, Semantic, Mining, in, Biomedicine, \n, will, be, held, at, the, European, Bioinformatics, Institute, (, EBI, ), in, \n, Biomedicine [CALL FOR PAPERS, The Fourth Symposium on Semantic Mining in Biomedicine, will be held at the European Bioinformatics Institute (EBI) in, Hinxton, Cambridgeshire, UK on October 25th and 26th, 2010., SMBM 2010 aims to bring together researchers from text and data mining, in biomedicine, medical, bio- and chemoinformatics, and researchers, from biomedical ontology design and engineering, SMBM 2010 is the, follow-up event of SMBM 2005 (EBI, U.K.), SMBM 2006 (University of, Jena, Germany) and SMBM 2008 (University of Turku, Finland)., A parallel event (LBM: The International Symposium on Languages in, Biology and Medicine) has been held in 2005 (KAIST, Daejeon, South, Korea), 2007 (Matrix, Biopolis, Singapore) and 2009 (Jeju Island,, South Korea)., The biomedical research community eagerly awaits the full integration, of very large text collections, biological databases, ontologies and, terminological resources, However, many challenges have yet to be met, to achieve this ambitious goal, Significant advances have been made, and many working systems for tasks ranging from entity recognition and, simple relation extraction to structured event extraction have been, deployed, Where do we stand and how do we advance toward fully, integrated systems combining the different tools and data sources?, We are inviting papers from a full range of topics (see below),, emphasizing in particular work on methods deployed in a, production-like research environment, the integration of text with, domain resources such as micro-array data and ontological resources, such as GO, UMLS etc, We also welcome contributions from across the, biomedical domains, including genomics, translational medicine,, clinical practice, and public health., For detailed up-to-date information, please consult the web site of the, conference: http://www.smbm.eu/, Topics of interest include (but are not limited to):, * Text mining, information extraction, and information retrieval, * Terminology and ontology development for biomedical information, systems, * Evaluation techniques and standards for text mining solutions, * Integration of text and data mining in the biomedical domain, * Annotation schemes for biomedical corpora, * Text mining for resource building, e.g, ontologies, and resource, enrichment, e.g., biomedical databases, * Representation and discovery of biomedical domain knowledge, * Privacy/trust, e.g in processing of patient records, * Image/caption processing in relation to content extraction, * domain-specific reasoning processes, e.g., to infer, non-explicit information, validation (trust-worthiness,, believability, safety) of extracted information, * (Semantic) Web mining of biomedical information, All accepted papers will be published in the conference proceedings, that will be available online, We invite both full and short papers,, where full papers will be given an oral presentation and short papers, presented as posters, Selected papers will be invited to submit an, extended version for publication in the Journal of Biomedical, Semantics (JBMS)., Submissions should follow the instructions for JBMS authors, with a, limit of eight (8) pages for full papers and four (4) pages for short, papers (plus one optional page for references), Manuscripts will be, submitted electronically as PDF files, Reviewing will be double-blind,, and submissions should therefore NOT contain author names or other, obviously identifying information., Important dates, July 30, 2010 Paper submission deadline, August 30, 2010 Notification of acceptance, September 24, 2010 Camera-ready deadline, October 25-26, 2010 Conference, Scientific chairs, Nigel Collier (National Institute of Informatics, Japan), Udo Hahn (Jena University, Language & Information Engineering, Lab, Germany), Organizing chairs, Dietrich Rebholz-Schuhmann (European Bioinformatics Institute, UK), Fabio Rinaldi (University of Zurich, Switzerland), Sampo Pyysalo (University of Tokyo, Japan), PC Committee, Adeline Nazarenko (Universite Paris-Nord, France), Adrian Shephard (Birkbeck University of London, UK), Ai Kawazoe
