53 International Symposium on Wireless Pervasive Computing ISWPC 2010 Modena, Italy CALL FOR PAPERS\r\n\r\n\r\n International Symposium on Wireless Pervasive Computing\r\n ISWPC 2010\r\n\r\n\r\n May 5-7, 2010 - Modena, Italy\r\n \r\n http://www.iswpc.org/2010/\r\n \r\n *Keynote speakers*\r\n Muriel Medard, MIT, USA, IEEE Fellow\r\n Keith Ross, New York University, USA, IEEE Fellow\r\n\r\n\r\n*********************************************************\r\n\r\nISWPC is a lively annual international conference, organized with the goal of bringing together researchers, scientists and engineers from academia and industry working in the area of advanced wireless communications and networking. As for its previous editions, the IEEE technical sponsorship has been requested and the event committee is confident to obtain it.\r\n\r\nCall For Papers\r\nProspective authors are invited to submit original technical papers for presentation at the conference via EDAS. The maximum length of each manuscript is six pages.\r\nContributions are sought in (but not limited to) the following areas:\r\n\r\n- Wireless peer-to-peer\r\n- Wireless mesh networks\r\n- Inter and intra vehicular communications\r\n- Wireless sensor networks\r\n- Green pervasive computing\r\n- Advanced localization and tracking techniques\r\n- Wireless video and multimedia\r\n- Pervasive computing applications\r\n- QoE in wireless systems\r\n- Wireless security\r\n- Cross-layer design\r\n- Wireless routing\r\n- Wireless network coding\r\n- Ad-hoc networks\r\n- Relay assisted and cooperative communications\r\n- Cognitive radio\r\n- UWB\r\n- Propagation and channel characterization\r\n- MIMO and multi-antenna communications\r\n- Smart antennas\r\n- CDMA, TDMA and FDMA air interface\r\n- Wireless access techniques\r\n- WPANs and WLANs\r\n- OFDM, OFDMA\r\n- Wi-MaX\r\n- UMTS and LTE\r\n- Game theory in wireless networks\r\n- Emergency networks\r\n\r\nVenue\r\nThe 2010 edition of ISWPC will take place in Modena, Italy. Modena is a historical city in northern Italy, renowned for its glorious past, witnessed by the medieval cathedral and the civic tower, declared Unesco World Heritage. A major city highlight is the magnificent 17th century Estense duke palace, headquarter of the oldest European military academy, where the conference will be located. Future is running fast in Modena, home in the present days of the only factory where Ferrari, the dream car known worldwide, is manufactured. Tradition and cutting edge innovation daily blend in Modena, and invite you to experience it, being part of the 2010 ISWPC event.\r\n\r\n\r\nIMPORTANT DATES:\r\nPaper submission hard deadline: January 25, 2010\r\nAcceptance notification: March 1, 2010\r\nFinal camera ready copy: March 25, 2010\r\n\r\nGeneral Chair\r\nMaria Luisa Merani, University of Modena and Reggio Emilia, Italy\r\n\r\nTechnical chair\r\nMario Gerla, UCLA, USA\r\n\r\nTechnical co-chairs\r\nEkram Hossain, University of Manitoba, Canada Ilenia Tinnirello, University of Palermo, Italy\r\n\r\nPanel chair\r\nGiuseppe Bianchi, University of Roma Tor Vergata, Italy\r\n\r\nTutorial chair\r\nRajeev Shorey, NIIT University, India\r\n\r\nFinance chair\r\nGiovanni Giambene, University of Siena, Italy\r\n\r\nPublication chair\r\nFabrizio Pancaldi, University of Modena and Reggio Emilia, Italy\r\n\r\nWeb chair\r\nDaniela Saladino, University of Modena and Reggio Emilia, Italy (CALL, FOR, PAPERS, \r\n\r\n\r\n , International, Symposium, on, Wireless, Pervasive, Computing, \r\n , ISWPC, 2010, \r\n\r\n\r\n , May, 5, -, 7, ,, 2010, -, Modena, ,, Italy, \r\n \r\n , http://www.iswpc.org/2010/, \r\n \r\n , *, Keynote, speakers, *, \r\n , Muriel, Medard, ,, MIT, ,, USA, ,, IEEE, Fellow, \r\n , Keith, Ross, ,, New, York, University, ,, USA, ,, IEEE, Fellow, \r\n\r\n\r\n, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, ...) USA [CALL FOR PAPERS, International Symposium on Wireless Pervasive Computing, ISWPC 2010, May 5-7, 2010 - Modena, Italy, , http://www.iswpc.org/2010/, , *Keynote speakers*, Muriel Medard, MIT, USA, IEEE Fellow, Keith Ross, New York University, USA, IEEE Fellow, *********************************************************, ISWPC is a lively annual international conference, organized with the goal of bringing together researchers, scientists and engineers from academia and industry working in the area of advanced wireless communications and networking, As for its previous editions, the IEEE technical sponsorship has been requested and the event committee is confident to obtain it., Call For Papers, Prospective authors are invited to submit original technical papers for presentation at the conference via EDAS, The maximum length of each manuscript is six pages., Contributions are sought in (but not limited to) the following areas:, - Wireless peer-to-peer, - Wireless mesh networks, - Inter and intra vehicular communications, - Wireless sensor networks, - Green pervasive computing, - Advanced localization and tracking techniques, - Wireless video and multimedia, - Pervasive computing applications, - QoE in wireless systems, - Wireless security, - Cross-layer design, - Wireless routing, - Wireless network coding, - Ad-hoc networks, - Relay assisted and cooperative communications, - Cognitive radio, - UWB, - Propagation and channel characterization, - MIMO and multi-antenna communications, - Smart antennas, - CDMA, TDMA and FDMA air interface, - Wireless access techniques, - WPANs and WLANs, - OFDM, OFDMA, - Wi-MaX, - UMTS and LTE, - Game theory in wireless networks, - Emergency networks, Venue, The 2010 edition of ISWPC will take place in Modena, Italy, Modena is a historical city in northern Italy, renowned for its glorious past, witnessed by the medieval cathedral and the civic tower, declared Unesco World Heritage, A major city highlight is the magnificent 17th century Estense duke palace, headquarter of the oldest European military academy, where the conference will be located, Future is running fast in Modena, home in the present days of the only factory where Ferrari, the dream car known worldwide, is manufactured, Tradition and cutting edge innovation daily blend in Modena, and invite you to experience it, being part of the 2010 ISWPC event., IMPORTANT DATES:, Paper submission hard deadline: January 25, 2010, Acceptance notification: March 1, 2010, Final camera ready copy: March 25, 2010, General Chair, Maria Luisa Merani, University of Modena and Reggio Emilia, Italy, Technical chair, Mario Gerla, UCLA, USA, Technical co-chairs, Ekram Hossain, University of Manitoba, Canada Ilenia Tinnirello, University of Palermo, Italy, Panel chair, Giuseppe Bianchi, University of Roma Tor Vergata, Italy, Tutorial chair, Rajeev Shorey, NIIT University, India, Finance chair, Giovanni Giambene, University of Siena, Italy, Publication chair, Fabrizio Pancaldi, University of Modena and Reggio Emilia, Italy, Web chair, Daniela Saladino, University of Modena and Reggio Emilia, Italy] International Symposium on Wireless Pervasive Computing {'January 25, 2010': 'paper submission hard deadline: january 25, 2010', 'March 1, 2010': 'acceptance notification: march 1, 2010', 'March 25, 2010': 'final camera ready copy: march 25, 2010'}
54 Evaluation of Information Filtering Systems in a Competitive Intelligence Framework Valletta, Malta [Apologies for multiple postings]\nCALL FOR PAPERS\n\nEvaluation of Information Filtering Systems in a Competitive Intelligence Framework Workshop\nWorkshop date: 22 May 2010\nHeld in conjunction with LREC 2010\n\nValetta, Malta\n\nAims\n\nThe constant growth of publicly available information has entailed a\nconsequently similar growth in the research areas devoted to the\nautomated organization of this information. In particular, Information\nFiltering systems have been developed to tackle the issues of many\napplications of business intelligence, from mail categorization to news\nrouting and technology watch. However, the theoretically challenging\nmodels of these systems have seldom been evaluated in real usage\ncontext. Indeed, standard evaluation benchmarks usually introduce\nartefacts that simplify the task. For instance, in the context of\ncompetitive intelligence, systems must filter documents without any\nglobal information on a ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂcollectionÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ but can use feedback from the user,\nand must be efficient enough to deal with a real-time document stream.\nFurthermore, with the increase of globalized access and availability of\nthe information, sources may be found in many languages, and the\nmultilinguality issue must also be considered. TREC Adaptive Filtering\nTrack and INFILE track at CLEF for multilingual information filtering\nhave tried to propose evaluation frameworks closer to the usage.\n\nThe goal of this workshop is to study different aspects of Information\nFiltering Evaluation and to bring together researchers from the\ncommunity of Information Filtering to develop new evaluation frameworks\nand confront current models with these new evaluation models.\nSubmissions are expected to propose new insights on evaluation\nmethodologies and resources for Information Filtering or to present\nInformation Filtering models that will meet the requirements of a real\nusage evaluation (in particular, researchers that submit papers\npresenting Information Filtering Models are encouraged to evaluate their\nmodel using an existing benchmark such as the INFILE benchmark,\navailable at http://www.infile.org).\n\nTopics\n\nBoth theoretical and practical research papers are welcome from both\nresearch and industrial communities addressing the main workshop theme,\nin any aspect including:\n- Resources and methodologies for Evaluation of Information Filtering\nSystems in real usage context\n- New models for Information Filtering, that tackle one or several\nissues of this kind of evaluation: efficiency, adaptability,\nmultilinguality, etc.\n- Results of the Evaluation of Information Filtering Systems\n- User studies of the use of Information Filtering Systems in\nCompetitive Intelligence\n\nSubmission information\n\nPapers will be submitted to the workshop via the START LREC Conference\nManager, under https://www.softconf.com/lrec2010/InFile2010/\nAuthors should submit a PDF file of no more than 10 pages, following the\nLREC conference formatting details. Papers will be reviewed by three\nmembers of the Program Committee,\nAccepted papers will be published in the workshop Proceedings.\nWhen submitting a paper from the START page, authors will be asked to\nprovide essential information about resources (in a broad sense, i.e.\nalso technologies, standards, evaluation kits, etc.) that have been used\nfor the work described in the paper or are a new result of your research.\nFor further information on this new initiative, please refer to\nhttp://www.lrec-conf.org/lrec2010/?LREC2010-Map-of-Language-Resources.\n\nImportant dates\n\nPaper submission deadline 28 February 2010\nNotification of acceptance 22 March 2010\nFinal version of accepted paper 4 April 2010\nWorkshop half-day 22 May 2010\n\nWorkshop Organizers\n\nRomaric Malta [[Apologies for multiple postings], CALL FOR PAPERS, Evaluation of Information Filtering Systems in a Competitive Intelligence Framework Workshop, Workshop date: 22 May 2010, Held in conjunction with LREC 2010, Valetta, Malta, Aims, The constant growth of publicly available information has entailed a, consequently similar growth in the research areas devoted to the, automated organization of this information, In particular, Information, Filtering systems have been developed to tackle the issues of many, applications of business intelligence, from mail categorization to news, routing and technology watch, However, the theoretically challenging, models of these systems have seldom been evaluated in real usage, context, Indeed, standard evaluation benchmarks usually introduce, artefacts that simplify the task, For instance, in the context of, competitive intelligence, systems must filter documents without any, global information on a ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ, ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂcollectionÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ but can use feedback from the user,, and must be efficient enough to deal with a real-time document stream., Furthermore, with the increase of globalized access and availability of, the information, sources may be found in many languages, and the, multilinguality issue must also be considered, TREC Adaptive Filtering, Track and INFILE track at CLEF for multilingual information filtering, have tried to propose evaluation frameworks closer to the usage., The goal of this workshop is to study different aspects of Information, Filtering Evaluation and to bring together researchers from the, community of Information Filtering to develop new evaluation frameworks, and confront current models with these new evaluation models., Submissions are expected to propose new insights on evaluation, methodologies and resources for Information Filtering or to present, Information Filtering models that will meet the requirements of a real, usage evaluation (in particular, researchers that submit papers, presenting Information Filtering Models are encouraged to evaluate their, model using an existing benchmark such as the INFILE benchmark,, available at http://www.infile.org)., Topics, Both theoretical and practical research papers are welcome from both, research and industrial communities addressing the main workshop theme,, in any aspect including:, - Resources and methodologies for Evaluation of Information Filtering, Systems in real usage context, - New models for Information Filtering, that tackle one or several, issues of this kind of evaluation: efficiency, adaptability,, multilinguality, etc., - Results of the Evaluation of Information Filtering Systems, - User studies of the use of Information Filtering Systems in, Competitive Intelligence, Submission information, Papers will be submitted to the workshop via the START LREC Conference, Manager, under https://www.softconf.com/lrec2010/InFile2010/, Authors should submit a PDF file of no more than 10 pages, following the, LREC conference formatting details, Papers will be reviewed by three, members of the Program Committee,, Accepted papers will be published in the workshop Proceedings., When submitting a paper from the START page, authors will be asked to, provide essential information about resources (in a broad sense, i.e., also technologies, standards, evaluation kits, etc.) that have been used, for the work described in the paper or are a new result of your research., For further information on this new initiative, please refer to, http://www.lrec-conf.org/lrec2010/?LREC2010-Map-of-Language-Resources., Important dates, Paper submission deadline 28 February 2010, Notification of acceptance 22 March 2010, Final version of accepted paper 4 April 2010, Workshop half-day 22 May 2010, Workshop Organizers, Romaric UniversitÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ© Lille 3, -- , --------------------------------------------------------------, Djamel MOSTEFA mostefa@elda.org, Language Resources Production and Evaluation, ELDA - Evaluations and Language resources Distribution Agency, 55-57, rue Brillat Savarin Tel : +33 1 43 13 33 33, ...] Evaluation of Information Filtering Systems in a Competitive Intelligence Framework Workshop {'May 2010': 'workshop half-day 22 may 2010', '28 February 2010': 'paper submission deadline 28 february 2010', '22 March 2010': 'notification of acceptance 22 march 2010', '4 April 2010': 'final version of accepted paper 4 april 2010'}
55 35th International Symposium on Mathematical Foundations of Computer Science Brno, Czech Republic 35th International Symposium on Mathematical Foundations of Computer Science\n\nMFCS Symposia\n\nThe series of MFCS symposia, organized in rotation by Poland, Slovakia, and the Czech Republic since 1972, has a long and well-established tradition. The symposia encourage high-quality research in all branches of theoretical computer science. Their broad scope provides an opportunity to bring together researchers who do not usually meet at specialized conferences. Quality papers presenting original research on theoretical aspects of computer science are solicited.\n\nThe 35th International Symposiums on Mathematical Foundations of Computer Science (MFCS 2010) is organized in parallel with the 19th EACSL Annual Conferences on Computer Science Logic (CSL 2010) at the same place. There will be common plenary sessions and social events, but the technical program and the proceedings are prepared independently.\n\nThe federated MFCS & CSL 2010 conference is accompanied by several satellite workshops on more specialized topics.\n\nWORKSHOP DATES: 23 August 2010 - 27 August 2010\n\nPrincipal topics of interest\n\nalgorithmic game theory, algorithmic learning theory, algorithms and data structures (incl. sequential, parallel, distributed, approximation, graph, network, on-line, optimization), automata, grammars and formal languages, bioinformatics, complexity (structural and computational), computational geometry, computer-assisted reasoning, concurrency theory, cryptography and security, databases and knowledge-based systems, formal specifications and program development, foundations of computing, logic in computer science, mobile computing, models of computation, networks (incl. wireless, sensor, ad-hoc), parallel and distributed computing, quantum computing, semantics and verification of programs, theoretical issues in artificial intelligence.\n\n\nProgramme Committee\n\nLuca Aceto (Reykjavik), JiÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¦ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ­ AdÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¡mek (Braunschweig), Christel Baier (Dresden), Patricia Bouyer-Decitre (Cachan), Sergio Cabello (Ljubljana), Witold Charatonik (Wroclaw), Jurek Czyzowicz (Quebec), Volker Diekert (Stuttgart), Rod Downey Lecture Notes style). If the authors believe that more details are essential to substantiate the main claims, they may include a clearly marked appendix that will be read at the discretion of the program committee. Simultaneous submissions of papers to any other conference with published proceedings or submitting previously published papers is not allowed. Only electronic submissions in the PDF format are accepted. Detailed information about the submission procedure will be available on the conference web page in due time. The proceedings will be published in Lecture Notes in Computer Science by Springer-Verlag.\n\n\nDeadlines\n\nAbstract submission: April 10, 2010\nFull paper submission: April 15, 2010\nNotification: May 28, 2010\nFinal version: June 14, 2010\n\n\nContact\n\n * Questions about the MFCS 2010 program should be sent to Petr (MFCS 2010 PC chairs).\n * General questions regarding organization, registration, accomodation, etc., should be sent to the MFCS & CSL 2010 organizing committee (mfcsl2010@fi.muni.cz) (35th, International, Symposium, on, Mathematical, Foundations, of, Computer, Science, \n\n, MFCS, Symposia, \n\n, The, series, of, MFCS, symposia, ,, organized, in, rotation, by, Poland, ,, Slovakia, ,, and, the, Czech, Republic, since, 1972, ,, has, a, long, and, well, -, established, tradition, ., The, symposia, encourage, high, -, quality, research, in, all, branches, of, theoretical, computer, science, ., Their, broad, scope, provides, an, opportunity, to, bring, together, researchers, who, do, not, usually, meet, at, specialized, conferences, ., Quality, papers, presenting, original, research, on, theoretical, aspects, of, computer, science, are, solicited, ., \n\n, The, 35th, International, Symposiums, on, Mathematical, Foundations, of, ...) Poland [35th International Symposium on Mathematical Foundations of Computer Science, MFCS Symposia, The series of MFCS symposia, organized in rotation by Poland, Slovakia, and the Czech Republic since 1972, has a long and well-established tradition, The symposia encourage high-quality research in all branches of theoretical computer science, Their broad scope provides an opportunity to bring together researchers who do not usually meet at specialized conferences, Quality papers presenting original research on theoretical aspects of computer science are solicited., The 35th International Symposiums on Mathematical Foundations of Computer Science (MFCS 2010) is organized in parallel with the 19th EACSL Annual Conferences on Computer Science Logic (CSL 2010) at the same place, There will be common plenary sessions and social events, but the technical program and the proceedings are prepared independently., The federated MFCS & CSL 2010 conference is accompanied by several satellite workshops on more specialized topics., WORKSHOP DATES: 23 August 2010 - 27 August 2010, Principal topics of interest, algorithmic game theory, algorithmic learning theory, algorithms and data structures (incl, sequential, parallel, distributed, approximation, graph, network, on-line, optimization), automata, grammars and formal languages, bioinformatics, complexity (structural and computational), computational geometry, computer-assisted reasoning, concurrency theory, cryptography and security, databases and knowledge-based systems, formal specifications and program development, foundations of computing, logic in computer science, mobile computing, models of computation, networks (incl, wireless, sensor, ad-hoc), parallel and distributed computing, quantum computing, semantics and verification of programs, theoretical issues in artificial intelligence., Programme Committee, Luca Aceto (Reykjavik), ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¦ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ tefankoviÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ Lecture Notes style), If the authors believe that more details are essential to substantiate the main claims, they may include a clearly marked appendix that will be read at the discretion of the program committee, Simultaneous submissions of papers to any other conference with published proceedings or submitting previously published papers is not allowed, Only electronic submissions in the PDF format are accepted, Detailed information about the submission procedure will be available on the conference web page in due time, The proceedings will be published in Lecture Notes in Computer International Symposium on Mathematical Foundations of Computer Science {'April 10, 2010': 'abstract submission: april 10, 2010', 'April 15, 2010': 'full paper submission: april 15, 2010', 'May 28, 56 The First IEEE Biomedical Circuits and Systems Conference Paphos, Cyprus The First IEEE Biomedical Circuits and Systems Conference\n\nThe recent years have witnessed an explosion of research activities in the areas of life sciences, physical sciences and engineering with application to medical problems. Such activities require inter-disciplinary collaborations among scientists, engineers, medical researchers, and practitioners to solve complex real world problems. This conference is the premier forum where members of the IEEE Circuits & Systems Society present results and innovative solutions for today's health problems at frontiers of Biomedical Engineering. "Smart Hybrid Biosystems" has been chosen as the theme for this years conference.\n\nThe conference is multidisciplinary in nature comprising an eclectic mix of insightful tutorials, and technical sessions. The organization and planning of the conference enables members of our communities to broaden their knowledge in emerging areas of research at the interface of the life sciences and the circuits and systems engineering discipline.\n\nThe multidisciplinary approach of this event will enable the CAS community to benefit from a mix of tutorials and technical sessions covering a wide range of topics such as:\n \n\n 1. Bioelectronics / Biomedical instrumentations\n 2. Bioinformatics\n 3. Genomics and Proteomics\n 4. Implantable and wearable electronics\n 5. Neuromorphic Engineering\n 6. Biomedical aids to the disabled\n 7. Low power micro-and nanoelectronics\n 8. Smart sensors / Body Sensor Network / Biotechnology sensor circuits\n 9. Mixed-mode system-on-chip\n 10. Micropower imaging technology / Biosignal processing\n 11. Wireless technology in medicine / Telecare systems\n 12. BioMEMS\n 13. Gene circuits and molecular circuits\n 14. Lab-on-chip\n 15. Bio-nanotechnology\n 16. System biology\n 17. Organic Semiconductors\n 18. Electronics for brain science\n 19. Biomedical Engineering technology\n 20. Healthcare: Information technology\n\n \n\nThis event will give to researchers in this area a unique opportunity to broaden their insight into the new and developing area of medical technologies and to create inter-disciplinary bonding and come up with innovative solutions that todays healthcare problems and challenges require.\n\nThe complete 4-page paper (in standard IEEE double-column format), including title, authors' names, affiliations and e-mail addresses, as well as a short abstract are requested. Papers must be submitted electronically in PDF format through www.biocas2010.org. Only electronic submissions will be accepted.\n\nA special issue consisting of the best presented papers will be published in the IEEE Transactions on Biomedical Circuits and Systems (TBCAS).\n\nAuthors' Schedule:\nDeadline for submission of papers:18th June, 2010\nNotification of paper acceptance: 27th August, 2010\nFinal submission: 17th September, 2010\n\nAdditional Deadlines:\nDeadline for submission of Tutorial Proposals: 18th June, 2010\nDeadline for submission of Special Session Proposals: 18th June, 2010 (The, First, IEEE, Biomedical, Circuits, and, Systems, Conference, \n\n, The, recent, years, have, witnessed, an, explosion, of, research, activities, in, the, areas, of, life, sciences, ,, physical, sciences, and, engineering, with, application, to, medical, problems, ., Such, activities, require, inter, -, disciplinary, collaborations, among, scientists, ,, engineers, ,, medical, researchers, ,, and, practitioners, to, solve, complex, real, world, problems, ., This, conference, is, the, premier, forum, where, members, of, the, IEEE, Circuits, &, Systems, Society, present, results, and, innovative, solutions, for, today, 's, health, problems, at, frontiers, of, Biomedical, Engineering, ., ", Smart, Hybrid, Biosystems, ", has, been, chosen, as, ...) IEEE [The First IEEE Biomedical Circuits and Systems Conference, The recent years have witnessed an explosion of research activities in the areas of life sciences, physical sciences and engineering with application to medical problems, Such activities require inter-disciplinary collaborations among scientists, engineers, medical researchers, and practitioners to solve complex real world problems, This conference is the premier forum where members of the IEEE Circuits & Systems Society present results and innovative solutions for today's health problems at frontiers of Biomedical Engineering, "Smart Hybrid Biosystems" has been chosen as the theme for this years conference., The conference is multidisciplinary in nature comprising an eclectic mix of insightful tutorials, and technical sessions, The organization and planning of the conference enables members of our communities to broaden their knowledge in emerging areas of research at the interface of the life sciences and the circuits and systems engineering discipline., The multidisciplinary approach of this event will enable the CAS community to benefit from a mix of tutorials and technical sessions covering a wide range of topics such as:, , 1, Bioelectronics / Biomedical instrumentations, 2, Bioinformatics, 3, Genomics and Proteomics, 4, Implantable and wearable electronics, 5, Neuromorphic Engineering, 6, Biomedical aids to the disabled, 7, Low power micro-and nanoelectronics, 8, Smart sensors / Body Sensor Network / Biotechnology sensor circuits, 9, Mixed-mode system-on-chip, 10, Micropower imaging technology / Biosignal processing, 11, Wireless technology in medicine / Telecare systems, 12, BioMEMS, 13, Gene circuits and molecular circuits, 14, Lab-on-chip, 15, Bio-nanotechnology, 16, System biology, 17, Organic Semiconductors, 18, Electronics for brain science, 19, Biomedical Engineering technology, 20, Healthcare: Information technology, , This event will give to researchers in this area a unique opportunity to broaden their insight into the new and developing area of medical technologies and to create inter-disciplinary bonding and come up with innovative solutions that todays healthcare problems and challenges require., The complete 4-page paper (in standard IEEE double-column format), including title, authors' names, affiliations and e-mail addresses, as well as a short abstract are requested, Papers must be submitted electronically in PDF format through www.biocas2010.org, Only electronic submissions will be accepted., A special issue consisting of the best presented papers will be published in the IEEE Transactions on Biomedical Circuits and Systems (TBCAS)., Authors' Schedule:, Deadline for submission of papers:18th June, 2010, Notification of paper acceptance: 27th August, 2010, Final submission: 17th September, 2010, Additional Deadlines:, Deadline for submission of Tutorial Proposals: 18th June, 2010, Deadline for submission of Special Session Proposals: 18th June, 2010] The First IEEE Biomedical Circuits and Systems Conference {'June, 2010': 'deadline for submission of tutorial proposals: 18th june, 2010', '27th August, 2010': 'notification of paper acceptance: 27th august, 2010', '17th September, 2010': 'final submission: 17th september, 2010', '18th June, 2010': 'deadline for submission of special session proposals: 18th june, 2010'}
57 1st International ICST Conference on e-services for Agriculture, Food, Environment and Life Sciences in Africa Johannesburg, South Africa CALL FOR PAPERS\n\n1st International ICST Conference on e-services for Agriculture, Food, Environment and Life Sciences in Africa\n\nSPONSORS\n\nSponsored by ICST\nTechnically co-sponsored by CREATE-NET\n\n***\n\nSCOPE\n\nThe conference will focus on the conceptualization, design, development, evaluation and application of innovative ways to use Information and Communication Technologies in the rural domain. The conference will, among others, explore the environmental impact of e-agriculture in the improvement and more efficient use of natural resources and exploitation of their potential towards a sustainable growth that best matches the needs of Africa. At this event current trends in the fields of agroecology and organic agriculture and the way these can be supported through e-agriculture, as well as particular applications and case studies that meet the needs of the African continent will be presented and discussed. In parallel, impacts that the use of e-services can have in the field of food, earth and life sciences, taking into account the particularities of Africa, will be evaluated.\n\nThe conference will bring together scientists, government agencies, technology developers, engineers and non-governmental organizations in an attempt to create a platform to exchange ideas and best practices on the implementation of e-services for agriculture, food, environment and life sciences, with emphasis on e-agriculture initiatives worldwide.\n\nThe event will include plenary sessions with distinguished keynote presentations and panel discussions with leading experts on cross-domain issues.\n\n***\n\nTOPICS\n\nTopics of interest include, but are not limited to the following focus areas:\n\n * ICT and Organic Agriculture/Agroecology\n * On-line trading of agricultural products\n * Supporting agricultural education/training through ICT\n * Raising awareness on environmental issues through the use of web technologies\n * Monitoring and decision support systems for environmental protection\n * ICT support for earth sciences\n * Improving quality of life in rural areas through ICT\n * Robotics and automation systems in agriculture and environmental protection\n * Web and mobile services for environmental/agricultural issues\n * Enhancing chain management and traceability in the agriculture chain through novel technologies\n * ICT adoption in Africa\n\n***\n\nPUBLICATION\n\nAccepted papers will be published by Springer in the Lecture Notes of the Institute for Computer Sciences, Social Informatics and Telecommunications Engineering (LNICST) series.\n\n***\n\nSUBMISSION\n\nDetailed submission and formatting instructions are available at http://www.eafricaconference.org/submission.shtml\n\n***\n\nIMPORTANT DATES\n\nPaper submission deadline: 2 April 2010\nNotification of acceptance: 3 May 2010\nCamera-ready deadline: 4 June 2010\n\n***\n\nWORKSHOP\n\nA pre-conference workshop will be organized on 8 September 2010, on Acceptable and Practical Precision Livestock Farming by BrightAnimal. For further information, please visit the event website.\n\n***\n\nORGANIZING COMMITTEE\n\nGeneral Chair\n\nAlexander B. Greece [CALL FOR PAPERS, 1st International ICST Conference on e-services for Agriculture, Food, Environment and Life Sciences in Africa, SPONSORS, Sponsored by ICST, Technically co-sponsored by CREATE-NET, ***, SCOPE, The conference will focus on the conceptualization, design, development, evaluation and application of innovative ways to use Information and Communication Technologies in the rural domain, The conference will, among others, explore the environmental impact of e-agriculture in the improvement and more efficient use of natural resources and exploitation of their potential towards a sustainable growth that best matches the needs of Africa, At this event current trends in the fields of agroecology and organic agriculture and the way these can be supported through e-agriculture, as well as particular applications and case studies that meet the needs of the African continent will be presented and discussed, In parallel, impacts that the use of e-services can have in the field of food, earth and life sciences, taking into account the particularities of Africa, will be evaluated., The conference will bring together scientists, government agencies, technology developers, engineers and non-governmental organizations in an attempt to create a platform to exchange ideas and best practices on the implementation of e-services for agriculture, food, environment and life sciences, with emphasis on e-agriculture initiatives worldwide., The event will include plenary sessions with distinguished keynote presentations and panel discussions with leading experts on cross-domain issues., ***, TOPICS, Topics of interest include, but are not limited to the following focus areas:, * ICT and Organic Agriculture/Agroecology, * On-line trading of agricultural products, * Supporting agricultural education/training through ICT, * Raising awareness on environmental issues through the use of web technologies, * Monitoring and decision support systems for environmental protection, * ICT support for earth sciences, * Improving quality of life in rural areas through ICT, * Robotics and automation systems in agriculture and environmental protection, * Web and mobile services for environmental/agricultural issues, * Enhancing chain management and traceability in the agriculture chain through novel technologies, * ICT adoption in Africa, ***, PUBLICATION, Accepted papers will be published by Springer in the Lecture Notes of the Institute for Computer Sciences, Social Informatics and Telecommunications Engineering (LNICST) series., ***, SUBMISSION, Detailed submission and formatting instructions are available at http://www.eafricaconference.org/submission.shtml, ***, IMPORTANT DATES, Paper submission deadline: 2 April 2010, Notification of acceptance: 3 May 2010, Camera-ready deadline: 4 June 2010, ***, WORKSHOP, A pre-conference workshop will be organized on 8 September 2010, on Acceptable and Practical Precision Livestock Farming by BrightAnimal, For further information, please visit the event website., ***, ORGANIZING COMMITTEE, General Chair, Alexander B, Sideridis, Agricultural University of Athens, 58 2nd International ICST Conference on Ambient Media and Systems Phoenix, Arizona, USA CALL FOR PAPERS\n\n2nd International ICST Conference on Ambient Media and Systems\n\nSPONSORS\n\nSponsored by ICST\nTechnically co-sponsored by CREATE-NET\n\n***\n\nBACKGROUND\n\nAmbient media and systems culminate from the emergence of mobile communication, sensor-actuator technology, virtual environments, and interactive computing. They represent the vision of an all-encompassing multimedia networking environment with human interaction at its core. Advances in computer and communication technologies have the potential to offer people an unprecedented level of convenience and flexibility for living and working. Such technologies need to be closely integrated with human interactions and activity, allowing greater support for smart solutions that improve quality of life, productivity, understanding and intelligence within their situated environment. AMBI-SYS 2010 focuses on emerging technologies, services and solutions for new, human-centric intelligent ambient environments.\n\n***\n\nTOPICS\n\nThe conference will consist of the following major areas or tracks:\n\n * Media and Content Provision, which is defined to cover integration of multimedia within ambient systems, multi-media processing, distribution and integration, provision and acquisition of ambient information, privacy, trust, accountability and dependability, cognition, intelligence, ambience, adaptivity, self-organization and evolution, multimedia and intelligent agents.\n * Communications and Networking, which will be covering wireless communication, ambient sensors, actuators and networking, quality of service and system performance, digital home and smart living, evolve-able and adaptive pervasive systems, scalability, integration, and ubiquity.\n * Human Interface and Interaction, which covers topics including haptic immersive environments, vision and recognition, visualization and display, sensor perception technologies, context awareness, system personalization, system and human collaboration, multimodal interaction, brain-computer interfaces, augmented reality.\n * Intelligence and Automation, which focuses on such topics as ambient intelligence, services, delivery, applications and smart solutions, multi-media knowledge management, acquisition and data fusion, detection and knowledge elicitation, prediction and self-learning, middleware, human-computer interaction in technology-rich environments, intelligence and automation, automatic behavioral analysis.\n * Applications of Ambient Systems including ambient assisted living, ambient media systems, domotics, intelligent spaces, mobile computing.\n\nAMBI-SYS 2010 will thus offer a unique forum for researchers to share ideas and disseminate new results in these important and emerging areas.\n\n***\n\nPUBLICATION\n\nThe papers will be published in the Springer Lecture Notes of ICST (LNICST) series.\n\n***\n\nSUBMISSION\n\nAll papers and workshop/tutorial proposal submissions will be handled electronically. For detailed submission guidelines, please visit http://ambi-sys.org/submission.shtml\n\n***\n\nIMPORTANT DATES\n\nPaper submission deadline: 31 May 2010\nNotification of acceptance: 15 August 2010\nCamera-ready deadline: 30 September 2010\n\n***\n\nORGANIZING COMMITTEE\n\nGeneral Chair\nKanav Kahol, Arizona State University, USA\n\nTechnical Program Chair\nSilvia Gabrielli, Foundation Bruno Kessler, Italy\n\nFor a complete list of committee and board members, please visit http://ambi-sys.org/committees.shtml\n\n***\n\nRELATED CONFERENCES\n\nTo find out about other conferences in the field of pervasive media, please visit http://www.icst.org/sibs/pervasive_media/ (CALL, FOR, PAPERS, \n\n, 2nd, International, ICST, Conference, on, Ambient, Media, and, Systems, \n\n, SPONSORS, \n\n, Sponsored, by, ICST, \n, Technically, co, -, sponsored, by, CREATE, -, NET, \n\n, *, *, *, \n\n, BACKGROUND, \n\n, Ambient, media, and, systems, culminate, from, the, emergence, of, mobile, communication, ,, sensor, -, actuator, technology, ,, virtual, environments, ,, and, interactive, computing, ., They, represent, the, vision, of, an, all, -, encompassing, multimedia, networking, environment, with, human, interaction, at, its, core, ., Advances, in, computer, and, communication, technologies, have, the, potential, to, offer, people, an, unprecedented, level, of, convenience, and, flexibility, for, living, and, ...) 59 3rd International ICST Conference on Electronic Healthcare for the 21st century Casablanca, Morocco CALL FOR PAPERS\n\n3rd International ICST Conference on Electronic Healthcare for the 21st century\n\n\nSPONSORS\n\nSponsored by ICST\nTechnically co-sponsored by CREATE-NET\n\n***\n\nSCOPE\n\nBased on the success of the 2nd edition of the eHealth conference series held in Istanbul in September 2009, the aim of eHealth 2010 is to bring together experts from academia, industry and global healthcare institutions such as WHO and ECDC to stimulate cutting-edge research discussions, share experience with real-world healthcare service providers and policy makers, as well as provide numerous business opportunities.\n\nSwine flu epidemics in 2009 demonstrated a breakthrough in use of web intelligence harnessing and mining user-generated content in social networks and Web 2.0 tools for rapid healthcare information dissemination and outbreak detection. In addition, despite substantial budgets spent on eHealth in recent years, existing healthcare services do not sufficiently address the issue of patient privacy or trust, nor the potential in e-learning and web mining for delivering 21st-century healthcare systems for European citizens. The key topic of eHealth 2010 will be investigating a realistic potential of Web 2.0 and Web Intelligence in providing evidence-based healthcare information, assist in outbreak detection and control, and provide quality-assured and effective interventions for patients and global users.\n\n***\n\nTOPICS\n\n * Web Intelligence - Web 2.0 and social networks, techniques for harnessing and mining user-generated content, provision of pertinent information to patients, outbreak detection and early warning systems, data collection and analysis for surveillance and epidemiology.\n * Privacy, trust and security - Electronic patient records, models for trust and privacy, novel mobile encryption technologies, identity federation, role based access control, privacy enhancing technologies.\n * Healthcare ontologies and knowledge management systems - Annotation, health care ontologies, coding standards, communication standards, quality tagging and quality of service, distribution issues, coding systems and ontology mapping, search, user customisation, alert agents.\n * E-learning, educational games and the impact of information delivery to patients and professionals - Using digital libraries in building online communities, moderated discussion groups, qualitative and quantitative evaluation studies, user attitudes towards the knowledge, studies of changes of user attitude with respect to digital libraries.\n * Web 2.0 in healthcare, wellbeing and online communities of practice - Community of practice, Web 2.0, user support groups, blogs, personalisation and profiling, online support for healthy lifestyle, wellbeing and public interventions.\n * Performance Monitoring and Evaluation Frameworks - Performance evaluation methodologies, virtualized models for evidence based medicine, patient/process flow models, sensor technologies and RFID tagging, mobile healthcare technologies, asset management systems, application to evidence based medicine, industrial practice and experience.\n\n***\n\nPUBLICATION\n\nAll accepted papers will be published in the Springer Lecture Notes of ICST (LNICST) series.\n\n***\n\nSUBMISSION\n\nAll paper submissions will be handled electronically. For detailed submission guidelines, please visit http://www.electronic-health.org/submission.shtml\n\n***\n\nIMPORTANT DATES\n\nMain Track\nSubmission Deadline: 1 June 2010\nNotification of Acceptance: 2 August 2010\n\nPoster and Workshops\nSubmission Deadline: 16 August 2010\nNotification of Acceptance: 13 September 2010\n\nCamera-Ready\nCamera-Ready Deadline: 20 September 2010\n\nConference\nWorkshop: 13 December 2010\nMain Track: 14 - 15 December 2010\n\n\n***\n\nORGANIZING COMMITTEE\n\nGeneral Chairs\n\nHarini Kulatunga, Department of Computing, Imperial College London, UK\nMartin Szomszor, City eHealth Research Centre, City University London, UK\n\nFor a complete list of committee and board members, please visit http://www.electronic-health.org/committees.shtml\n\n*** (CALL, FOR, PAPERS, \n\n, 3rd, International, ICST, Conference, on, Electronic, Healthcare, for, the, 21st, century, \n\n\n, SPONSORS, \n\n, Sponsored, by, ICST, \n, Technically, co, -, sponsored, by, CREATE, -, NET, \n\n, *, *, *, \n\n, SCOPE, \n\n, Based, on, the, success, of, the, 2nd, edition, of, the, eHealth, conference, series, held, in, Istanbul, in, September, 2009, ,, the, aim, of, eHealth, 2010, is, to, bring, together, experts, from, academia, ,, industry, and, global, healthcare, institutions, such, as, WHO, and, ECDC, to, stimulate, cutting, -, edge, research, discussions, ,, share, experience, with, real, -, world, healthcare, service, providers, and, policy, makers, ...) 60 1st International ICST Conference on Wireless Mobile Communication and Healthcare Ayia Napa, Cyprus CALL FOR PAPERS\n1st International ICST Conference on Wireless Mobile Communication and Healthcare\nOctober 18-20 2010\n\nSPONSORS\n\nSponsored by ICST\nTechnically co-sponsored by CREATE-NET\n\n\n***\n\nSCOPE\n\nThe objectives of the conference are to advance medical diagnosis, treatment, and patient care through applications of wireless communication, mobile computing and sensing technologies. MOBIHEALTH 2010 provides an international forum to bring together researchers and experts from academia, healthcare organizations, research institutions, and industrial enterprises working in the field of wireless communication and healthcare to share ideas and discuss cutting-edge research, present experience with recent developments in healthcare delivery, and to provide practical guidance to policy makers and the setting of applicable standards.\n\n***\n\nTOPICS\n\nOriginal unpublished contributions are solicited that can improve the knowledge, understanding and practice in the interdisciplinary design of efficient protocols and technologies to help implement and provide advanced mobile health care applications.\n\nTopics of interest include but are not restricted to:\n\n * Emergency and disaster applications\n * Specialty and site specific applications\n * Wearable, outdoor and home based applications\n * Sensing of vital signs and signatures\n * Intra-body propagation and communication\n * Mobile devices for patient monitoring\n * Measurement and monitoring technologies\n * Decision support algorithms for sensor analysis\n * Transmission of patient data\n * Ad hoc and sensor systems and networks\n * Real-time transmission of multiple medical data\n * Healthcare telemetry and telemedicine\n * Secure and high quality networks\n * Ad hoc wireless networks for enhanced monitoring\n * Remote diagnosis and patient management\n * Accuracy and reliability of diagnoses\n * Home and rural environments\n * Novel mobile encryption technologies\n * Coding and communication standards\n * Identity and privacy enhancing technologies\n * Mobile data management and processing\n * Wireless access in ubiquitous systems\n * Wearable computing and communication\n * Wireless and wearable devices for pervasive healthcare\n * Mobile and wireless technologies for healthcare delivery\n * Sensor networks for pervasive healthcare\n * Patient monitoring in diverse environments (hospitals, nursing homes, assisted living)\n\n\n***\n\nPUBLICATION\n\nThe Proceedings of MOBIHEALTH 2010 will be published in the Lecture Notes of ICST (LNICST), appear in SpringerLink and will be referenced in the ICST digital library, the European Union Digital Library (EUDL).\n\n***\n\nSUBMISSION\n\nPapers should be submitted to www.assyst-online.org by 30 April 2010. The preferred length for initial submissions is 4 pages, however, the length of final papers should not exceed 8 pages including all figures, tables and references. Extra pages will incur additional charges. The papers must be submitted in PDF format. All papers will be reviewed. All submissions will be peer-reviewed, and acceptances will be provided by 30 June.\nFor submission instructions, please visit http://mobihealth.name/submission.shtml\n\n***\n\nIMPORTANT DATES\n\nPaper submission deadline: 30 April 2010\nNotification of acceptance: 30 June 2010\nCamera-ready deadline: 30 July 2010\n\n***\n\nORGANIZING COMMITTEE\n\nGeneral Chair\nJames C. Lin, University of Illinois at Chicago, USA\n\nTechnical Program Chair\nKonstantina S. Nikita, National Technical University of Athens, Greece\n\nLocal Arrangements Chair\nGeorge Papadopoulos, University of Cyprus, Cyprus\n\nFor a complete list of committee and board members, please visit http://www.mobihealth.name/orgncomm.shtml (CALL, FOR, PAPERS, \n, 1st, International, ICST, Conference, on, Wireless, Mobile, Communication, and, Healthcare, \n, October, 18, -, 20, 2010, \n\n, SPONSORS, \n\n, Sponsored, by, ICST, \n, Technically, co, -, sponsored, by, CREATE, -, NET, \n\n\n, *, *, *, \n\n, SCOPE, \n\n, The, objectives, of, the, conference, are, to, advance, medical, diagnosis, ,, treatment, ,, and, patient, care, through, applications, of, wireless, communication, ,, mobile, computing, and, sensing, technologies, ., MOBIHEALTH, 2010, provides, an, international, forum, to, bring, together, researchers, and, experts, from, academia, ,, healthcare, organizations, ,, research, institutions, ,, and, industrial, enterprises, working, in, the, field, of, wireless, ...) standards, * Identity and privacy enhancing technologies, * Mobile data management and processing, * Wireless access in ubiquitous systems, * Wearable computing and communication, * Wireless and 61 2nd International ICST Conference on Digital Forensics & Cyber Crime Abu Dhabi, UAE CALL FOR PAPERS\n2nd International ICST Conference on Digital Forensics & Cyber Crime\nConference date: 4/10/2010 - 6/10/2010\n\nKEYNOTE SPEAKERS (tentative)\n\nDr. Eugene Spafford, Purdue University and CERIAS, USA\nDr. Marcus Rogers, Purdue University and CERIAS, USA\n\n***\n\nSPONSORS\nSponsored by ICST\nTechnically co-sponsored by CREATE-NET and Zayed University\n\n***\n\nSCOPE\n\nThe Internet has made it easier to perpetrate traditional crimes by providing criminals an alternate avenue for launching attacks with relative anonymity. The increased complexity of the communication and networking infrastructure is making investigation of the crimes difficult. Clues of illegal activities are often buried in large volumes of data that need to be sifted through in order to detect crimes and collect evidence. The field of digital forensics is becoming very important for law enforcement, network security, and information assurance. This is a multidisciplinary area that encompasses multiple fields, including: law, computer science, finance, networking, data mining, and criminal justice. The applications of this technology are far-reaching which include law enforcement, disaster recovery, accounting frauds, homeland security, and information warfare. This conference brings together practitioners and researchers from diverse fields providing opportunities for business and intellectual engagement among attendees. The conference is organized by the College of Information Technology at Zayed University with the Institute for Computer Sciences, Social Informatics and Telecommunications Engineering (ICST).\n\n***\n\nTOPICS\n\nTechnical papers describing original, previously unpublished research, not currently under review by another conference or journal, are solicited. The following topics highlight the conference theme:\n\n * Financial Crimes (Money Laundering, Fraud, Identity Theft)\n * Forensic Accounting (Accounting Fraud, Continuous Assurance, etc.)\n * Digital Forensics Training & Education\n * Digital Forensics Process and Procedures\n * Digital Forensics & Law (e-Discovery & Litigation Support, Incident Response, Evidence Handling)\n * Cyber Crime Investigations\n * Cyber Security & Information Warfare\n * Computer/Handheld Device & Multimedia Forensics (Tools and Techniques)\n * Forensics Standardization, Accreditation\n * Cyber Criminal Psychology and Profiling\n\n\n***\n\nPUBLICATION\n\nThe conference proceedings will be published in the series of the Lecture Notes of ICST (LNICST) by Springer.\n\n***\n\nSUBMISSION\n\nFor submission guidelines, please visit http://d-forensics.org/submissiondetails.shtml\n\n***\n\nCALL FOR PRESENTATIONS\n\nSCOPE\n\nThe 2nd International ICST Conference on Digital Forensics and Cyber Crime (ICDF2C) is a unique conference encompassing not only technical, but also the social, legal, and business aspects of forensics. The forensics field is set to explode and the United Arab Emirates is in a prime position to take advantage of it. The United Arab Emirates has taken large governmental efforts in establishing UAE Cyber Laws, Digital Forensic Laboratories in Abu Dhabi and Dubai, governmental bodies specializing in security and has now introduced digital forensic research, development and education in the higher educational system. By bringing together both practitioners and researchers, we hope to benefit from understandings of current practice and the innovations that research has to offer.\n\nThis call for presenters is in addition to the call for papers. As opposed to research papers, the presentations will be focused on more applied topics. Presentation length should be from 1/2 to 1-hour. Presentations must be vendor neutral.\n\nFor submission guidelines, please visit http://d-forensics.org/callforpresentations.shtml.\n\n***\n\nTUTORIAL (tentative)\n\nAdvances in Digital Image Forensics\nby Dr. Nasir Memon, Polytechnic Institute of New York University, USA\n\nGiven the ease by which digital images can be created, altered, and manipulated with no obvious traces, digital image forensics has emerged as a research field with important implications for ensuring digital image credibility. This tutorial will provide an overview of recent developments in the field, focusing on three problems. First, collecting image evidence and reconstructing them from fragments with or without missing pieces. This involves sophisticated file carving technology. Second, attributing the image to a source, be it a camera, a scanner, or a graphically generated picture. The process entails associating the image with a class of sources with common characteristics (device model) or matching the image to an individual source device, for example a specific camera. Third, attesting to the integrity of image data. This involves image forgery detection to determine whether an image has undergone modification or processing after being initially captured.\n\nFor further information please visit http://d-forensics.org/tutorial.shtml\n\n***\n\nIMPORTANT DATES\n\nPaper Submission Deadline: 1 May 2010\nNotification of Paper Acceptance: 15 June 2010\nCamera-Ready Paper Submission: 1 August 2010\nPresentation Proposal Submission Deadline: 1 June 2010\nNotification of Presentation Proposal Acceptance: 15 June 2010\nPresentation Submission Deadline: 1 August 2010\n\n***\n\nORGANIZING COMMITTEE\n\nGeneral Chair\nIbrahim Baggili, College of Information Technology, Zayed University, UAE\n\nFor a complete list of committee and board members, please visit http://d-forensics.org/orgcommittee.shtml (CALL, FOR, PAPERS, \n, 2nd, International, ICST, Conference, on, Digital, Forensics, &, Cyber, Crime, \n, Conference, date, :, 4/10/2010, -, 6/10/2010, \n\n, KEYNOTE, SPEAKERS, (, tentative, ), \n\n, Dr., Eugene, Spafford, ,, Purdue, University, and, CERIAS, ,, USA, \n, Dr., Marcus, Rogers, ,, Purdue, University, and, CERIAS, ,, USA, \n\n, *, *, *, \n\n, SPONSORS, \n, Sponsored, by, ICST, \n, Technically, co, -, sponsored, by, CREATE, -, NET, and, Zayed, University, \n\n, *, *, *, \n\n, SCOPE, \n\n, The, Internet, has, made, it, easier, to, perpetrate, traditional, crimes, by, providing, criminals, an, alternate, avenue, for, launching, attacks, with, relative, anonymity, ...) the United Arab Emirates [CALL FOR PAPERS, 2nd International ICST Conference on Digital Forensics & Cyber Crime, Conference date: 4/10/2010 - 6/10/2010, KEYNOTE SPEAKERS (tentative), Dr, Eugene Spafford, Purdue University and CERIAS, USA, Dr, Marcus Rogers, Purdue University and CERIAS, USA, ***, SPONSORS, Sponsored by ICST, Technically co-sponsored by CREATE-NET and Zayed University, ***, SCOPE, The Internet has made it easier to perpetrate traditional crimes by providing criminals an alternate avenue for launching attacks with relative anonymity, The increased complexity of the communication and networking infrastructure is making investigation of the crimes difficult, Clues of illegal activities are often buried in large volumes of data that need to be sifted through in order to detect crimes and collect evidence, The field of digital forensics is becoming very important for law enforcement, network security, and information assurance, This is a multidisciplinary area that encompasses multiple fields, including: law, computer science, finance, networking, data mining, and criminal justice, The applications of this technology are far-reaching which include law enforcement, disaster recovery, accounting frauds, homeland security, and information warfare, This conference brings together practitioners and researchers from diverse fields providing opportunities for business and intellectual engagement among attendees, The conference is organized by the College of Information Technology at Zayed University with the Institute for Computer Sciences, Social Informatics and Telecommunications Engineering (ICST)., ***, TOPICS, Technical papers describing original, previously unpublished research, not currently under review by another conference or journal, are solicited, The following topics highlight the conference theme:, * Financial Crimes (Money Laundering, Fraud, Identity Theft), * Forensic Accounting (Accounting Fraud, Continuous Assurance, etc.), * Digital Forensics Training & Education, * Digital Forensics Process and Procedures, * Digital Forensics & Law (e-Discovery & Litigation Support, Incident Response, Evidence Handling), * Cyber Crime Investigations, * Cyber Security & Information Warfare, * Computer/Handheld Device & Multimedia Forensics (Tools and Techniques), * Forensics Standardization, Accreditation, * Cyber Criminal Psychology and Profiling, ***, PUBLICATION, The conference proceedings will be published in the series of the Lecture Notes of ICST (LNICST) by Springer., ***, SUBMISSION, For submission guidelines, please visit http://d-forensics.org/submissiondetails.shtml, ***, CALL FOR PRESENTATIONS, SCOPE, The 2nd International ICST Conference on Digital Forensics and Cyber Crime (ICDF2C) is a unique conference encompassing not only technical, but also the social, legal, and business aspects of forensics, The forensics field is set to explode and the United Arab Emirates is in a prime position to take advantage of it, The United Arab Emirates has taken large governmental efforts in establishing UAE Cyber Laws, Digital Forensic Laboratories in Abu Dhabi and Dubai, governmental bodies specializing in security and has now introduced digital forensic research, development and education in the higher educational system, By bringing together both practitioners and researchers, we hope to benefit from understandings of current practice and the innovations that research has to offer., This call for presenters is in addition to the call for papers, As opposed to research papers, the presentations will be focused on more applied topics, Presentation length should be from 1/2 to 1-hour, Presentations must be vendor neutral., For submission guidelines, please visit http://d-forensics.org/callforpresentations.shtml., ***, TUTORIAL (tentative), Advances in Digital Image Forensics, by Dr, Nasir Memon, Polytechnic Institute of New York University, USA, Given the ease by which digital images can be created, altered, and manipulated with no obvious traces, digital image forensics has emerged as a research field with important implications for ensuring digital image credibility, This tutorial will provide an overview of recent developments in the field, focusing on three problems, First, collecting image evidence and reconstructing them from fragments with or without missing pieces, This involves sophisticated file carving technology, Second, attributing the image to a source, be it a camera, a scanner, or a graphically generated picture, The process entails associating the image with a class of sources with common characteristics (device model) or matching the image to an individual source device, for example a specific camera, Third, attesting 62 International Conference on Green Computing Chicago, USA ///////////////// CALL FOR PAPERS ////////////////////////////\n International Conference on Green Computing\n Chicago, USA\n August 15-18 2010\n\nThe International Green Computing Conference technically co-sponsored by IEEE addresses key issues and topics related to energy efficiency in computing and promoting environmentally friendly computer technologies and systems. The conference aims to provide a forum to a wide audience for discussing, sharing and investigating the state-of-the-art for all aspects of green computing, which include energy-efficient use of computers, design of algorithms and systems for environmentally-friendly computer technologies, and wide range of related topics. The conference will publish papers pertaining to hardware and software systems, algorithms, applications as well as power, energy and temperature related research areas of current importance to researchers, engineers and practitioners. The conference will hold forums and workshops on hot topics related to how the carbon footprint of computing can be reduced and how computers can contribute to the environment and overall well being of the planet.\n\nTopics of interest are:\n\n * Power-aware software\n * Code profiling and transformation for power management\n * Power-aware middleware\n * Power-efficient architectures and chip designs\n * Resource management to optimize performance and power\n * Runtime systems that assist in power saving\n * Models for collective optimization of power and performance\n * Monitoring tools for power and performance\n * Algorithms for reduced power, energy and heat\n * Power-aware applications\n * Static and dynamic data allocation for distributed servers\n * Efficient circuit design for energy harvesting\n * Power efficient cluster and enterprise computing\n * Power management at component level, including memory, disk.\n * Configurable and renewable energy\n * Low power electronics\n * Embedded systems, ASICs and FPGSs\n * Power leakage and dissipation\n * Power implications for portable and mobile computing\n * Power aware networking\n * Reliability of Power-aware computers\n * Use of sensors for climate monitoring\n * Smart control for eco-friendly buildings\n * Thermal control of data centers\n * Energy recycling\n * Energy efficient power and cooling infrastructure\n\nCommittee\n\nGenera Co-Chairs\n\n * Ishfaq Ahmad, University of Texas at Arlington, USA, and Sanjay Ranka, University of Florida, USA\n\nTechnical Committee Co-Chairs\n\n * Rajesh Gupta, University of California at San Diego, USA, and David Lowenthal, University of Arizona, USA\n\nLocal Arrangement Chair\n\n * Ashfaq Khokhar, University of Illinois at Chicago, USA\n\nPublication Chair\n\n * Saeed Rajput, Nova Southeastern University, USA\n\nPublication Co-Chair\n\n * Feilong Tang, Shangahi Jiaotong University, China\n\nPublicity Co-Chair\n\n * Javier Alonso, Technical University of Catalonia, Spain, Koji Nakano, University of Hiroshima, Japan, Masoud Sadjadi, Florida International University, USA\n\nSteering Committee\n\n * Behrooz Shirazi (Co-Chair), Washington State University, USA, Ishfaq Ahmad (Co-Chair), University of Texas at Arlington, USA, Sandeep Gupta, Arizona State University, USA, Ali Hurson, Missouri University of Science and Technology, USA, Ashfaq Khokhar, University of Illinois at Chicago, USA, Francis Lau, University of Hong Kong, China, Sanjay Ranka, University of Florida, USA\n\n\nSubmitted manuscripts may not exceed 15 single-spaced pages using 12-point size font on 8.5x11 inch pages, including figures, tables, and references. Please use the standard 1-inch margin. Files should be submitted by following the instructions available at the EasyChair. The easy chair conference ID is IGCC 10 : First IEEE International Green Computing Conference. It is and is indexed at number 832 under 2011 conferences. Authors must ensure that electronically submitted files are formatted in PDF format for 8.5x11 inch paper. The final appearance of the accepted papers in the official conference proceedings (through IEEE Digital Library) is contingent on two conditions: (1) that at least one author of an accepted paper registers for the conference at the time of the submission of the final manuscript and (2) that one of the authors presents the paper at the conference in person.\n\nReview of Manuscripts\n\nAll submitted manuscripts will be reviewed and evaluated on correctness, originality, technical strength, significance, quality of presentation, and interest and relevance to the conference scope. Papers must be received by March 15, 2010, by 11:59pm, U.S. Eastern Daylight Time. Full manuscripts must be received by May 15, 2010, by 11:59 PM, U.S. Eastern Daylight Time.\n\nBest Paper Awards\n\nAwards will be given for best papers in different categories.\n\nImportant Dates:\n\n * Paper Due: Monday, March 15, 2010\n * Paper notification: April 30, 2010\n * Camera ready papers due: May 15, 2010 (/////////////////, CALL, FOR, PAPERS, ////////////////////////////, \n , International, Conference, on, Green, Computing, \n , Chicago, ,, USA, \n , August, 15, -, 18, 2010, \n\n, The, International, Green, Computing, Conference, technically, co, -, sponsored, by, IEEE, addresses, key, issues, and, topics, related, to, energy, efficiency, in, computing, and, promoting, environmentally, friendly, computer, technologies, and, systems, ., The, conference, aims, to, provide, a, forum, to, a, wide, audience, for, discussing, ,, sharing, and, investigating, the, state, -, of, -, the, -, art, for, all, aspects, of, green, computing, ,, which, include, energy, -, efficient, use, of, computers, ,, design, of, algorithms, and, systems, for, ...) technically co-sponsored by IEEE addresses key issues and topics related to energy efficiency in computing and promoting environmentally friendly computer technologies and systems, The conference aims to provide a forum to a wide audience for discussing, sharing and investigating the state-of-the-art for all aspects of green computing, which include energy-efficient use of computers, design of algorithms and systems for environmentally-friendly computer technologies, and wide range of related topics, The conference will publish papers pertaining to hardware and software systems, algorithms, applications as well as power, energy and temperature related research areas of current importance to researchers, engineers and practitioners, The conference will hold forums and workshops on hot topics related to how the carbon footprint of computing can be reduced and how computers can contribute to the environment and overall well being of the planet., Topics of interest are:, * Power-aware software, * Code profiling and transformation for power management, * Power-aware middleware, * Power-efficient architectures and chip designs, * Resource management to optimize performance and power, * Runtime systems that assist in power saving, * Models for collective optimization of power and performance, * Monitoring tools for power and performance, * Algorithms for reduced power, energy and heat, * Power-aware applications, * Static and dynamic data allocation for distributed servers, * Efficient circuit design for energy harvesting, * Power efficient cluster and enterprise computing, *
