70 CfP: Workshop on Collaborative Modeling and Simulation (CoMetS) Larissa - Greece #################################################################\n IEEE WETICE 2010 \n 1st International Workshop on\n Collaborative Modeling and Simulation \n CALL FOR PAPERS \n################################################################# \n\nJune 28 - June 30, 2010, Larissa (Greece) \nhttp://www.sel.uniroma2.it/CoMetS10 \n\n################################################################# \n# Papers Due: *** March 2, 2010 *** \n# Accepted papers will be published in the conference proceedings \n# by the IEEE Computer Society Press and indexed by EI. \n################################################################# \n\nModeling and Simulation (M&S) is increasingly becoming a central \nactivity in the design of new systems and in the analysis of \nexisting systems because it enables designers and researchers to \ninvestigate systems behavior through virtual representations. For \nthis reason, M&S is gaining a primary role in many industrial and \nresearch fields, such as space, critical infrastructures, \nmanufacturing, emergency management, biomedical systems and \nsustainable future. However, as the complexity of the \ninvestigated systems increases and the types of investigations \nwidens, the cost of M&S activities increases because of the more \ncomplex models and of the communications among a wider number and \nvariety of M&S stakeholders (e.g., sub-domain experts, simulator \nusers, simulator engineers, and final system users). To address \nthe increasing costs of M&S activities, collaborative \ntechnologies must be introduced to support these activities by \nfostering the sharing and reuse of models, by facilitating the \ncommunications among M&S stakeholders, and more generally by \nintegrating processes, tools and platforms. \n\nAside from seeking applications of collaborative technologies to \nM&S activities, the workshop seeks innovative contributions that \ndeal with the application of M&S practices to the design of \ncollaborative environments. These environments are continuously \nbecoming more complex and therefore their design requires \nsystematic approaches to meet the required quality of \ncollaboration. This is important for two reasons: to reduce \nrework activities on the actual collaborative environment, and to \nmaximize the productivity and the quality of the process the \ncollaborative environment supports. M&S offers the methodologies \nand tools for such investigations and therefore it can be used to \nimprove the quality of collaborative environments. \n\nA non-exhaustive list of hi-level topics includes: \n\n* collaborative environments for M&S \n* agent-based M&S \n* collaborative distributed simulation \n* net-centric M&S \n* web-based M&S \n* model sharing and reuse \n* model building and evaluation \n* modeling and simulation of business processes \n* modeling for collaboration \n* simulation-based performance evaluation of collaborative \n networks \n* model-driven simulation engineering \n* domain specific languages for the simulation of collaborative \n environments \n* domain specific languages for collaborative M&S \n\nTo stimulate creativity, however, the workshop maintains a wider \nscope and invites interested researchers to present contributions \nthat offer original perspectives on collaboration and M&S. \n\n+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ \nOn-Line Submissions and Publication \n+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ \n\nCoMetS'10 intends to bring together researchers and practitioners \nto discuss key issues, approaches, open problems, innovative \napplications and trends in the workshop research area. \n\nPapers should contain original contributions not published or \nsubmitted elsewhere. Papers up to six pages (including figures, \ntables and references) can be submitted. Papers should follow the \nIEEE format, which is single spaced, two columns, 10 pt \nTimes/Roman font. All submissions should be electronic (in PDF) \nand will be peer-reviewed by at least three program committee \nmembers. \n\nFull papers accepted for the workshop will be included in the \nproceedings, published by the IEEE Computer Society Press (IEEE \napproval pending). Note that at least one author from each \naccepted paper should register to attend WETICE 2010 to get the \npaper published in the proceedings. \n\nAuthors may contact the organizers for expression of interests \nand content appropriateness at any time. Papers can be submitted \nin PDF format at the submission site \n(http://www.easychair.org/conferences/?conf=comets10), which is \nsupported by the EasyChair conference management system. Please \ncontact the workshop chairs (comets10@easychair.org) if you \nexperience problems with the EasyChair Web site. \n\n+++++++++++++++ \nImportant Dates \n+++++++++++++++ \n\n* Submission Deadline: March 2, 2010 \n* Decision to paper authors: April 2, 2010 \n* Final version of accepted papers due to IEEE: April 14, 2010 \n* Conference dates: June 28 - June 30, 2010 \n\n++++++++++++++++++++ \nOrganizing Committee \n++++++++++++++++++++ \n\n* Andrea D'Ambrogio, University of Roma TorVergata, Italy \n* Daniele Gianni, European Space Agency, Netherlands \n* Joachim Fuchs, European Space Agency, Netherlands \n* Giuseppe Iazeolla, University of Roma TorVergata, Italy \n\n+++++++++++++++++ \nProgram Committee \n+++++++++++++++++ \n\n* Michele Angelaccio, University of Roma TorVergata, Italy \n* Olivier Dalle, University of Nice Sophia Antipolis, CNRS & INRIA, France \n* Steve McKeever, University of Oxford, UK \n* Alessandra Pieroni, University of Roma TorVergata, Italy \n* Andrew Rice, University of Cambridge, UK \n* JosÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ© L. Risco-Martin, Universidad Complutense de Madrid, Spain \n* Helena Szczerbicka, University of Hannover, Germany \n* Hans Vangheluwe, McGill University, Canada \n* Gabriel Wainer, Carleton University, Canada \n* J.Chris White, ViaSim Solutions, USA \n* Quirien Wijnands, European Space Agency, Netherlands \n* Heming Zhang, Tsinghua University, China \n\n*** Contact Information *** \nAndrea D'Ambrogio (workshop co-chair) \nEmail: dambro@info.uniroma2.it (#, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, \n , IEEE, WETICE, 2010, \n , 1st, International, Workshop, on, \n , Collaborative, Modeling, and, Simulation, \n , CALL, FOR, PAPERS, \n, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, #, ...) ################################################################# , # Papers Due: *** March 2, 2010 *** , # Accepted papers will be published in the conference proceedings , # by the IEEE Computer Society Press and indexed by EI, ################################################################# , Modeling and Simulation (M&S) is increasingly becoming a central , activity in the design of new systems and in the analysis of , existing systems because it enables designers and researchers to , investigate systems behavior through virtual representations, For , this reason, M&S is gaining a primary role in many industrial and , research fields, such as space, critical infrastructures, , manufacturing, emergency management, biomedical systems and , sustainable future, However, as the complexity of the , investigated systems increases and the types of investigations , widens, the cost of M&S activities increases because of the more , complex models and of the communications among a wider number and , variety of M&S stakeholders (e.g., sub-domain experts, simulator , users, simulator engineers, and final system users), To address , the increasing costs of M&S activities, collaborative , technologies must be introduced to support these activities by , fostering the sharing and reuse of models, by facilitating the , communications among M&S stakeholders, and more generally by , integrating processes, tools and platforms, Aside from seeking applications of collaborative technologies to , M&S activities, the workshop seeks innovative contributions that , deal with the application of M&S practices to the design of , collaborative environments, These environments are continuously , becoming more complex and therefore their design requires , systematic approaches to meet the required quality of , collaboration, This is important for two reasons: to reduce , rework activities on the actual collaborative environment, and to , maximize the productivity and the quality of the process the , collaborative environment supports, M&S offers the methodologies , and tools for such investigations and therefore it can be used to , improve the quality of collaborative environments, A non-exhaustive list of hi-level topics includes: , * collaborative environments for M&S , * agent-based M&S , * collaborative distributed simulation , * net-centric M&S , * web-based M&S , * model sharing and reuse , * model building and evaluation , * modeling and simulation of business processes , * modeling for collaboration , * simulation-based performance evaluation of collaborative , networks , * model-driven simulation engineering , * domain specific languages for the simulation of collaborative , environments , * domain specific languages for collaborative M&S , To stimulate creativity, however, the workshop maintains a wider , scope and invites interested researchers to present contributions , that offer original perspectives on collaboration and M&S, +++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ , On-Line Submissions and Publication , +++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ , CoMetS'10 intends to bring together researchers and practitioners , to discuss key issues, approaches, open problems, innovative , applications and trends in the workshop research area, Papers should contain original contributions not published or , submitted elsewhere, Papers up to six pages (including figures, , tables and references) can be submitted, Papers should follow the , IEEE format, which is single spaced, two columns, 10 pt , Times/Roman font, All submissions should be electronic (in PDF) , and will be peer-reviewed by at least three program committee , members, Full papers accepted for the workshop will be included in the 71 Knowledge Engineering in Global Software Development Workshop Princeton Call for Papers ICGSE KNOWING\nKnowledge Engineering in Global Software Development Workshop (KNOWING)\n\n\nKnowledge engineering is an evolutionary process of engineering artefacts and using them to gain new understandings. These new understandings are then used to further engineer or modify artefacts and the process continues.\nKnowledge engineering in global software development is being increasingly researched by the software and the knowledge management communities.\nTo implement a good knowledge management strategy in a global software engineering environment,organizations have to overcome issues which have been identified in many previous studies. These issues make global software distribution a difficult and complex task.\nHosting a workshop on this topic at the International Conference on Global Software Engineering will bring together researchers from both these communities in a forum where they can discuss and explore similarities between both communities' research.\nTopics should have a global software development focus and include, but are not limited to:\n\n\n*\tknowledge management within software engineering from a business perspective \n*\tcollaboration and knowledge sharing \n*\tknowledge discovery services and tools \n*\tworkflows and decision making including experiences with Wiki support \n*\tmethods and tools for managing knowledge \n*\tarchitectural knowledge management practices \n*\tskills management and transfer of knowledge \nPaper Submission\n\n\nPapers must be submitted electronically by email to Sarah Beecham, [log in to unmask], or, Ivan Mistrik, [log in to unmask]\n*\ttraceability,accountability and risks \n*\tknowledge management in global software product line engineering \n*\tautomated extraction,collection, and abstraction of knowledge from software archives \n*\tapplications of ontologies \n*\tempirical analysis of globally distributed development project performance \n*\tknowledge management issues in agile and iterative approaches \n*\tportals and services for knowledge management on the semantic web \n*\tsoftware process simulation of emergent issues\n\n\nYour paper must conform to the IEEE proceedings publication format(8.5" x 11",Two-Column Format) described at IEEE/CPS (http://www.computer.org/portal/site/cscps/menuitem.02df7cde46985ea21618fc2e6bcd45f3/index.jsp?&pName=cscps_level1&path=cscps/cps&file=cps_forms.xml&xsl=generic.xsl&) \n\nYour paper should be no longer than 6 pages including all text,references, appendices, and figures. Your submissions should be in PDF format. submissions that exceed the page limit(6) or do not comply with the proceedings format will be desk rejected without review. The results described must not be under consideration for publication elsewhere. Conference details are available on www.icgse.org (http://www.icgse.org/) . \n\nImportant Dates\n\nPaper abstracts:\t March 15, 2010\t\nPaper submissions:\t March 31, 2010\t\nNotification of authors:\t April 23, 2010\t\nCamera-ready papers due:\t May 28, 2010\t\nWorkshop:\t August 23, 2010 (Call, for, Papers, ICGSE, KNOWING, \n, Knowledge, Engineering, in, Global, Software, Development, Workshop, (, KNOWING, ), \n\n\n, Knowledge, engineering, is, an, evolutionary, process, of, engineering, artefacts, and, using, them, to, gain, new, understandings, ., These, new, understandings, are, then, used, to, further, engineer, or, modify, artefacts, and, the, process, continues, ., \n, Knowledge, engineering, in, global, software, development, is, being, increasingly, researched, by, the, software, and, the, knowledge, management, communities, ., \n, To, implement, a, good, knowledge, management, strategy, in, a, global, software, engineering, environment, ,, organizations, have, to, overcome, issues, which, have, been, identified, in, many, previous, studies, ., ...) None [Call for Papers ICGSE KNOWING, Knowledge Engineering in Global Software Development Workshop (KNOWING), Knowledge engineering is an evolutionary process of engineering artefacts and using them to gain new understandings, These new understandings are then used to further engineer or modify artefacts and the process continues., Knowledge engineering in global software development is being increasingly researched by the software and the knowledge management communities., To implement a good knowledge management strategy in a global software engineering environment,organizations have to overcome issues which have been identified in many previous studies, These issues make global software distribution a difficult and complex task., Hosting a workshop on this topic at the International Conference on Global Software Engineering will bring together researchers from both these communities in a forum where they can discuss and explore similarities between both communities' research., Topics should have a global software development focus and include, but are not limited to:, *\tknowledge management within software engineering from a business perspective , *\tcollaboration and knowledge sharing , *\tknowledge discovery services and tools , *\tworkflows and decision making including experiences with Wiki support , *\tmethods and tools for managing knowledge , *\tarchitectural knowledge management practices , *\tskills management and transfer of knowledge , Paper Submission, Papers must be submitted electronically by email to Sarah Beecham, [log in to unmask], or, Ivan Mistrik, [log in to unmask], *\ttraceability,accountability and risks , *\tknowledge management in global software product line engineering , *\tautomated extraction,collection, and abstraction of knowledge from software archives , *\tapplications of ontologies , *\tempirical analysis of globally distributed development project performance , *\tknowledge management issues in agile and iterative approaches , *\tportals and services for knowledge management on the semantic web , *\tsoftware process simulation of emergent issues, Your paper must conform to the IEEE proceedings publication format(8.5" x 11",Two-Column Format) described at IEEE/CPS (http://www.computer.org/portal/site/cscps/menuitem.02df7cde46985ea21618fc2e6bcd45f3/index.jsp?&pName=cscps_level1&path=cscps/cps&file=cps_forms.xml&xsl=generic.xsl&) , Your paper should be no longer than 6 pages including all text,references, appendices, and figures, Your submissions should be in PDF format, submissions that exceed the page limit(6) or do not comply with the proceedings format will be desk rejected without review, The results described must not be under consideration for publication elsewhere, Conference details are available on www.icgse.org (http://www.icgse.org/) , Important Dates, Paper abstracts:\t March 15, 2010\t, Paper submissions:\t March 31, 2010\t, Notification of authors:\t April 23, 2010\t, Camera-ready papers due:\t May 28, 2010\t, Workshop:\t August 23, 2010] Knowledge Engineering in Global Software Development Workshop (KNOWING) {'March 15, 2010': 'paper abstracts: march 15, 2010 ', 'March 31, 2010': 'paper submissions: march 31, 2010 ', 'April 23, 2010': 'notification of authors: april 23, 2010 ', 'May 28, 2010': 'camera-ready papers due: may 28, 2010 ', 'August 23, 2010': 'workshop: august 23, 2010'}
72 1st International Workshop on Recent Trends in SOA Based Information Systems Funchal, Madeira, Portugal :::::::::::::::::::::::::: 2nd Annoucement ::::::::::::::::::::::::::\n\n 1st International Workshop on\n Recent Trends in SOA Based Information Systems\n\n========================================================\n\n in conjunction with the 12th International Conference\n on Enterprise Information Systems\n (http:// www.iceis.org/)\n Funchal, Madeira, Portugal\n\n\n\nThis is new Workshop joint to ICEIS 2010. Service Oriented Architecture is\nan architectural approach to designing, building, and deploying information\nsystems such that the system is created from simpler manageable building\nblocks, offering ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂservices.ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ Each service implements a discrete piece of\nbusiness functionality. These services can then be mixed and matched to\ncreate entirely new applications or to deliver new business capabilities.\nAs a concept, SOA is not new. It is a product of the evolution of IT\narchitecture and distributed computing concepts. However, it has only become\na reality over the last few years because of the emergence of standards and\nmaturation of supporting technology. The Internet has played a significant\nrole in the evolution of these standards, allowing (Web) services to\ninteroperate globally within and across the boundaries of large and small\norganizations. Without standards, it would be difficult for services to\ncommunicate and interact with each other. Consequently, the aforementioned\nsharing, reuse and combination of services to create business processes on\nan as-needed basis would not be possible.\nAt its core, service orientation is about aligning technology to efficiently\nand flexibly support the process and performance needs of the business.\nIt means a technology capability that:\nÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ Meets the process and performance needs of the business\nÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ Adapts quickly to changing business needs\nÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ Can incorporate new technologies to deliver new business capability\nUnder conventional approaches to building IT systems, an application typically\nsupports a pre-defined set of business requirements (such as sales orders or\naccounting). Whenever a new business need arises, organizations build or install\nnew applications. This is highly inefficient especially when the different\napplications perform similar tasks and share the same data. Hence, SOA provides\nboth IT flexibility and business agility.\nSOA is an industrial reality with projects and commercial offers. Moreover, related\nadvanced topics are numerous as : Cloud Computing, Grid, Green IT, Software as a\nService, Aspect Based Services, service based Multi Agent Systems ...\nThis first workshop on Recent Trends in SOA Based Information Systems provides\na forum for researchers and practitioners to present results, applications, and\nexperiences in software based on SOA and Web services. The organizing committee\nwelcomes high quality contributions that describe original and unpublished works\nin the field of services-based application engineering in terms of design, development,\ntesting, and deployment, Enterprise Service Bus ...\n\n\n===============================================================\n\nThe workshop welcomes three types of submissions:\n\n1. Full papers describing novel ideas on recent trends in aspects based\napplications at practical or theoretical levels. The maximum length of a full\npaper is 10 pages.\n2. Position papers describing work in progress or an authorÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢s position\nregarding the recent practice of software engineering for aspects based\napplications and/or its future trends. The maximum length of a position paper is 4 pages.\n3. Demo papers describing practical context-aware application/prototype.\nThe maximum length of a demo paper is 4 pages. It is expected that the authors\nof the paper will showcase their application in public.\nInstructions for preparing manuscripts (in Word and Latex format) are available at the ICSOFT web site. Papers should be submitted through the online submission system.\nAll papers will undergo a double-blind review and be selected on the basis of relevance, clarity and technical quality. At least one author should attend the workshop to present the paper.\nAll accepted papers will be published, under an ISBN reference, by INSTICC Press in the workshop proceedings. The workshop proceedings will be distributed to the participants in printed form at the registration desk.\nPublication of a selection of the workshop's best papers in a special issue of an international journal is under investigation.\n\n\n===================================================\n\nTopics of interests include, but are not limited to:\n\n\nSOA Architecture & Design\nService Modeling & BPM\nThe Business of Service-Orientation\nSOA Project Delivery & Methodology\nService Programming\nSOA Governance\nSOA Design Patterns & Service Engineering\nModern ESB & SOA Middleware\nInteractive Services & the Human Factor\nModel Driven Development\nOntologies\nFormal specifications and verification\nE-learning, Intelligent Tutoring Systems\nMulti Agent Systems based on services\nInteroperability\nMobility\nContext aware applications\nReal Time\nHuman Men Interface\nReal World SOA Case Studies, Industrial feed back\nSOA & Rest\nSoftware as a Service\nGreen IT\nSOA & Cloud Computing\nCloud Computing\nGRID\n\n\n===========================\n\nImportant dates:\n\nRegular Paper Submission: March 08, 2010\nAuthors Notification: April 06, 2010\nFinal Paper Submission and Registration: April 21, 2010\nWorkshop Dates: June 8-12, 2010\n\n\n==========================\n\nChairs\n\nWathiq Mansoor\nProfessor\nAmerica University in Dubai\nDubai, UAE\nwmansoor@aud.edu\n\n\nSaid Elnaffar\nProfessor\nAmerica University in Dubai\nDubai, UAE\n\nsaid.elnaffar@gmail.com\n (:, :, :, :, :, :, :, :, :, :, :, :, :, :, :, :, :, :, :, :, :, :, :, :, :, :, , 2nd, Annoucement, :, :, :, :, :, :, :, :, :, :, :, :, :, :, :, :, :, :, :, :, :, :, :, :, :, :, \n\n , 1st, International, Workshop, on, \n , Recent, Trends, in, SOA, Based, Information, Systems, \n\n, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, ...) Word [:::::::::::::::::::::::::: 2nd Annoucement ::::::::::::::::::::::::::, 1st International Workshop on, Recent Trends in SOA Based Information Systems, ========================================================, in conjunction with the 12th International Conference, on Enterprise Information Systems, (http:// www.iceis.org/), Funchal, Madeira, Portugal, This is new Workshop joint to ICEIS 2010, Service Oriented Architecture is, an architectural approach to designing, building, and deploying information, systems such that the system is created from simpler manageable building, blocks, offering ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ, ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂservices.ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ Each service implements a discrete piece of, business functionality, These services can then be mixed and matched to, create entirely new applications or to deliver new business capabilities., As a concept, SOA is not new, It is a product of the evolution of IT, architecture and distributed computing concepts, However, it has only become, a reality over the last few years because of the emergence of standards and, maturation of supporting technology, The Internet has played a significant, role in the evolution of these standards, allowing (Web) services to, interoperate globally within and across the boundaries of large and small, organizations, Without standards, it would be difficult for services to, communicate and interact with each other, Consequently, the aforementioned, sharing, reuse and combination of services to create business processes on, an as-needed basis would not be possible., At its core, service orientation is about aligning technology to efficiently, and flexibly support the process and performance needs of the business., It means a technology capability that:, ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ Meets the process and performance needs of the business, ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ Adapts quickly to changing business needs, ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ Can incorporate new technologies to deliver new business capability, Under conventional approaches to building IT systems, an application typically, supports a pre-defined set of business requirements (such as sales orders or, accounting), Whenever a new business need arises, organizations build or install, new applications, This is highly inefficient especially when the different, applications perform similar tasks and share the same data, Hence, SOA provides, both IT flexibility and business agility., SOA is an industrial reality with projects and commercial offers, Moreover, related, advanced topics are numerous as : Cloud Computing, Grid, Green IT, Software as a, Service, Aspect Based Services, service based Multi Agent Systems ..., This first workshop on Recent Trends in SOA Based Information Systems provides, a forum for researchers and practitioners to present results, applications, and, experiences in software based on SOA and Web services, The organizing committee, welcomes high quality contributions that describe original and unpublished works, in the field of services-based application engineering in terms of design, development,, testing, and deployment, Enterprise Service Bus ..., ===============================================================, The workshop welcomes three types of submissions:, 1, Full papers describing novel ideas on recent trends in aspects based, applications at practical or theoretical levels, The maximum length of a full, paper is 10 pages., 2, Position papers describing work in progress or an authorÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢s position, regarding the recent practice of software engineering for aspects based, applications and/or its future trends, The maximum length of a position paper is 4 pages., 3, Demo papers describing practical context-aware application/prototype., The maximum length of a demo paper is 4 pages, It is expected that the authors, of the paper will showcase their application in public., Instructions for preparing manuscripts (in Word and Latex format) are available at the ICSOFT web site, Papers should be submitted through the online submission system., All papers will undergo a double-blind review and be selected on the basis of relevance, clarity and technical quality, At least one author should attend the workshop to present the paper., All accepted papers will be published, under an ISBN reference, by INSTICC Press in the workshop proceedings, The workshop proceedings will be distributed to the participants in printed form at the registration desk., Publication of a selection of the workshop's best papers in a special issue of an international journal is under investigation., ===================================================, Topics of interests include, but are not limited to:, SOA Architecture & Design, Service Modeling & BPM, The Business of Service-Orientation, SOA Project Delivery & Methodology, Service Programming, SOA Governance, SOA Design Patterns & Service Engineering, Modern ESB & SOA Middleware, Interactive Services & the Human Factor, Model Driven Development, Ontologies, Formal specifications and verification, E-learning, Intelligent Tutoring Systems, Multi Agent Systems based on services, Interoperability, Mobility, ...] 1st International Workshop on Recent Trends in SOA Based Information Systems {'March 08, 2010': 'regular paper submission: march 08, 2010', 'April 06, 2010': 'authors notification: april 06, 2010', 'April 21, 2010': 'final paper submission and registration: april 21, 2010', 'June 8-12, 2010': 'workshop dates: june 8-12, 2010'}
73 5th International ICST Conference on Access Networks Budapest, Hungary CALL FOR PAPERS\r\n\r\nSPONSORS\r\n\r\nSponsored by ICST\r\nTechnically co-sponsored by CREATE-NET\r\n\r\n***\r\n\r\nSCOPE\r\n\r\nWith the rapid growth of the Internet as well as the increasing demand for broadband services, access networks have been receiving growing investments in recent years. This has led to a massive network deployment with the goal of eliminating the bandwidth bottleneck between end-users and the network core. Today many diverse technologies are being used to provide broadband access to end users. The architecture and performance of the access segment (local loop, wired and wireless access networks, and even home networks) are getting increasing attention for ensuring quality of service of diverse broadband applications. Moreover, most access lines will no longer terminate on a single device, thus leading to the necessity of having a home network designed for applications that transcend simple Internet access sharing among multiple personal computers and enable multimedia support. Therefore, the access network and its home portion have become a hot investment pool from both a financial as well as a research perspective.\r\n\r\nThe aim of the annual International Conference on Access Networks (ACCESSNETS) is to provide a forum that brings together scientists and researchers from academia, as well as managers and engineers from the industry and government organizations to meet and exchange ideas and recent work on all aspects of access networks and how they integrate with their in-home counterparts. ACCESSNETS 2010 is the fifth edition of this exciting event, which will be held in Budapest, Hungary, on 3-5 November 2010. The conference will consist of technical sessions, industry track, workshops and panels. The technical sessions will present original and fundamental research advances while the industry track, workshops and panels will focus on development, application and related business issues in this hot and exciting area.\r\n\r\n***\r\n\r\nTOPICS\r\n\r\nThe conference solicits original technical papers that were not previously published and are not currently under review for publication elsewhere. Topics of interest include but are not limited to:\r\n\r\n * Autonomy in access networks\r\n * Cable-based access technology\r\n * Cross-layer design\r\n * Deployment/standardization statuses\r\n * Digital satellite access technology\r\n * Dynamic spectrum access networks\r\n * FTTx and PON technologies\r\n * Green aspects of access networks\r\n * Home networks\r\n * Hybrid fiber coaxial (HFC) technology\r\n * Hybrid wired/wireless LANs\r\n * Integrated wired/wireless networks\r\n * Long reach Ethernet\r\n * Management issues in access networks\r\n * Medium access control\r\n * MIMO techniques\r\n * Municipal and community networks\r\n * Network architectures and protocols\r\n * Network scalability and upgradeability\r\n * Network survivability and security\r\n * Networked appliances\r\n * OFDM, OFDMA, CDMA techniques\r\n * Powerline communication technology\r\n * Quality of service provisioning\r\n * Service convergence\r\n * WiFi and WiMax networks\r\n * Wireless mesh networks\r\n * xDSL technology and DSM \r\n\r\n\r\n***\r\n\r\nWORKSHOPS\r\n\r\nWe solicit workshop proposals on new and emerging topics in wired and wireless access networks, services, and applications. A proposal should focus on a specific theme of current interest and can attract high-quality submissions. Proposals for one-day workshops to be held in conjunction with the conference are solicited. To propose a workshop or discuss ideas, please visit http://accessnets.org/cfw.shtml.\r\n\r\n***\r\n\r\nPUBLICATION\r\n\r\nAccepted papers will appear in the Lecture Notes of the Institute for Computer Sciences, Social Informatics and Telecommunications Engineering (LNICST) series.\r\n\r\n***\r\n\r\nSUBMISSION\r\n\r\nDetailed submission guidelines are available at http://accessnets.org/submission.shtml\r\n\r\n***\r\n\r\nIMPORTANT DATES\r\n\r\nPapers due: 2 May 2010\r\nNotification of paper acceptance: 4 July 2010\r\nSubmission of camera-ready papers: 31 August 2010\r\nSubmission of workshop proposals: 14 March 2010\r\n\r\n***\r\n\r\nORGANIZING COMMITTEE\r\n\r\nGeneral Chair\r\nGyula Sallai, Scientific Association for Infocommunications, Hungary\r\n\r\nConference Vice Chair\r\nRobert Szabo, Budapest University of Technology and Economics, Hungary\r\n \r\nTechnical Program Co-Chairs\r\nHua Zhu, ArgonST, Network Systems, USA\r\nSandor Imre, Budapest University of Technology and Economics, Hungary\r\n\r\nFor a complete list of committee and board members, please visit http://accessnets.org/committees.shtml (CALL, FOR, PAPERS, \r\n\r\n, SPONSORS, \r\n\r\n, Sponsored, by, ICST, \r\n, Technically, co, -, sponsored, by, CREATE, -, NET, \r\n\r\n, *, *, *, \r\n\r\n, SCOPE, \r\n\r\n, With, the, rapid, growth, of, the, Internet, as, well, as, the, increasing, demand, for, broadband, services, ,, access, networks, have, been, receiving, growing, investments, in, recent, years, ., This, has, led, to, a, massive, network, deployment, with, the, goal, of, eliminating, the, bandwidth, bottleneck, between, end, -, users, and, the, network, core, ., Today, many, diverse, technologies, are, being, used, to, provide, broadband, access, to, end, users, ., The, architecture, and, performance, of, the, access, ...) Budapest [CALL FOR PAPERS, SPONSORS, Sponsored by ICST, Technically co-sponsored by CREATE-NET, ***, SCOPE, With the rapid growth of the Internet as well as the increasing demand for broadband services, access networks have been receiving growing investments in recent years, This has led to a massive network deployment with the goal of eliminating the bandwidth bottleneck between end-users and the network core, Today many diverse technologies are being used to provide broadband access to end users, The architecture and performance of the access segment (local loop, wired and wireless access networks, and even home networks) are getting increasing attention for ensuring quality of service of diverse broadband applications, Moreover, most access lines will no longer terminate on a single device, thus leading to the necessity of having a home network designed for applications that transcend simple Internet access sharing among multiple personal computers and enable multimedia support, Therefore, the access network and its home portion have become a hot investment pool from both a financial as well as a research perspective., The aim of the annual International Conference on Access Networks (ACCESSNETS) is to provide a forum that brings together scientists and researchers from academia, as well as managers and engineers from the industry and government organizations to meet and exchange ideas and recent work on all aspects of access networks and how they integrate with their in-home counterparts, ACCESSNETS 2010 is the fifth edition of this exciting event, which will be held in Budapest, Hungary, on 3-5 November 2010, The conference will consist of technical sessions, industry track, workshops and panels, The technical sessions will present original and fundamental research advances while the industry track, workshops and panels will focus on development, application and related business issues in this hot and exciting area., ***, TOPICS, The conference solicits original technical papers that were not previously published and are not currently under review for publication elsewhere, Topics of interest include but are not limited to:, * Autonomy in access networks, * Cable-based access technology, * Cross-layer design, * Deployment/standardization statuses, * Digital satellite access technology, * Dynamic spectrum access networks, * FTTx and PON technologies, * Green aspects of access networks, * Home networks, * Hybrid fiber coaxial (HFC) technology, * Hybrid wired/wireless LANs, * Integrated wired/wireless networks, * Long reach Ethernet, * Management issues in access networks, * Medium access control, * MIMO techniques, * Municipal and community networks, * Network architectures and protocols, * Network scalability and upgradeability, * Network survivability and security, * Networked appliances, * OFDM, OFDMA, CDMA techniques, * Powerline communication technology, * Quality of service provisioning, * Service convergence, * WiFi and WiMax networks, * Wireless mesh networks, * xDSL technology and DSM , ***, WORKSHOPS, We solicit workshop proposals on new and emerging topics in wired and wireless access networks, services, and applications, A proposal should focus on a specific theme of current interest and can attract high-quality submissions, Proposals for one-day workshops to be held in conjunction with the conference are solicited, To propose a workshop or discuss ideas, please visit http://accessnets.org/cfw.shtml., ***, PUBLICATION, Accepted papers will appear in the Lecture Notes of the Institute for Computer Sciences, Social Informatics and Telecommunications Engineering (LNICST) series., ***, SUBMISSION, Detailed submission guidelines are available at http://accessnets.org/submission.shtml, ***, IMPORTANT DATES, Papers due: 2 May 2010, Notification of paper acceptance: 4 July 2010, Submission of camera-ready papers: 31 August 2010, Submission of workshop proposals: 14 March 2010, ***, ORGANIZING COMMITTEE, General Chair, Gyula Sallai, Scientific Association for Infocommunications, Hungary, Conference Vice Chair, Robert Szabo, Budapest University of Technology and Economics, Hungary, , Technical Program Co-Chairs, Hua Zhu, ArgonST, Network Systems, USA, Sandor Imre, Budapest University of Technology and Economics, Hungary, For a complete list of committee and board members, please visit http://accessnets.org/committees.shtml] The conference will consist of technical sessions, industry track, workshops and panels {'3-5 November 2010': 'accessnets 2010 is the fifth edition of this exciting event, which will be held in budapest, hungary, on 3-5 november 2010', 'May 2010': 'papers due: 2 may 2010', '4 July 2010': 'notification of paper acceptance: 4 july 2010', '31 August 2010': 'submission of camera-ready papers: 31 august 2010', '14 March 2010': 'submission of workshop proposals: 14 march 2010'}
74 3rd International ICST Conference on Forensic Applications and Techniques in Telecommunications, Information and Multimedia Shanghai, China CALL FOR PAPERS\r\n\r\n\r\nSPONSORS\r\n\r\nSponsored by ICST\r\nTechnically co-sponsored by CREATE-NET and Shanghai Jiao Tong University\r\n\r\n\r\n***\r\n\r\nSCOPE\r\n\r\nOur society has entered an era where commercial activities, business transactions and government services have been, and more and more of them will be, conducted and offered over open networks such as the Internet. It has led to new opportunities for criminals and new challenges for law enforcement. For instance, Voice over IP raises significant challenges for call intercept and route tracing; information systems are becoming overwhelmingly large and the challenge of information source identification requires new sophisticated tools; consumer multimedia devices are increasingly becoming the tools to create potentially illegal content. At the same time, the scientific gathering and investigation of evidence at a crime scene push towards a variety of fascinating digital techniques.\r\n\r\nElectronic telecommunications, information technology, consumer devices and sophisticated software are creating new opportunities for both criminals and forensic investigators. This conference aims to bring together the research contributions in the development of tools and techniques that assist in the investigation of potentially illegal activity associated with electronic communication and electronic devices. It will also investigative the practice and requirements for presentation of evidence in court. This might include the discovery, analysis, handling and storage of digital evidence, meeting the legal burden of proof, and the establishment of the forensic chain of evidence.\r\n\r\n\r\n***\r\n\r\nTOPICS\r\n\r\nTechnical papers describing original, previously unpublished research, not currently under review by another conference or journal, are solicited. Topics of interest include, but are not limited to, the following:\r\n\r\n * Digital evidence gathering, storage and handling protocols\r\n * Records tracing and data mining\r\n * Fraud management in commercial transactions\r\n * Device forensics\r\n * Techniques for addressing identity theft\r\n * Data carving\r\n * Content filtering\r\n * Geo-location techniques for cellular, ad-hoc, wireless and IP network communications\r\n * Distributed data association across massive, disparate database systems\r\n * Multimedia source identification\r\n * Image tamper identification\r\n * Image association and recognition\r\n * Motion analysis\r\n * Voice analysis\r\n * VoIP call tracing and intercept\r\n * Watermarking and applications\r\n * Cryptographic techniques in digital forensics\r\n\r\nGeneral papers on IT security will be considered where there is a clear application to the underlying topic of forensic investigation.\r\n\r\n***\r\n\r\nPUBLICATION\r\n\r\nAll accepted papers will be included in the printed and electronic E-Forensics 2010 Conference Proceedings to be published by Springer in the Lecture Notes of ICST (LNICST) series and reviewed for indexing by Engineering Information (EI).\r\n\r\n***\r\n\r\nSUBMISSION\r\n\r\nPaper submission will be handled electronically. Authors should prepare an Adobe Acrobat PDF version of their full paper. All submitted papers will be subject to a rigorous peer- review. Papers must be formatted using the Springer LNICST Authors Kit and submitted only through the ASSYST conference management system. Papers must not exceed the limit of 15 pages including text, figures and references. The font size must be at least 10 points. Please visit the Submission page for detailed submission requirements and procedures: http://www.e-forensics.eu/2010/submission.shtml\r\n\r\n***\r\n\r\nIMPORTANT DATES\r\n\r\nPaper submission deadline: 1 April 2010\r\nNotification of acceptance: 1 June 2010\r\nCamera-ready deadline: 1 August 2010\r\n\r\n***\r\n\r\nPANELS / WORKSHOPS / TUTORIALS\r\n\r\nProposals for panels/workshops/tutorials are solicited. Potential organizers are welcome to submit a proposal to the Technical Program Committee Chair or the General Chair.\r\n\r\nWorkshop proposal submission deadline: 1 February 2010\r\nWorkshop proposal notification of acceptance: 6 February 2010\r\n\r\n***\r\n\r\nORGANIZING COMMITTEE\r\n\r\nGeneral Chair\r\nDawu Gu, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, China\r\n\r\nTechnical Program Committee Chair\r\nXuejia Lai, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, China\r\n\r\nFor a complete list of committee and board members, please visit http://www.e-forensics.eu/2010/organizingcommittee.shtml (CALL, FOR, PAPERS, \r\n\r\n\r\n, SPONSORS, \r\n\r\n, Sponsored, by, ICST, \r\n, Technically, co, -, sponsored, by, CREATE, -, NET, and, Shanghai, Jiao, Tong, University, \r\n\r\n\r\n, *, *, *, \r\n\r\n, SCOPE, \r\n\r\n, Our, society, has, entered, an, era, where, commercial, activities, ,, business, transactions, and, government, services, have, been, ,, and, more, and, more, of, them, will, be, ,, conducted, and, offered, over, open, networks, such, as, the, Internet, ., It, has, led, to, new, opportunities, for, criminals, and, new, challenges, for, law, enforcement, ., For, instance, ,, Voice, over, IP, raises, significant, challenges, for, call, intercept, and, route, tracing, ;, information, ...) China [CALL FOR PAPERS, SPONSORS, Sponsored by ICST, Technically co-sponsored by CREATE-NET and Shanghai Jiao Tong University, ***, SCOPE, Our society has entered an era where commercial activities, business transactions and government services have been, and more and more of them will be, conducted and offered over open networks such as the Internet, It has led to new opportunities for criminals and new challenges for law enforcement, For instance, Voice over IP raises significant challenges for call intercept and route tracing; information systems are becoming overwhelmingly large and the challenge of information source identification requires new sophisticated tools; consumer multimedia devices are increasingly becoming the tools to create potentially illegal content, At the same time, the scientific gathering and investigation of evidence at a crime scene push towards a variety of fascinating digital techniques., Electronic telecommunications, information technology, consumer devices and sophisticated software are creating new opportunities for both criminals and forensic investigators, This conference aims to bring together the research contributions in the development of tools and techniques that assist in the investigation of potentially illegal activity associated with electronic communication and electronic devices, It will also investigative the practice and requirements for presentation of evidence in court, This might include the discovery, analysis, handling and storage of digital evidence, meeting the legal burden of proof, and the establishment of the forensic chain of evidence., ***, TOPICS, Technical papers describing original, previously unpublished research, not currently under review by another conference or journal, are solicited, Topics of interest include, but are not limited to, the following:, * Digital evidence gathering, storage and handling protocols, * Records tracing and data mining, * Fraud management in commercial transactions, * Device forensics, * Techniques for addressing identity theft, * Data carving, * Content filtering, * Geo-location techniques for cellular, ad-hoc, wireless and IP network 75 Cognitive Aspects of the Lexicon Beijing, China First Call for Papers\n\nCognitive Aspects of the Lexicon Workshop\n2nd SIGLEX endorsed COLING Workshop (August 22, 2010, Beijing) \n\n\nSubmission deadline: May 30, 2010\n\n================================================================================\n\nAIMS and TARGET AUDIENCE\n\nThe aim of this workshop is to bring together researchers involved in the construction and application of electronic dictionaries to discuss modifications of existing resources in line with the users' needs, thereby fully exploiting the advantages of the digital form. Given the breadth of the questions, we welcome reports on work from many perspectives, including but not limited to: computational lexicography, psycholinguistics, cognitive psychology, language learning and ergonomics.\n\n\nMOTIVATION\n\nWhenever we read a book, write a letter or launch a query on a search engine, we always use words, the shorthand labels and concrete forms of abstract notions (concepts, ideas and more or less well specified thoughts). Yet, words are not only vehicles to express thoughts, they are also means to conceive them. They are mediators between language and thought, allowing us to move quickly from one idea to another, refining, expanding or illustrating our possibly underspecified thoughts. Only words have these unique capabilities, which is why they are so important.\n\nObviously, a good dictionary should contain many entries and a lot of information associated with each one of them. Yet, the quality of a dictionary depends not only on coverage, but also on accessibility of information. Access strategies vary with the task (text understanding vs. text production) and the knowledge available at the moment of consultation (word, concept, speech sounds). Unlike readers who look for meanings, writers start from them, searching for the corresponding words. While paper dictionaries are static, permitting only limited strategies for accessing information, their electronic counterparts promise dynamic, proactive search via multiple criteria (meaning, sound, related words) and via diverse access routes. Navigation takes place in a huge conceptual lexical space, and the results are displayable in a multitude of forms (e.g. as trees, as lists, as graphs, or sorted alphabetically, by topic, by frequency).\n\nMany lexicographers work nowadays with huge digital corpora, using language technology to build and to maintain the lexicon. But access to the potential wealth of information in dictionaries remains limited for the common user. Yet, the new possibilities of electronic media in terms of comfort, speed and flexibility (multiple inputs, polyform outputs) are enormous. Computational resources are not prone to the same limitations as paperbound dictionaries. The latter were limited in scope, being confined to a specific task (translation, synonyms, ...) due to economical reasons, but this limitation is not justified anymore.\n\nToday we can perform all tasks via one single resource, which may comprise a dictionary, a thesaurus and even more. The goal of this workshop is to perform the groundwork for the next generation of electronic dictionaries, that is, to study the possibility of integrating the different resources, as well as to explore the feasibility of taking the user's needs, knowledge and access strategies into account.\n\n\nTOPICS\n\nFor this workshop we invite papers including but not limited to the following topics:\n\n Conceptual input of a dictionary user. What is in the authors' minds when they are generating a message and looking for a word? Do they start from partial definitions, i.e. underspecified input (bag of words), conceptual primitives, semantically related words, something akin to synsets, or something completely different? What does it take to bridge the gap between this input, incomplete as it may be, and the desired output (target word)?\n\n Organizing the lexicon and indexing words. Concepts, words and multi-word expressions can be organized and indexed in many ways, depending on the task and language type. For example, in Indo-European languages words are traditionally organized in alphabetical order, whereas in Chinese they are organized by semantic radicals and stroke counts. The way words and multi-word expressions are stored and organized affects indexing and access. Since knowledge states (i.e. knowledge available when initiating search) vary greatly and in unpredictable ways, indexing must allow for multiple ways of navigation and access. Hence the question: what organizational principles allow the greatest flexibility for access?\n\n NLP applications: Contributors can also demonstrate how such enhanced dictionaries, once embedded in existing NLP applications, can boost performance and help solve lexical and textual-entailment problems, such as those evaluated in SEMEVAL 2007, or, more generally, generation problems encountered in the context of summarization, question-answering, interactive paraphrasing or translation.\n\n\n\nIMPORTANT DATES\n\n * Deadline for paper submissions: May 30, 2010\n * Notification of acceptance: June 30, 2010\n * Camera-ready papers due: July 10, 2010\n * Cogalex workshop: August 22, 2010\n\n\n\nSUBMISSION INSTRUCTIONS\n\nAuthors are invited to submit original, unpublished work on any of the topic areas of the workshop. As reviewing will be blind, the paper should not include the authors' names and affiliations. Furthermore, self-references revealing the authors' identity, should be avoided. Further details concerning the paper submission will be announced closer to the May 30 submission deadline.\n\n\nRELATED CONFERENCES in BEIJING\n\nNext to COLING 2010 there are two conferences workshop participants may be interested in:\n\n The 7th International Conference on Cognitive Science (ICCS) which takes place August 17 to 20, 2010, just before COLING. It is our hope that this unique opportunity will foster scientific exchange between the scientific communities of Computational Linguistics and Cognitive Science. The ICCS' venue is the China National Convention Center (CNCC) which is close to COLING's site, the Beijing International Convention Center (BICC), located on the other side of the China National Stadium ('Bird Nest').\n\n\nPROGRAM COMMITTEE\n\n - Slaven Bilac (Google Tokyo, Japan)\n - Pierrette Bouillon (ISSCO, Geneva, Switzerland)\n - Dan Cristea (University of Iasi, Romania)\n - Katrin Erk (University of Texas, USA)\n - Olivier Ferret (CEA LIST, France)\n - Thierry Fontenelle (EU Translation Centre, Luxemburg)\n - Sylviane Granger (Universite Catholique de Louvain, Belgium)\n - Gregory Grefenstette (Exalead, Paris, France)\n - Ulrich Heid (IMS, University of Stuttgart, Germany)\n - Erhard Hinrichs (University of Tuebingen, Germany)\n - Graeme Hirst (University of Toronto, Canada)\n - Ed Hovy (ISI, University of Southern California, Los Angeles, USA)\n - Chu-Ren Huang (Hongkong Polytechnic University, China)\n - Terry Joyce (Tama University, Kanagawa-ken, Japan)\n - Philippe Langlais (DIRO/RALI, University of Montreal, Canada)\n - Marie Claude L'Homme (University of Montreal, Canada)\n - Verginica Mititelu (RACAI, Bucharest, Romania)\n - Alain Polguere (Nancy-Universite & ATILF CNRS, France)\n - Reinhard Rapp (University of Tarragona, Spain)\n - Sabine Schulte im Walde (University of Stuttgart, Germany)\n - Gilles Serasset (IMAG, Grenoble, France)\n - Serge Sharoff (University of Leeds, UK)\n - Anna Sinopalnikova (FIT, BUT, Brno, Czech Republic)\n - Carole Tiberius (Institute for Dutch Lexicology, The Netherlands)\n - Takenobu Tokunaga (TITECH, Tokyo, Japan)\n\nWEBSITE, WORKSHOP ORGANIZERS and CONTACT PERSONS\n\n * http://pageperso.lif.univ-mrs.fr/~michael.zock/cogalex-2.html\n\n * Michael Zock (LIF-CNRS, Marseille, France), michael.zock AT lif.univ-mrs.fr\n * Reinhard Rapp (University of Tarragona, Spain), reinhard.rapp AT urv.cat\n\nWeb: \nhttp://www.lif.univ-mrs.fr/spip.php?article268\n (First, Call, for, Papers, \n\n, Cognitive, Aspects, of, the, Lexicon, Workshop, \n, 2nd, SIGLEX, endorsed, COLING, Workshop, (, August, 22, ,, 2010, ,, Beijing, ), \n\n\n, Submission, deadline, :, May, 30, ,, 2010, \n\n, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, ...) Beijing [First Call for Papers, Cognitive Aspects of the Lexicon Workshop, 2nd SIGLEX endorsed COLING Workshop (August 22, 2010, Beijing) , Submission deadline: May 30, 2010, application of electronic dictionaries to discuss modifications of existing resources in line with the users' needs, thereby fully exploiting the advantages of the digital form, Given the breadth of the questions, we welcome reports on work from many perspectives, including but not limited to: computational lexicography, psycholinguistics, cognitive psychology, language learning and ergonomics., less well specified thoughts), Yet, words are not only vehicles to express thoughts, they are also means to conceive them, They are mediators between language and thought, allowing us to move quickly from one idea to another, refining, expanding or illustrating our possibly underspecified thoughts, Only words have these unique capabilities, which is why they are so important., Obviously, a good dictionary should contain many entries and a lot of information associated with each one of them, Yet, the quality of a dictionary depends not only on coverage, but also on accessibility of information, Access strategies vary with the task (text understanding vs, text production) and the knowledge available at the moment of consultation (word, concept, speech sounds), Unlike readers who look for meanings, writers start from them, searching for the corresponding words, While paper dictionaries are static, permitting only limited strategies for accessing information, their electronic electronic media in terms of comfort, speed and flexibility (multiple inputs, polyform outputs) are enormous, Computational resources are not prone to the same limitations as paperbound dictionaries, The latter were limited in scope, being confined to a specific task (translation, synonyms, ...) due to economical reasons, but this limitation is not justified anymore., Today we can perform all tasks via one single resource, which may comprise a dictionary, a thesaurus and even more, The goal of this workshop is to perform the groundwork for the next generation of electronic dictionaries, that is, to study the possibility of integrating the different resources, as well as to explore the feasibility of taking the user's needs, knowledge and access strategies into account., TOPICS, For for a word? 76 Annual Conference of the Prognostics and Health Management Society Portland, USA The Annual Conference of the Prognostics and Health Management Society will take place in Portland, Oregon on October 10-14, 2010. The 2010 conference is going to be colocated with the 21st Annual Workshop on the Principles of Diagnosis (DX'10). DX'10 will run from October 13 to October 16. The Call for Papers may be downloaded here.\n\nImportant dates:\n\nFull papers due: May 24, 2010\nReview results back: July 12, 2010\nFinal papers due: August 23, 2010\nWorkshop dates: October 10-14, 2010 (The, Annual, Conference, of, the, Prognostics, and, Health, Management, Society, will, take, place, in, Portland, ,, Oregon, on, October, 10, -, 14, ,, 2010, ., The, 2010, conference, is, going, to, be, colocated, with, the, 21st, Annual, Workshop, on, the, Principles, of, Diagnosis, (, DX'10, ), ., DX'10, will, run, from, October, 13, to, October, 16, ., The, Call, for, Papers, may, be, downloaded, here, ., \n\n, Important, dates, :, \n\n, Full, papers, due, :, May, 24, ,, 2010, \n, Review, results, back, :, July, 12, ,, 2010, \n, Final, papers, due, :, August, 23, ,, 2010, \n, Workshop, dates, ...) 77 Third Workshop on Transforming and Weaving OWL Ontologies in MDE/MDA Malaga, Spain ======================================================================\r\n\r\n Third Workshop on\r\n Transforming and Weaving OWL Ontologies in MDE/MDA\r\n\r\n TWOMDE 2010\r\n\r\n CALL FOR PAPERS\r\n\r\n at TOOLS 2010 federated conferences, Malaga, Spain\r\n\r\n http://www.uni-koblenz.de/confsec/twomde2010/\r\n\r\n IMPORTANT DATES\r\n -----------------------------\r\n * April 15, 2010: Papers submission\r\n * May 14, 2010: Author notification\r\n * May 31, 2010: Submission of camera-ready papers\r\n * June 30, 2010: Workshop day\r\n ======================================================================\r\n\r\n\r\nAIMS AND SCOPE\r\n-----------------------------\r\n\r\nAs model-driven engineering (MDE) spreads, disciplines like model transformation, domain specific languages (DSLs) and traceability become essential in order to support different kinds of models in an model-driven environment. Understanding the role of ontology technologies like knowledge representation, automated reasoning, dynamic classification and consistency checking in these fields is crucial to leverage the development of such disciplines. Thus, we highlight the following open questions: How can the scientific and technical results around ontologies, ontology languages and their corresponding reasoning technologies be used fruitfully in MDE? What is the role of ontologies in supporting model transformation or traceability? How can ontologies improve designing DSLs? Are current query languages able to query both kinds of models? \r\n\r\nDiscussions about these and related questions will be supported by this workshop. TWOMDE2010 aims at providing a forum for discussing the application of different aspects of ontologies to enhance model-driven engineering.\r\n\r\nThe intended audience embraces members of the modeling community with experience or interest in model-driven engineering and in Knowledge Representation. Specifically, but not only, the participation of experts in technologies related with UML, MOF, ATL, QVT, RDF or OWL is highly welcome.\r\n\r\n\r\nTOPICS OF INTEREST\r\n-----------------------------\r\n\r\nTWOMDE2010 is the exclusive forum at a MDE conference to address the application of ontologies in model-driven development. The potential of this field has just started being explored.\r\n\r\nFor this edition, we expect use cases in a wider range of topics. Topics of interest are but not exclusive:\r\n\r\n * RDF metamodel repository: interfaces and models to store, retrieve, query and manage MOF/Ecore metadata in RDF stores.\r\n\r\n * Reasoning over MOF-based models using ontologies: verification and validation of models using ontologies; application of Description Logics reasoning in UML diagrams or MOF/Ecore models, in order to enhance and to support models and metamodels at design time as well as at runtime.\r\n\r\n * Application of ontologies in model transformation: usage of ontologies and reasoning to automatically generate model transformations; validation of model transformations; use of reasoning in model transformation rules.\r\n\r\n * Reasoning and query languages for integrated models: development or integration of query languages able to retrieve objects of MOF-based models and OWL-based models; reasoning approaches or algorithms regarding both semantics of Description Logics semantics of and MOF-based models.\r\n\r\n * Integration of modeling standards and metamodeling of ontology technologies: integration approaches like aspect-oriented programming to weave modeling standards like MOF, Ecore, UML, OCL, ODM, and SWRL; development, improvement or integration of metamodels for ontology technologies, for example, OWL, SWRL, F-Logic.\r\n\r\n * Ontology driven software development: ontology support to web service orchestration; software architectures and methodologies for developing semantic web services and agents; reuse of web service ontologies or application of reasoning in specifying execution logics of orchestration.\r\n\r\n * MDE tools using ontologies: implementations of MDE tools relying on ontologies or on reasoning services.\r\n\r\n * Semantic support to Domain Specific Languages: integration of metamodeling and ontologies in order to provide abstract syntax and formal semantics for DSL.\r\n\r\n * Ontology engineering with MDA/MDE techniques: application of MDA/MDE techniques in order to support ontology engineering activities like ontology pruning, ontology refactoring, or ontology measurement.\r\n\r\n * Ontology connectors to system models: methods and techniques for integrating ontology constructs like classes and properties with MOF-based constructs like classes, properties or operations.\r\n\r\n * Application of Ontologies in traceability and provenance: usage of model annotations, ontologies and reasoning in order to improve traceability between MOF-based models.\r\n\r\n\r\nSUBMISSION\r\n-----------------------------\r\n\r\n * Full Papers: describe concrete contributions validated by appropriate evaluation. Full paper submissions must not exceed 15 pages.\r\n\r\n * Short Papers: comprehend research-in-progress, industrial experience and position papers. Short paper submissions do not exceed 6 pages.\r\n\r\n * Posters and Demos: authors are invited to submit a three-page paper describing tools involving ontologies in MDE.\r\n\r\nAll papers must be submitted online using the submission website (http://www.easychair.org/conferences/?conf=twomde2010). Submissions must be in PDF, formatted in the style of the Springer Publications format for Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS).\r\n\r\n\r\nPROCEEDINGS\r\n-----------------------------\r\n\r\nFinal versions of accepted papers will be published electronically in the CEUR Workshop Proceedings Series. \r\n\r\n\r\nORGANIZATION\r\n-----------------------------\r\n\r\n * Fernando Silva Parreiras (DE), University of Koblenz-Landau\r\n * Jeff Z. Pan (GB), University of Aberdeen\r\n * Uwe Assmann (DE), Dresden University of Technology\r\n\r\n\r\nTENTATIVE PROGRAM COMMITTEE\r\n-----------------------------\r\n\r\n * Alexander Paar (DE), University of Karlsruhe (TH)\r\n * Andreas Winter (DE), University of Oldenburg\r\n * Bernhard Rumpe (DE), RWTH Aachen University\r\n * Christian Kop (AT), Alpen-Adria-UniversitÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¤t LuÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ­s Ferreira Pires (NL), University of Twente\r\n * Peter Haase (DE), University of Karlsruhe (TH)\r\n * Saartje Brockmans (DE), Ontoprise\r\n * Steffen Staab (DE), University of Koblenz-Landau\r\n *
