conferences, ,, Malaga, ,, ...) Malaga [======================================================================, Third Workshop on, Transforming and Weaving OWL Ontologies in MDE/MDA, TWOMDE 2010, CALL FOR PAPERS, at TOOLS 2010 federated conferences, Malaga, Spain, http://www.uni-koblenz.de/confsec/twomde2010/, IMPORTANT DATES, -----------------------------, * April 15, 2010: Papers submission, * May 14, 2010: Author notification, * May 31, 2010: Submission of camera-ready papers, * June 30, 2010: Workshop day, ======================================================================, AIMS AND SCOPE, -----------------------------, As model-driven engineering (MDE) spreads, disciplines like model transformation, domain specific languages (DSLs) and traceability become essential in order to support different kinds of models in an model-driven environment, Understanding the role of ontology technologies like knowledge representation, automated reasoning, dynamic classification and consistency checking in these fields is crucial to leverage the development of such disciplines, Thus, we highlight the following open questions: How can the scientific and technical results around ontologies, ontology languages and their corresponding reasoning technologies be used fruitfully in MDE? What is the role of ontologies in supporting model transformation or traceability? How can ontologies improve designing DSLs? Are current query languages able to query both kinds of models? , Discussions about these and related questions will be supported by this workshop, TWOMDE2010 aims at providing a forum for discussing the application of different aspects of ontologies to enhance model-driven engineering., The intended audience embraces members of the modeling community with experience or interest in model-driven engineering and in Knowledge Representation, Specifically, but not only, the participation of experts in technologies related with UML, MOF, ATL, QVT, RDF or OWL is highly welcome., TOPICS OF INTEREST, -----------------------------, TWOMDE2010 is the exclusive forum at a MDE conference to address the application of ontologies in model-driven development, The potential of this field has just started being explored., For this edition, we expect use cases in a wider range of topics, Topics of interest are but not exclusive:, * RDF metamodel repository: interfaces and models to store, retrieve, query and manage MOF/Ecore metadata in RDF stores., * Reasoning over MOF-based models using ontologies: verification and validation of models using ontologies; application of Description Logics reasoning in UML diagrams or MOF/Ecore models, in order to enhance and to support models and metamodels at design time as well as at runtime., * Application of ontologies in model transformation: usage of ontologies and reasoning to automatically generate model transformations; validation of model transformations; use of reasoning in model transformation rules., * Reasoning and query languages for integrated models: development or integration of query languages able to retrieve objects of MOF-based models and OWL-based models; reasoning approaches or algorithms regarding both semantics of Description Logics semantics of and MOF-based models., * Integration of modeling standards and metamodeling of ontology technologies: integration approaches like aspect-oriented programming to weave modeling standards like MOF, Ecore, UML, OCL, ODM, and SWRL; development, improvement or integration of metamodels for ontology technologies, for example, OWL, SWRL, F-Logic., * Ontology driven software development: ontology support to web service orchestration; software architectures and methodologies for developing semantic web services and agents; reuse of web service ontologies or application of reasoning in specifying execution logics of orchestration., * MDE tools using ontologies: implementations of MDE tools relying on ontologies or on reasoning services., * Semantic support to Domain Specific Languages: integration of metamodeling and ontologies in order to provide abstract syntax and formal semantics for DSL., * Ontology engineering with MDA/MDE techniques: application of MDA/MDE techniques in order to support ontology engineering activities like ontology pruning, ontology refactoring, or ontology measurement., * Ontology connectors to system models: methods and techniques for integrating ontology constructs like classes and properties with MOF-based constructs like classes, properties or operations., * Application of Ontologies in traceability and provenance: usage of model annotations, ontologies and reasoning in order to improve traceability between MOF-based models., SUBMISSION, -----------------------------, * Full Papers: describe concrete contributions validated by appropriate evaluation, Full paper submissions must not exceed 15 pages., * Short Papers: comprehend research-in-progress, industrial experience and position papers, Short paper submissions do not exceed 6 pages., * Posters and Demos: authors are invited to submit a three-page paper describing tools involving ontologies in MDE., All papers must be submitted online using the submission website (http://www.easychair.org/conferences/?conf=twomde2010), Submissions must be in PDF, formatted in the style of the Springer Publications format for Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS)., PROCEEDINGS, -----------------------------, Final versions of accepted papers will be published electronically in the CEUR Workshop Proceedings Series, LuÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ­s Ferreira Pires (NL), University of Twente, * Peter Haase (DE), University of Karlsruhe (TH), * Saartje Brockmans (DE), Ontoprise, * Steffen Staab (DE), University of Koblenz-Landau, * Yuting Zhao (GB), University of Aberdeen, * Krzysztof Miksa (PL), Comarch , CONTACT, -----------------------------, Please do not hesitate about contacting us, if you have any question regarding this event., Fernando Silva Parreiras, parreiras@uni-koblenz.de, SPONSORS, -----------------------------, EU STReP MOST, http://www.most-project.eu/] at TOOLS 2010 federated conferences, Malaga, Spain {'April 15, 78 First IEEE International Workshop on Engineering Mobile Service Oriented Systems collocated with SCC 2010 Miami, Florida, USA, First IEEE International Workshop on Engineering Mobile Service Oriented Systems (EMSOS) collocated with SCC 2010\n\nMiami, Florida, USA, held between July 5-10, 2010 in conjunction with ICWS 2010, SCC 2010, and CLOUD 2010\n \nAims and Scope\n\nMobile systems are characterized with autonomous, dynamically adaptable, and heterogeneous components collaborating in open intra-organizational environments to provide solutions. Next generation phones, mobile networks, mobile cloud computing are a few examples of mobile applications where code, users and their devices continuously move. Evolving requirements, such as reliability, security, scalability, performance and privacy, from fixed to mobile settings, has revealed new and important challenges. This is due to the behavioural constraints that mobility poses, and that were not faced in traditional distributed settings. Examples include: dynamic network topology, changes in location, constrained resource availability, communication protocols heterogeneity, unstable connectivity, and so forth. The service-oriented paradigm is a promising approach for engineering open, dynamic and distributed systems. There are a plethora of research issues on how mobile systems can make use of service oriented engineering techniques.\n\nThe EMSOS Workshop aims to bring together researchers from academia and industry, as well as practitioners in the area of engineering services in mobile environments in order to provide a forum where recent research results can be presented and discussed. The aim is to understand open issues in the software engineering area of services applied in mobile environments, and to build a community of researchers and practitioners willing to collaborate on these issues.\n\nThe workshop seeks contributions that address theoretical foundations, important issues, recent developments, applications, methods, practical techniques, tools, empirical studies, experience, and lessons learned related to engineering mobile service oriented systems. \n\nList of Topics\n\nThe list of topics include, but are not limited to:\n\n * Mobile services in the cloud\n * Business Process Modelling and Requirements of services for mobility;\n * Model-Driven Service Engineering for mobile systems;\n * Software Product Line and mobility\n * Aspect-Oriented and Service Oriented Engineering for mobile environments;\n * Service-Oriented Architectures and mobility\n * Modelling, developing, deploying, configuring and maintaining mobile services\n * Semantics and Formal methods for mobile service oriented systems\n * Enterprise Service Buses and Middleware-induced service oriented architectures for mobile environments\n * Security, trust and privacy issues in service oriented systems for mobile environments;\n * Dependability issues in service-oriented mobile systems\n * Service Discovery and publication in mobile systems\n * Service Level Agreements for mobility\n * Composing and orchestrating services in mobile environments\n * Service oriented testing for mobility\n * Maintenance and evolution of mobile systems using service oriented engineering;\n * Economics of developing and evolving mobile services,\n * Context-Aware and Autonomic Computing in Service Oriented mobile environments\n * Tool support\n * Empirical, Industrial and Experience studies -Applying Service Oriented Engineering in mobile domains such as wireless sensor networks, cloud computing, mobile telephony energy saving, climate change, healthcare, etc. \n\nPaper Submission\n\nAuthors are invited to submit UNPUBLISHED research and industrial papers in three paper categories: 6 page (full papers), 4 page (short papers), and 2 page (position papers) of double column text using single spaced 10 point size on 8.5 x 11 inch pages, as per IEEE 8.5 x 11 manuscript guidelines (http://www.computer.org/cspress/instruct.htm).\n\nAuthors should submit a Word or PDF files using the online submission and review system. The accepted papers will be published in the proceedings of the SERVICES 2010 by the IEEE Computer Society Press and will be made available online through the IEEE Digital Library.\n\nImportant Dates\n\n * Paper Submission: April 20th, 2010 (Extended)\n * Decision Notification (Electronic): April 30th, 2010\n * Camera-Ready Submission & Pre-registration: May 7th, 2010\n\nOrganizers\n\n * Nour Ali, Lero, The Irish Software Engineering Research Centre, nour.ali@lero.ie\n * Rami Bahsoon, University of Birmingham, UK, bahsoon@cs.bham.ac.uk \n * Ian Gorton, Pacific Northwest National Laboratory, WA. Ian.gorton@pnl.gov\n\nProgram Committee (tentative)\n\n * Nour Ali, Lero, University of Limerick, Ireland\n * Rami Bahsoon, University of Birmingham, UK\n * Paul Brebner, NICTA, Australia\n * Licia Capra, University College London, UK\n * Carlos Cuesta, Universidad Rey Juan Carlos, Spain\n * Schahram Dustdar, Vienna Uni. of Technology, Austria\n * Jose Luiz Fiadeiro, University of Leicester, UK\n * Hanan Lutfiyya, The University of Western Ontario, Canada\n * Roberto Silva Filho, Siemens Corporate Research, USA\n * Ian Gorton, Pacific Northwest National Lab, USA\n * Mike Hinchey, Lero, University of Limerick, Ireland\n * Sam Malek, George Mason University, USA\n * Andreas Metzger, University of Duisburg-Essen, Germany\n * Mirco Musolesi, University of St. Andrews, UK\n * Bashar Nuseibeh, Lero, University of Limerick, Ireland\n * Gruia-Catalin Roman, Washington University in St. Louis, USA\n * Carlos Solis, Lero, University of Limerick, Ireland\n * Christopher Staite, University of Birmingham, UK\n * Shingo Takada, Keio University, Japan\n * Emilio Tuosto, University of Leicester, UK\n * Ian Warren, University of Auckland, New Zealand (First, IEEE, International, Workshop, on, Engineering, Mobile, Service, Oriented, Systems, (, EMSOS, ), collocated, with, SCC, 2010, \n\n, Miami, ,, Florida, ,, USA, ,, held, between, July, 5, -, 10, ,, 2010, in, conjunction, with, ICWS, 2010, ,, SCC, 2010, ,, and, CLOUD, 2010, \n \n, Aims, and, Scope, \n\n, Mobile, systems, are, characterized, with, autonomous, ,, dynamically, adaptable, ,, and, heterogeneous, components, collaborating, in, open, intra, -, organizational, environments, to, provide, solutions, ., Next, generation, phones, ,, mobile, networks, ,, mobile, cloud, computing, are, a, few, examples, of, mobile, applications, where, code, ,, users, and, their, devices, continuously, move, ., ...) Miami [First IEEE International Workshop on Engineering Mobile Service Oriented Systems (EMSOS) collocated with SCC 2010, Miami, Florida, USA, held between July 5-10, 2010 in conjunction with ICWS 2010, SCC 2010, and CLOUD 2010, , Aims and Scope, Mobile systems are characterized with autonomous, dynamically adaptable, and heterogeneous components collaborating in open intra-organizational environments to provide solutions, Next generation phones, mobile networks, mobile cloud computing are a few examples of mobile applications where code, users and their devices continuously move, Evolving requirements, such as reliability, security, scalability, performance and privacy, from fixed to mobile settings, has revealed new and important challenges, This is due to the behavioural constraints that mobility poses, and that were not faced in traditional distributed settings, Examples include: dynamic network topology, changes in location, constrained resource availability, communication protocols heterogeneity, unstable connectivity, and so forth, The service-oriented paradigm is a promising approach for engineering open, dynamic and distributed systems, There are a plethora of research issues on how mobile systems can make use of service oriented engineering techniques., The EMSOS Workshop aims to bring together researchers from academia and industry, as well as practitioners in the area of engineering services in mobile environments in order to provide a forum where recent research results can be presented and discussed, The aim is to understand open issues in the software engineering area of services applied in mobile environments, and to build a community of researchers and practitioners willing to collaborate on these issues., The workshop seeks contributions that address theoretical foundations, important issues, recent developments, applications, methods, practical techniques, tools, empirical studies, experience, and lessons learned related to engineering mobile service oriented systems, List of Topics, The list of topics include, but are not limited to:, * Mobile services in the cloud, * Business Process Modelling and Requirements of services for mobility;, * Model-Driven Service Engineering for mobile systems;, * Software Product Line and mobility, * Aspect-Oriented and Service Oriented Engineering for mobile environments;, * Service-Oriented Architectures and mobility, * Modelling, developing, deploying, configuring and maintaining mobile services, * Semantics and Formal methods for mobile service oriented systems, * Enterprise Service Buses and Middleware-induced service oriented architectures for mobile environments, * Security, trust and privacy issues in service oriented systems for mobile environments;, * Dependability issues in service-oriented mobile systems, * Service Discovery and publication in mobile systems, * Service Level Agreements for mobility, * Composing and orchestrating services in mobile environments, * Service oriented testing for mobility, * Maintenance and evolution of mobile systems using service oriented engineering;, * Economics of developing and evolving mobile services,, * Context-Aware and Autonomic Computing in Service Oriented mobile environments, * Tool support, * Empirical, Industrial and Experience studies -Applying Service Oriented Engineering in mobile domains such as wireless sensor networks, cloud computing, mobile telephony energy saving, climate change, healthcare, etc, Paper Submission, Authors are invited to submit UNPUBLISHED research and industrial papers in three paper categories: 6 page (full papers), 4 page (short papers), and 2 page (position papers) of double column text using single spaced 10 point size on 8.5 x 11 inch pages, as per IEEE 8.5 x 11 manuscript guidelines (http://www.computer.org/cspress/instruct.htm)., Authors should submit a Word or PDF files using the online submission and review system, The accepted papers will be published in the proceedings of the SERVICES 2010 by the IEEE Computer Society Press and will be made available online through the IEEE Digital Library., Important Dates, * Paper Submission: April 20th, 2010 (Extended), * Decision Notification (Electronic): April 30th, 2010, * Camera-Ready Submission & Pre-registration: May 7th, 2010, Organizers, * Nour Ali, Lero, The Irish Software Engineering Research Centre, nour.ali@lero.ie, * Rami Bahsoon, University of Birmingham, UK, bahsoon@cs.bham.ac.uk , * Ian Gorton, Pacific Northwest National Laboratory, WA, Ian.gorton@pnl.gov, Program Committee (tentative), * Nour Ali, Lero, University of Limerick, Ireland, * Rami Bahsoon, University of Birmingham, UK, * Paul Brebner, NICTA, Australia, * Licia Capra, University College London, UK, * Carlos Cuesta, Universidad Rey Juan Carlos, Spain, * Schahram Dustdar, Vienna Uni, of Technology, Austria, * Jose Luiz Fiadeiro, University of Leicester, UK, * Hanan University of Limerick, Ireland, * Gruia-Catalin Roman, Washington University in St, Louis, USA, * Carlos Solis, Lero, University of Limerick, Ireland, * Christopher Staite, University of Birmingham, UK, * Shingo Takada, Keio University, Japan, * Emilio Tuosto, University of Leicester, UK, * Ian Warren, University of Auckland, New Zealand] First IEEE International Workshop on Engineering Mobile 30th, 2010', 'May 7th, 2010': ' * camera-ready submission & pre-registration: may 7th, 2010'}
79 Eighteenth Italian Symposium on Advanced Database Systems Rimini, Italy A CALL FOR PAPERS\nThe Eighteenth Italian Symposium on Advanced Database Systems\n\nBackground\n\nCurrently at its eighteenth edition, SEBD is the major annual event of the Italian research community in the database field. The symposium is thought as a gathering forum to meet, discuss and exchange experiences among all those, both in the academy and industry, who are interested in database systems and in all their broad range of applications.\n\nThe 2010 edition of the SEBD Symposium will take place in Rimini, Italy, from the 20th to the 23rd of June 2010.\n\nTopics\n\nThe conference covers a broad range of topics, including traditional database management, as well as new challenges for data management in any possible domain. Prospective authors are encouraged to consider novel topics and approaches rather than proposing incremental improvements of existing results. Suggested topics include (but not limited to) the following:\n\nCORE DATABASE TECHNOLOGY\n\n * Access Methods and Physical Design\n * Concurrency Control and Recovery\n * Data Security and Privacy\n * Database Administration and Manageability\n * Database Performance and Evaluation\n * Distributed and Parallel Databases\n * Embedded and Mobile Databases\n * Engine-based Views, Replication, and Caching\n * Fuzzy, Probabilistic, and Approximate Data\n * Grid Database Management\n * Native Semi-Structured Data and XML\n * Peer-to-Peer Databases\n * Query Processing and Optimization\n * Real-Time and Micro Databases\n * Stream Databases\n * Transaction and Workflow Management\n\nINFORMATION INFRASTRUCTURE\n\n * Content Delivery Networks\n * Database Services and Applications\n * Data Design, Evolution and Migration\n * Data Management in Computational Science\n * Data Mining and Knowledge Discovery\n * Data Quality and Semantics\n * Data Warehousing\n * Heterogeneous and Federated DBMS\n * Information Integration and Retrieval\n * Provenance Management and Curated Databases\n * Sensor Networks\n * Social Systems and Recommendations\n * XML Middleware Platforms\n\nDATABASE APPLICATIONS\n\n * Adapting DB Technology to Industrial Settings and Requirements\n * Application Areas (Government, Finance, Humanities, Telecommunications, Home and Personal Computing, ...)\n * Biological Databases\n * Databases in e-Commerce and e-Services\n * Databases and Digital Libraries\n * Databases and the Semantic Web\n\nSubmission Instructions\n\nSEBD 2010 invites submissions of research, industry and application contributions as well as software demonstrations. Research papers, describing original ideas on the fundamental aspects of all forms of database systems and technology, are solicited. Moreover, extended abstract containing descriptions of on-going projects or presenting results already published are also welcome. Research papers presenting original works should be at most 12 pages long whereas extended abstract should be at most 8 pages long. Papers must be written in English. In order to allow a meaningful assignment of your paper to the most suitable reviewers, it is important that you indicate the content of the paper with a suitable set of keywords from the provided list. Accepted papers and extended abstracts will be published in the proceedings of the symposium. SEBD 2010 submissions must be in electronic form in Portable Document Format (PDF) format. Papers must be formatted using the Lecture Notes in Computer Science style available at http://www.springer.de/comp/lncs/authors.html.\n\nPapers must be submitted electronically, here.\n\nStudent Submission and Award\n\nStudents and post-docs researchers are strongly encouraged to submit papers presenting the results of research activities in the fields covered by the conference topics. Papers must be authored only by PhD student(s) or by post-doc(s) who defended their theses after 1/1/2008. The SEBD Steering Committee will select the three top papers to be awarded.\n\nImportant Dates\nAbstract submission: \tMarch 5, 2010\nPaper submission: \tMarch 12, 2010\nNotification of Acceptance: \tMay 3, 2010\nCamera-ready copy due: \tMay 14, 2010\nSEBD conference: \tJune 20-23, 2010 (A, CALL, FOR, PAPERS, \n, The, Eighteenth, Italian, Symposium, on, Advanced, Database, Systems, \n\n, Background, \n\n, Currently, at, its, eighteenth, edition, ,, SEBD, is, the, major, annual, event, of, the, Italian, research, community, in, the, database, field, ., The, symposium, is, thought, as, a, gathering, forum, to, meet, ,, discuss, and, exchange, experiences, among, all, those, ,, both, in, the, academy, and, industry, ,, who, are, interested, in, database, systems, and, in, all, their, broad, range, of, applications, ., \n\n, The, 2010, edition, of, the, SEBD, Symposium, will, take, place, in, Rimini, ,, Italy, ,, from, the, 20th, to, the, ...) Rimini [A CALL FOR PAPERS, The Eighteenth Italian Symposium on Advanced Database Systems, Background, Currently at its eighteenth edition, SEBD is the major annual event of the Italian research community in the database field, The symposium is thought as a gathering forum to meet, discuss and exchange experiences among all those, both in the academy and industry, who are interested in database systems and in all their broad range of applications., The 2010 edition of the SEBD Symposium will take place in Rimini, Italy, from the 20th to the 23rd of June 2010., Topics, The conference covers a broad range of topics, including traditional database management, as well as new challenges for data management in any possible domain, Prospective authors are encouraged to consider novel topics and approaches rather than proposing incremental improvements of existing results, Suggested topics include (but not limited to) the following:, CORE DATABASE TECHNOLOGY, * Access Methods and Physical Design, * Concurrency Control and Recovery, * Data Security and Privacy, * Database Administration and Manageability, * Database Performance and Evaluation, * Distributed and Parallel Databases, * Embedded and Mobile Databases, * Engine-based Views, Replication, and Caching, * Fuzzy, Probabilistic, and Approximate Data, * Grid Database Management, * Native Semi-Structured Data and XML, * Peer-to-Peer Databases, * Query Processing and Optimization, * Real-Time and Micro Databases, * Stream Databases, * Transaction and Workflow Management, INFORMATION INFRASTRUCTURE, * Content Delivery Networks, * Database Services and Applications, * Data Design, Evolution and Migration, * Data Management in Computational Science, * Data Mining and Knowledge Discovery, * Data Quality and Semantics, * Data Warehousing, * Heterogeneous and Federated DBMS, * Information Integration and Retrieval, * Provenance Management and Curated Databases, * Sensor Networks, * Social Systems and Recommendations, * XML Middleware Platforms, DATABASE APPLICATIONS, * Adapting DB Technology to Industrial Settings and Requirements, * Application Areas (Government, Finance, Humanities, Telecommunications, Home and Personal Computing, ...), * Biological Databases, * Databases in e-Commerce and e-Services, * Databases and Digital Libraries, * Databases and the Semantic Web, Submission Instructions, SEBD 2010 invites submissions of research, industry and application contributions as well as software demonstrations, Research papers, describing original ideas on the fundamental aspects of all forms of database systems and technology, are solicited, Moreover, extended abstract containing descriptions of on-going projects or presenting results already published are also welcome, Research papers presenting original works should be at most 12 pages long whereas extended abstract should be at most 8 pages long, Papers must be written in English, In order to allow a meaningful assignment of your paper to the most suitable reviewers, it is important that you indicate the content of the paper with a suitable set of keywords from the provided list, Accepted papers and extended abstracts will be published in the proceedings of the symposium, SEBD 2010 submissions must be in electronic form in Portable Document Format (PDF) format, Papers must be formatted using the Lecture Notes in Computer Science style available at http://www.springer.de/comp/lncs/authors.html., Papers must be submitted electronically, here., Student Submission and Award, Students and post-docs researchers are strongly encouraged to submit papers presenting the results of research activities in the fields covered by the conference topics, Papers must be authored only by PhD student(s) or by post-doc(s) who defended their theses after 1/1/2008, The SEBD Steering Committee will select the three top papers to be awarded., Important Dates, Abstract submission: \tMarch 5, 2010, Paper submission: \tMarch 12, 2010, Notification of Acceptance: \tMay 3, 2010, Camera-ready copy due: \tMay 14, 2010, SEBD conference: \tJune 20-23, 2010] The Eighteenth Italian Symposium on 80 ACM SIGPLAN Fifth Workshop on Programming Languages and Analysis for Security Toronto, Canada ***********************************************************************\n\n Call for Papers\n\n Fifth ACM SIGPLAN Workshop on\n Programming Languages and Analysis for Security\n (PLAS 2010) \n\n http://software.imdea.org/events/plas2010/index.html\n June 10, 2010\n Co-located with PLDI 2010, Toronto, Canada\n\n\n***********************************************************************\nSCOPE\n\nPLAS aims to provide a forum for exploring and evaluating ideas on the\nuse of programming language and program analysis techniques to improve\nthe security of software systems. Strongly encouraged are proposals of\nnew, speculative ideas, evaluations of new or known techniques in\npractical settings, and discussions of emerging threats and important\nproblems.\n\nThe scope of PLAS includes but is not limited to:\n\n* Compiler-based security mechanisms or runtime-based security\n mechanisms such as inline reference monitors\n* Program analysis techniques for discovering security vulnerabilities\n* Automated introduction and/or verification of security enforcement\n mechanisms\n* Language-based verification of security properties in software\n including verification of cryptographic protocols\n* Specifying and enforcing security policies for information flow and\n access control\n* Model-driven approaches to security\n* Security concerns for web programming languages\n* Language design for security in new domains such as cloud computing\n and embedded platforms\n* Applications, case studies, and implementations of these techniques\n\n\nIMPORTANT INFORMATION\n*****************************\nSubmissions due: Friday, March 12, 2010\nAuthor notification: Friday, April 23, 2010\nRevised papers due: Monday, May 10, 2010\nPLAS 2010 workshop: Thursday, June 10, 2010 \n\nSubmission URL: https://www.easychair.org/login.cgi?conf=plas2010\n\n\nSUBMISSION GUIDELINES\n\nWe invite papers in two categories:\n\n* Full papers should be at most 12 pages long including bibliography\n and appendices. Papers in this category are expected to have\n relatively mature content. Full paper presentations will be 25\n minutes each.\n\n* Position papers should be at most 6 pages long including\n bibliography and appendices. Preliminary and exploratory work are\n welcome in this category. Position paper presentations will be 10\n minutes each. Authors submitting papers in this category must\n prepend the phrase "Position Paper: " (without quotes) to the title\n of the submitted paper.\n\nSubmissions should be PDF documents typeset in the ACM proceedings\nformat using 10pt fonts. SIGPLAN-approved templates can be found at\nhttp://www.acm.org/sigs/sigplan/authorInformation.htm. We recommend\nusing this format, which improves greatly on the ACM LaTeX format. All\nsubmissions must be in English. Page limits are strict.\n\nBoth full and position papers must describe work not published in\nother refereed venues (see the SIGPLAN republication policy at\nhttp://www.acm.org/sigs/sigplan/republicationpolicy.htm for\ndetails). Accepted papers will appear in the workshop proceedings\nwhich will be distributed to workshop participants and be available in\nthe ACM Digital Library.\n\n\nPROGRAM COMMITTEE\n\nAnindya Banerjee (IMDEA Software) (co-chair)\nGilles Barthe (IMDEA Software)\nAvik Chaudhuri (University of Maryland)\nVeronique Cortier (LORIA, CNRS)\nBrendan Eich (Mozilla Corporation)\nUlfar Erlingsson (Microsoft Research and Reykjavik University)\nDeepak Garg (Carnegie Mellon University) (co-chair)\nAndrew D. Gordon (Microsoft Research)\nJoshua Guttman (Worcester Polytechnic Institute)\nShriram Krishnamurthi (Brown University)\nSergio Maffeis (Imperial College London)\nTodd Millstein (University of California, Los Angeles)\nJohn Mitchell (Stanford University)\nMarco Pistoia (IBM TJ Watson Research Center)\nAndrei Sabelfeld (Chalmers University)\nZhendong Su (University of California, Davis) (*, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, \n\n , Call, for, Papers, \n\n , Fifth, ACM, SIGPLAN, Workshop, on, \n , Programming, Languages, and, Analysis, for, Security, \n , (, PLAS, 2010, ), \n\n , http://software.imdea.org/events/plas2010/index.html, \n , June, 10, ,, 2010, ...) Toronto [***********************************************************************, Call for Papers, Fifth ACM SIGPLAN Workshop on, Programming Languages and Analysis for Security, (PLAS 2010) , http://software.imdea.org/events/plas2010/index.html, June 10, 2010, Co-located with PLDI 2010, Toronto, Canada, ***********************************************************************, SCOPE, PLAS aims to provide a forum for exploring and evaluating ideas on the, use of programming language and program analysis techniques to improve, the security of software systems, Strongly encouraged are proposals of, new, speculative ideas, evaluations of new or known techniques in, practical settings, and discussions of emerging threats and important, problems., The scope of PLAS includes but is not limited to:, * Compiler-based security mechanisms or runtime-based security, mechanisms such as inline reference monitors, * Program analysis techniques for discovering security vulnerabilities, * Automated introduction and/or verification of security enforcement, mechanisms, * Language-based verification of security properties in software, including verification of cryptographic protocols, * Specifying and enforcing security policies for information flow and, access control, * Model-driven approaches to security, * Security concerns for web programming languages, * Language design for security in new domains such as cloud computing, and embedded platforms, * Applications, case studies, and implementations of these techniques, IMPORTANT INFORMATION, *****************************, Submissions due: Friday, March 12, 2010, Author notification: Friday, April 23, 2010, Revised papers due: Monday, May 10, 2010, PLAS 2010 workshop: Thursday, June 10, 2010 , Submission URL: https://www.easychair.org/login.cgi?conf=plas2010, SUBMISSION GUIDELINES, We invite papers in two categories:, * Full papers should be at most 12 pages long including bibliography, and appendices, Papers in this category are expected to have, relatively mature content, Full paper presentations will be 25, minutes each., * Position papers should be at most 6 pages long including, bibliography and appendices, Preliminary and exploratory work are, welcome in this category, Position paper presentations will be 10, minutes each, Authors submitting papers in this category must, prepend the phrase "Position Paper: " (without quotes) to the title, of the submitted paper., Submissions should be PDF documents typeset in the ACM proceedings, format using 10pt fonts, SIGPLAN-approved templates can be found at, http://www.acm.org/sigs/sigplan/authorInformation.htm, We recommend, using this format, which improves greatly on the ACM LaTeX format, All, submissions must be in English, Page limits are strict., Both full and position papers must describe work not published in, other refereed venues (see the SIGPLAN republication policy at, http://www.acm.org/sigs/sigplan/republicationpolicy.htm for, details), Accepted papers will appear in the workshop proceedings, which will be distributed to workshop participants and be available in, the ACM Digital Library., PROGRAM COMMITTEE, Anindya Banerjee (IMDEA Software) (co-chair), Gilles Barthe (IMDEA Software), Avik Chaudhuri (University of Maryland), Veronique Cortier (LORIA, CNRS), Brendan Eich (Mozilla Corporation), Ulfar Erlingsson (Microsoft Research and Reykjavik University), Deepak Garg (Carnegie Mellon University) (co-chair), Andrew D, Gordon (Microsoft Research), Joshua Guttman (Worcester Polytechnic Institute), Shriram Krishnamurthi (Brown University), Sergio Maffeis (Imperial College London), Todd Millstein (University of California, Los Angeles), John Mitchell (Stanford University), Marco Pistoia (IBM TJ Watson Research Center), Andrei Sabelfeld (Chalmers University), Zhendong Su (University of California, Davis)] Fifth ACM SIGPLAN Workshop on Programming 81 22nd IEEE International Conference on Tools with Artificial Intelligence Arras (France) IEEE-ICTAI'10\n\n22nd International IEEE Conference on Tools with Artificial Intelligence\n\n October 27-29, 2010, Arras, France\n\n 45 mn from Charles de Gaulle Paris International Airport by direct train \n or \n 50 mn from downtown Paris by direct train\n\n\n http://www.cril.univ-artois.fr/ictai10/\n\n========================================================\nImportant Dates\n\nPaper submission: June 6, 2010\nPaper notification: July 15, 2010\nCamera ready paper: August 31, 2010\n\n========================================================\n\nAim & Scope\n-------------------\n\nThe annual IEEE International Conference on Tools with Artificial Intelligence (ICTAI) \nprovides a major international forum where the creation and exchange of ideas related to \nartificial intelligence are fostered among academia, industry, and government agencies. The \nconference facilitates the cross-fertilization of these ideas and promotes their transfer into \npractical tools, for developing intelligent systems and pursuing artificial intelligence \napplications. The ICTAI encompasses all technical aspects of specifying, developing and \nevaluating the theoretical underpinnings and applied mechanisms of the AI based components \nof computer tools (i.e. algorithms, architectures and languages).\n\nTopics (not limited to)\n-------------------------------\n\nAI Algorithms\nAI in Bioinformatics\nAI in Computer Security\nAI in Databases and Data Mining\nAI in E-commerce\nAI in Games\nAI in Information Assurance\nAI in Logistics\nAI in Medicine\nAI in Multimedia Systems\nAI in Real-time & Embedded Applications\nAI in Robotics\nAI in Software Engineering\nCase-Based Reasoning\nCognitive Modelling\nConstraint Programming\nCollaborative Software Agents\nReasoning Under Fuzziness or Uncertainty\nEvolutionary Computing\nHybrid Intelligent Systems\nInformation Retrieval\nIntelligent Tutoring/Training Systems\nIntelligent Internet Agents\nIntelligent Interface Agents\nKnowledge-based Systems\nKnowledge Extraction \nKnowledge Management and Sharing\nKnowledge Representation and Reasoning\nMachine Learning\nNatural Language Processing and Understanding\nNeural Networks\nOntologies\nPlanning and Scheduling\nQualitative Reasoning\nSearch and Heuristics, SAT, CSP, QBF\nSemantic Web-Techniques & Technologies\nSpeech Processing and Understanding\nVision/Image Processing & Understanding\n\nPaper Submission \n---------------------------\n\nThe submissions should contain original, high quality, not submitted or published elsewhere \nwork. Papers should be submitted electronically (through ICTAI 2010 web site) in pdf format \nand should conform to IEEE specifications (single-spaced, double-column, 10-point font size, \nup to 8 pages).\n\nPaper Presentation\n----------------------------\n\nEach accepted paper should be presented by one of the authors and accompanied by at least \none full registration fee payment, to guarantee publication in the proceedings. All accepted \npapers will be included in proceedings of ICTAI 2010, which will be published by the IEEE.\n\nIJAIT special issue \n---------------------------\n\nExtended versions of the best papers of the conference will be invited for publication in a \nspecial issue of the International Journal on Artificial Intelligence Tools (IJAIT) (SCI \nIndexed).\n\nFurther Information\n---------------------------\n\nÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ°ric liaison)\n\nProgram Committee Chair\n-------------------------------------\n\nÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ°ric Tabary (IEEE, -, ICTAI'10, \n\n, 22nd, International, IEEE, , Conference, on, Tools, with, Artificial, Intelligence, \n\n , October, 27, -, 29, ,, 2010, ,, Arras, ,, France, \n\n , 45, mn, from, Charles, de, Gaulle, Paris, International, Airport, by, direct, train, \n , or, \n , 50, mn, from, downtown, Paris, by, direct, train, \n\n\n , http://www.cril.univ, -, artois.fr, /, ictai10/, \n\n, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, =, ...) Arras [IEEE-ICTAI'10, 22nd International IEEE Conference on Tools with Artificial Intelligence, October 27-29, 2010, Arras, France, 45 mn from Charles de Gaulle Paris International Airport by direct train , or , 50 mn from downtown Paris by direct train, http://www.cril.univ-artois.fr/ictai10/, ========================================================, Important Dates, Paper submission: June 6, 2010, Paper notification: July 15, 2010, Camera ready paper: August 31, 2010, ========================================================, Aim & Scope, -------------------, The annual IEEE International Conference on Tools with Artificial Intelligence (ICTAI) , provides a major international forum where the creation and exchange of ideas related to , artificial intelligence are fostered among academia, industry, and government agencies, The , conference facilitates the cross-fertilization of these ideas and promotes their transfer into , practical tools, for developing intelligent systems and pursuing artificial intelligence , applications, The ICTAI encompasses all technical aspects of specifying, developing and , evaluating the theoretical underpinnings and applied mechanisms of the AI based components , of computer tools (i.e, algorithms, architectures and languages)., Topics (not limited to), -------------------------------, AI Algorithms, AI in Bioinformatics, AI in Computer Security, AI in Databases and Data Mining, AI in E-commerce, AI in Games, AI in Information Assurance, AI in Logistics, AI in Medicine, AI in Multimedia Systems, AI in Real-time & Embedded Applications, AI in Robotics, AI in Software Engineering, Case-Based Reasoning, Cognitive Modelling, Constraint Programming, Collaborative Software Agents, Reasoning Under Fuzziness or Uncertainty, Evolutionary Computing, Hybrid Intelligent Systems, Information Retrieval, Intelligent Tutoring/Training Systems, Intelligent Internet Agents, Intelligent Interface Agents, Knowledge-based Systems, Knowledge Extraction , Knowledge Management and Sharing, Knowledge Representation and Reasoning, Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing and Understanding, Neural Networks, Ontologies, Planning and Scheduling, Qualitative Reasoning, Search and Heuristics, SAT, CSP, QBF, Semantic Web-Techniques & Technologies, Speech Processing and Understanding, Vision/Image Processing & Understanding, Paper Submission , ---------------------------, The submissions should contain original, high quality, not submitted or published elsewhere , work, Papers should be submitted electronically (through ICTAI 2010 web site) in pdf format , and should conform to IEEE specifications (single-spaced, double-column, 10-point font size, , up to 8 pages)., Paper Presentation, ----------------------------, Each accepted paper should be presented by one of the authors and accompanied by at least , one full registration fee payment, to guarantee publication in the proceedings, All accepted , papers will be included in proceedings of ICTAI 2010, which will be published by the IEEE., IJAIT special issue , ---------------------------, Extended versions of the best papers of the conference will be invited for publication in a , special issue of the International Journal on Artificial Intelligence Tools (IJAIT) (SCI , Indexed)., Further Information, ---------------------------, (PC Chair) , CRIL UMR 8188 CNRS , UniversitÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ© d'Artois , rue Jean Souvraz SP18 , F-62307 Lens, FRANCE , , Email: gregoire [at] cril [dot] univ-artois [dot] fr, Steering Committee, -----------------------------, Nikolaos Bourbakis, (Chair), Chittoor V, Ramamoorthy, Jeffrey Tsai, Benjamin W, ...] 22nd International IEEE Conference on Tools with Artificial Intelligence {'October 27-29, 2010': ' october 27-29, 2010, arras, france', 'June 6, 2010': 'paper submission: june 6, 2010', 'July 15, 2010': 'paper notification: july 15, 2010', 'August 31, 2010': 'camera ready paper: august 31, 2010'}
82 First International Workshop on Seamless Wireless Mobility Miami, Florida, USA **********************************************************************\n****** ******\n First International Workshop on \n Seamless Wireless Mobility\n* *\n* December 10, 2010 in Miami, Florida *\n* in Conjunction with GLOBECOM 2010 *\n* *\n* http://www.coe.uncc.edu/~jxie1/SWM/ *\n* *\n* All accepted and presented papers will be included in the *\n* IEEE GLOBECOM proceedings and IEEE digital library. Selected *\n* accepted papers will be published in a special issue of *\n* Journal of Communications (JCM). *\n* *\n**********************************************************************\n\nScope:\n===================\n\nThe advances in wireless technologies and mobile devices have enabled \nthe realization of a wide range of wireless networking opportunities. \nThe coexistence of wireless heterogeneous networks has been widely \nrecognized, and it has become more and more common that new mobile \ndevices get equipped with multiple and heterogeneous wireless interfaces. \nFurthermore, the recent advances in software-defined and cognitive radio \ntechnologies promise even more diversity and heterogeneity. This brings \nabout a lot of opportunities and challenges for mobile wireless networking. \n \nWith the emerging wireless technologies, mobility has more generic \nmeaning than just node movement as in the traditional sense. It also \nmeans that when the operational environment changes (such as frequency \nand power), a node or the network adapts to the environmental changes, \nwhich requires the cognitive capability. On one hand, it is of critical \nimportance that seamless, low latency and transparent services are \nprovided to the users, via potentially multiple heterogeneous wireless \ntechnologies or opportunistic spectrum access involved during the \ncourse of node movement or environmental changes. Environment cognizance, \nspectrum-aware mobility management, and vertical handoff become critical \ncomponents in the solution space. On the other hand, host and network \nmobility also affects the performance of network protocols significantly, \nwhile at the same time allows opportunistic interconnections of heterogeneous \nnetworks, which in turn makes mobility adaptability an important design issue. \nThis asks the design of wireless architectures, protocols, spectrum management, \nand mobility management mechanisms to be revisited. \n\nCohesive with the main theme of Globecom 2010 --- "moving into the age \nof mobile interactivity", the workshop welcomes original submissions from \nboth researchers and practitioners that explore recent advances in \narchitecture, system, protocol, modeling, and testbed design, as well as \nemerging applications and standards to enable seamless mobility and \ntransparency in wireless networks. Topics of interest include, but are \nnot limited to:\n\n- Architecture, system, and protocol design for seamless roaming support \n in wireless networks\n\n- Spectrum cognition and agility associated with mobility \n\n- Vertical handoff and seamless integration of heterogeneous networks\n\n- Location tracking, positioning, and address management\n\n- Mobility modeling and theoretical/experimental validation\n\n- Mobility impact on routing, resource/power/QoS management\n\n- Adaptive and resilient protocols for seamless mobility support at all layers, \n as well as cross-layer approaches\n\n- Security and privacy issues under mobility and network access\n\n- Emerging standards and applications on mobility\n\n- Simulation/testbed tools and experimental measurements\n\n\nImportant Dates:\n================\n\nSubmission deadline : July 11, 2010\nNotification of acceptance : August 13, 2010\nCamera-ready version : August 31, 2010\nWorkshop Date : December 10, 2010\n\n\nSubmission Details:\n===================\n\nThe workshop will only accept original, previous unpublished papers. Prospective \nauthors are encouraged to submit an IEEE conference style paper up to 5 pages \n(including all text, figures, and references) through EDAS submission system, \nbut one additional page will be allowed with additional publication fee. \n\nAn accepted paper must be registered before the registration deadline. An \naccepted paper must be presented at the workshop. Failure to register before \nthe deadline will result in automatic withdrawal of the paper from the workshop \nproceedings and the program. \n\nAll accepted and presented papers will be included in the IEEE GLOBECOM \nproceedings and IEEE digital library. GLOBECOM has the right to remove an \naccepted and registered but not presented paper from the IEEE digital library.\n\nExtended version of selected accepted papers will be published in a special\nissue of Journal of Communications (JCM).\n\n\nOrganization Committee:\n=======================\n\nSubir Das, Telcordia Technologies, Inc. \n\nJing Deng, University of North Carolina at Greensboro \n\nNada Gomie, National Institute of Standards and Technology\n \nJason H. Li, Intelligent Automation, Inc. \n\nJiang (Linda) Xie, University of North Carolina at Charlotte \n\n\nFor more information about the workshop, \nsee http://www.coe.uncc.edu/~jxie1/SWM/ (*, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, \n, *, *, *, *, *, *, , *, *, *, *, *, *, \n , First, International, Workshop, on, \n , Seamless, Wireless, Mobility, \n, *, , *, \n, *, , ...) Miami [**********************************************************************, ****** ******, First International Workshop on , Seamless Wireless Mobility, * *, * December 10, 2010 in Miami, Florida *, * in Conjunction with GLOBECOM 2010 *, * *, * http://www.coe.uncc.edu/~jxie1/SWM/ *, * *, * All accepted and presented papers will be included in the *, * IEEE GLOBECOM proceedings and IEEE digital library, Selected *, * accepted papers will be published in a special issue of *, * Journal of Communications (JCM), *, * *, **********************************************************************, Scope:, ===================, The advances in wireless technologies and mobile devices have enabled , the realization of a wide range of wireless networking opportunities, The coexistence of wireless heterogeneous networks has been widely , recognized, and it has become more and more common that new mobile , devices get equipped with multiple and heterogeneous wireless interfaces, Furthermore, the recent advances in software-defined and cognitive radio , technologies promise even more diversity and heterogeneity, This brings , about a lot of opportunities and challenges for mobile wireless networking, , , With the emerging wireless technologies, mobility has more generic , meaning than just node movement as in the traditional sense, It also , means that when the operational environment changes (such as frequency , and power), a node or the network adapts to the environmental changes, , which requires the cognitive capability, On one hand, it is of critical , importance that seamless, low latency and transparent services are , provided to the users, via potentially multiple heterogeneous wireless , technologies or opportunistic spectrum access involved during the , course of node movement or environmental changes, Environment cognizance, , spectrum-aware mobility management, and vertical handoff become critical , components in the solution space, On the other hand, host and network , mobility also affects the performance of network protocols significantly, , while at the same time allows opportunistic interconnections of heterogeneous , networks, which in turn makes mobility adaptability an important design issue, This asks the design of wireless architectures, protocols, spectrum management, , and mobility management mechanisms to be revisited, Cohesive with the main theme of Globecom 2010 --- "moving into the age , of mobile interactivity", the workshop welcomes original submissions from , both researchers and practitioners that explore recent advances in , architecture, system, protocol, modeling, and testbed design, as well as , emerging applications and standards to enable seamless mobility and , transparency in wireless networks, Topics of interest include, but are , not limited to:, - Architecture, system, and protocol design for seamless roaming support , in wireless networks, - Spectrum cognition and agility associated with mobility , - Vertical handoff and seamless integration of heterogeneous networks, - Location tracking, positioning, and address management, - Mobility modeling and theoretical/experimental validation, - Mobility impact on routing, resource/power/QoS management, - Adaptive and resilient protocols for seamless mobility support at all layers, , as well as cross-layer approaches, - Security and privacy issues under mobility and network access, - Emerging standards and applications on mobility, - Simulation/testbed tools and experimental measurements, Important Dates:, ================, Submission deadline : July 11, 2010, Notification of acceptance : August 13, 2010, Camera-ready version : August 31, 2010, Workshop Date : December 10, 2010, Submission Details:, ===================, The workshop will only accept original, previous unpublished papers, Prospective , authors are encouraged to submit an IEEE conference style paper up to 5 pages , (including all text, figures, and references) through EDAS submission system, , but one additional page will be allowed with additional publication fee, An accepted paper must be registered before the registration deadline, An , accepted paper must be presented at the workshop, Failure to register before , the deadline will result in automatic withdrawal of the paper from the workshop , proceedings and the program, All accepted and presented papers will be included in the IEEE GLOBECOM , proceedings and IEEE digital library, GLOBECOM has the right to remove an , accepted and registered but not presented paper from the IEEE digital library., Extended version of selected accepted papers will be published in a special, issue of Journal of Communications (JCM)., Organization Committee:, =======================, Subir Das, Telcordia Technologies, Inc, Jing Deng, University of North Carolina at Greensboro , ...] First International Workshop on Seamless Wireless Mobility {'December 10, 2010': 'workshop date : december 10, 2010', 'July 11, 2010': 'submission deadline : july 11, 2010', 'August 13, 2010': 'notification of acceptance : august 13, 2010', 'August 31, 2010': 'camera-ready version : august 31, 2010'}
83 2nd International Workshop on Dynamic Networks - Algorithms and Security Bordeaux, France ______________________________________________________________________\n\n Call for papers\n\n DYNAS 2010\n\n 2nd International Workshop on\n Dynamic Networks - Algorithms and Security\n\n To be held July 5, 2010\n Bordeaux, France\n\n Colocated with ICALP 2010\n\n http://dynas2010.labri.fr/\n______________________________________________________________________\n\nWorkshop:\n---------\nDYNAS is about dynamic networks such as Peer-to-Peer, Sensor and\nAd-Hoc Networks. We gladly welcome descriptions of original, well\ndefined (possibly not yet completely solved) problems in the following\ntypical but not exclusive areas:\n* Algorithms for construction and maintenance of Peer-to-Peer, Sensor\n and Ad-Hoc Networks.\n* Algorithms working on top of networks.\n* Security and anonymity issues in systems of computationally weak\n devices (like RFID-tags).\n\nSubmissions:\n------------\nSubmitted papers must be written in English, use at least 11 point\nfont, have reasonable margins, and not exceed 6 pages. Papers\ncontaining interesting problems without (with partial) analysis are\nalso welcome.\n\nProceedings:\n------------\nThere will be no published proceedings for DYNAS.\n\nImportant Dates:\n----------------\nSubmission deadline: 10th of April 2010\nAuthor notification: 10th of May 2010\nManuscript for the workshop due: 22nd of May 2010\n\nInvited speakers:\n-----------------\n* Serge Chaumette, University of Bordeaux, France\n* Miroslaw Kutylowski, WrocÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¦ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂaw _, _, _, _, _, _, _, _, _, _, _, _, _, _, _, \n\n , Call, for, papers, \n\n , DYNAS, 2010, \n\n , 2nd, International, Workshop, on, \n , Dynamic, Networks, -, Algorithms, and, Security, \n\n , To, be, held, July, 5, ,, 2010, \n , Bordeaux, ,, ...) Bordeaux [______________________________________________________________________, Call for papers, DYNAS 2010, 2nd International Workshop on, Dynamic Networks - Algorithms and Security, To be held July 5, 2010, Bordeaux, France, Colocated with ICALP 2010, http://dynas2010.labri.fr/, ______________________________________________________________________, Workshop:, ---------, DYNAS is about dynamic networks such as Peer-to-Peer, Sensor and, Ad-Hoc Networks, We gladly welcome descriptions of original, well, defined (possibly not yet completely solved) problems in the following, typical but not exclusive areas:, * Algorithms for construction and maintenance of Peer-to-Peer, Sensor, and Ad-Hoc Networks., * Algorithms working on top of networks., * Security and anonymity issues in systems of computationally weak, devices (like RFID-tags)., Submissions:, ------------, Submitted papers must be written in English, use at least 11 point, font, have reasonable margins, and not exceed 6 pages, Papers, containing interesting problems without (with partial) analysis are, also welcome., Proceedings:, ------------, There will be no published proceedings for DYNAS., Important Dates:, ----------------, Submission deadline: 10th of April 2010, Author notification: 10th of May 2010, Manuscript for the workshop due: 22nd of May 2010, Invited speakers:, -----------------, * Serge Chaumette, University of Bordeaux, France, * Miroslaw Kutylowski, WrocÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¦ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂaw University of Technology, Poland, * University of Technology, Poland] 2nd International Workshop on Dynamic Networks - Algorithms and Security {'July 5, 2010': ' to be held july 5, 2010', '10th of April 2010': 'submission deadline: 10th of april 2010', '10th of May 2010': 'author notification: 10th of may 2010', '22nd of May 2010': 'manuscript for the workshop due: 22nd of may 2010'}
84 2nd Workshop on Collaboratively Constructed Semantic Resources Beijing, China COLING 2010\nCALL FOR PAPERS\n\n2nd Workshop on\nCollaboratively Constructed Semantic Resources\n\nBeijing\nAugust 28th, 2010\nhttp://www.ukp.tu-darmstadt.de/scientific-community/coling-2010-workshop/\n\n\nKeywords:\nWikipedia, Wiktionary, Mechanical Turk, Games with a purpose,\nFolksonomies, Twitter, Social Networks\n\n\nINTRODUCTION\n\nThe workshop builds upon the success of the first ACL "The People's Web\nmeets NLP" Workshop in 2009 that attracted 21 submissions. Accepted\nsubmissions included papers on Wikipedia [1], Wiktionary [2], Mechanical\nTurk [3], and game-based construction of semantic resources [4]. This\nclearly demonstrates a substantial and growing interest of the NLP\ncommunity in collaboratively constructed semantic resources (CSRs),\nalso evidenced by the increasing number of publications in this area\nand the EMNLP 2009 Web 2.0 track. In many works, CSRs have been used\nto overcome the knowledge acquisition bottleneck and coverage problems\npertinent to conventional lexical semantic resources. The greatest\npopularity in this respect can so far certainly be attributed to\nWikipedia [1]. However, other resources, such as folksonomies or the\nmultilingual collaboratively constructed dictionary Wiktionary, have\nalso shown great potential. Thus, the scope of the workshop deliberately\nincludes any collaboratively constructed resource, not only Wikipedia.\n\nEffective deployment of CSRs to enhance NLP introduces a pressing need\nto address a set of fundamental challenges, e.g. the interoperability\nwith existing resources, or the quality of the extracted lexical\nsemantic knowledge. Interoperability between resources is crucial as\nno single resource provides perfect coverage. The quality of CSRs is\na fundamental issue, as they lack editorial control and entries are\noften incomplete. Thus, techniques for link prediction [5] or\ninformation extraction [6] have been proposed to guide the "crowds"\nwhile constructing resources of better quality.\n\n[1] Olena Medelyan, David Milne, Catherine Legg and Ian H. Witten.\n Mining meaning from Wikipedia.\n In: International Journal of Human-Computer Studies. 67(9), 2009.\n[2] Torsten Zesch, Christof Mueller and Iryna Gurevych\n Extracting Lexical Semantic Knowledge from Wikipedia and Wiktionary\n Proceedings of the Conference on Language Resources and Evaluation\n (LREC), 2008.\n http://www.ukp.tu-darmstadt.de/software/jwpl/\n http://www.ukp.tu-darmstadt.de/software/jwktl/\n[3] Rion Snow, Brendan O'Connor, Daniel Jurafsky and Andrew Y. Ng.\n Cheap and Fast---But is it Good? Evaluating Non-Expert Annotations\n for Natural Language Tasks.\n Proceedings of EMNLP. 2008.\n[4] Luis von Ahn and Laura Dabbish.\n General Techniques for Designing Games with a Purpose.\n Communications of the ACM, 2008.\n[5] Rada Mihalcea and Andras Csomai\n Wikify!: Linking Documents to Encyclopedic Knowledge.\n Proceedings of the Sixteenth ACM Conference on Information and\n Knowledge Management, CIKM 2007.\n[6] Daniel S. Weld et al.\n Intelligence in Wikipedia.\n Twenty-Third Conference on Artificial Intelligence (AAAI), 2008.\n\n\nTOPICS\n\nThe workshop will bring together researchers from different worlds, for\nexample those using collaboratively constructed resources as sources of\nlexical semantic information for NLP purposes such as information\nretrieval, named entity recognition, or keyword extraction, and those\nusing NLP techniques to improve the resources or extract and analyze\ndifferent types of lexical semantic information from them. We will\nespecially welcome contributions of interdisciplinary nature, e.g. those\napplying discourse analysis techniques from computational linguistics to\nthe content of CSRs to better understand their properties.\n\nSpecific topics include but are not limited to:\n * Analysis of collaboratively constructed resources, such as wiki-based\n platforms, folksonomies, Twitter, or social networks;\n * Using collaboratively constructed resources for NLP purposes such\n as information retrieval, text categorization, information\n extraction, etc.;\n * Using special features of collaboratively constructed resources to\n create novel resource types, for example revision-based corpora,\n simplified versions of resources, etc.;\n * Analyzing the structure of collaboratively constructed resources\n related to their use in NLP;\n * Interoperability of collaboratively constructed resources with\n conventional lexical semantic resources and between themselves;\n * Mining social and collaborative content for constructing structured\n semantic resources and the corresponding tools;\n * Mining multilingual information from collaboratively constructed\n resources;\n * Quality and reliability of collaboratively constructed semantic\n resources. \n\nWe especially encourage short papers describing publicly available tools\nfor accessing or analyzing collaboratively constructed resources that can\nserve as a multiplier in the NLP community.\n\nThe workshop is intended to be highly interdisciplinary. Thus, we encourage\nthe participation of researchers working on computational linguistics\naspects (e.g. parsing or discourse analysis) or NLP applications (e.g.\ninformation retrieval, information extraction, question answering, and\nknowledge representation) as well as researchers from other areas who\nmight benefit from collaboratively constructed semantic resources.\n\nSubstantially extended versions of the best papers from the workshop can\nbe submitted to a planned Special Issue in one of the major computational\nlinguistics journals. The revised papers will have to undergo a separate\nreviewing process required for journal publications.\n\n\nIMPORTANT DATES\n\nPaper submission deadline (full and short): May 30, 2010\nNotification of acceptance of papers: June 30, 2010\nCamera-ready copy of papers due: July 10, 2010\nCOLING 2010 Workshop: Aug 28, 2010\n\n\nORGANIZERS\n\nIryna Gurevych\nTorsten Zesch\n\nUbiquitous Knowledge Processing Lab\nTechnische UniversitÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¤t Darmstadt, Germany\n\n\nPROGRAM COMMITTEE\n\nAndras Csomai Google Inc.\nAnette Frank Heidelberg University\nBenno Stein Bauhaus University Weimar\nBernardo Magnini ITC-irst Trento\nChristiane Fellbaum Princeton University\nDan Moldovan University of Texas at Dallas\nDelphine Bernhard LIMSI-CNRS, Orsay\nDiana McCarthy University of Sussex\nElke Teich Technische Darmstadt\nEmily Pitler University of Pennsylvania\nEneko Agirre University of the Basque Country\nErhard Hinrichs Eberhard Karls UniversitÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¤t
