89 First Workshop on Secure Control Systems Stockholm, Sweden The First Workshop on Secure Control Systems (SCS) will be held April 12, 2010 in Stockholm, Sweden as part of the 13th International Conference on Hybrid Systems: Computation and Control (HSCC) which is one of five conferences associated with CPSWeek 2010.\r\n\r\nThe focus of the workshop will be on system theoretic approaches to enhance security and resilience of control and monitoring systems. These systems govern the operation of critical infrastructure systems such as power transmission, water distribution, transportation networks, building automation systems and process control systems.\r\n\r\nThe workshop will include a tutorial session on the need for resilient control systems lead by researchers from the Idaho National Laboratory (INL) which will focus on the importance of resilient control systems and their related processes as well as SCADA test-beds. (The, First, Workshop, on, Secure, Control, Systems, (, SCS, ), will, be, held, April, 12, ,, 2010, in, Stockholm, ,, Sweden, as, part, of, the, 13th, International, Conference, on, Hybrid, Systems, :, Computation, and, Control, (, HSCC, ), which, is, one, of, five, conferences, associated, with, CPSWeek, 2010, ., \r\n\r\n, The, focus, of, the, workshop, will, be, on, system, theoretic, approaches, to, enhance, security, and, resilience, of, control, and, monitoring, systems, ., These, systems, govern, the, operation, of, critical, infrastructure, systems, such, as, power, transmission, ,, water, distribution, ,, transportation, networks, ,, building, automation, systems, and, process, control, systems, ., ...) Stockholm [The First Workshop on Secure Control Systems (SCS) will be held April 12, 2010 in Stockholm, Sweden as part of the 13th International Conference on Hybrid Systems: Computation and Control (HSCC) which is one of five conferences associated with CPSWeek 2010., The focus of the workshop will be on system theoretic approaches to enhance security and resilience of control and monitoring systems, These systems govern the operation of critical infrastructure systems such as power transmission, water distribution, transportation networks, building automation systems and process control systems., The workshop will include a tutorial session on the need for resilient control systems lead by researchers from the Idaho National Laboratory (INL) which will focus on the importance of resilient control systems and their related processes as well as SCADA test-beds.] The First Workshop on Secure Control Systems (SCS) will be held April 12, 2010 in Stockholm, Sweden as part of the 13th International Conference on Hybrid Systems: Computation and Control (HSCC) which is one of five conferences associated with CPSWeek 2010. {'April 12, 2010': 'the first workshop on secure control systems (scs) will be held april 12, 2010 in stockholm, sweden as part of the 13th international conference on hybrid systems: computation and control (hscc) which is one of five conferences associated with cpsweek 2010.'}
90 The 3rd International Conference on Image and Signal Processing (CISP 2010) and the 3rd International Conference on BioMedical Engineering and Informatics (BMEI 2010) Yantai, China The 3rd International Conference on Image and Signal Processing (CISP 2010) and the 3rd International Conference on BioMedical Engineering and Informatics (BMEI 2010) will be jointly held from 16-18 October 2010, in Yantai, China. Yantai was listed as one of the world's most inhabitable places by the United Nations and was recognized as the "most charming city of China" by China Central Television. Undulating hills rise above the area's many rivers and are framed by beaches and neighboring islands. During summer, the breeze wafts from the sea, and the hills become ornamented with a sea of wildflowers. Famous tourist attractions include the Tashan Mountain, Kongdong Island, and Penglai Pavilion Scenic Area. Seafood and fruits are plentiful in Yantai.\r\n\r\nCISPÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢10-BMEIÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢10 is a premier international forum for scientists and researchers to present the state of the art of multimedia, signal processing, biomedical engineering, and biomedical informatics. CISPÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢10-BMEIÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢10 91 Computational Linguistics - Applications WisÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¦ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂa, Poland CLA'10-NL1 :: Computational Linguistics - Applications (CLA'10) Preliminary Announcement\r\nComputational Linguistics - Applications (CLA'10)\r\nWisÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¦ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂa, Poland, October 18-20, 2010\r\n\r\ncla\r\nhttp://CLA2010.imcsit.org\r\n\r\n\r\nfacebookIf you have your account at Facebook you can also join a group: HERE.\r\nWorkshop Goals\r\n\r\nThe Computational Linguistics - Applications Workshop was created in 2008 in response to the fast-paced progress in the area.\r\n\r\nTraditionally, computational linguistics was limited to the scientists specialized in the processing of a natural language by computers. Scientific approaches and practical techniques come from linguistics, computer science, psychology, and mathematics. Nowadays, there is a number of practical applications available. These applications are sometimes developed by smart yet NLP-untrained developers who solve the problems using sophisticated heuristics.\r\n\r\nComputational Linguistics needs to be applied to make the full use of the Internet. There is a definite need for software that can handle unstructured text to allow search for information on the web. According to the European Commission, Human Language Technologies are one of the key research areas for the upcoming years. The priority aim of the research in this area is to enable users to communicate with the computer in their native language.\r\n\r\nCLA'10 Workshop is a place where the parties meet to exchange views and ideas with a benefit to all involved. The Workshop will focus on practical outcome of modeling human language use and the applications needed to improve human-machine interaction.\r\nPaper Topics\r\n\r\nThis call is for papers that present research and developments on all aspects of Natural Language Processing used in real-life applications, such as (this list is not exhaustive):\r\n\r\n * information retrieval\r\n * extraction of linguistic knowledge from text corpora\r\n * semantic ontologies in computer linguistics\r\n * lexical resources\r\n * machine translation and translation aids\r\n * ambiguity resolution\r\n * text classification\r\n * corpus-based language modeling\r\n * POS-tagging\r\n * parsing issues\r\n * proofing tools\r\n * dialogue systems\r\n * machine learning methods applied to language processing\r\n * ontology and taxonomy evaluation\r\n * opinion mining\r\n * question answering\r\n * sentiment analysis\r\n * speech and audio processing\r\n * text summarization\r\n * use of NLP techniques in practical applications\r\n\r\n \r\nPaper Presentation\r\n\r\nThe presentation of the paper has to include a demonstration of an existing tool. The papers should include a section describing the tool (or a prototype), which demonstrates the theory discussed in the paper.\r\n\r\nThe presentation is divided into two parts. First, the author(s) shortly demonstrate their tools to the audience. In the second part, the authors discuss their work with other participants and let the audience test their software.\r\n\r\nPapers will be evaluated and accepted on the basis of their technical merit, usefulness of the real life application and relevance to the workshop scope by the CLA'10 Program Committee. The paper will be assessed by academics as well as industry representatives in order to assure fair and balanced assessment.\r\n\r\nAll accepted and presented papers will be published in the Conference Proceedings and included in the IEEE XploreÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ® database. The best demonstrations will be selected to be shown to the general audience of the conference at a plenary session.\r\nPapers Submission\r\n\r\n \r\n\r\n * Authors should submit draft papers (as Postscript, PDF of MSWord file).\r\n * The total length of a paper should not exceed 8 pages (IEEE style). IEEE style templates will be available ASAP.\r\n * Papers will be refereed and accepted on the basis of their scientific merit and relevance to the workshop.\r\n * Accepted and Presented paper will be published in the Conference Proceedings and included in the IEEE XploreÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ® database.\r\n * Organizers reserve right to move accepted papers between IMCSIT events.\r\n\r\n \r\nImportant dates\r\n\r\n31.05.2010 (May 31, 2010) - Full paper submission\r\n12.07.2010 (July 12, 2010) - Notification of acceptance\r\n23.08.2010 (August 23, 2010) - Camera-ready version of the accepted paper\r\nCLA '09 post conference report\r\n\r\nIt seems that the motto of our workshop "Show the system in action" has been accepted by the NLP community. This year 33 papers were submitted (90% increase from last year); 19 of them were accepted by the programming committee. 15 papers were presented during the workshop - our guests from Iran or Tunisia seemingly found Poland too far away from their homelands. Still, 11 countries were represented in the workshop, mainly from the Western Europe.\r\n\r\nThe workshop was composed of oral presentations and the demo-poster session. Presentations, given on Tuesday (October, 12th), were divided into three sessions:\r\n\r\n 1. Information Retrieval,\r\n 2. Use of NLP Tools In practical application,\r\n 3. Parsing issues; Linguistic resources.\r\n\r\n\r\nIn the evening the audience voted for the best presentations of each of the session as well as the best overall performance. The voters used their mobile phones and the result were known immediately - to the chairman. The winners were presented officially at the Gala Ceremony (In the Oscar Ceremony fashion). The Information Retrieval session was one by Igor Leturia from Spain - or rather his virtual agent who could fluently answer any question posed in the Basque language. The session on Practical Applications was won by Eric Wehrli from Switzerland and his micro-scanner that read German texts and translated them into English. Parsing issues were best presented by charming Katarzyna Moroz from Poznan (Poland) who convinced the audience that her new parsing algorithm using pregroup grammars will soon outperform existing ones. And finally, after the three nominees had been presented, the Oscar went to...Spain.\r\n\r\nThe demo-poster session took place on Wednesday morning. It looked as if the participants had not celebrated too long into the Tuesday night - at 9 a.m. almost all of them were ready to put their applications under the pressure of real tests. Well, the winner did not understand the chairman's Basque too well... she obviously preferred her master, Igor.\r\n\r\n\r\nCLA - where sciencemeets reality ! (CLA'10-NL1, :, :, Computational, Linguistics, -, Applications, (, CLA'10, ), Preliminary, Announcement, \r\n, Computational, Linguistics, -, Applications, (, CLA'10, ), \r\n, WisÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ, ¦, ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂa, ,, Poland, ,, October, 18, -, 20, ,, 2010, \r\n\r\n, cla, \r\n, http://CLA2010.imcsit.org, \r\n\r\n\r\n, facebookIf, you, have, your, account, at, Facebook, you, can, also, join, a, group, :, HERE, ., \r\n, Workshop, Goals, \r\n\r\n, The, Computational, Linguistics, -, Applications, Workshop, was, created, in, 2008, in, response, to, the, fast, -, paced, progress, in, the, area, ., \r\n\r\n, Traditionally, ,, computational, linguistics, was, limited, to, the, scientists, specialized, in, the, processing, of, a, natural, language, by, computers, ...) Poland [CLA'10-NL1 :: Computational Linguistics - Applications (CLA'10) Preliminary Announcement, Computational Linguistics - Applications (CLA'10), WisÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¦ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂa, Poland, October 18-20, 2010, cla, http://CLA2010.imcsit.org, facebookIf you have your account at Facebook you can also join a group: HERE., Workshop Goals, The Computational Linguistics - Applications Workshop was created in 2008 in response to the fast-paced progress in the area., Traditionally, computational linguistics was limited to the scientists specialized in the processing of a natural language by computers, Scientific approaches and practical techniques come from linguistics, computer science, psychology, and mathematics, Nowadays, there is a number of practical applications available, These applications are sometimes developed by smart yet NLP-untrained developers who solve the problems using sophisticated heuristics., Computational Linguistics needs to be applied to make the full use of the Internet, There is a definite need for software that can handle unstructured text to allow search for information on the web, According to the European Commission, Human Language Technologies are one of the key research areas for the upcoming years, The priority aim of the research in this area is to enable users to communicate with the computer in their native language., CLA'10 Workshop is a place where the parties meet to exchange views and ideas with a benefit to all involved, The Workshop will focus on practical outcome of modeling human language use and the applications needed to improve human-machine interaction., Paper Topics, This call is for papers that present research and developments on all aspects of Natural Language Processing used in real-life applications, such as (this list is not exhaustive):, * information retrieval, * extraction of linguistic knowledge from text corpora, * semantic ontologies in computer linguistics, * lexical resources, * machine translation and translation aids, * ambiguity resolution, * text classification, * corpus-based language modeling, * POS-tagging, * parsing issues, * proofing tools, * dialogue systems, * machine learning methods applied to language processing, * ontology and taxonomy evaluation, * opinion mining, * question answering, * sentiment analysis, * speech and audio processing, * text summarization, * use of NLP techniques in practical applications, , Paper Presentation, The presentation of the paper has to include a demonstration of an existing tool, The papers should include a section describing the tool (or a prototype), which demonstrates the theory discussed in the paper., The presentation is divided into two parts, First, the author(s) shortly demonstrate their tools to the audience, In the second part, the authors discuss their work with other participants and let the audience test their software., Papers will be evaluated and accepted on the basis of their technical merit, usefulness of the real life application and relevance to the workshop scope by the CLA'10 Program Committee, The paper will be assessed by academics as well as industry representatives in order to assure fair and balanced assessment., All accepted and presented papers will be published in the Conference Proceedings and included in the IEEE XploreÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ® database, The best demonstrations will be selected to be shown to the general audience of the conference at a plenary session., Papers Submission, , * Authors should submit draft papers (as Postscript, PDF of MSWord file)., * The total length of a paper should not exceed 8 pages (IEEE style), IEEE style templates will be available ASAP., * Papers will be refereed and accepted on the basis of their scientific merit and relevance to the workshop., * Accepted and Presented paper will be published in the Conference Proceedings and included in the IEEE XploreÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ® database., * Organizers reserve right to move accepted papers between IMCSIT events., , Important dates, 31.05.2010 (May 31, 2010) - Full paper submission, 12.07.2010 (July 12, 2010) - Notification of acceptance, 23.08.2010 (August 23, 2010) - Camera-ready version of the accepted paper, CLA '09 post conference report, It seems that the motto of our workshop "Show the system in action" has been accepted by the NLP community, This year 33 papers were submitted (90% increase from last year); 19 of them were accepted by the programming committee, 15 papers were presented during the workshop - our guests from Iran or Tunisia seemingly found Poland too far away from their homelands, Still, 11 countries were represented in the workshop, mainly from the Western Europe., The workshop was composed of oral presentations and the demo-poster session, Presentations, given on Tuesday (October, 12th), were divided into three sessions:, 1, Information Retrieval,, 2, Use of NLP Tools In practical application,, 3, Parsing issues; Linguistic resources., In the evening the audience voted for the best presentations of each of the session as well as the best overall performance, The voters used their mobile phones and the result were known immediately - to the chairman, The winners were presented officially at the Gala Ceremony (In the Oscar Ceremony fashion), The Information Retrieval session was one by Igor Leturia from Spain - or rather his virtual agent who could fluently answer any question posed in the Basque language, The session on Practical Applications was won by Eric Wehrli from Switzerland and his micro-scanner that read German texts and translated them into English, Parsing issues were best presented by charming Katarzyna Moroz from Poznan (Poland) who convinced the audience that her new parsing algorithm using pregroup grammars will soon outperform existing ones, And finally, after the three nominees had been presented, the Oscar went to...Spain., The demo-poster session took place on Wednesday morning, It looked as if the participants had not celebrated too long into the Tuesday night - at 9 a.m, almost all of them were ready to put their applications under the pressure of real tests, Well, the winner did not understand the chairman's Basque too well.., she obviously preferred her master, Igor., CLA - where sciencemeets reality !] CLA'10-NL1 :: Computational Linguistics - 92 TEXT, SPEECH and DIALOGUE Brno, Czech Republic *********************************************************\r\n TSD 2010 - FIRST CALL FOR PAPERS\r\n *********************************************************\r\n\r\nEleventh International Conference on TEXT, SPEECH and DIALOGUE (TSD 2010)\r\n Brno, Czech Republic, 6-10 September 2010\r\n http://www.tsdconference.org/\r\n\r\nThe conference is organized by the Faculty of Informatics, Masaryk\r\nUniversity, Brno, and the Faculty of Applied Sciences, University of\r\nWest Bohemia, Pilsen. The conference is supported by International\r\nSpeech Communication Association.\r\n\r\nVenue: Brno, Czech Republic\r\n\r\n\r\nTSD SERIES\r\n\r\nTSD series evolved as a prime forum for interaction between\r\nresearchers in both spoken and written language processing from the\r\nformer East Block countries and their Western colleagues. Proceedings\r\nof TSD form a book published by Springer-Verlag in their Lecture Notes\r\nin Artificial Intelligence (LNAI) series.\r\n\r\n\r\nTOPICS\r\n\r\nTopics of the conference will include (but are not limited to):\r\n\r\n text corpora and tagging\r\n transcription problems in spoken corpora\r\n sense disambiguation\r\n links between text and speech oriented systems\r\n parsing issues\r\n parsing problems in spoken texts\r\n multi-lingual issues\r\n multi-lingual dialogue systems\r\n information retrieval and information extraction\r\n text/topic summarization\r\n machine translation\r\n semantic networks and ontologies\r\n semantic web\r\n speech modeling\r\n speech segmentation\r\n speech recognition\r\n search in speech for IR and IE\r\n text-to-speech synthesis\r\n dialogue systems\r\n development of dialogue strategies\r\n prosody in dialogues\r\n emotions and personality modeling\r\n user modeling\r\n knowledge representation in relation to dialogue systems\r\n assistive technologies based on speech and dialogue\r\n applied systems and software\r\n facial animation\r\n visual speech synthesis\r\n\r\nPapers on processing languages other than English are strongly\r\nencouraged.\r\n\r\n\r\nPROGRAM COMMITTEE\r\n\r\n Frederick Jelinek, USA (general chair)\r\n Hynek Hermansky, Switzerland (executive chair)\r\n Eneko Agirre, Spain\r\n Genevieve Baudoin, France\r\n Jan Cernocky, Czech Republic\r\n Attila Ferencz, Romania\r\n Alexander Gelbukh, Mexico\r\n Louise Guthrie, GB\r\n Jan Hajic, Czech Republic\r\n Eva Hajicova, Czech Republic\r\n Patrick Hanks, Czech Republic\r\n Ludwig Hitzenberger, Germany\r\n Jaroslava Hlavacova, Czech Republic\r\n Ales Horak, Czech Republic\r\n Eduard Hovy, USA\r\n Ivan Kopecek, Czech Republic\r\n Steven Krauwer, The Netherlands\r\n Siegfried Kunzmann, Germany\r\n Natalija Loukachevitch, Russia\r\n Vaclav Matousek, Czech Republic\r\n Hermann Ney, Germany\r\n Elmar Noeth, Germany\r\n Karel Oliva, Czech Republic\r\n Karel Pala, Czech Republic\r\n Nikola Pavesic, Slovenia\r\n Vladimir Petkevic, Czech Republic\r\n Fabio Pianesi, Italy\r\n Josef Psutka, Czech Republic\r\n James Pustejovsky, USA\r\n Leon Rothkrantz, The Netherlands\r\n Ernst G. Schukat-Talamazzini, Germany\r\n Pavel Skrelin, Russia\r\n Pavel Smrz, Czech Republic\r\n Marko Tadic, Croatia\r\n Tamas Varadi, Hungary\r\n Zygmunt Vetulani, Poland\r\n Taras Vintsiuk, Ukraine\r\n Yorick Wilks, GB\r\n Victor Zakharov, Russia\r\n\r\n\r\nFORMAT OF THE CONFERENCE\r\n\r\nThe conference program will include presentation of invited papers,\r\noral presentations, and poster/demonstration sessions. Papers will\r\nbe presented in plenary or topic oriented sessions.\r\n\r\nSocial events including a trip in the vicinity of Brno will allow\r\nfor additional informal interactions.\r\n\r\n\r\nSUBMISSION OF PAPERS\r\n\r\nAuthors are invited to submit a full paper not exceeding 8 pages\r\nformatted in the LNCS style (see below). Those accepted will be\r\npresented either orally or as posters. The decision about the\r\npresentation format will be based on the recommendation of the\r\nreviewers. The authors are asked to submit their papers using the\r\non-line form accessible from the conference website.\r\n\r\nPapers submitted to TSD 2008 must not be under review by any other\r\nconference or publication during the TSD review cycle, and must not be\r\npreviously published or accepted for publication elsewhere.\r\n\r\nAs reviewing will be blind, the paper should not include the authors'\r\nnames and affiliations. Furthermore, self-references that reveal the\r\nauthor's identity, e.g., "We previously showed (Smith, 1991) ...",\r\nshould be avoided. Instead, use citations such as "Smith previously\r\nshowed (Smith, 1991) ...". Papers that do not conform to the\r\nrequirements above are subject to be rejected without review.\r\n\r\nThe authors are strongly encouraged to write their papers in TeX\r\nor LaTeX formats. These formats are necessary for the final\r\nversions of the papers that will be published in the Springer\r\nLecture Notes. Authors using a WORD compatible software for the\r\nfinal version must use the LNCS template for WORD and within the\r\nsubmit process ask the Proceedings Editors to convert the paper\r\nto LaTeX format. For this service a service-and-license fee of\r\nCZK 1500 will be levied automatically.\r\n\r\nThe paper format for review has to be either PDF or PostScript file\r\nwith all required fonts included. Upon notification of acceptance,\r\npresenters will receive further information on submitting their\r\ncamera-ready and electronic sources (for detailed instructions on\r\nthe final paper format see\r\nhttp://www.springer.de/comp/lncs/authors.html#Proceedings.)\r\n\r\nAuthors are also invited to present actual projects, developed\r\nsoftware or interesting material relevant to the topics of the\r\nconference. The presenters of the demonstration should provide the\r\nabstract not exceeding one page. The demonstration abstracts will not\r\nappear in the conference proceedings.\r\n\r\n\r\nIMPORTANT DATES\r\n\r\nMarch 13 2010 ............ Submission of abstract\r\nMarch 20 2010 ............ Submission of full papers\r\nMay 13 2010 .............. Notification of acceptance\r\nMay 31 2010 .............. Final papers (camera ready) and registration\r\nJuly 25 2010 ............. Submission of demonstration abstracts\r\nJuly 30 2010 ............. Notification of acceptance for\r\n demonstrations sent to the authors\r\nSeptember 6-10 2010 ...... Conference date\r\n\r\nSubmission of abstract serves for better organization of the review\r\nprocess only - for the actual review a full paper submission is\r\nnecessary.\r\n\r\nThe contributions to the conference will be published in proceedings\r\nthat will be made available to participants at the time of the\r\nconference.\r\n\r\n\r\nOFFICIAL LANGUAGE\r\n\r\nThe official language of the conference is English.\r\n\r\n\r\nACCOMMODATION\r\n\r\nThe organizing committee will arrange discounts on accommodation in\r\nthe 3-star hotel at the conference venue. The current prices of the\r\naccommodation will be available at the conference website.\r\n\r\n\r\nADDRESS\r\n\r\nAll correspondence regarding the conference should be\r\naddressed to\r\n \r\n Dana Hlavackova, TSD 2010\r\n Faculty of Informatics, Masaryk University\r\n Botanicka 68a, 602 00 Brno, Czech Republic\r\n phone: +420-5-49 49 33 29\r\n fax: +420-5-49 49 18 20\r\n email: tsd2010@tsdconference.org\r\n\r\nThe official TSD 2010 homepage is: http://www.tsdconference.org/\r\n\r\n\r\nLOCATION\r\n\r\nBrno is the second largest city in the Czech Republic with a\r\npopulation of almost 400.000. The city is the country's judiciary and\r\ntrade-fair center. Brno is the capital of Moravia, which is in the\r\nsouth-east part of the Czech Republic. Brno had been a Royal City\r\nsince 1347 and with its six universities it forms also a cultural\r\ncenter of the region.\r\n\r\nBrno can be reached easily by direct flights from London, Moscow,\r\nBarcelona and Prague and by trains or buses from Prague (200 km) or\r\nVienna (130 km).\r\n\r\nFor the participants with some extra time, some nearby places may also\r\nbe of interest. Local ones include: Brno Castle now called Spilberk,\r\nVeveri Castle, the Old and New City Halls, the Augustine Monastery\r\nwith St. Thomas Church and crypt of Moravian Margraves, Church of St.\r\nJames, Cathedral of St. Peter & Paul, Cartesian Monastery in Kralovo\r\nPole, the famous Villa Tugendhat designed by Mies van der Rohe along\r\nwith other important buildings of between-war Czech architecture.\r\n\r\nFor those willing to venture out of Brno, Moravian Karst with Macocha\r\nChasm and Punkva caves, battlefield of Battle of three emperors\r\n(Napoleon, Russian Alexander and Austrian Franz - Battle by\r\nAusterlitz), Chateau of Slavkov (Austerlitz), Pernstejn Castle,\r\nBuchlov Castle, Lednice Chateau, Buchlovice Chateau, Letovice Chateau,\r\nMikulov with one of the largest Jewish cemeteries in Central Europe,\r\nTelc - a town on the UNESCO heritage list, and many others are all\r\nwithin easy reach. (*, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, \r\n , TSD, 2010, -, FIRST, CALL, FOR, PAPERS, \r\n , *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, *, ...) Czech Republic [*********************************************************, TSD 2010 - FIRST CALL FOR PAPERS, *********************************************************, Eleventh International Conference on TEXT, SPEECH and DIALOGUE (TSD 2010), Brno, Czech Republic, 6-10 September 2010, http://www.tsdconference.org/, The conference is organized by the Faculty of Informatics, Masaryk, University, Brno, and the Faculty of Applied Sciences, University of, West Bohemia, Pilsen, The conference is supported by International, Speech Communication Association., Venue: Brno, Czech Republic, TSD SERIES, TSD series evolved as a prime forum for interaction between, researchers in both spoken and written language processing from the, former East Block countries and their Western colleagues, Proceedings, of TSD form a book published by Springer-Verlag in their Lecture Notes, in Artificial Intelligence (LNAI) series., TOPICS, Topics of the conference will include (but are not limited to):, text corpora and tagging, transcription problems in spoken corpora, sense disambiguation, links between text and speech oriented systems, parsing issues, parsing problems in spoken texts, multi-lingual issues, multi-lingual dialogue systems, information retrieval and information extraction, text/topic summarization, machine translation, semantic networks and ontologies, semantic web, speech modeling, speech segmentation, speech recognition, search in speech for IR and IE, text-to-speech synthesis, dialogue systems, development of dialogue strategies, prosody in dialogues, emotions and personality modeling, user modeling, knowledge representation in relation to dialogue systems, assistive technologies based on speech and dialogue, applied systems and software, facial animation, visual speech synthesis, Papers on processing languages other than English are strongly, encouraged., PROGRAM COMMITTEE, Frederick Jelinek, USA (general chair), Hynek Hermansky, Switzerland (executive chair), Eneko Agirre, Spain, Genevieve Baudoin, France, Jan Cernocky, Czech Republic, Attila Ferencz, Romania, Alexander Gelbukh, Mexico, Louise Guthrie, GB, Jan Hajic, Czech Republic, Eva Hajicova, Czech Republic, Patrick Hanks, Czech Republic, Ludwig Hitzenberger, Germany, Jaroslava Hlavacova, Czech Republic, Ales Horak, Czech Republic, Eduard Hovy, USA, Ivan Kopecek, Czech Republic, Steven Krauwer, The Netherlands, Siegfried Kunzmann, Germany, Natalija Loukachevitch, Russia, Vaclav Matousek, Czech Republic, Hermann Ney, Germany, Elmar Noeth, Germany, Karel Oliva, Czech Republic, Karel Pala, Czech Republic, Nikola Pavesic, Slovenia, Vladimir Petkevic, Czech Republic, Fabio Pianesi, Italy, Josef Psutka, Czech Republic, James Pustejovsky, USA, Leon Rothkrantz, The Netherlands, GB, Victor Zakharov, Russia, FORMAT OF THE CONFERENCE, The conference program will include presentation of invited papers,, oral presentations, and poster/demonstration sessions, Papers will, be presented in plenary or topic oriented sessions., Social events including a trip in the vicinity of Brno will allow, for additional informal interactions., SUBMISSION OF PAPERS, ...] TSD 2010 - FIRST CALL FOR PAPERS {'6-10 September 2010': ' brno, czech republic, 6-10 september 2010', 'March 13 2010': 'march 13 2010 ...........', 'March 20 2010': 'march 20 2010 ...........', 'May 13 2010': 'may 13 93 The 2nd International Workshop on Web-based Contents Management Technologies Jiuzhai Valley, China The 2nd International Workshop on Web-based Contents Management Technologies(WCMT 2010)\r\nTo be held in conjunction with WAIM 2010\r\nJuly 15, 2009\r\nJiuzhai Valley, China\r\nhttp://www.zhuangyi.net/~wcmt10/\r\n\r\n\r\n= Aims and Scope = \r\n\r\nThe Web are ever-increasing in size and involving a quite broad range of technologies such as \r\ndatabases,XML and digital contents, data and Web mining, Web services, semantic Web and ontology,\r\ninformation retrieval,and others. WCMT 2010 will be held in conjunction with WAIM 2010 \r\nconference and invites original research contribution on XML, Web, and Internet contents technologies.\r\nWCMT 2010 aims at bringing together researchers in different fields related to Web information \r\nprocessing who have a common interest in interdisciplinary research.The workshop provides a forum \r\nwhere researchers and practitioners can share and exchange their knowledge and experience. \r\n\r\n= Topics of Interest = \r\n\r\nThe WCMT 2010 topics include but are certainly not limited to the following areas: \r\n\r\n* Contents modeling and organization\r\n* XML and semi-structured data management for content processing\r\n* Requirements elicitation, design, and implementation of web-based\r\ncontent management systems\r\n* Contents-based workflow management and workflow for contents development\r\n* Multimedia information retrieval on the Web\r\n* Web contents mining\r\n* Service-oriented architecture for contents management\r\n* Semantic Web and ontology for contents management\r\n* Content integration, sharing, and distribution on the Web\r\n* Privacy, security, and intellectual property of web contents\r\n* Contents management for mobile and ubiquitous computing\r\n* Context / location sensitive / intelligent content recommendation\r\n* Enterprise contents management and customer relationship management\r\n* Contents management for e-Learning\r\n* Performance, quality of service, and reliability issues \r\n\r\nWe strongly encourage submission of papers bridging the research in different fields and promoting \r\nmutual exchange and understanding of cross-field research results.\r\n\r\n= Publication and Submission Details = \r\n\r\nAll papers accepted by WAIM 2010 workshops will be published in a combined volume of\r\nLecturer Notes in Computer Science series published by Springer. All submissions should be in English.\r\nSubmission of a paper should be regarded as an undertaking that, should the paper be accepted, at least\r\none author will attend the workshop to present the work. \r\nPapers should not exceed 12 pages in LNCS (Lecture Notes in Computer Science) format\r\nhttp://www.springer.de/comp/lncs/authors.html\r\nPapers have to present original research contributions not concurrently submitted elsewhere. Papers\r\nmust be submitted to https://cmt.research.microsoft.com/WCMT2010/Default.aspx\r\n\r\nAll manuscripts will be reviewed by members of the program committee based on originality, significance,\r\ntechnical soundness, and clarity of exposition.\r\n\r\n= Important Date =\r\n\r\n* Full papers due: January 30th, 2010 \r\n* Notification to authors: March 20th, 2010\r\n* Camera-ready due: April 1st, 2010\r\n* Workshop: July 14th, 2010\r\n\r\n\r\n= General Chairs = \r\n\r\nDickson K.W. Chiu, Dickson Computer Systems, Hong Kong, China\r\nHua Hu, Hangzhou Dianzi University, China\r\n\r\n= Program Chair = \r\n\r\nYi Zhuang, Zhejiang Gongshang University, China\r\nJie Shao, The University of Melbourne, Australia (The, 2nd, International, Workshop, on, Web, -, based, Contents, Management, Technologies(WCMT, 2010, ), \r\n, To, be, held, in, conjunction, with, WAIM, 2010, \r\n, July, 15, ,, 2009, \r\n, Jiuzhai, Valley, ,, China, \r\n, http://www.zhuangyi.net/~wcmt10/, \r\n\r\n\r\n, =, Aims, and, Scope, =, \r\n\r\n, The, Web, are, ever, -, increasing, in, size, and, involving, a, quite, broad, range, of, technologies, such, as, \r\n, databases, ,, XML, and, digital, contents, ,, data, and, Web, mining, ,, Web, services, ,, semantic, Web, and, ontology, ,, \r\n, information, retrieval, ,, and, others, ., WCMT, 2010, will, be, held, in, conjunction, with, WAIM, 2010, \r\n, conference, and, ...) Jiuzhai Valley [The 2nd International Workshop on Web-based Contents Management Technologies(WCMT 2010), To be held in conjunction with WAIM 2010, July 15, 2009, Jiuzhai Valley, China, http://www.zhuangyi.net/~wcmt10/, = Aims and Scope = , The Web are ever-increasing in size and involving a quite broad range of technologies such as , databases,XML and digital contents, data and Web mining, Web services, semantic Web and ontology,, information retrieval,and others, WCMT 2010 will be held in conjunction with WAIM 2010 , conference and invites original research contribution on XML, Web, and Internet contents technologies., WCMT 2010 aims at bringing together researchers in different fields related to Web information , processing who have a common interest in interdisciplinary research.The workshop provides a forum , where researchers and practitioners can share and exchange their knowledge and experience, = Topics of Interest = , The WCMT 2010 topics include but are certainly not limited to the following areas: , * Contents modeling and organization, * XML and semi-structured data management for content processing, * Requirements elicitation, design, and implementation of web-based, content management systems, * Contents-based workflow management and workflow for contents development, * Multimedia information retrieval on the Web, * Web contents mining, * Service-oriented architecture for contents management, * Semantic Web and ontology for contents management, * Content integration, sharing, and distribution on the Web, * Privacy, security, and intellectual property of web contents, * Contents management for mobile and ubiquitous computing, * Context / location sensitive / intelligent content recommendation, * Enterprise contents management and customer relationship management, * Contents management for e-Learning, * Performance, quality of service, and reliability issues , We strongly encourage submission of papers bridging the research in different fields and promoting , mutual exchange and understanding of cross-field research results., = Publication and Submission Details = , All papers accepted by WAIM 2010 workshops will be published in a combined volume of, Lecturer Notes in Computer Science series published by Springer, All submissions should be in English., Submission of a paper should be regarded as an undertaking that, should the paper be accepted, at least, one author will attend the workshop to present the work, Papers should not exceed 12 pages in LNCS (Lecture Notes in Computer Science) format, http://www.springer.de/comp/lncs/authors.html, Papers have to present original research contributions not concurrently submitted elsewhere, Papers, must be submitted to https://cmt.research.microsoft.com/WCMT2010/Default.aspx, All manuscripts will be reviewed by members of the program committee based on originality, significance,, technical soundness, and clarity of exposition., = Important Date =, * Full papers due: January 30th, 2010 , * Notification to authors: March 20th, 2010, * Camera-ready due: April 1st, 2010, * Workshop: July 14th, 2010, = General Chairs 94 8th IEEE International Conference on Industrial Informatics Osaka, Japan We apologize if you receive multiple copies of this message.\r\n\r\nDear Colleagues,\r\n\r\nLet me kindly inform you that the paper submission deadline for INDIN 2010 \r\n(the 8th IEEE International Conference on Industrial Informatics ) has been EXTENDED \r\nto 23rd January, 2010. INDIN2010 will be held in Osaka, Japan from 13-16 July 2010.\r\n\r\nAll the information about the conference is available at \r\nhttp://indin2010.ist.osaka-u.ac.jp\r\n\r\nIEEE INDIN is the premier conference series presenting the state of the art \r\nand future perspectives of industrial information technologies, where industry \r\nexperts, researchers, and academics share ideas and experiences surrounding \r\nfrontier technologies, breakthrough and innovative solutions and applications.\r\n\r\nThe theme of INDIN 2010 is \r\n"Information Technologies for Sustainable Development." \r\n\r\nYou are kindly invited to submit original, previously unpublished works \r\nwithin the scope of INDIN2010, by the following deadlines:\r\n\r\nSubmission of full papers (EXTENDED): 23rd January, 2010\r\nNotification of acceptance: 20th March, 2010\r\nFinal papers for publication: 20th April, 2010\r\n\r\nThe topics of this conference include, but are not limited to:\r\n- Building Automation and Smart Homes\r\n- Cognitive and Computational Intelligence in Industrial Informatics\r\n- Distributed, Embedded and Networked Control\r\n- e-Learning for Small and Medium Enterprises\r\n- Emerging Platform Technologies in Industrial Informatics\r\n- Infrastructure and Technology\r\n- Engineering e-Networked Industrial Ecosystems\r\n- Factory Automation\r\n- Human, Computer and Machine Interface\r\n- Industrial Informatics Applications\r\n- Information Security, Safety and Trust\r\n- Mechatronics and Robotics\r\n- Sensing and Communication Technologies\r\n- Service-Oriented Architectures\r\n- Supply Chain Management and Logistics\r\n- Green IT\r\n\r\nDon't hesitate contacting us should you have any questions.\r\n\r\nBest regards,\r\n\r\nINDIN2010 Program Chairs\r\nToshiya Kaihara, Kobe Univ. \r\nLuis Gomes, Univ. Nova de Lisboa \r\nPeter Palensky, Univ. of Pretoria \r\n\r\nEmail: indin2010@ist.osaka-u.ac.jp (We, apologize, if, you, receive, multiple, copies, of, this, message, ., \r\n\r\n, Dear, Colleagues, ,, \r\n\r\n, Let, me, kindly, inform, you, that, the, paper, submission, deadline, for, INDIN, 2010, \r\n, (, the, 8th, IEEE, International, Conference, on, Industrial, Informatics, ), has, been, EXTENDED, \r\n, to, 23rd, January, ,, 2010, ., INDIN2010, will, be, held, in, Osaka, ,, Japan, from, 13, -, 16, July, 2010, ., \r\n\r\n, All, the, information, about, the, conference, is, available, at, \r\n, http://indin2010.ist.osaka, -, u.ac.jp, \r\n\r\n, IEEE, INDIN, is, the, premier, conference, series, presenting, the, state, of, the, art, \r\n, and, future, perspectives, of, industrial, information, ...) Building Automation and Smart Homes, - Cognitive and Computational Intelligence in Industrial Informatics, - Distributed, Embedded and Networked Control, - e-Learning for Small and Medium Enterprises, - Emerging Platform Technologies in Industrial Informatics, - Infrastructure and Technology, - Engineering e-Networked Industrial Ecosystems, - Factory Automation, - Human, Computer and Machine Interface, - Industrial Informatics Applications, - Information Security, Safety and Trust, - Mechatronics and Robotics, - Sensing and Communication Technologies, - Service-Oriented Architectures, - Supply Chain Management and Logistics, - 95 The Fifth International Conference on Wireless Algorithms, Systems and Applications Beijing, China Please accept our apologies for multiple postings. Some important information\r\nhas been updated.\r\n\r\nThe Fifth International Conference on Wireless Algorithms,\r\nSystems and Applications (WASA 2010)\r\nAugust 15-17, 2010, Beijing, China\r\n\r\nhttp://staff.vbi.vt.edu/maleq/wasa2010/\r\n\r\nSCOPE:\r\nThe WASA 2010 conference addresses the research and development efforts in\r\nthe area of algorithms, systems and applications for the current and next\r\ngeneration wireless networks. It provides a forum for researchers and\r\npractitioners around the world to exchange ideas, share new findings, and\r\ndiscuss challenges in wireless networks.\r\n\r\nThis call solicits technical papers that describe original research work,\r\nvisionary approaches, and future research directions dealing with effective\r\nand efficient algorithm design and analysis, reliable and secure system\r\ndevelopment and implementations, experimental study and test bed validation,\r\nand new application explorations in wireless networks.\r\n\r\nTOPICS:\r\n\r\nThe conference invites submissions on the following topics (but not limited to):\r\n\r\n- Cyber-physical systems (transportation, health care, civil infrastructure, etc)\r\n- Theoretical frameworks and analysis of fundamental cross-layer protocol and network\r\ndesign and performance issues\r\n- Distributed and localized algorithm design and analysis\r\n- Game theory\r\n- Information and Coding theory for Wireless Networks\r\n- Localization\r\n- Mobility models and mobile social networking\r\n- Topology control and coverage\r\n- Security and privacy\r\n- PHY/MAC/Routing protocols\r\n- Information processing and data management\r\n- Programmable service interfaces\r\n- Energy-efficient systems and protocol design\r\n- Operating system and middleware support\r\n- Software-defined radio, reconfigurable radio networks\r\n- Pervasive and ubiquitous computing\r\n- Local area and personal wireless networks\r\n- Applications, design, and performance of wireless ad hoc and sensor networks\r\n- Delay/disruption tolerant networks\r\n- Experimental test-beds, models and case studies\r\n\r\nSUBMISSION FORMAT:\r\nAuthors are required to submit their papers in the Springer LNCS Format with at least\r\n10 point font and no more than 10 pages. All submissions should be in the PDF format.\r\nAccepted papers will be published in the Springer-LNCS series.\r\n\r\nBEST PAPER AWARD:\r\nThere will be a best paper award, which will be selected by the program committee.\r\n\r\nIMPORTANT DATES\r\nPaper Submission Deadline: March 28, 2010\r\nAcceptance Notification: May 15 , 2010\r\nCamera-Ready Deadline: June 1, 2010\r\nConference Dates: August 15-17, 2010\r\n\r\nORGANIZING COMMITTEE:\r\n\r\nHonorary General Chair: Sun JiaGuang, Tsinghua University\r\nGeneral Co-Chairs: Gu Ming, Tsinghua University, and\r\n Yunhao Liu, Hong Kong University of Science and Technology\r\nProgram Committee Co-Chairs: Gopal Pandurangan, Nanyang Technological University and Brown University\r\n Anil Vullikanti, Virginia Tech (Please, accept, our, apologies, for, multiple, postings, ., Some, important, information, \r\n, has, been, updated, ., \r\n\r\n, The, Fifth, International, Conference, on, Wireless, Algorithms, ,, \r\n, Systems, and, Applications, (, WASA, 2010, ), \r\n, August, 15, -, 17, ,, 2010, ,, Beijing, ,, China, \r\n\r\n, http://staff.vbi.vt.edu, /, maleq, /, wasa2010/, \r\n\r\n, SCOPE, :, \r\n, The, WASA, 2010, conference, addresses, the, research, and, development, efforts, in, \r\n, the, area, of, algorithms, ,, systems, and, applications, for, the, current, and, next, \r\n, generation, wireless, networks, ., It, provides, a, forum, for, researchers, and, \r\n, practitioners, around, the, world, to, exchange, ideas, ,, ...) Beijing [Please accept our apologies for multiple postings, Some important information, has been updated., The Fifth International Conference on Wireless Algorithms,, Systems and Applications (WASA 2010), August 15-17, 2010, Beijing, China, http://staff.vbi.vt.edu/maleq/wasa2010/, SCOPE:, The WASA 2010 conference addresses the research and development efforts in, the area of algorithms, systems and applications for the current and next, generation wireless networks, It provides a forum for researchers and, practitioners around the world to exchange ideas, share new findings, and, discuss challenges in wireless networks., This call solicits technical papers that describe original research work,, visionary approaches, and future research directions dealing with effective, and efficient algorithm design and analysis, reliable and secure system, development and implementations, experimental study and test bed validation,, and new application explorations in wireless networks., TOPICS:, The conference invites submissions on the following topics (but not limited to):, - Cyber-physical systems (transportation, health care, civil infrastructure, etc), - Theoretical frameworks and analysis of fundamental cross-layer protocol and network, design and performance issues, - Distributed and localized algorithm design and analysis, - Game theory, - Information and Coding theory for Wireless Networks, - Localization, - Mobility models and mobile social networking, - Topology control and coverage, - Security and privacy, - PHY/MAC/Routing protocols, - Information processing and data management, - Programmable service interfaces, - Energy-efficient systems and protocol design, - Operating system and middleware support, - Software-defined radio, reconfigurable radio networks, - Pervasive and ubiquitous computing, - Local area and personal wireless networks, - Applications, design, and performance of wireless ad hoc and sensor networks, - Delay/disruption tolerant networks, - Experimental test-beds, models and case studies, SUBMISSION FORMAT:, Authors are required to submit their papers in the Springer LNCS Format with at least, 10 point font and no more than 10 pages, All submissions should be in the PDF format., Accepted papers will be published in the Springer-LNCS series., BEST PAPER AWARD:, There will be a best paper award, which will be selected by the program committee., IMPORTANT DATES, Paper Submission Deadline: March 28, 2010, Acceptance Notification: May 15 , 2010, Camera-Ready Deadline: June 1, 2010, Conference Dates: August 15-17, 2010, ORGANIZING COMMITTEE:, Honorary General Chair: Sun JiaGuang, Tsinghua University, General Co-Chairs: Gu Ming, Tsinghua University, and, Yunhao Liu, Hong Kong University of Science and Technology, Program Committee Co-Chairs: Gopal Pandurangan, Nanyang Technological University and Brown University, Anil Vullikanti, Virginia Tech] The Fifth International Conference on Wireless Algorithms, {'August 15-17, 2010': 'conference dates: august 15-17, 2010', '28, 2010': 'paper submission deadline: march 28, 2010', 'May 15 , 2010': 'acceptance notification: may 15 , 2010', 'June 1, 2010': 'camera-ready deadline: june 1, 2010'}
96 1st International Workshop on Workflow Approaches for New Data-Centric Science Indianapolis, IN, USA WANDS 2010\r\n1st International Workshop on Workflow Approaches for New Data-Centric Science\r\nworkshop site: http://wands2010.doc.ic.ac.uk\r\ninquiries: wands10@easychair.org\r\n\r\nHeld in conjunction with SIGMOD 2010\r\nIndianapolis, IN, USA\r\nhttp://www.sigmod2010.org\r\n\r\n-----\r\nFOCUS\r\n-----\r\nThe workshop aims at clarifying the role of workflow technology in accelerating science, by providing effective means to automate data management tasks on a large scale. Thus, it sits at the intersection between process management for scientific applications, and data management. \r\nA number of innovative, but uncoordinated, efforts in data-centric workflows have made their mark on the scientific and business world in recent years. The goal of this workshop is to use these efforts to start bringing together a research community around the theoretical foundations, technology development, and domain applications of workflow systems in the context of large-scale data management for science.\r\n\r\nIn this spirit, we seek contributions from both researchers and practitioners on all aspects of data and process management that contribute towards this goal. More specifically, relevant topics include, but are not limited to, the following:\r\n\r\n- Role of workfows in data analytics, mining and statistics \r\n- Performance estimation and optimization of workflow execution\r\n- Scalability of workflow-based solutions on very large data sets\r\n- Role of metadata in static profiling of dataflows\r\n- Impact of, and new requirements for, workflow technology on open science\r\n- Workflow warehousing, indexing, searching, and mining \r\n- Workflows for service orchestration\r\n- Mapping workflows to cloud computing environments\r\n- In-database workflow execution\r\n- User interaction models for complex eScience: visibility vs. commoditization\r\n- Workflow repurposing and reuse\r\n- Privacy models for data-centric workflows\r\n- Workflow semantics\r\n- Workflows as invisible middleware\r\n- Workflows in Service-oriented life sciences\r\n- Component-based business intelligence\r\n- Sensor data processing\r\n- Data integration and provenance tracking in medical research\r\n\r\n----------------\r\nIMPORTANT DATES\r\n----------------\r\n * Paper submission deadline: 2nd March\r\n * Author notification: 30th April\r\n * Camera-ready Copy: 28th May\r\n * Workshop: 6th June\r\n\r\n---------------------------\r\nFORMAT AND PAPER SUBMISSION\r\n---------------------------\r\nWe seek full research and experience papers, at most no 15 pages long\r\n in the LNCS style (http://www.springer.com/computer/lncs?SGWID=0-164-7-72376-0).\r\n\r\nThe workshop proceedings will be part of the SIGMOD DISC distribution. Additionally, we are working on arrangements with a publisher.\r\n\r\n---------------------------\r\nCHAIRS\r\n---------------------------\r\nPaolo Missier, University of Manchester, UK\r\nVasa Curcin, Imperial College London, UK\r\nSusan Davidson, University of Pennsylvania, USA\r\n\r\n\r\n---------------------------\r\nProgram Committee\r\n---------------------------\r\nWil van der Aalst, University of Eindhoven, Netherlands\r\nLoretta Auvil, University of Illinois, USA\r\nRajkumar Buyya, University of Melbourne, Australia\r\nJinjun Chen, Swinburne University of Technology, Australia\r\nSarah Cohen-Boulakia, Univ. Paris Sud, France \r\nMick Correl, Dana Farber Institute, USA\r\nJuliana Freire, University of Utah, USA\r\nVenkatesh Ganti, Microsoft Research, USA\r\nMichael Gertz, University of Heidelberg, Germany\r\nMoustafa Ghanem, Nile University, Cairo, Egypt\r\nFosca Giannotti, IST ? CNR, Italy\r\nCarole Goble, University of Manchester, UK\r\nPaul Groth, University of Amsterdam, Netherlands\r\nYike Guo, Imperial College London, UK\r\nJan Hidders, Technical University of Delft, Netherlands\r\nMatt Jones, UCSB, USA\r\nShiyong Lu, Wayne State University, USA\r\nAlex Michie, Erasmus Institute, Netherlands\r\nLuc Moreau, University of Southampton, UK\r\nBeth Plale, Indiana University, Bloomington, USA\r\nOmer Rana, Cardiff University, UK\r\nDavid De Roure, University of Southampton, UK\r\nAnthony Rowe, IDBS Ltd, UK\r\nYogesh Simmhan, Microsoft Research, USA\r\nPhilippe Soares, Wyeth, France \r\nJacek Sroka, University of Warsaw, Poland\r\nVlado Stankovski, University of Ljubljana, Slovenia\r\nDouglas Thain,\t University of Notre Dame, USA\r\nLizhe Wang, Rochester Institute of Technology, USA (WANDS, 2010, \r\n, 1st, International, Workshop, on, Workflow, Approaches, for, New, Data, -, Centric, Science, \r\n, workshop, site, :, http://wands2010.doc.ic.ac.uk, \r\n, inquiries, :, wands10@easychair.org, \r\n\r\n, Held, in, conjunction, with, SIGMOD, 2010, \r\n, Indianapolis, ,, IN, ,, USA, \r\n, http://www.sigmod2010.org, \r\n\r\n, -----, \r\n, FOCUS, \r\n, -----, \r\n, The, workshop, aims, at, clarifying, the, role, of, workflow, technology, in, accelerating, science, ,, by, providing, effective, means, to, automate, data, management, tasks, on, a, large, scale, ., Thus, ,, it, sits, at, the, intersection, between, process, management, for, scientific, applications, ,, and, data, management, ., \r\n, A, number, of, innovative, ,, but, uncoordinated, ...) Indianapolis [WANDS 2010, 1st International Workshop on Workflow Approaches for New Data-Centric Science, workshop site: http://wands2010.doc.ic.ac.uk, inquiries: wands10@easychair.org, Held in conjunction with SIGMOD 2010, Indianapolis, IN, USA, http://www.sigmod2010.org, -----, FOCUS, -----, The workshop aims at clarifying the role of workflow technology in accelerating science, by providing effective means to automate data management tasks on a large scale, Thus, it sits at the intersection between process management for scientific applications, and data management, A number of innovative, but uncoordinated, efforts in data-centric workflows have made their mark on the scientific and business world in recent years, The goal of this workshop is to use these efforts to start bringing together a research community around the theoretical foundations, technology development, and domain applications of workflow systems in the context of large-scale data management for science., In this spirit, we seek contributions from both researchers and practitioners on all aspects of data and process management that contribute towards this goal, More specifically, relevant topics include, but are not limited to, the following:, - Role of workfows in data analytics, mining and statistics , - Performance estimation and optimization of workflow execution, - Scalability of workflow-based solutions on very large data sets, - Role of metadata in static profiling of dataflows, - Impact of, and new requirements for, workflow technology on open science, - Workflow warehousing, indexing, searching, and mining , - Workflows for service orchestration, - Mapping workflows to cloud computing environments, - In-database workflow execution, - User interaction models for complex eScience: visibility vs, commoditization, - Workflow repurposing and reuse, - Privacy models for data-centric workflows, - Workflow semantics, - Workflows as invisible middleware, - Workflows in Service-oriented life sciences, - Component-based business intelligence, - Sensor data processing, - Data integration and provenance tracking in medical research, ----------------, IMPORTANT DATES, ----------------, * Paper submission deadline: 2nd March, * Author notification: 30th April, * Camera-ready Copy: 28th May, * Workshop: 6th June, ---------------------------, FORMAT AND PAPER SUBMISSION, ---------------------------, We seek full research and experience papers, at most no 15 pages long, in the LNCS style (http://www.springer.com/computer/lncs?SGWID=0-164-7-72376-0)., The workshop proceedings will be part of the SIGMOD DISC distribution, Additionally, we are working on arrangements with a publisher., ---------------------------, CHAIRS, ---------------------------, Paolo Missier, University of Manchester, UK, Vasa Curcin, Imperial College London, UK, Susan Davidson, University of Pennsylvania, USA, ---------------------------, Program Committee, ---------------------------, Wil van der Aalst, University of Eindhoven, Netherlands, Loretta Auvil, University of Illinois, USA, Rajkumar Buyya, University of Melbourne, Australia, Jinjun Chen, Swinburne University of Technology, Australia, Sarah Cohen-Boulakia, Univ, Paris Sud, France , Mick Correl, Dana Farber Institute, USA, Juliana Freire, University of Utah, USA, Venkatesh Ganti, Microsoft Research, USA, Michael Gertz, University of Heidelberg, Germany, Moustafa Ghanem, Nile University, Cairo, Egypt, Fosca Giannotti, IST ? CNR, Italy, Carole Goble, University of Manchester, UK, Paul Groth, University of Amsterdam, Netherlands, Yike Guo, Imperial College London, UK, Jan Hidders, Technical University of Delft, Netherlands, Matt Jones, UCSB, USA, Shiyong Lu, Wayne State University, USA, Alex Michie, Erasmus Institute, Netherlands, Luc Moreau, University of Southampton, UK, Beth Plale, Indiana University, Bloomington, USA, Omer Rana, Cardiff University, UK, David De Roure, University of Southampton, UK, Anthony Rowe, IDBS Ltd, UK, Yogesh Simmhan, Microsoft Research, USA, Philippe Soares, Wyeth, France , Jacek Sroka, University of Warsaw, Poland, Vlado Stankovski, University of Ljubljana, Slovenia, Douglas Thain,\t University of Notre Dame, USA, Lizhe Wang, Rochester Institute of Technology, USA] 1st International Workshop on Workflow Approaches for New Data-Centric Science {'2nd March': ' * paper submission deadline: 2nd march', '30th April': ' * author notification: 30th april', '28th May': ' * camera-ready copy: 28th may', '6th June': ' * workshop: 6th june'}
97 1st International Workshop on Adaptation, Personalization and REcommendation in the Social-semantic Web Heraklion, Greece ============================================================ \r\nCall for Papers \r\n\r\n1st International Workshop on Adaptation, Personalization and REcommendation\r\nin the Social-semantic Web (APRESW 2010) \r\n31 May 2010 | Heraklion, Greece\r\nhttp://nets.ii.uam.es/apresw2010/\r\n\r\nIn conjunction with the\r\n7th Extended Semantic Web Conference (ESWC 2010) \r\nhttp://www.eswc2010.org/\r\n============================================================ \r\n\r\n+++++++++++++++\r\nImportant dates\r\n+++++++++++++++\r\n\r\n * Paper submission: 15 March 2010 (extended)\r\n * Notification of paper acceptance/rejection: 5 April 2010\r\n * Camera-ready copies of accepted papers: 18 April, 2010\r\n * APRESW 2010 Workshop: 30 or 31 May 2010\r\n\r\n++++++++++\r\nMotivation\r\n++++++++++\r\n\r\nDuring the last years, researchers and practitioners of the Semantic Web\r\nhave progressively consolidated a number of very important achievements.\r\nFormal languages have been standardized to define ontology-based knowledge\r\nrepresentations, logic formalisms and query models. Ontology engineering\r\nmethodologies and tools have been proposed to ease the designing and\r\npopulating of ontological knowledge bases. Reasoning engines have been\r\nimplemented to exploit inference capabilities of ontologies, and\r\nsemantic-based frameworks have been built to enrich the functionalities of\r\nWeb services. These achievements are the pillars to deal with the complex\r\nchallenge of bringing semantics to the Web.\r\n\r\nThe above gives a new ground to extend the focus of the Semantic Web by\r\nengaging it in other communities, where semantics can play an important\r\nrole. The available semantic knowledge bases can be used to enrich and link\r\nadditional repositories, ontology engineering techniques can be utilized to\r\nproperly design and build ontologies in further real-world domains, and\r\ninference and query mechanisms can enhance classic information management\r\nand retrieval approaches.\r\n\r\nAmong these communities, this workshop aims to attract the attention of\r\nstudents and professionals both from academia and industry who take benefit\r\nof semantic-based techniques and technologies in within-application\r\nAdaptation, Personalization and Recommendation approaches. In parallel to\r\nthe progress made in the Semantic Web research topics, there have been\r\nappearing works in the above areas that use ontologies to model the userÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢s\r\npreferences, tastes and interests, and exploit these personal features\r\ntogether with meta-information about multimedia contents in order to provide\r\nthe user with adaptation and personalization capabilities for different\r\npurposes such as information retrieval and item recommendation.\r\n\r\nMoreover, with the advent of the Web 2.0 (also called the Social Web), the\r\npotential study and development of those approaches have increased\r\nexponentially. Social networks allow people to provide explicit\r\nrelationships with others, and find out implicit user similarities based on\r\ntheir profiles. Social tagging services offer the opportunity to easily\r\ncreate and exploit personal knowledge representations. Wiki-style sites\r\nrepresent an environment where the community contributes and shares\r\ninformation, and blogs are media in which users express subjective opinions.\r\nIn all of these scenarios, adaptation, personalization and recommendation\r\nare core functionalities. However, the understanding and exploitation of the\r\nsemantics underlying user and item profiles are still open issues.\r\n\r\n++++++++++++++++++\r\nTopics of interest\r\n++++++++++++++++++\r\n\r\nThe workshop will focus on establishing user/usage models for adaptation,\r\npersonalization and recommendation approaches for the Social-semantic Web.\r\n\r\nTopics of interest include, but are not limited to the exploitation of the\r\nWeb of Data, the identification of semantics underlying social annotations\r\nof multimedia contents, and the application of semantic-based techniques and\r\ntechnologies in research fields related to:\r\n\r\n * Personalized access to multimedia content\r\n * Content-based recommendation and collaborative filtering\r\n * Adaptive exploration of multimedia content\r\n * Adaptive user interfaces for multimedia content browsing and searching\r\n * Community extraction and exploitation\r\n * Social networks analysis for collaborative recommendation\r\n * User profile construction based on social tagging information\r\n * Context-aware multimedia content access and delivery\r\n * Mobile and ubiquitous multimedia content access and delivery\r\n\r\n++++++++++++++++++++\r\nOrganizing Committee\r\n++++++++++++++++++++\r\n\r\n * IvÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¡n Cantador, Universidad AutÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ³noma de Madrid, Spain\r\n * Peter Mika, Yahoo! Research, Spain\r\n * David Vallet, Universidad AutÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ³noma de Madrid, Spain\r\n * JosÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ© C. Greece [============================================================ , Call for Papers , 1st International Workshop on Adaptation, Personalization and REcommendation, in the Social-semantic Web (APRESW 2010) , 31 May 2010 | Heraklion, Greece, http://nets.ii.uam.es/apresw2010/, In conjunction with the, 7th Extended Semantic Web Conference (ESWC 2010) , http://www.eswc2010.org/, ============================================================ , +++++++++++++++, Important dates, +++++++++++++++, * Paper submission: 15 March 2010 (extended), * Notification of paper acceptance/rejection: 5 April 2010, * Camera-ready copies of accepted papers: 18 April, 2010, * APRESW 2010 Workshop: 30 or 31 May 2010, ++++++++++, Motivation, ++++++++++, During the last years, researchers and practitioners of the Semantic Web, have progressively consolidated a number of very important achievements., Formal languages have been standardized to define ontology-based knowledge, representations, logic formalisms and query models, Ontology engineering, methodologies and tools have been proposed to ease the designing and, populating of ontological knowledge bases, Reasoning engines have been, implemented to exploit inference capabilities of ontologies, and, semantic-based frameworks have been built to enrich the functionalities of, Web services, These achievements are the pillars to deal with the complex, challenge of bringing semantics to the Web., The above gives a new ground to extend the focus of the Semantic Web by, engaging it in other communities, where semantics can play an important, role, The available semantic knowledge bases can be used to enrich and link, additional repositories, ontology engineering techniques can be utilized to, properly design and build ontologies in further real-world domains, and, inference and query mechanisms can enhance classic information management, and retrieval approaches., Among these communities, this workshop aims to attract the attention of, students and professionals both from academia and industry who take benefit, of semantic-based techniques and technologies in within-application, Adaptation, Personalization and Recommendation approaches, In parallel to, the progress made in the Semantic Web research topics, there have been, appearing works in the above areas that use ontologies to model the userÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢s, preferences, tastes and interests, and exploit these personal features, together with meta-information about multimedia contents in order to provide, the user with adaptation and personalization capabilities for different, purposes such as information retrieval and item recommendation., Moreover, with the advent of the Web 2.0 (also called the Social Web), the, potential study and development of those approaches have increased, exponentially, Social networks allow people to provide explicit, relationships with others, and find out implicit user similarities based on, their profiles, Social tagging services offer the opportunity to easily, create and exploit personal knowledge representations, Wiki-style sites, represent an environment where the community contributes and shares, information, and blogs are media in which users express subjective opinions., In all of these scenarios, adaptation, personalization and recommendation, are core functionalities, However, the understanding and exploitation of the, semantics underlying user and item profiles are still open issues., ++++++++++++++++++, Topics of interest, ++++++++++++++++++, The workshop will focus on establishing user/usage models for adaptation,, personalization and recommendation approaches for the Social-semantic Web., Topics of interest include, but are not limited to the exploitation of the, Web of Data, the identification of semantics underlying social annotations, of multimedia contents, and the application of semantic-based techniques and, technologies in research fields related to:, * Personalized access to multimedia content, * Content-based recommendation and collaborative filtering, * Adaptive exploration of multimedia content, * Adaptive user interfaces for multimedia content browsing and searching, * Community extraction and exploitation, * Social networks analysis for collaborative recommendation, * User profile construction based on social tagging information, * Context-aware multimedia content access and delivery, * Mobile and ubiquitous multimedia content access and delivery, ++++++++++++++++++++, Organizing Committee, ++++++++++++++++++++, *
